The object of the game is to be the first player to collect all six of your colored ice cubes. Each player chooses a color and places all six of their ice cubes on the game board. Turn on electronic Erik the penguin by pressing the button on his back. As he jumps and shakes around, he flips out ice cubes. Quickly grab your color cubes and quickly try to put the other players' cubes back in the base before they can grab them. The player to get all six of his ice cubes must press the button on Erik to turn him off and win the game.

Contents: Erik figure, a plastic game base, a game playing surface, 24 ice cubes in four colors, and rules. The game requires three AA batteries, which are not included.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bildrullespelet
description:
User summary

A swedish self-published amateur game; simple and humouristic cardbased race game where the players try to reach goal as fast as possible. Game consists of a deck of cards and a simple race track with two illegal shortcuts. On a turn, the player may first move forward as many spaces as his previously played cards allow him, then he can play card either on himself (to increase movement) or on someone else (to get in their way). during the game, the players can use the shortcuts and ignore certain blocking cards, but if they do, they are "wanted" for one turn and may be the target for cop cards, which causes them to lose one turn and their current movement card.

name: 90210: Truth Be Told Challenge Game
description:
Publisher Description:

"You wanna live in the zip? You gotta live by the code! Dealing with cliques and classmates is a challenge at West Beverly, just ask Annie! Being popular ain't easy. You can you trust? Do you dare stand out against the crowd? The competition can be fierce, and what's West Beverly without drama, ohh the drama!!!"

A party game about the 2008 television series. Players complete "truth or dare" challenges or answer trivia to collect cards with digits. The first player to display 90210 on their personal board wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Mini-Quincala
description: An abstract strategy game that's a simplified version of the more complex Quincala, inspired by the 'sowing' mechanic of Mancala. Each player controls pieces of three different sizes, which can stack upon each other to form towers, thereby increasing their movement radius. Towers can also be formed from a combination of both players' pieces, which blocks all pieces involved from moving. Each piece can capture others of the same size, and the game is won when a player captures one of each type of piece.

name: error + delete
description:
User summary

An indie 2-player full information abstract. Players each have one of two identical set of 5 viruses, starting on one half of the board. Each turn, players must move one of their viruses according to that virus movement capacity. The goal of the game is to either delete each of your own viruses by stepping on the delete-square on the opponent's board half, or block the opponents every possible move – this is a victory by error

Game comes as a folded A4 cardboard. Half is the rules, the other half is cut out to form pieces and board.

name: Knock Tommy
description:
First shuffle the cards face downwards. Each player then draws seven cards each in turn. The game is played over 7 hands. In order, they are Tommy, Polly, Bob, Pam, Jim, Amy and Knock.When ready, the players call “TOMMY”.

The player who holds four-way “TOMMY” now plays that card to the centre of the table. The next player to his left, plays a “TOMMY” to the nearest point of four-way “TOMMY”. The next player to the left, plays a “TOMMY” to his nearest point. The fourth player does like-wise to the next point. The first player now closes the four-way by playing a “TOMMY” to the last vacant place.

If any player cannot “go” at any stage of the game, he asks the next player on his left to give him the card he wants. Should he be unable to do so, he asks the other players in turn, until the card is obtained. The borrower plays the card received, to his point. The next player continues to play to his own point, or does the same as the previous player, if unable to match the card he last played. Players must always play to their own point.

If a hand is completed, the next player must play a 4 Way Polly card, and cards are used in the same procedure as described (except it is Polly cards that must be added. After completion, 4 Way Bob is resolved, and so on until all seven are played (unless the game stops earlier than the very end).

The hand is finished when one player plays all his cards, or alternatively, when a player has tried all the players, and fails to get a card to enable him to 'go' at his point.

Each hand completely changes scoring possibilities. The complete seven hands can be played in twenty minutes. The player with the lowest score after the seven hands, wins.

name: The War to End All Wars: The North American Upgrade Set
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The North American Upgrade Set is an expansion set for The War to End All Wars and stand alone game. The North American Upgrade Set provides four primary game scenarios. The first two of these are attachment scenarios to allow this expanded map to be used with The War to End All Wars and the rest of the WW1 series. The first is simply new unit placements and expanded rules for the American entry into WWI. It provides expanded play options for the USA, Canada, and Mexico. The second is a scenario where the US is certain to enter on the Central Powers' side, and British, Canadian, Mexican, Japanese, and possibly even French forces must move to defeat or at least contain America and win the war in Europe before American war industries gear up to break to deadlock in the war. Additionally the game provides two stand alone scenarios. These are the War of 1812, and the American-Mexican War. The map provides resource differences for the three time periods, and therule book includes different set ups, political rules, and scenario guidelines for each war.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Leverage
description:
This is a simple "throw dice, move round track, pick up card and follow instructions" game that has some bells and whistles attached. The object of the game is to achieve a certain Profit and a 5/5 rating in each of four "Business Leverage" areas.
There are ten different coloured packs of cards that correspond to the square colours on the game track that influence these different areas. Some card instructions are mandatory, others optional and yet others are put up for auction.
There is a mildly complex record sheets to keep track of the different aspects and a caculator is a useful extra.

name: Chess 2000
description:
This is a two player (black and white) abstract game played on a 13 square by 12 board. The two centre squares of the opposite long sides are coloured white and the rest of the squares are each coloured one of six other colours.
Each player starts with 26 pieces, one king, two queens, two rooks four bishops, four knights and thirteen pawns. All except the king have a colour matching one or other of the board square colours and pieces start on the same rank as their king on their matching board square colour, pawns doing likewise on the second rank.
Pieces mostly move as in chess but the king can move up to three squares, the object being to be first to get your king onto the opposing player's king's starting square.
Pawns can be promoted to any piece that has been captured so that loss of your king is not necessarily fatal.

name: Duel of Aces
description:
From the website:

Duel of Eagles is part of the Wings at War series of wargames rules from Tumbling Dice. Duel is designed for recreating World War I air combat using Tumbling Dice's 1/600th scale aircraft models.

The games are designed to last around one or two hours. As the sky tends to be a lot less cluttered than the ground, games can be set up quickly and fewer models are required - making for a cheaper night out.

Any number of people can play. As the victory target is dependant on the size of a force, opposing sides don't have to be equally balanced, a smaller or less sophisticated mix of planes can defeat a larger or more advanced enemy by reaching their (lower) victory target first.

Each model represents and individual aircraft or balloon. Elevation is abstracted using 4 levels, and the game uses D6 and D3 (a d6 numbered 1,1,2,2,3,3) for combat resolution.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Christmas Chaos
description:
Santa's head elf Bartholomew has decided to retire, and rather than just choosing a replacement willy-nilly, the big guy has decided to leave the position open this year and let the top contenders for the job prove themselves over the holiday season! The players will be taking on the roles of these elves each of them trying to build toys as efficiently as possible to make all the good little girls and boys happy. Each one will be sending their helper elves to different locations at the North Pole - taking letters from children back to the workbench, gathering parts to build toys, recruiting more helper elves, or even tattling on each other! After the twelve days of Christmas are done, the elf that has done the best job this holiday season (by collecting the most victory points) will be named Santa's new Head Elf (and win the game)!

Christmas Chaos, designed by Bill Corey Jr, is a game for 3-5 players ages 10 and up, and takes 90-120 minutes to play. Christmas Chaos is a worker placement game with elements of resource gathering and management, and area influence.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Realism
description:
From the publisher:
Realism is an exciting board game of money and life that is great fun to play. Try to become a virtual millionaire by buying property, shares & other assets and learn about investment. Players have jobs; buy businesses and property; have mortgages, bank loans and credit cards and take out insurance. Opportunities allow a player to improve their assets and increase their income. Life Events affect an individual player and may be good or bad for their asset position. Market Events affect all players and could be good or bad. Luxuries cost the player money and don't earn any income. The length of the game is determined by the players but is typically around 90 minutes. The winner is the player with the most net assets at the end.
Net worth is calculated as the sum of all cash and investments (shares, property, bank deposits, speculations etc. including half the value of any luxuries) less any borrowings from the bank (mortgages, bank loans and credit cards).

name: Crysis Analogue Edition: The Board Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Crysis Analogue Edition: The Board Game transfers the unique game play of the award-winning and best-selling video game series Crysis to the game board! In the game, 2-8 players form two teams — CELL vs. US Forces — and battle for supremacy in a futuristic New York in fourteen different scenarios. Playing time varies depending on the scenario, with each game taking about 90+ minutes to complete.

Be fast! Be strong! Be invisible! Be the weapon!
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Stage
description:
Theater-themed card game. Players try to collect sets of a theatrical genre, such as farce or grand opera. Vaguely similar to Pit, but played in turn with one card exchanged at a time.

Description is based on rules that were included with a different game (see images).

name: Deutschland-Quiz: Niedersachsen
description:
Objective: gain most question cards finding correct answers
- acting by turns -
draw a card and give the correct answer;
if you are right keep card as bonus point

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Niedersachsen, state of Germany.

name: Wale und Delfine Quiz-Spiel
description:
"Whales and Dolphins Quiz Game" in English

32 cards show 2 questions with three answers each, the back side shows information and illustration on the subject. Players have question cards and risk cards, the starting player chooses a card and the candidate on his left tries to answer the first question - if he is right, the second is asked. In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his risk cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by risking one of his risk cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

name: IC Squared
description: IC Squared – a.k.a., IC² – is a tile placement game for two to four players with an old-style computer theme. In the game, players score points by placing a tile on the grid that completes one or more square circuits. Watch closely because if a player creates a square circuit and doesn't notice it, another player can steal the point. Players can also score additional points by capturing bugs placed by other players in a circuit of any shape. If a player causes her own bug to be captured in a circuit, she will lose points. When players have played a set number of tiles, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

name: Zomboozle
description:
Zomboozle: To throw someone to a zombie so that you can get away.

Zomboozle is a card game with a Euro chassis but a fun, sci-fi feel for two to five players that has players as neighbor captains in a zombie- and alien-ravaged world who are trying to become the Governor of Fornia (which is all that's left of California) by most effectively managing who gets in and out of their neighborhood.

Each turn, players attract human survivors to their neighborhood, then venture into The Wild to draw a new card. When a new card is selected, another player is dealt a card through a "Gifting" process. Thus, players must choose wisely when they select a card because they may be giving others a good card, too.

Midway through the game, players score for the humans in their neighborhood – counting themselves and dividing that number into The Human Alliance (people who reject the alien's attack) and the Neoxenophiliacs (those who embrace the extraterrestrials) – while also scoring for having the fewest aliens and zombies in their little fiefdoms. Scoring happens again at the end of the game, with the winning player gaining the prestigious role of Governor of Fornia. (Okay, it's not that prestigious.)

Zomboozle is notable for being the first game with the "Gifting Mechanism". When you draft a card, someone else gets a card as a result. The location of the card on a tableau or the information on the card might govern how the distribution occurs. This mechanism is in two other proposed games from 3Sided Card.

name: Theme Park
description:
In Theme Park, players take on the role of theme park managers that all work for the Earl Synergy Company, an entertainment giant that has spent the last 75 years making movies, television and theme parks for families around the world. Players get to run their own regional Synergyland theme park. Over the course of four years, each player makes the best use of his management team and resources to maximize his own Synergyland's performance by building out his parks; ensuring the right mix of attractions, shops and shows to draw tourists to his park; taking advantage of marketing opportunities to promote his own parks, both building overall attendance and his own block of it; and developing out his roster of executive staff. The player with the most victory points (including special "Brownie Points" for being a "company man") at the end of four years becomes the new CEO of the Earl Synergy Company and wins the game.

Each turn in Synergyland, players place their differently skilled executive pieces on the various company spaces to claim resources, attractions, shows, marketing opportunities and other items that will help build out their park so they can grab the highest attendance and revenue when the tourists are distributed throughout the year. Each year, different factors will affect the company as a whole, new marketing campaigns and brands will be developed that executives may or may not want to harness to drive the masses to their parks. But the trick to getting more value out of your company executives is that the more they collaborate, the better the synergy. When more than one executive is placed on a specific location, they generate more of an advantage, a more valuable park addition or a greater marketing campaign or they just make the item cheaper in the long run – although there are certainly some times when too much help means too many ideas...so be careful to get into that "sweet spot" for collaboration.

name: Wild Cards: For the Love of Cats
description: Adorable cats are paired with amazing facts in this game and book set that will have cat lovers of all ages oohing and ahhing. Can cats really see in the dark? How sensitive are their whiskers? What messages do they give with their tails? Learn all about cats and have endless fun playing brain-stimulating memory and matching games with friends and family.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Wild Cards: Dinosaurs
description: Discover which dinosaurs were ferocious killers and which ones were gentle giants as you play 3 games of memory and strategy. The deck of 36 cards includes some of the biggest, smallest, fiercest, fastest, and strangest dinosaurs. Each card gives the Latin name of the dinosaur and what the name means. Children also see how big each dinosaur is compared to themselves. The companion fact book has the latest scientific information
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Atomic Submarine: Up Scope!
description:
This is a vintage 1950s dexterity game with a submarine warfare theme.

The "gimmick" is a combination periscope/torpedo launcher that functions like an actual sub! Stand-up cardboard models of enemy ships are set up on a large triangular board decorated with ocean graphics. The sub commander looks through the mirrored periscope device (viewing down, not up, of course!) to target the enemy ships. The device contains two torpedo launchers with spring-loaded triggers. The torpedo looks like a plastic dart from a vintage dart pistol, but without the rubber tip. When the sub commander has the enemy in sight, he pulls the trigger and launches the torpedo. Scoring is based on the target value of the ships.

Includes the periscope/launcher device, ships, torpedo darts, ocean board, and rules.

name: Gregs Tagebuch: Von Idioten umzingelt! – Suche die unterschiede
description:
The game is about finding differences in the images faster than your opponent. Mark them on the erasable cards with the provided marker. The first one to complete an image keeps the card. Collect a week's worth (seven) cards to create a comic, tell the story and win the game.

The box also contains blank cards. Use these to create your own images.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Novel-based

name: Sweet Desires
description: Sweet Desires is a game of playful activity for a couple. Each player rolls the dice and moves around the board to collect Sweet Desires cards. Each Sweet Desires card has a romantic couple's activity on it. Pit and Cream cards can be used to block the other player. The first player to collect Sweet Desire cards for Monday to Saturday is the winner.

name: Sõpradega kooliteel
description:
Roll the dice and move game.
Players are children going to school. If player move to green circle he advances further, if red circle he must go back somewhere. In yellow circles player must answer the questions about traffic-signs. If the answer is wrong player misses next turn.

Who finishes first is the winner.

name: Lone Survivor
description:
You are inside Lone Survivor Hospital. Mysterious murders have been occurring there for the past three weeks. Electronic doors locked behind you as you entered. Everyone in the hospital fears for his safety, and all the characters are fighting for their survival. Will you be the last one to survive? To do so, you must eliminate all your opponents before they eliminate you.

The object of Lone Survivor is for each player to try to keep his/her character alive until there are no other players. To survive, you need to eliminate all your opponents before they get you. When only one player is the lone survivor, the game ens and that player is declared the winner.

In order to eliminate opponents, you must first move around the hospital and acquire a weapon. Movement is accomplished via playing cards, while weapons can be picked up from their starting location, or stolen from another player. A player may eliminate another player at the end of their turn if (1) you have a murder weapon in your possession, (2)you and your victim are the only two players in the room, and (3) you have the appropriate murder weapon card.

name: Castle Guards
description:
"Capture the fort!"

This children's dexterity game with a military theme features a spring-loaded cannon which fires wooden dowels (representing artillery shells) at cardboard soldiers. The target soldiers are mounted on slotted wooden stands. The game also includes a cardboard castle with a gate. Players score points by knocking down the figures.

Includes the cannon, artillery projectile dowels, soldiers, the fort, and rules.

name: Decryption
description:
Players take on the role of rival hackers of the early 1980's trying to decipher each others secret rule they used to encrypt an important piece of code.

S E T U P
Deal each player 8 cards. The remaining cards form a draw pile.
Think of a secret rule using the colors, shapes, and numbers on the cards that you can begin with 2 cards from your hand
Example rules:
even, odd, even, odd numbers
only triangles
only green and numbers increasing by 2
Write the secret rule on a sheet of paper and keep it hidden from your opponents
Place the 2 cards that start your pattern in order, face up in front of you.

G A M E P L A Y
Player to the left of the dealer begins
Play a card, face up, from your hand as the next card in one of your opponents patterns
If the card is played correctly, your opponent says “yes” and leaves the card as part of the pattern
If the card is played incorrectly, your opponent says “no” and pulls the card towards them in that space

or
Discard a card from your hand that you believe will not be the next card on any of your opponents patterns
Starting with the player to your left, a player can pick up the discard and place it on their pattern, if it works.
The card is pushed forward in its space to show this card was picked up from being discarded, but is correct

or
Play a key generator card from your hand in front of one opponent
The opponent draws one card
Then, ask that opponent to play a card from their hand onto their own pattern
If the opponent doesn’t have a card that will play as the next card in their pattern, they must discard a card

S C O R I N G
When all 8 cards have been played from each players hand, players total the point value of the cards that are placed on their own pattern. After 3 hands, Highest score wins!

The 2 cards played to begin the pattern are worth 2 points
Cards that were played correctly are worth 1 point
Cards that were played incorrectly (pulled back) and cards that were picked up from the discard pile (pushed forward) are each worth 2 points.
If a player has less than 3 cards played on his pattern (including key generaor cards), they receive 10 bonus points for the round

name: Skate Tour
description:
The national Skate Tour is coming to your ramp, so now is the chance to show the judges your stuff.

You started with an Ollie Impossible, playing to the judges for a while, but your buddy pulled a sweet Tail Slide followed up with a Double Kickflip, so now the judges think he’s the pro.

So should you go for a big trick right away?
You have to decide right now, because as your first Skate Tour, you can’t afford to hesitate, otherwise your buddy will end up the winner.

So pull some easy tricks to warm up, but don’t let someone else steal your big finish.

To compete, lay down a stronger trick than the previous skater or play a better executed one by laying down more cards of the same trick. If you run out of tricks, that’s good! It means you’ve gone the distance and shown off your whole routine!

Not only can you enjoy Skate Tour on its own, but the tricks are printed on a complete deck of poker cards.

A trick-beating game for 2 to 6 players, Skate Tour brings the heavy one-upmanship of skateboarding to your table!

name: The Waning Shadow
description:
The Waning Shadow is a revamped, Hemloch-themed edition of Politico.

To become the next ruler, players must choose either to politic with the members of the kingdom's four classes, or to use their political pull as royalty to change the lives of the people, for better or worse! The first player to gain thirteen followers, with at least one follower from each class, becomes the next ruler and winner.

name: Mr. Buckethead Adventure Game Series: Mr. Buckethead Vs. Doctor Neuron
description:
Mr. Buckethead races on his Super-Scooter and learns secret Kung-Fu powers in a battle against the alien monster criminal Dr. Neuron and an entire alien monster army!

This is an interactive gamebook where the player constantly chooses options in an evolving comic-book-like story, collecting money, items, friends and Action Points (used to activate special powers). The book includes a scoresheet and many puzzles and mini-games throughout, as the player works to gain the challenging Victory Point (by defeating the Moom Monster). Like other books in the series, there is also a 2-player monster fight mini-game included.

ABOUT THE SERIES:
Based on the live action television and film character, this new series of interactive gamebooks is adventure-packed! 64 pages of intense gameplay action with an innovative story structure that allows continuous play across multiple issues. Each issue in this series contains a solo adventure plus a bonus multi-player monster fighting game! The appeal of an evolving RPG with the look and feel of a comic book, the Mr. Buckethead Adventure Game Series is challenging and entertaining fun for all ages!
categories: Adventure, Book, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Exploration, Fighting, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
mechanics: Memory, Network and Route Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pocket Quiz: Knifflige Knobeleien
description:
A pocket sizes trivia game with 50 cards. The game consists entirely of little mental exercises in form of text riddles which aim to test your logical thinking and knowledge.
Each card has the correct answer printed on the back so you know if you were right or not.

name: Virion
description: Virion is a war strategy game where players battle for territories using troops, tactics cards, and bio-weapons (virions) that they develop by investing their resources. The goal of the game is to be the last player to possess a capital. Different regions have different allotments of troops/money, thus changing a player's strategy from game to game. Battling is dice-based, with tactics cards being used to modify the battles. As virions are developed they become more powerful, becoming game-changers. Players must develop a hospital infrastructure to allow them to deploy their troops and save them from enemy attacks.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Clicker
description:
The game consists of a wooden box containing 9 wooden tiles numbered 1 to 9 printed on both sides of the tile, one side yellow and the other pink, and an additional tile without numbers. At the beginning of the game the tiles are mixed and placed all with the same color side up in the back of the box. One side of the playing area is marked yellow and the other pink. The players decide which one is playing with each colored edege.

The starting player then pushes the unnumbered tile against any tile, causing thus one tile to be push out of the gaming area. The newly placed tile must show the opposite color of the starting one. The second player takes the tile slid out and uses it now as above. The game ends after 8 moves, when only one tile of the original color remains.

The winner is the player who gets the higher score by adding the three tiles placed on his colored edge. The unnumbered tile counts as zero.

name: Johnny & Co
description:
The goal in this game for very young kids is to collect as many sets of four equal tiles as possible. The sets are collected on tractor boards.
The active player rolls a die and flips over as many tiles as the die shows. If there are several tiles with the same image, the player takes these and places them on his/her tractor board. All other tiles are flipped back and returned to the middle of the table (everyone tries to remember where). If all tiles are different, the player just chooses one. If a Johnny (the name of the tractor) symbol is rolled, all players pass their incomplete tractor boards to the left (they can keep complete ones). When all sets have been collected, the player with most sets is the winner.

name: Mr. Buckethead Adventure Game Series: Mr. Buckethead Vs. The Astro-Gorillas
description:
Mr. Buckethead infiltrates Astro-Gorilla territory to recover top-secret high-tech components for the new experimental SUPER-BLASTOV rocketship. From highway chases in the BZX spy car to adventures in a dark alien dungeon lair, it's danger at every turn!

This is an interactive gamebook where the player constantly chooses options in an evolving comic-book-like story, collecting money, items, friends and Action Points (used to activate special powers). The book includes a scoresheet and many puzzles and mini-games throughout, as the player works to gain the challenging Victory Point (by defeating the Moom Monster). Like other books in the series, there is also a 2-player monster fight mini-game included.

ABOUT THE SERIES:
Based on the live action television and film character, this new series of interactive gamebooks is adventure-packed! 64 pages of intense gameplay action with an innovative story structure that allows continuous play across multiple issues. Each issue in this series contains a solo adventure plus a bonus multi-player monster fighting game! The appeal of an evolving RPG with the look and feel of a comic book, the Mr. Buckethead Adventure Game Series is challenging and entertaining fun for all ages!
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Exploration, Fighting, Humor, Maze, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents

name: The Movie Murder Mystery Party
description:
The Movie Murder Mystery Party is murder mystery game where guests take the roles of various cast and crew members celebrating the completion of filming of their movie. At the start of the game, each player is given a character and a personality trait sheet from a set of 20 options. With the couples' rules, two players may share the same character. Players get to know each other in a party setting until the director, the game's host, suddenly dies at the party.

Before the players arrived, the game's host hid clues about the murderer's personality. When the director dies, the party turns into a scavenger hunt. Players use the clues and deduction to deduce who killed the director to win the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Mayhem
description:
Described by the publisher as 'The Word Game of Utter Chaos'.

A family game of utter chaos and craziness as players grab letters and shout words, all within a particular category. Equally challenging for kids and adults. Categories available for kids and families.

Once players fill the game board with letters, one person will draw a card with a list of categories. Players then scramble to grab as many pieces as they can by thinking of words that fit into the category and start with each letter. The categories vary in difficulty, so younger players can join in on simple sets like "dessert" or "seen at the supermarket" while more advanced players are challenged by "tools" and "historic events." You can play until the board is cleared, or until all players are stumped, and the person with the most letters at the end wins. To level the playing field, each letter has a different color on the back — players can agree to only award points to certain color pieces, adding an element of chance to the outcome.

Contents: Game board, 50 letter tokens, 50 cards (250 categories), scoring pad and pencil

name: WordGirl Worrrd Up! Game
description:
Endowed with power punches and dictionary strength, WordGirl™ makes fun and learning go hand in hand! Help WordGirl™ build a Word Tower to rescue the city from Dr. Two-Brains!

Draw cards to get words that you spell on your building pieces. Players cooperatively add their building pieces to the tower as they spell their words. The more words, the higher the tower. Players of higher skill levels compete spelling longer words.

Reading is required.

name: Archon Arena
description:
The game takes place in the universe of Nemyne, an entire world on the head of a pin, literally. At these scales magic is real, fantastical beasts roam, and good and evil vie for supremacy. At the heart of Nemyne is Archon Arena. Here the lords of the land, the Archons, wage ruthless battles night and day. Combatants with equal resources call forth the power of melee and magic: weapons, armor, maneuvers, spells and potions, all under the watchful eye of the battle leader. They have only one goal, to eliminate the opponent. Winning means prestige and acclaim; and being the target of countless challengers.

A duel in Archon Arena consists of three battles. The two players each begin with equal decks that are randomly divided into three piles, one for each upcoming battle. For a given battle each player chooses a surprise reserve card and a leader who grants a special ability. Then a round consists of playing cards simultaneously, comparing offense and defense, and tallying damage. The battle is complete when one or both players lose all their hit points, and the overall winner is the player who wins more of the three battles.

name: Schnatti Schnatter
description:
In this game the child learns to know the colors. They must listen well, what color Mama duck calls, and then search the duck that listens to it. At the bottom of the duck children recognize if it is really the right ducks. If it is true, the player may give a piece of bread to the ducks.
If Mama duck quacks, all ducklings find their place in the new pond.
First player who has no more bread pieces left wins the game.

name: Mor In A Row
description: Players take turns dropping marbles through the slots at the top of the tower, trying to create vertical, horizontal, or diagonal rows of 4 or more marbles of the same color. A nice addition to an old game is that each column has a screw at the bottom, so players can twist it in his turn; with each twist the bottom marble drops down, shifting the whole pattern.

name: Cosmic Wombat
description:
Cosmic Wombat is a collectible card game played with the business cards of Cosmic Wombat Games. Collect as many as you can and challenge your friends to see if you can win their cards.

It plays like Rock, Paper, Scissors

Asteroid crushes Space Station
Space Station uploads virus to Ray Gun
Ray Gun vaporizes Asteroid

name: Welcome to Wall Street
description: We're proud to bring "Welcome to Wall Street" to the public for the first time. We have worked for years making this the most exciting game of investing ever! A player buys stock and commodities through and tries to build up his/her portfolio while trying to bankrupt other investors. An investor can also force opponents to sell them their shares through "Hostile Takeovers". Investors have opportunities to purchase IPOs, force others to share their profits when they get Mutual Funds, and investors will also face having their transportation repossessed and get stuck driving a "beater" if bad investments are made. When an investor goes bankrupt, the investor with the most cash assets is declared the "King" or "Queen" of the bulls. There's some back stabbing and luck involved. It's a "Dog eat Dog" world out there. This is one place you can lose it all and still walk away laughing. "Welcome to Wall Street".

name: Rumble Tactics
description:
A turn based tactics strategy game pitting two armies against each other for total dominating victory. The last one standing is the victor. Armies consist of units that range from a wide range of factions, including circus performers, fairies and the undead.

The game begins with an always changing battlefield and a win/lose condition being selected, such as last one standing or capture the flag. Players then take their fully customized armies and deploy their units one at a time, alternating players between each unit to ensure both offensive and defensive lineups. When the deploy is completed, players alternate activating each of their units, moving and attacking, to try to reach the win condition.

Each unit has their own critical stats, such as Attack value, Defensive value, movement value, attack grids and inherent powers. To stop overpowered armies, associated costs are also attached to each unit to put a cap on army limits. Strategy doesn't lie in the most powerful units, it lies in picking the right units for your army and how to position them best counter your opponent's strategies.

Ultimately, he idea behind Rumble Tactics is a tactics strategy game that is affordable, portable, and customizable.

AFFORDABILITY: the game in its core is and will always be free to play by making it "print and play". If fancier cards and tokens are requested, for example, DIY solutions are available.

PORTABLE: The Unit Tokens are 1" in size and a standard battlefield is no larger than a piece of 8.5 x 11 paper. With the addition of a handful of Unit Cards and d6, you've got a game that you can take anywhere and play at even the smallest of restaurant tables.

CUSTOMIZABLE: Through both the BGG site and Rumble Tactics site, all of the rules, cards, and tokens will be available in many graphic formats so players can create their own units. Want an army full of cows that shoot lasers? Why not. As long as you and your friends/opponents agree on the units, the possibilities are endless. There's even a handy spreadsheet to input values (attack, defense, etc.) that will calculate the COST of each unit, making it as fair as possible.

Come join the fun and fill the ranks of Rumble Tactics!

name: Brigandine
description:
Brigandine is a casual open-source skirmish-level fantasy tabletop miniatures rules set. Like many tactical minis wargames, Brigandine uses the I-go-U-go style. The rules are minimalist, and involve very little arithmetic and dice rolling.

Brigandine features:

- A simple hit resolution system that requires only one die roll per action
- Unit creation rules to allow for any miniatures to be used
- A light, flexible magic system
- A campaign system to link battles in a narrative, and an appendix with an introductory campaign
- No tie to a specific universe or mythos or theme
- 8 sample forces with 40 typical fantasy units generated using the unit creation rules
- An open source license that encourages and forking/redistribution
- Scenarios that work on small (24"x24") game boards

Brigandine is licensed under the GNU Free Documentation License.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Emden vs. Sydney
description:
Emden vs. Sydney is a tactical naval wargame for two players, based on a modified version of the classic rules first developed by Fletcher Pratt in the 1930s. The game simulates the Battle of Cocos that took place on November 9, 1914, between the German cruiser Emden and the Australian cruiser Sydney in the South Indian Ocean.

Emden vs. Sydney is a simple, all-skill game in which players maneuver their ship on the floor and fire at the enemy to inflict damage. The Emden—a raider that had captured or sank over 100,000 tons of shipping since the outbreak of hostilities—met its end in the actual battle at the hands of the Sydney, a light cruiser with larger guns and superior range. The game is one of skill, as players not only use strategy in moving their ship, but also must direct and estimate the range of their gunfire towards the enemy. Good tactics—and a good eye for directing fire—can spell the difference between victory and defeat.

name: Qero
description:
Qero is played on a rectangular 5 times 5 board. As with most old games the exact rules passed on over time are not exactly clear. Variants described here are usually taken from Internet or book sources mentioned or as found, played and explained by word of mouth on mediaeval LARP conventions. The game is assumed to be derived from or match the family of Alquerque.

Mentioned web sites or references claim Qero to be an ancient mediaeval game of unknown source. Thus on the one hand unfortunately no game author can be listed and on the other hand it should not have any legal restrictions, trademarks, patents, or utility patterns in place. The game is in the public domain.

Mostly Qero is played without any specific line patterns shown on board (in contrast to Alquerque). If a line pattern is shown on the board players may agree on performing moves on each direction of lines shown by the pattern only. Thus moves are allowed along the lines only. Otherwise rules might allow horizontal and vertical moves only. By agreement diagonal moves in any direction could be performed as well. Although the later seems to be quite uncommon.

Variant 1: Started on an empty board the players set up all their pieces first. Players' pieces are facing up their own symbol or color. The pieces are placed onto the remaining free positions of the board in alternating game play. Thus if no player achieved a winning situation during this board set up phase then the first player ends up with 13 gaming pieces set and the second player set 12 gaming pieces of own color.

Up to that point it is a typical 5-in-a-row variant like tic-tac-toe, Renju, Pente, or Go-Moku without any kind of capturing. After this set up phase game play changes although the goal is still to build a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of five of your pieces. After set up phase take a piece of your color off the chosen edge position and place it back on the board shifting the other pieces filling up the newly formed gap (from the end of an incomplete row or column of your choice). Like in Quixo... Probably just gut feeling: There seem to be less draw situations in direct comparison to Quixo (assumed experienced players really try to achieve winning the game).

In this Qero variant the amount of pieces on board controlled by the player is fixed after the initial set up phase. So you could simply use some two sided game pieces (Othello/Reversi) or even simple pawns (e.g. 13 white plus 12 black pawns w/ white starting the game) and start playing on any 5 times 5 board as well.

Variant 2: Started on an empty board the players set up all their pieces first. Players' pieces are facing up their own symbol or color. The pieces are placed onto the remaining free positions of the board in alternating game play. Each player sets up 12 pieces of own color if no player achieved a winning situation during this board set up phase. One board position remains empty.

Up to that point it is a typical 5-in-a-row variant, too. There is no kind of capturing opponent's gaming pieces. After this set up phase game play changes although the goal is still to build a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of five of your own pieces. The game continues and a player's turn consists in chosing any type of gaming piece may it be own or opponent's from the edge positioned in direct straight line towards the board position left empty. From the chosen board position push all pieces in between in straight line so the chosen position is the new empty position.

Variant 3: At start of game on all but one board position a die is placed with none symbol facing or a symbol indicating a neutral field not owned by any player. The dice has to show various faces (one with a number or symbol for the first player, another for the second player and finally one for indicating neutral positions). Compared to previous variants there is no set up phase.

A player's turn consists in selecting a die showing an empty or own symbol from the edge. If this die is showing an empty face it turns to show the face with the player's symbol now. The selected die has to be positioned in direct straight line towards the board position left empty. Otherwise it can not be selected. From the chosen board position push all pieces in between in straight line so the chosen position is the new empty position. Again the goal is still to build a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of five of your own pieces.

Obviously a fourth variant could be introduced similiar to the one before allowing to chose any (not just own or empty) die from the edge instead.

Variant 2 is most-likely targeted and described in German in "Allerley Spielerey - Spielen wie im Mittelalter", Gisela Muhr and Eleonore Sieck, ISBN 978-3-939722-38-0, p.118, 2011, published by Regionalia. The book includes only an abstract description how the authors interprete to push a chosen stone from the edge (is it allowed to use own color only or could the opponent's color be chosen as well?) to the empty position exactly.

name: The Expanse: Bash Drive
description: This promo card for The Expanse allows the user to change the position of Anomalies while moving. This card was provided to Board Game Bash attendees at the premiere event.

name: Pop 'n' Spawn
description:
Pop 'n' Spawn is a 2-player abstract strategy board game where players attempt to occupy territory with mushrooms. Once placed on the board, mushrooms have the capacity to spawn endless copies of themselves in different directions. Players struggle for supremacy by growing, defending and capturing mushrooms.

Players take alternating turns to play. On each turn a player places one mushroom of his colour on an empty square on the board. Before placing the mushroom, the player chooses the direction of the mushroom to be up, down, left or right; the direction is indicated by an arrow on the mushroom. After playing the mushroom the player's turn ends and his mushroom(s) will now spawn: each of his mushrooms on the board will make a duplicate of itself in the direction of the arrow on the mushroom.

Mushrooms that spawn towards each other will combine their directions allowing them to make copies of themselves in multiple directions. If a player's mushroom spawns towards his opponent's mushroom, it will attack and capture it, changing the colour to its own. However a capture can be prevented if the defending mushroom has a direction opposed to the attacking mushroom. After spawning the turn passes to the next player and so on.

The board is made up of grass squares which are worth 1 point as well as flower squares which are worth 3 points. A player earns the points on the square in which he has a mushroom. The game ends when there are no more empty squares on the board and the winner is the player with the most points.

Play online: http://www.popnspawn.com

name: Black Hole
description:
Black Hole was invented some years ago as a result of the game designer's fascination with strange cosmic phenomena.

Black Hole is a strategy game, not hard to learn, but extremely hard to play well. It should appeal to anyone who enjoys spatial games and puzzles like the Rubik's Cube or strategic games like Chess.

The aim of the game is simple, capture as many stars as possible by creating black holes while preventing your opponents from doing the same. The game plays much like the pen and paper game boxes. Each turn the player draws one "star" token from the supplied cloth bag (Affectionately known as the "nebula" and places it into an empty region of "space" on the the board.

Once a certain threshold number of adjacent stars is reached the whole zone collapses into a black hole and the player who played the star captures all of the stars in the collapsed zone before playing another star. With more than two players the game becomes mind-bogglingly difficult to think more than one move ahead making the tactics almost impossible to work out.

The game ships with two play modes, a basic mode in which all stars score the same and a more complicated advanced game where players compete to not only capture the most stars but the highest scoring ones as well. The advanced game also introduces gravity charges that allow players to remove a black hole from the board if stuck.

All in all a great little time waster that will continue to be played for years to come.
publishers: Gravitysoft Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Short Cuts
description:
A traditional roll the dice and move on game that incorporates the theme of safety in the workplace.
The game allows for you to jump ahead in the game by taking 'short cuts'. You may get in the lead quickly but there is a cost involved. You may get away with gambe, you may have an accident and have to put a plaster on you. Get 3 plasters and you are killed off.
The idea is to train people that where taking a short cut in processes may pay off in the short term, in the long term you are gambling with your life.
The game is Print & Play and involves a board, sets of cards and a rule sheet. You will also need a box of plasters and a simple timer if you want to keep the game to a specified time.
If you decide to incorporate this into your workplace you could use counters that have something to do with that business: As a can manufacturer we used mini aerosol cans.
An understanding of PPE would be helpful. (Personal Protective Equipment)

name: Safety League
description:
This is a children's game designed to teach younger kids about safety. Players move along a pathway and answer simple questions that offer educational information. The board is divided into zones, and each zone has a matching card deck:

Neighborhood Safety
School Safety
Travel Safety
Street Safety
Home Safety
Shopping Safety
Internet Safety

There is also an "Interactive" deck which requires the child to perform a simple safety-related charade.

Sample Question: On a class trip to the museum, is it best to stay with your group?

Answer: Yes. Never go off on your own. Stay safe and stay with your class. Enjoy your visit.

Players can advance on the next turn with a correct answer. The first player to reach the finish line is declared the winner.

Includes a colorful board, cards, six tokens, a die, and a storage insert. The rules are printed on the box.

Designed for 2 to 6 children at least six years old.

name: Tornado Arena
description:
Each player has a press-o-matic tornado​​.
They place them to the arena and both press the start button. The tornado that spins the longest wins and score points (indicated on the tornado). Who scored the most points after 5 duels wins.

name: Glockenturm-Gesellschaftsspiel
description:
Promotional game by a producer of egg-noodles.

The enormous board features 8 starting points (one for each player and up to 8 players can play). From your starting point there is a track up the bell-tower, to reach the bells in the centre of the board.

The game is a simple roll and move game but with the slight originality of the separate tracks. However the tracks are all identical. When you land on the special spaces, follow the instructions (that are on the inside of the lid). First to reach the centre, wins.

name: Politocracy The Game
description:
Politocracy The Game is a presidential election campaign board game in which Conservative, Progressive and Centrist candidates compete in a race to occupy the White House. The game is a fun and educational political game for the family, friends, adversaries and Politocrats.

Players roll a die to move along the Campaign Trail, amassing popularity at each Constituent, depending upon Ideology, and whether the Candidate has sufficient funds to acquire the Constituents. At a Political Poll, Candidates can roll the die to access the 'Money Trail' – to collect funds - Deficit Dollars - from Interest Groups needed to acquire the support of Constituents. The cost and benefit of each Constituent and the collection of Constituents owned or controlled by a Candidate are based on their Ideology. Decisions must be made by the Candidates as to which Ideology they should chose or be to win: Conservative or Progressive.

Hope and Change can drastically affect a Candidate’s quest for the White House, either advancing or hindering. This is where things can get “dirty”.

Towards the end, an election is held where two final Candidates compete in each of the 10 U.S. Regions to secure the majority (270) Electoral Votes needed to claim the White House. Winning a region may seem as simple as rolling the highest die. However, elections (die rolls) can be influenced by money, advertising and more. Investing in both positive and negative ads is essential.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Battle of the Sexes: Chocolate After Dinner Mint Edition
description:
Objective: To test your knowledge of the opposite sex through a series of gender based questions. The first player ro team to get their token across the board via the fastest route to their opponents start position wins the "I am the superior sex" badge and wins the remaining after dinner mints.

Contents:
24 After Dinner Mints (medals)
1 gameboard, 6 counters (3 male, 3 female)
1 "I am the superior sex" badge
60 game cards: 20x his, 20x hers, 10 female wild cards, 10 male wild cards.

name: Bar Hopping
description:
Bar Hopping is a roll-and-move drinking game which instructs players on alternatives to drinking and driving. Players (or teams of players) move their playing pieces (cars) around the board and perform actions on cards that they draw, depending on which space they land on. The first player (or team) to complete the predetermined number of kilometers is the winner.

From the game box:

"You and your friends are out bar hopping, when you suddenly realize that nobody can legally drive. So you all decide that the smartest thing to do would be to take a cab home. Great move, but here is where the twist in the game begins. While riding home in the cab, everyone falls asleep and starts to dream. These dreams turn into the worst nightmares of your life. Believe it or not, you actually start dreaming that you are driving home from the bar. Like most dreams, this one is just as crazy, as you will soon find out. When the dreams begin, so does the game. The only way to wake up and end these horrible nightmares is to win the game by being the first person, or team, to obtain the predetermined amount of kilometers set before starting the game."

name: More Convoluted
description: More Convoluted takes the Convoluted series to the next level; even more ways to win! With new actions like Salvage and Recycle. Don’t have the winning card? Try taking it from the discard pile. Players race to complete words that change so be quick, only one can claim a word! Too late? Try for a different word. Wild cards replace any letter! But too many will hurt your score. In a game where scoring matters. 10 points to win! More Convoluted: social, engaging, fun and fraught.

name: Respawn
description:
Respawn is a action packed board game that blends a sci-fi setting with the action of PC shooters and some tactical elements of miniature games into a sizable slug fest.
On each turn, a player gets 3 actions in which to make their moves/attacks, then it's on to the next player. During ones turn, you collect from dozens of items and weapons, blow up your buddy and score points. Be careful though, as the more points you score, the more points you are worth to others.
The game features 6 different characters, 10 unique weapons, and a dozen items and gadgets. Maps can be made differently each game with 4 double sided map sheets, and contains rules and components for multiple game types.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Brain Shift
description:
Four steering wheels anchor the Brain Shift game, with one wheel designated for each player. In the center of the game sits the stick shift, surrounded by six color (and numbered) lights: (1) red; (2) green; (3) yellow; (4) blue; (5) orange; and (6) white. During a game, players will shift to each of these lights according to the prescribed pattern.

There are six games in all:
Stick Shift: Brain Shift calls out a player, followed by a color, the player must shift to that color. Additional colors are added and the time to complete the shift decreases until only one player is left. Later on in the game, the timer in the game becomes so fast that the player is forced to 'shift' the color whilst it's being called out. Most notability, at later shift levels such as trying to get 14 shifts, the game will cheat the player at the very last shift. The last green on level 14 becomes impossible to shift to and will cause the player to fail.
Memory Shift: Brain Shift calls out a player, plus a sequence of colors. Players must shift to these colors or be eliminated. Players are called in order.
Who Shifts It: Just like Memory Shift except random players are chosen each turn.
Ear Shift: A sound is associated to each light. Brain Shift plays the sounds and players must shift to the appropriate color that is assigned to that sound to stay in the game.
Secret Shift: Brain Shift gives you one color, then you must guess the others in 60 seconds. One player only.
Shift Around: Brain Shift provides a starting sequence. Thereafter, each player adds one color after completing the previous sequence.

The game also has a hidden 'test mode'. To access the test mode, you must hold down the 'POWER' and 'PAUSE' buttons, remove battery cover, take out one battery 'not the top left or bottom left batteries' and then release the two buttons. You will hear a hidden 'Happy Birthday' music. If you shift green, you will hear most of the voices in the game. If you shift yellow, you'll hear the main menu music and if you shift blue, you'll hear most of the voices used in game and the gameplay background music. If you shift red you will hear a beep and if you shift white you'll hear the Happy Birthday music again. Don't shift white too many times or the game will shut off and exit test mode.

In 2018, Samtastic Games Studios successfully created a game called Mob Shift that remakes the Brain Shift toy for iOS and Android and it also works nicely on PC and Mac. Mob Shift version 2.0 can be downloaded from the iTunes Store and itch.lo for $1.99.

Windows, Mac Version Download link: https://samtastic.itch.io/mob-shift

iTunes Store link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/mob-shift/id1361156814

name: Alba
description:
Simple dice word game, published by Alba, a British radio and television manufacturer. The game comprises of four dice, kept in a leather wallet,

Any number can play. The four dice are thrown by each player in turn and the first player to throw the word 'ALBA', wins and takes the prize or kitty. Those are the rules although the publisher does say that "many variations can be thought up of this popular party game". For instance, a player throwing all four of the same letter can get a second place prize, and so on.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Jinx 11
description:
Dice game with elements of Shut the Box.

Each player lines up a set of cards in two rows:
6 7 8 9 10
12 13 14 15 16
First player throws the numbered blocks (i.e. dice) and turns face down the card that corresponds to the sum of the top numbers of the blocks. If he should throw 11 on the first turn he merely misses turning over a card, but at all later turns he must turn up a card he has already turned down if he has any.
Play passes to the right. On the second and all other turns, if a player throws a number that he has already turned over, the first player to the right who still has the number may turn it over and have a turn throwing the blocks.
Play continues to the right, it does not go back to those who lost a turn. If every player has turned over the number that is thrown, it is “dead" and the one who threw it may throw again until he throws a number that he or some other player can use, or until he throws an 11.
If a player throws 11, it is good strategy to turn up a number that is "dead" or one that has three chances to one to be thrown. For example, only 3 and 3 make 6, but 3 and 7, 4 and 6, or 5 and 5 make 10.

The first player to get all the cards turned over is winner and the first player next game. Four to six players recommended.

name: 4SQR
description: A tile-on-tile laying word game for 2 or more players. The board consists of seven tiles, each with a two-by-two grid of spaces. In the early turns, these are laid out and letter tiles placed on them. Once they are all out, turns consist of moving a board tile and replacing the letters. Score more for longer words and multiple words. The game can be played for a predetermined number of rounds or to a points target.

name: Blast-Off
description:
Space race game. Object of the game is to move 4 satellites completely around the orbit in a clockwise direction and into their correct position in "Final stage" marked by corresponding colour.

Movement of satellites is by the roll of the dice with a 1 or 6 to start a satellite from inside its rocket to the blast off position to begin the orbit . The satellite then moves around the orbit by exact number of spaces indicated by the dice. If a player lands on his opponents satellite, he knocks his opponents satellite out of orbit sending it back to the start. Satellites may land on hazards which sends them back to their original position in the rocket.

The satellites are coloured marbles

Copyright 1958 by Quality - Craft Products

Distributed by Raoul Inmports Inc. Dallas Texas

name: A Trip to the Moon
description:
Early space exploration to the moon

A simple spin and move game based very much on the Jules Verne From the Earth to the Moon novel. The instructions describe a group of men who form the Cannon Club with the objective of firing a projectile (air coach) from a cannon to the moon. The players travel inside the air coach to the moon and return safely to earth.
Two versions of this game exist. A large version (and possibly earlier) is titled "The Journey to the Moon". This differs from the smaller version by name and having cards that determine the number of spaces a player moves during his turn. The smaller version uses a spinner to direct movement. The larger version includes metal playing pieces that are in the form of both men and women. The smaller version most likely used markers
The playing board has the moon central and imaginary graphics of what space travel might be like in early 20th century. Players advance 35 spaces to reach the moon and another 35 to return to earth. The first player to reach the 70th space by direct number is the winner. Along the way, players landing on red numbers follow the rules to incur either a penalty or benefit.

Unknown German publisher but from the graphics and costumes on the playing pieces early 20th century.

name: Journey to the Moon
description:
Space exploration game from earth to the moon, where the object is to navigate 2 rocket ships from earth to the moon which keeps circling the earth. Three artificial satellites also circle the earth and rocket ships land on each of the moving bases before reaching their objective. First to reach both ships on the moon is the winner.

Moon and satellites are flat coloured disks. Rocket ships and similar to wooden golf tees.

Devised by B. and A. Reid

Published by Geographia probably late 1950s

name: Colonel Jet Space Game
description:
Simple spin and move game that advances through space. For two players, th objective is to see which Colonel Jet can get his armada of 3 space ships to the top of the world.

Interestingly, the playing pieces also can be worn as lapels with pins for hats, button holes, shirts etc. The tin spinner (windsock indicator) is secured into the board.

Produced by Silver Rich Corp. 32-36 Greenpoint Av, Long Island, N.Y. Dated 1952.

name: Don Future Rocketeer
description:
Space adventure, real estate game where players travel around the solar system to control planets, moons and rocket companies. The objective is to have the most property and money at the end of the game.

Large monopoly style space game board where each player moves his rocket ship around the outside of the board buying up planets or rocket stations. He then builds rocket fields on his planets and returns to earth to collect more money from the space bank. The game has a three dimensional feel with planets and moons as solid coloured balls on the central area of the playing board. Rocket fields are smaller orange balls place atop of the planets by coloured sticks. Space-o-gram cards are similar to chance cards in monopoly.

name: Rocket Patrol
description:
Tactical space war game similar to the boardgame Battleship where two players each with sets of grids (strato-maps) place their space ships upon the grid. Oposing players then give corodinates on the Strato-maps to locate and destroy their enemies spaceships.

The inside of the lid is used by one player while the inside box by the other. Colorful 1950s graphics.

name: Wizard's Tournament for Kids
description:
From publisher blurb:

Once a year, wizards from all over the realm come together to fight for the title of Archmage. The winner of this tournament is crowned the most powerful sorcerer in the entire world and becomes the head of the Council of High Mages. Wizard’s Tournament for Kids is a fantasy deck building game of magic combat where players fight to defeat each other using spells, monsters, and relics. The game comes with thirty three different sets of cards composed of six copies of that specific card.

During play, each player starts the game with nine copies of the Spirit card, which is his starting deck. Cards are purchased from the twelve active stacks of cards and placed in a player’s discard pile. Once a player’s deck runs out of cards, the player shuffles his discard pile together to make a new deck. The changing sets of cards means that every time you play Wizard’s Tournament for Kids, it is a brand new but balanced game. Spells cards allow a player to manipulate, heal, and damage monsters, your opponent, and yourself. Monsters are brutal attackers and valiant defenders that you can summon to your side during a battle to protect you from rampaging monsters and attack your opponent. Relics are ancient artifacts that give a player a special power that can be used each turn. Each player starts with thirty Life and if you reduce your opponent’s Life to zero, you win the game.

This Deck Building Game Includes:

12 Monster Cards
15 Spell Cards
6 Relic Cards
Spirit Cards

name: Destination Moon
description:
Simple roll and move game to the moon and back, with the objective to be first back

Graphics similar to Dan Dare type rockets and space vehicles and probably dated around mid 1950s

Published by Holdson products, New Zealand
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Hex Rampart
description: Hex Rampart is a variant of Rampart played on a hex hex board. Play starts with black. On his turn a player may either drop a stone of his color or remove a dead enemy group. Players may only legally drop stones adjacent to at least one of their stones already on the board. A group is considered dead if any stone within it has no adjacent empty cells. Removal of a group takes a whole turn. Removing own dead groups is strictly prohibited. Passing is prohibited unless a player has no legal move on his turn. The player to remove all enemy groups from the board is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Pattern Building

name: Wizard's Tournament for Kids: Spirit Storm
description:
From publisher blurb:

Spirit Storm is a game supplement that adds twelve new cards to Wizard’s Tournament for Kids. These cards will greatly increase the playability of the game and the possible combinations that can be played each game.

This Card Booster Includes:

6 Monster Cards
3 Spell Cards
3 Relic Cards

name: The Fourth Horse
description: The 4th Horse is a card game that combines the excitement of a fight to the finish with the intense strategy of chess. Two, three or four players may compete. Certain card combinations can be used to win bidding rounds or as special powers. The illustrations of cards are of a medieval style. There are 4 Horse Cards that can act as wild cards in their suits or if all 4 are played then the game can be won. Winning is also achieved by having 4 sequential royal cards of a suite and as the only player at the end of the turn to do so. Number cards can be played to attack when 4 cards in sequential order are played. Knives can remove cards of one suite from the play area, Thieves can steal all of a players cards, Swords can discard cards, Moon cards replicate other powers and also can eliminate a player. When playing cards, at least 2 cards in sequential order must be played. The challenge is deciding on whether to use the cards for their bidding value, save them to build sets or play them on the table to show people what you are collecting.

name: Cracked's Game of Millionaire
description:
It’s like Monopoly: Roll and move. Land on an unowned property: buy it. Land on an owned property: pay money to the owner.

It’s different from Monopoly: Only one die is used. The board is rectangular, with 10 spaces between the corners on the long edges and 6 spaces between the corners on the short edges.

It’s much less than Monopoly: No color groupings, therefore no monopolies. No house/hotel improvements. No utilities. No railroads. No auctions. No mortgages.

Victory conditions: Players are eliminated when they go bankrupt. The last player with money is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Battle of Oshi-jou
description:
Battle of Oshi-jou is fought in1590.
This is part of Hideyoshi's Odawara campaign.
The game focuses only the siege battle of Oshi-jou.

The game uses turn sequence. In each turn, each side has movement, fire then melee. In each turn, Hohjo side can decide to go first or last, since they have home-town benefit.
The game starts July 1st turn and end July 17th turn.
Hideyoshi side must either conquer Hon-maru or eliminate Narita Nagachika until the game end.

DTP game.
1 map, 1 rulebook, 2 countersheet.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table
publishers: Dōjin Club Ludens Faber (同人会ルデンス・ファベル)

name: Target the moon
description:
Space Race style board game where the objective is to land all your spacecraft on the moon first. Roll of the dice and move game,

Players becomes Astronauts, passing Astronaut training by throwing a double. He then moves a spacecraft onto the launch pads and moves the spaces by roll of the dice. Another doube thow can move another spaceship onto the launch pad. As they circle around the moon they progess into number of orbits (i.e. 1st, 2nd, 3rd orbit). Spacecraft in the final 3rd orbit may shoot for the moon, go into a lunar orbit and successfully touch down.

Publisher Eugenia Doughtie, 907 Marshall, Houston, Texas

Spacecraft can be captured by landing on an opponents ship Spacecraft may also land on Mercury communication or solar communication cards and follow directions. Spacecraft may get lost in outer space

name: Land on the Moon
description:
Tiddlywink style game where small plastic rings (flying saucers)are place on a launcher at an angle. The ring is pressed down with a flat disc to propel the ring into a playing board set at an angle 2 to 3 feet away.

The object is that players shoot at the board showing the moon and planets. Players score points for landing on the moon, in moon craters, on moon mountains or on planets. The first to reach 250 points is declared to winner.

Not dated but would be a 1960s game based on graphics

Warren Built - Rite game, No 8600, Lafayette, Indiana, USA

name: Europe Nature 70
description:
This game is intended for children to teach them endangered plant and animal species.

There is a spinner in the middle of the game board and boxes representing different species on the edge.

In his turn player spins the arrow and draws a card. If the arrow points either the animal or the habitat, or the threat with other cards player has, he keeps the card and plays it in front of him. If the player is mistaken for a complete series, it must discard all cards of this series!
The winner is the one who has got the most cards if the deck is exhausted..
Many other variants are available.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Decouvrir la Côte D'or
description:
There are area of Northeast of France seen on the gameboard, with its main cities, 3 tours crisscrossing the region, and beautiful photos!
Each player chooses a circuit (Architecture-Culture-History, Economics, Gourmet or Nature) and places his token on one of the cities. Everyone gets three tourist tickets (1 point each) and must travel 20 cities on its circuit.
If player reaches a stage town, the player responds to a question. In case of right answer, the player receives 1 to 3 points depending on the difficulty of the question. Competitors move either box by box, or by using a special die to extend 2 to 5 space (do not exceed your goal).

The game ends when a player has completed his circuit.
The winner is the player who scores the most points on the tourist tickets

name: Space Flight
description:
Simple top style game where opponets have to hand held tops that they manually spin on a game board. The board has the planets with holes in the middle of them. The objective is the base of the top falls into the planet holes and players score points. First player to a set value (i.e. 1000 points is declared the winner.

Not dated posiibly 1970s
publishers: Pressman Toy Corp., Thomas Salter Ltd

name: The Race to Mars
description:
Simple roll and move game, starting from earth the objective is the first to reach mars.

No date but graphics suggest late 50s early 60s

name: Iron Age: Council of the Clans
description:
In this tabletop political strategy game, players compete and co-operate with each other to create a community. Players gain honour by growing and managing their villages, and by interacting with other players. The more honour they gain, the better their position at the Landsmoot, a special democratic assembly where players vote for a Chieftain. Win the Landsmoot often enough, and you win the game as a whole.

Iron Age was originally developed by a professor of philosophy to teach political science to his students. From the "soft power" of culture, trade, and diplomacy, to the "hard power" of the army, nearly every facet of real world politics is reproduced in this game.
categories: City Building, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Trading, Voting

name: Escape of the Kre'null
description:
This is a game of intense, steampunk-airship battle and daring rescue. Players work together to overcome an evil squad of airfoils while attempting to rescue The Grand Duchess from the battleship Kre'null.

Escape of the Kre'null is a strategic cooperative arial combat game where 1 to 4 players work together in an effort to reach The Grand Duchess while fighting off enemy airships. Upon reaching the Kre'null the players must search for, rescue, and escape with The Grand Duchess before being knocked out of the sky or failing to reach the Kre'null entirely.

The game allows players to:
- use various charts to create their ships
- select from over 12 game board layouts
- coordinate actions while dealing with various random events
- take turns making strategic decisions during aerial combat
- support the game's enemy AI system as it tries to defeat the players

All in a day’s work you say? What are you waiting for? Jump into one of the Naruil Airfoils and head off into adventure!
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Découvrir le Bas-Rhin
description:
There is a Bas-Rhin in the game board what is a department of France.

Each player chooses a circuit (Architecture-Culture-History, Economics, Gourmet or Nature) and places his token on one of the places. Everyone gets three tourist tickets (1 point each) and must travel 20 cities on its circuit.

If player reaches a stage town, the player responds to a question. In case of right answer, the player receives 1 to 3 points depending on the difficulty of the question. Competitors move either box by box, or by using a special die to extend 2 to 5 space (do not exceed your goal).

The game ends when a player has completed his circuit.
The winner is the player who scores the most points on the tourist tickets.

name: Decouvrir La Moselle
description:
There is a La Moselle in the game board what is a department in the east of France named after the river Moselle.

Each player chooses a circuit (Architecture-Culture-History, Economics, Gourmet or Nature) and places his token on one of the places. Everyone gets three tourist tickets (1 point each) and must travel 20 cities on its circuit.

If player reaches a stage town, the player responds to a question. In case of right answer, the player receives 1 to 3 points depending on the difficulty of the question. Competitors move either box by box, or by using a special die to extend 2 to 5 space (do not exceed your goal).

The game ends when a player has completed his circuit.
The winner is the player who scores the most points on the tourist tickets.

name: Découvrir La Marne
description:
La Marne is a game about the department in the Champagne province, the Grand Est region of France.

Each player chooses a circuit (Architecture-Culture-History, Economics, Gourmet or Nature) and places his token on one of the places. Everyone gets three tourist tickets (1 point each) and must travel 20 cities on its circuit.

If player reaches a stage town, the player responds to a question. In case of right answer, the player receives 1 to 3 points depending on the difficulty of the question. Competitors move either box by box, or by using a special die to extend 2 to 5 space (do not exceed your goal).

The game ends when a player has completed his circuit.
The winner is the player who scores the most points on the tourist tickets.

name: Agentes do Destino
description:
