"My life is mine?" is a cardgame themed on life. One player will be the protagonist of the game. He and all other players use cards to write the destiny of the protagonist. Each card will have a part of your life. The game is divided into four seasons (child, youth, adult, elderly). At the end of each cycle, the cards played are checked to know what really happens in the protagonist's life and that will not happen. Points are earned with the cards that were successful. At the end of the game, whoever has the most points is the winner.

Will the protagonists be able to have command of your own life and win in the end? Or is that the other players will determine how it will be his life?

This is a fast game, created for fun, involving a bit of memorization, bluff and strategy. And luck, of course, exists in all of our lives (or not!). Enjoy it!

Ps.: Sorry for my english. It isn't my native language.

name: Tac-Tic' Flip
description:
Looks like a Connect 4 Launchers but reduced to a single deck.

Players each have sixteen chips they try to shoot to board in proper holes in their turn.
Player who get 4 in a row is the winner.

name: Analysis
description:
Analysis is a game of deduction in which players take turns being the Analyst, the person responsible for choosing and (using the game's components) outlining a character, Man or Woman, Living or Dead, Real or Fictional, for the remaining players to deduce. Points are scored based on how well the Analyst describes the character before the mystery is solved, or by players who successfully determine the character's identity. A score of 500 wins the game.

The game's equipment consists of 25 descriptive cards, some small round plastic chips, a playing board with categorical areas (Personality, Profession, Geographical Location, Physical Description) and their point values on which the cards are to be placed, and a smaller "key" board with more detailed subsets of the board's categories and point values, where the chips are placed.

name: Puppetmaster Endgame
description:
This game is about a world where free peoples struggle against the control of the Illuminati.

There are two opposing teams in this game. On one side are the “Free Peoples” players who can only win or lose together. Their main goal is to survive. On the other side are the “Illuminati” players who must both the defeat the “Free Peoples” players and lastly also their team members to win the game individually. Illuminati players need to get as much power as possible. Nobody knows who belongs to which side at the start of the game.

Each player starts up in a province and can then expand his civilization. He can also upgrade the technology level. At the end of each turn calamities may occur. A player gets "power points" which he can use for his actions or save his provinces from the effects of these calamities, so a player must strike a balance between these two.

It's a tactical game with only a very small element of luck (the calamities at the end of each turn), so it becomes kind of like chess to plan your moves.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Fernsehverbot!
description:
The three catastrophes a child can encounter: Pa watches sports on TV. The TV is broken. Being grounded, TV ban!

The cards are shuffled, and placed in 2 tiles beneath the board (TV cards, TV jokers, broadcast interruption and TV ban, TV allowed). The game has 2-4 players moving on a board by roll of a die. Landing on a yellow TV space means the player must draw a TV card. This means a TV card - a player must collect 4 of the same kind - or a TV joker which completes a 3-card-set. Or if unlucky a broadcast interruption card. With this card still on his hand a player cannot win. Players landing on a blue TV ban spot must draw a TV ban card. This tells the player why the punishment by grounding occurred and usually instructs the player to give one TV card (of his/her choosing) to the next player. This is usually bad, of course it could be good if the broadcast interruption card can be offloaded onto someone else. A TV allowed card lets a player draw additional TV cards.
The first player to either collect a set of 4 matching TV cards or reach the end of the board wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bluff King Hal
description: In Bluff King Hal, players represent factions in the court of King Henry VIII of England. Players secretly bid for control of character cards already at court and attempt to bring new allies to court from their hand of cards. Influential characters move up the court hierarchy and earn points for the player controlling them. During Henry's phase, though, the court can change in an instant as characters are divorced, beheaded, or consumed by sickness. Only the shrewdest players will survive the machinations of court and win the esteem of Bluff King Hal.

name: WU
description:
WU claims Go ("WEI-CHI'I") as its ancestor; contemporary gamers will note it is very similar to Pente, with several key differences. The game is played with small colored glass stones on a 19x19 vinyl mat that rolls up into a tube-like box, and is organized into three difficulty levels: Basic, Intermediate, and Advanced. Like its ancestor and contemporaries, WU is played by taking turns placing the stones on grid points.

At the Basic level, the winning condition is simply to place five pieces in a row vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. The Intermediate Level adds the winning condition of seizing five pairs of the opponent's stones. Unlike Pente, these stones are left on the board, not removed. Players are required to notify their opponent of the danger of seizure, by saying "Chiau Tsi" or "stones seized." Advanced difficulty adds the use of sand timers to force players to think quickly when making their every move. Though two sets of stones are included, the instructions allow that up to four can play with additional colors of stones.
publishers: Masterpiece, S & H Marketing Group, Inc.

name: Company of Liars
description:
Company of Liars [COL] is a strategic card game with a board. It is a game for two persons and it is set in the gloomy times of World War II. The aim of each player is to collect 60 points, to take control of key points, or simply to destroy their enemy!

At the moment there are four factions: the USA, Germany, the United Kingdom and the Resistance.

Players conceal their troops on a map where companies are formed. These companies will then assault their foes. Each unit has its specific abilities so merging units will increase their power and augment their flexibility which is crucial for gaining the upper hand over your enemy!

Equally important elements of the game are managing your supply of commands that will allow you to perform actions, gathering information about the enemy and last but not least.. skilful bluffing!

The company of Liars awaits you!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Trilevel
description:
Game rules:

The younger player starts the game. The players alternate placing a rod in one of the holes. The aim is to build different formations (e.g. stairs, blocks, pyramids). The game comes supplemented with rules only for the stairs variant:

Each player tries to build stairs, or to prevent enemy stairs. An staircase is formed placing three adjacent rods of increasing length: (1 2 3: short, medium, and long rod). It is also possible to build two stairs using five rods: 12321 or 32123.

Endgame and puntuation:

Scoring takes place after all rods have been placed. Black rods are scored first: each row is inspected in search of black stairs, then the columns are also inspected. After the black scoring is done, white stairs are scored. The winner is the player with the most number of stairs built.

name: Kostbare Spielkarte
description:
Despite it's name this is a dice and card game.

The 36 large-sized cards represent various styles of cards used in playing card decks.

Lay out the 36 cards in 6 rows of 6 cards in each row. In your turn, roll the dice. Let's say you rolled a 3 and a 4. Then you could swap the card number 3 in row 4 for another card in row 4 or another card in the 3rd row vertically. The idea is to be the player who completes a row horizontally with 6 cards with the same banner colour at the top of the card. The game is won by the player who correctly places the last card in the chosen row.

The game was made for the Deutsches Spielkarten-Museum.

name: Groove Trac
description:
A simple easy to learn abstract tile laying game. Player's take turns laying down tiles trying to enclose their own color while blocking their opponent(s).

The tiles are double-sided with mirrored images so opaque bags are needed to draw the tiles from. You score enclosed spots by squaring their number. Larger groups are worth way more but are riskier to accomplish.

This game came about while trying to find games to use up some domino tiles, as such they were made to stick onto them although cardboard works just fine.

name: Knights of Arxlandia
description:
About the Game

Between the time of the great collapse of the Old Kingdom and the rise of the Federation,Arxlandia was ruled by The Knights. The Knights were the warlords whom held power over the four
lands of Arxlandia. Constantly at war over territory, The Knights soon grew weary of rebuilding their Knightdoms and decided to take their battles to the battle grounds of Arxlandia. An ancient battle ground where the epic warriors of past times still do battle and sometimes can be recruited.

Board

The board itself is based on the classic hexagon design but it the purpose and the game play is very unique.It forces players to think strategically before each move as there are several possible moves for each roll.The board consists of hexagons which will allow the players to move around. There will be obstacles that the players cannot cross. Obstacles such a rivers and mountains; players can only move from hexagon to hexagon. In places where there are bridges or mountain passes, the player may go from one the hexagon where the ridge/mountain pass begins to the where it ends. The movement will be determined by the roll of the dice. The players may move in any direction but may not cross the same hexagon in the same turn.

There are several hexagons that will be marked including the starting position of each player. Other marked positions include places to assume command of fighting units (draw cards).

There are 100 cards total split into 4 groups. Each group consists of different class of units.


Yellow cards are Ranged Units: Longbow man, Arbalist, Javelinmen, Slinger
Green cards are Infantry units: Swordsmen, Pikemen, Peasant, Macemen
Red cards are Cavalry units: Knight, Light Cavalry, Heavy Cavalry, Scouts
Blue cards are Artillery units: Trebuchet, Catapult, Scorpion, Heavy Crossbow



Each unit has special bonus against other type of units. For example, ranged weapons have +100 bonuses against Infantry.
These bonuses are listed on the cards themselves.

Specialized Units:

Huns, Spartans, War Elephants, Helepolis

The design itself was inspired by magic cards but the game play is very unique along with the board design.

The objective is to defeat your opponents by outplaying them on the board and then finishing them off in the battle mode
with the army you have collected.

The game is current on sale for $29.99
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Tira Tijolo
description: "Mister Egg" is carefully put above of a wall made of small bricks. Each turn a player remove one single brick. When one player pull down the Mister Egg falls, the other one wins the game.

name: World War II in Europe
description:
World War II in Europe

This game is now in it's second version (as of 2022) with many changes from the first that include revised map and set-ups for both 1939 and 1941. The rules have been edited with many colour diagrams to assist in illustrating movements and combat. Naval rules have been clarified, and many optional rules have been added for more layers to the game.

World War II in Europe is a theatre level game that begins in the fall of 1939 or spring 1941. You take on the side of the Axis (Germany and Italy) or the Allies (France, UK, US and USSR). You control the economies and production of these nations as well as their armed forces. This game has been heavily revised from the original, with new map, rules and set-up.

Features:

Rules for terrain that affect defence and movement.
- Supply to your armies will be important, as your armies can be cut off from their supply source and destroyed.
- Ships and planes operate from bases.
- Fleets can intercept enemy fleets fleet movements.
- Convoys can be set up or cancelled. You will need convoys to supply your armies, lend resources to allies or collect for overseas territories. Protect your convoys from the wolfpacks.
- Blitzkrieg movements.
- Optional rules, such as Vichy France, the surrender of Italy, technology, the winter in Russia, diplomacy, and special units.
- Rules for oil production and use in the armed forces.
- Advanced rules for naval combat that add weather, day or night engagements, initiative, and surface combat or carrier combat.

To play this game you will need:

Axis & Allies Europe 1940 (for the pieces, chips and airbases).
- 6 paratroopers - 1 for each country (available from HBG).
- fortress markers (available from HBG)
- supply or beachhead markers (available from HBG)
- cut off markers
- markers to denote convoy routes
- This game can be played with World War II in Asia and the Pacific as a global war game.

All these extras are available from Historical Board Gaming.

Go to www.historicalboardgaming.com

The game is available from here:
https://combatminiatures.org/en-ca/collections/historical-bo...

For questions on the game:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/393062939698414

name: World War II in Asia and the Pacific
description:
This game is now in it's second version (as of 2022) with many changes from the first that include revised map and set-ups for 1941. The rules have been edited with many colour diagrams to assist in illustrating movements and combat. Naval rules have been clarified, and many optional rules have been added for more layers to the game.

World War II in Asia and the Pacific is a theatre level game that begins in either the fall of 1939 or the spring of 1941. You take on the side of the Japanese Empire or the Allies with ANZAC, France, USA, UK and USSR.

This game can be linked with World War II in Europe.

-This game features rules for terrain, such as rivers, deserts, mountains and woodlands.
-Supply will be important, as your armies can be cut off and destroyed.
-Unique combat system.
-Fleets can intercept each other with the naval interception rules.
-Convoys will need to be protected in order to ensure safe supply to your troops, as well as collecting the needed raw materials for making your weapons of war.
-Optional rules, such as technology, special units, diplomacy or linking with the Europe game.
-Advanced rules for naval combat that add weather, day or night engagements, initiative, and surface combat or carrier combat.

Needed to play this game, you will need:

Axis & Allies Pacific 1940
10 supply markers or Brown Poker Chips
10 cut off from supply markers
6 paratroopers (1 for each country) -Airborne Roundels

All these extras are available from Historical Board Gaming.

Go to www.historicalboardgaming.com

The game itself is available here: https://combatminiatures.org/en-ca/collections/historical-bo...

name: Minute to Win It Card Game
description: Based on the NBC TV game show, the Minute to Win It Card Game asks players to select and complete simple, nerve-racking tasks using the cards and everyday household objects in under a minute. Challenge cards explain what to do, and stunt cards let you do it. Some examples of challenge activities involve flinging, flicking, balancing, blowing, stacking, sorting, and scooting. The game comes with 30 challenge cards, 26 stunt cards (each with one alphabet letter on it), a one-minute sand timer, and an instructions card.

name: Web of Influence
description:
You the player will take over a person living in a corrupt society, that is going to try and take advantage of government policies, corporate bureaucracies and a few bribes to climb up the ladder to a position of power. You'll need money to get influence with the right people and the right spots, soon after you'll have a small group of contacts that will expand into a web. A Web of Influence.

The game takes place in a hexagonal board, divided in its axis by public or private sectors.
In every round each player has to decide if they want to build their connections on the board between the private and public sectors or move through the connections he has made to perform actions.

At the end of the round a maintenance phase occurs, giving players money for their hard work, deals appear for the next round.

Deals can be made between 2 or 3 players where their connections cross each others, the active player collects everything that is involved in the deal and creates two stashes or three (depending on the number of players in the deal) and then the other players choose one stash leaving the remaining one for the active player.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building

name: Heroes of Tygara
description:
Heroes of Tygara is a card game for 1-4 players. During each game, players assume the role of brave adventurers traveling through the island of Tygara, a land full of dangerous adventures that will bring them fame and fortune. To win the game players must successfully achieve the victory conditions shown in the target card revealed early in the game. Depending on the target, the number of players who win the game can vary, as well as experience of the game.


Héroes de Tygara es un juego de cartas para 1-4 jugadores. Durante cada partida los jugadores asumirán el papel de valientes aventureros que viajarán por la isla de Tygara, unas tierras llenas de peligrosas aventuras que les aportará fama y fortuna. Para que los jugadores ganen la partida, deberán conseguir con éxito las condiciones de victoria que se muestra en la carta de Objetivo revelada al inicio del juego. Dependiendo del Objetivo, el número de jugadores que ganen la partida puede variar, así como la experiencia del juego.

name: The Missing Trash Hunt
description: The Missing Trash Hunt is a Sesame Street Storybook Game in which players move their pieces around the board by spinning and matching colors. The object of the game is to collect cards to help Oscar the Grouch get his missing trash back. The first player to collect two trash cards is the winner. The board game comes with a 16 page storybook, a gameboard, an Oscar the Grouch spinner, 16 circular trash cards, and four playing pieces.

name: Plot!
description:
A simple game for children produced by Marshall Cavendish for their part work series discovery issue Guy Fawkes and the gunpowder plot.

The objective of the game is to get a certain number of gunpowder barrel (represented by cards with a numerical value on them)b to the Lords Chamber.

It uses a fairly simple throw a dice move that number of spaces system, and if he lands on an event square either take a card or carries out the instructions on the square.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wipp oder Kipp
description: Roll the coloured die and add a wooden marker to the see-saw. Stack the same colours on top of each other. Remove a marker if you roll black. You lose if the see-saw topples over. You win if you stack the 5th and final one of a colour.

name: The Coach's Box
description:
A game to simulate Australian Football...

Two coaches, or teams of coaches, place their teams on the field. Coaches use dice to determine who has possession of the ball. They aim to keep possession, so they can pass the ball to their forwards, and shoot for goal.
Each team has players of different abilities, and they may move their players during the course of the game.

Tactics come into the game, as coaches decide upon their best path to goal, whilst ensuring they have a strategy to prevent their opponents from scoring.

A standard game may last up to thirty minutes, but can be extended to last a traditional "four quarters".

The game can be played by two players, or two teams of coaches.

name: Teki
description:
Who am I? An animal? Something with wheels? Guess quickly and win. Each of the 120 cards shows a picture - e.g. a monkey, a pirate, a birthday cake, a car, and so on. One player, the 'leader' for the round, draws a card from the deck without showing it. In turn the other players ask the card holder a question that has a 'Yes' or 'No' answer. After asking a question a player can guess the object, or choose not to try and guess. If he guesses and is right he wins the card but if he is wrong he has to give back an already won card. The player who guesses correctly then becomes the leader for the next round.

The winner is the first to correctly win four cards (or any other number of cards as agreed by the players.

Contains 120 cards in a bus shaped-box. A great game for a road trip!

name: Mission Secrète
description: Players try to complete their secret objectives (Missions cards) by piling cubes. Each mission completed is worth 1 or 2 points. A player can also get points by placing 4 adjacent cubes of his/her color. First player to get to 15 points is the winner.

name: Assedio alla Rocca
description:
Easy boardgame about the siege of Civitavecchia (Italy) by Imperial troops, aided by Pisan ships. Piero Latro and the other citizens try to resist assaults along the walls and from sea.
Published by Novecentonovanta, a local association promoting boardgames at national level and organizing game events in schools and libraries of the city. Published again in the first issue of the GiocAreA magazine, february 1998.
An easy combat system, with cardboard soldiers fighting over a map divided into huge hexes. Players have several kinds of units, with different movement and combat abilities. Archers and boiling oil caudrons attack adjacent hexes, melee happens in the same hex. Leaders enhance the power of units in the same hex.

name: Le Sourire Du Dragon
description:
Le Sourire Du Dragon (The Smile Of The Dragon) is a board game where players are characters from the Dungeons & Dragons Animated Series cartoon (Hank the Ranger, Eric the Cavalier, Diana the Acrobat, Presto the Magician, Sheila the Thief and Bobby the Barbarian). Starting at the roller-coaster that bought the children into the magical Realm, the goal of the game is to reach the Vortex home.

Players navigate the board by rolling three dice; one for Movement and one for Adventuring, but must declare which one is prioritized before rolling; with the highest die roll being the prioritized one and the lowest die roll being the other (the middle scoring die roll is ignored). Players move clockwise around the board a number of squares equal to their Movement score.

Various illustrated Adventure Boxes present tasks that their Adventuring score must not be lower than otherwise the player remains on the square and has to try again next round. The Adventure Boxes and their scores are Armoured Warrior (6), River (4), Castle (6), Dragon (6), Wall (4), Village (0), Crevasse (5), Magician's Peak (6), Treasure (0), Desert (4), Lake (5), Spiders' Webs (6), Whirlwind (6), Castle Of Shadows (3), Venger (7), Tiamat (7) and Dungeon Master (5).

Players must draw a card from the deck when they land on a green square. Cards can be Monsters, Magical Items, Commands, Dungeon Master or Uni the unicorn. (Black-spotted cards indicate that the card is kept by the player.)

Monster cards are numbered and the player's Adventuring score must not be lower than it otherwise the player is moved back to the previous Adventure Box. The monsters and their scores are Frog (2), Wolf (3), Bullywug (4), Orc (5), Dragon (6), Lolth (7), Venger (8) and Tiamat (8).

Magical Item cards can be used by any player and provide bonuses with the bonus greater if the item belongs to the character (e.g.: Hank the Ranger and his Bow). The Magic Item cards are Bow, Cloak (which makes Sheila immune to the Brawl rule), Club (gives Bobby automatic success on Castle, Wall, Magician's Peak and Castle of Shadows), Hat (gives Presto random bonuses and penalties), Javelin (gives Diana automatic success on River, Castle, Wall, Crevasse and Magician's Peak) and Shield (prevents Eric going back to previous Adventure Box when losing against a monster).

Command cards can move the player forward two Adventure Boxes, backwards one Adventure Box, make them give their cards to the last player, make them give any magical items to their proper owners, negate missing a go on an orange square and select a card from another player.

The Dungeon Master card can be played once to automatically succeed on an Adventure Box and Uni the unicorn gives a bonus to either Movement or to Adventuring (but only when picking a monster card) throughout game play.

Players do nothing on yellow squares. Players miss-a-go on orange squares. Players sharing squares can swap cards and even steal them if the other player refuses.

To move from the outer track to the inner track the player must land on the Whirlwind where he is transported (if his Adventuring score is 6 or more) to the Castle Of Shadows and then continues (if his Adventuring score is 3 or more) around in a circle until he lands on the green square with an arrow pointing to the Vortex. If the card he has drawn does not result in him moving off of the arrowed square then he has won the game.

CONTENTS:

Game board x1
Playing pawns x6
Playing pawn stands x6
Dice x3
Instructions x1
Cards x56 (see below for individual cards)

Dungeon Master card x1
Uni card x1
Frog card x1
Wolf card x5
Bullywug card x2
Orc card x10
Dragon card x5
Lolth card x1
Tiamat card x2
Venger card x4
Bow card x1
Club card x1
Cloak card x1
Hat card x1
Javelin card x1
Shield card x1
"Give Your Cards To The Last Player" card x2
"Do Not Miss-A-Go" card x2
"Pick Any Card You Want" card x2
"Go Back One Adventure Box" card x2
"Advance Two Adventure Boxes" card x4
"Give Object To Its Owner" card x6
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Election 2012: Romney vs. Obama
description:
After four tumultuous years, President Barack Obama announced he was running for re-election. His challenger, Mitt Romney, survived an at-times brutal primary season to emerge the victor. Can you run a campaign to lead your candidate to victory?

Each player starts the game with a set number of cards: several common cards that represent issues (such as Economic Growth or Immigration), demographics (such as Hispanics or Single Women) or regions (such as the Midwest or the Northeast). Each candidate also has many candidate specific cards with special abilities. Each player secretly forms an "Agenda" with these cards. Each player then also places Campaign Tokens--representing the efforts and money they put into campaigning--on each of these Agenda cards (or on random events that want to "spin" their way"). These Agendas and tokens are revealed simultaneously and resolved.

Players earn support in each "Swing State" (the game starts with 16 swing states, although more can be added as the game progresses) by "winning" these issues, demographics, or special abilities. Players battle these states until election day, when the electoral votes are awarded and a victor is determined. Other campaign tactics--such as selecting a Vice President, gaining grassroots support, and using advertising to change a region's major concern about issues--also come into play.

This is a print and play game. Print and play instructions are included in the files section.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Keelekärg 4
description:
For ages 11+.
The hex-tiles are shuffled and dealt to players.
The first tile is placed on the table and in his turn player places tile from the hand if he is able on the table with at least one edge adjacent to previos hex. the edges of the hexes form pairs with Estonian words and English words with same meanings and they must always fit.

Player who gets rid of his tiles first is the winner.

name: Keelekärg 2
description:
For ages 9+.
The hex-tiles are shuffled and dealt to players.
The first tile is placed on the table and in his turn player places tile from the hand if he is able on the table with at least one edge adjacent to previos hex. the edges of the hexes form pairs with Estonian words and English words with same meanings and they must always fit.

Player who gets rid of his tiles first is the winner.

name: Keelekärg 1
description:
For ages 8+.
The hex-tiles are shuffled and dealt to players.
The first tile is placed on the table and in his turn player places tile from the hand if he is able on the table with at least one edge adjacent to previos hex. the edges of the hexes form pairs with Estonian words and English words with same meanings and they must always fit.

Player who gets rid of his tiles first is the winner.

name: Keelekärg 3
description:
For ages 10+.
The hex-tiles are shuffled and dealt to players.
The first tile is placed on the table and in his turn player places tile from the hand if he is able on the table with at least one edge adjacent to previos hex. the edges of the hexes form pairs with Estonian words and English words with same meanings and they must always fit.

Player who gets rid of his tiles first is the winner.

name: Reis ümber Eesti
description: Players roll and move the dice and move on the board. Who finishes first is the winner.

name: Cédric La Course Aux Gages
description:
The board represents a simple scale of progression between points of departure and arrival. Each player places his pawn color on the starting square.

The player in his turn presses the center button of the electronic dice and draws as many cards as the dice indicates.
If the color of the square fits with the color of the one of more cards player may move forward if not then he must move backward.

The first who arrives on the destination square wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Le Zool
description:
In Zool, players have eight game-pieces and the objective is to capture five opponent's game-pieces. To capture player must bring two of his pawns on two neighboring cells of an opponent's piece.
For moving player doesn't move a game-piece, but all game-pieces located around the intersection in the direction of clockwise, provided that at least one of his own pieces belong to the group. You can even rotate a group along deck, provided that it does not come back to capture a game-piece.

name: Best Seller: Il Gioco dell'editore
description: Card game in which each player is a publisher trying to be the first to publish a best-seller. To do that, the player must play all the 4 cards composing the cover of the book and the contract for that same books. Cards are both drawn and bargained with other players.

name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets Aragog Chapter Game
description:
A small game patterned after the chapter "Aragog" in the novel, "Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets."

In this game, 2 players (Ron and Harry) attempt to escape a small maze of spiderwebs within the Forbidden Forest. The maze is different each time you play, depending on where the players place 4 miniature spiders that block certain paths. The position of these spiders is determined by dice rolls. Players will also take turns rotating a larger Aragog figure. If Aragog "looks" directly at a player, that player must move back to the starting space. The first player to exit the maze and land on the flying car wins the game.

The box is designed to resemble a book, and holds all the components.

name: Cows vs. Visitors
description:
Cows Vs Visitors by Omni-Miniatures

Is a table top Miniatures stratagy game that uses a 6d system. Cows VS Visitors throws in a twist to the usual table top games by the use of drop cards that have random objects (Like "probe" or "Angry Cat")that are drawn when a team captures an objective token and use the drop card as a weapon in the game.

Battles can be set up on a 4x4 table where you can use your own imagination to create your own senery and cover. The miniatures are sold in sets and are suplied un-painted and the Cows miniatures require assembly, making this a great choice for the hobby gamer who enjoys customising. The Cows VS Vistors Starter set is sold with everything you need to play minus the ruler and metal minis.

In the starter set You get the rulebook, one deck of drop cards, drop card markers, dice, full color card stock playing pieces with plastic stands.

name: Beer Con
description:
A simple dice game, partly inspired by Zombie Dice. Players take turns rolling three dice, trying to get lots of "beer glasses" while avoiding the "queue" and "drunk" symbols. Three "drunk" symbols will mean no beer for the player this turn. If the player stops in time, he/she may take as many beer labels from the table (from three random stacks), as the sum of beer glasses rolled.

The winner is the player who collects the most types of beer (labels) at the Beer Con.

Game strategy comes down to know when to quit, and when to push your luck. In addition, choosing the right beer labels to increase your score or prevent others from scoring, is important, too.

name: Dan Dare Space-Ship Construction Game
description:
Dane Dare is an English science fiction comic hero from the 1950s. Game play is related to Jumbolino where interlocking pieces are put together on the roll of the dice.

Players pieces are the outershell of the Dan Dare spaceship and are individually numbered. Each player has an identical and equal number of pieces to construct by the roll of the dice. The combined number on the dice roll (i.e. 2 to 12) designates which piece is selected to be be placed on the game board. How they construct their ship may not be in the same order (i.e player 1 may throw a 7 to enable an engine piece (numbered 7) to be placed on the playing board / Player 2 may then throw a 12 to enable to place the cockpit (numbered 12) on his side of the playing board.

The player that constructs their spaceship first is the winner.

name: Orbit Space Race
description:
Space Race game where rockets are placed on their Take Off bases and move with the roll of the dice in a clockwise orbit firstly around earth and then Mars. Each orbit consists of outer shells and to progress out from earth and into mars players must land by exact count on specific orbital spots. Doing so takes you to the next orbital shell and closer to Mars.

The object of the games is to get your spaceship to Mars first.

No date or game publisher, possibly manufactured in the U.K. Graphics suggest game production around mid 50s to early 60s

name: Questionable Fun: Hilarious Answers to Irrelevant Questions!
description:
Game Overview: Players write down their funniest answers to our ridiculous question cards. The judge picks an answer and that player gets a point. First one to 5 points wins.

Questionable Fun is a question-and-answer type of casual party game for relatively mature audiences. All of the questions are hypothetical and designed with one thought in mind: give players enough imagery to see some funny answer possibilities but leave them enough room for their own creativity and style. Some of the questions set the players up to easily answer with politically incorrect, slightly raunchy, or generally inappropriate humorous responses. Some are just silly or even look totally innocent. Either way, questions leave enough room so your group can tailor answers to their own style.

name: Happy Lotto
description:
Happy Lotto dice

With the Happy Lotto Dice 10 Pack, you can roll all of your lottery numbers at the same time or give them as gifts to friends and co-workers. Happy Lotto Dice allows lottery players to randomly roll lottery numbers from 1-60 These random numbers can be used to play almost any lottery. Lotto Dice are perfect for selecting numbers at home, at the store or for your office Lottery Pool.
There are rules inclued for a 2+ player game

Happy Lotto:
One player Rolls all ten dice. Place six of ten in row from left to right. Player chooses 6 of the 18 numbers that on the dice and writes then down and keep numbers hidden. Other players write down the six numbers that they belive player one wrote down. Player one shows his numbers and each player then scores 1 point for each number matched. If a opponent get all six,they win the game. Game then starts again with a new player.The player to reach 10 points wins.

name: Sailing Game
description:
Game from 'The Children's Book of Games, Puzzles and Pastimes. A simple roll and move game in the tradition of 'Goose' games.

RULES. This game is for two players, who must provide themselves with two counters of different colours to represent the boats, and a dice (sic). Each opponent takes a turn at throwing the dice and moves his boat forward the number of spaces shown by the throw. Any boat getting on the marked squares must follow the rules below :
FAIR WIND 3 spaces forward
FOUL WIND 3 spaces back
FAIR TIDE 1 space forward
FOUL TIDE 1 space back
HIT BUOY Start again
FAIR WIND AND TIDE 5 spaces forward

First to the Finish Boat, wins.

name: Card Football
description:
This game was in The Children's Book of Games, Puzzles and Pastimes.

The rules:
This is an exciting game played with one pack of cards and a piece of paper with the “pitch” as shown. You can use a coin, counter or button for the ball.

Place the ball in the centre and the pack face downwards at the side of the table. One player begins by turning the top card face up on to the table, and then moves the ball according to the following rules, with the object of moving it into the opposite goal.
If the card is a red one, then the red player moves, and the black player moves if the card is a black one. For odd numbers move the ball one square in any direction; for even numbers move the ball two squares in any direction, including a “bent” move, which is one sideways and one forward. If it is a court card, move the ball one square sideways, either way.

When a goal is scored, replace the ball in the centre and continue play until the end of the pack is reached, when you can shuffle them and replace face down¬wards on the table and continue.

The winner is the first to score a number of goals previously decided.

name: Test Match
description:
Game from The Children's Book of Games, Puzzles and Pastimes.

INSTRUCTIONS. You will require one counter, pencil and paper and a pack ot playing cards to consist only of the ace, 2, 3, 4, s. 6 of each suit. You will find it a most enjoyable game for two.
1. First choose your teams and write them down on a sheet of paper in score-card form.
2. Toss for innings. That is, cut the pack and the one with the highest card (the ace counts as one) chooses whether to bat or bowl.
3. The batting side places the counter on the starting square and the bowler proceeds to bowl the ball by taking off the top card in the pack.
4. The batsman moves the counter according to the number turned up by the bowler— the ace counts as one—and the score shown by the square on which the counter lands is put down on the score sheet for the first batsman. But remember that extras are not included in a batsman’s individual score but are added below the score to make the total.
5. The bowler bowls again and the score is now put down for the second batsman. The game continues thus—bowling to the two opening batsmen alternately.
6. When a batsman is out, continue playing alternately with the man left and the next batsman.
7. Carry on round the board until the tenth wicket falls and the last man is then left “not out".
8. The other side then bats and scores as before.

The one with the highest total score is, of course, the winner.

name: Pixie Pip's Snowy Day Race Game
description:
Game in the 1974 book, The Jack and Jill Book of Games and Puzzles.

A simple race game in the tradition of the Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a black square, obey the instructions. The first to reach space 44 is the winner.

I am amazed that such basic games were still being made in 1974. 1874, yes but not 1974 please.

name: Partymaster
description:
The Partymaster game is a simple and fun board game. It can be played in teams or as single players. The game consists of six pieces, where every single piece symbolizes a personality of the Partymaster Family.
If you are more than five people playing the game, we recommend that you team up. In this way, everyone has a chance of being a part of the experience.
There is a challenge card inside the game box, and with that, everything will be explained for you. It only takes a couple of minutes to read this card through, and understand the game. So the game is very simple and easy to learn.
The average time of a game varies from 30mins to several hours. It depends on how creative and willingly you are to be integrated in the game experience.

Gameplay: You or your team pick a brick. You can choose any brick except the green one, which is the pukemaster. Now you pick a challenge with your opponents that the looser shall do. You roll the dice to figure out who starts.
The game mecanic is dice rolling. The teams throw the dice in turns and move the brick until the number is stated on the cube. Every field you land on from now has a picture that refers to the challenge card. The challenge card states what must happen when a person lands on a field. This could be "Give a Pitch" which means that one team should sing 10 seconds of a song, then point at another team that has to continue the singing in 10 seconds. If they can, your team have to drink two sips, if they cannot then they have to drink three sips.
The reason that you cannot pick the pukemaster is that when you land on his field, then you have to down your drinks and become the pukemaster that takes sips when everyone else does. So you don't want to be the pukemaster.
The game continues over 37 fields and finishes when the goal is reached.

name: Thunderbird: The Mystic Game of Many Angles
description:
Thunderbird can be played as a competitive game for two (or four as partners,) as a series of solitaire games or puzzles, or as a means of creating ornamental or figurative designs. The game board consists of an 8x8 grid of squares, with 64 square playing pieces in the following combination: 8 Junctions, 28 Diagonals, and 28 Crosses. Each square has a red and a blue line, in one of three of the aforementioned patterns.

In the competitive game, players choose blue or red, and take turns placing their pieces in an attempt to be the first to connect all four sides of the board with paths of their color. Several methods of drawing pieces are provided in the rules, ranging from complete chance to a perfect knowledge of each other's pieces. Variations are also provided for winning by reaching different objectives or scores.

Solitaire games include shuffling and drawing the pieces at random while trying to complete objectives such as placing all the pieces without mismatching the colored lines.

Included in the instructions are 56 diagrams of the board and pieces featuring only the red lines; assembling these designs reveals the whole picture.

name: Battle of the Crater
description:
Part of the series of tongue in cheek games "Kombat Klassics" published in the magazine La Vivandiere back in the day.

This game on the siege of Petersburg is from vol 1 #3 of the magazine.

THIS IS A JOKE GAME not really intended for play, though you could... the humor mainly is in the rules writing and social commentary therein.

The union player has three Negro units and one regular infantry unit, the regulars can only enter the crater on turn one, afterwards, only the Negro units may enter the crater and I suspect Burnside since the only way he can get killed is to move into it as well.

The confederate players one and sole action is to choose whether or not to remove the dead unit from the crater. The confederates can not move or take any other action in game terms. I suspect he might find some fun in waiting for the union player to figure out how to get Burnside killed and win a decisive victory!

It looks like the object is to enter the crater and stay there after the big explosion rocked the confederate line. Now the funny part. It's impossible to do with all combat results being elimination or back two! However, the Union wins a decisive victory if Burnside is killed.....Hmmm....I wonder what the astute union player will do?
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Humor

name: LOKI: The Computer Game
description:
LOKI is a game for two to six players that to some extent simulates a computer program. Players use deductive reasoning and estimate probability to overcome elements of luck. The game board is a large sheet of paper covered by clear plastic. Equipment consists of a grease pencil, 6 small wood player markers, two dice, and three decks of cards. One set of cards is the Computer Action deck, including fifty gold-colored cards each with an instruction for the player to follow when instructed by the board. The two other sets of cards, one blue and one green, are the Keyword decks, with names of countries (blue) and names of sports (green.)

On the board are three areas. First, the Logic Path along which player markers are moved; this path has hundreds of thousands of possible variations and changes through the course of the game. Instructions are written in each section of the path. Second, the Output Buffers are six areas players use for spelling out their Keywords. Third are the Subroutines, located on the board's bottom right corner. These direct players either to change the path of logic or to move letters back and forth from the Output Buffers.

Players randomly draw one of each Keyword cards, then take turn rolling dice to determine how many steps to move their markers along the Logic Path. The instructions of whatever section they land on are then followed, and quite a lot of complexity results between the rules for movement and the instructions from the board. Players are awarded letters of their Keywords by making complete circuits of the logic board. The winning player is first to spell out his Keywords in their entirety in his Output Buffers.

name: Kettering (with Classic Kettering)
description:
KETTERING is a 2 player Strategy game played on a chessboard, masked to 7x8, and using "KETTERING CARDS" -- tiles with arrows which are placed on the chessboard at the start of play to create a gameboard with a unique flow for every game.

The object is to be able to capture your opponents KETT - a King type piece. There are 4 types of pieces:- KETTS, PONES, CROWNS & DISCS,each of which has a different movement. (These pieces can be taken from a Chess and a Draughts/Checkers or Backgammon sets).

CLASSIC KETTERING is an expanded version played on a 7x10 boar

See also A-A-ARCTIC KETTERING - The Icehouse version.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Le Raid Pékin-Paris
description:
French game commemorative for the race Peking-Paris of june, 1907, the first great car race of the world.

From the french instructions:
"A magnificent performace in motoring is surprising both the most skeptics as well the most courageous sportifs.
The race Peking-Paris is, indeed, the demonstration of the most tenacious endurance and the most fecund in incidents that have been undertaken so far.
This game represents the various steps taken by our valiant drivers and our young competitors can execute, in their rooms and without great danger, this wandering race around half of the world."

The game is composed by pins, balls and a giant 3D boardgame racing track where a small racing car must travel. The play is very simple and has an obvious link with bowling: each player must push (or let it go) the car in the track. At the end of the track the car will hit a basket with balls. The balls will spread over a board with holes, numbers and pins, representing obstacles and its values. The balls will eventually hit some pins and enter a few holes. The player´s score is the sum of the points of every hole where a ball fell.

A copy was available at "Museu do Brinquedo" (Toy Museum) in Sintra, Portugal. Unfortunately the museum closed its doors for good in 2014.

name: Wirbel
description:
The gameboard has a spiral printed on it. Each player has 2 pawns. One gets a (black) hat on and starts from the inside out. One is unhatted and starts from the outside in. Movement is by a D6. Some places on the board have an arrow them and the playing piece on them is "sucked" to where the arrow points (which is good or bad depending on the intended direction of movement). Players have their choices which pawn to move. The player first succeeding to move each of his/her pawns to the opposide part of the spiral wins.
Additional rules involve the hats - on rolling a 1 a player can remove the hat of another players pawn and place the hat on the spirals inside, the player must go back to retrieve it. When another player has both of his playing pieces started on the board the hats can be swapped, so the pawns must change their movement direction. On a 6 a player takes possession of the neutral black pawn. This possession protects him/her from attacks on his/her hats. When a player gets on a spiral piece where another colours pawn is located the other colour must go back to the inside or outside of the spiral.

Contents: game board, die, 8 playing pieces, 5 hats, one neutral black playing piece.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Satellite to the Moon
description:
Object is for a player to reach the moon with all four of his rockets first.

Rockets leave earth by spinning a 1 or 3 on the central rocket shaped spinner and proceed to orbit the moon. Players can have more than one rocket in orbit. Landing on the moon requires and exact number to be spun on the spinner. Players can be sent back to earth if landed on by an opponent.

name: Mitre, Musket & Lace: Fast Play 18th Century Wargame Rules
description:
This is fastplay set of miniature wargame rules for the battles of the 18th century, primarily the Seven Years War and Austrian War of Succession.

Figure scale is 1:50 and battles can be completed in an evening.

It would appear that the game is likely to be by the same designer as Fusil and Fortress, but this is an assumption.

The rules are written for reasonable people.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Francophile
description:
Players choose city of departure and city of arrival and start traveling. The goal is to collect maximum points by answering questions correctly.
They roll the dice and move on the France.
Depending on destination square, player must give the names of some sites (rivers, mountains, province, region, ...) to earn 50 points.
If player stops on a yellow box then the questions are asked about history, gastronomy etc.
When all players have arrived at the destination cities, the one with the most points wins the game.

name: Grands jeux de Stock Cars
description:
Each player has 2 cars with team named like "Panther", "Hercules", "Hurricane" or "Vampire".

The board represents a path with starting areas for each player and squares with many adventures.
In his turn player rolls the dice and moves one of its vehicles on the track.
There are several actions in many boxes what allows to move faster or eliminate opponents's cars.
Eliminated car can be recovered by bringing the other vehicle on the special square.
But if both cars are eliminated the player loses.
Be the last on the track to win the game.

name: Kiriacoulis Mediterranean Game
description:
The board represents the "Mare Nostra" with its coasts, and grid for navigation of vessels.
You choose to start a journey of racing, with its ports of departure and arrival. At each turn you move a weathervane with your breath (you are Eole!), This will determine your ability to progress and depending on the wind direction, your trip can be upgraded or penalized.
During the game, each player has the option, but one single time, to change the direction of the wind with the help of special cards.
The first arriving safely wins the race!

name: Kalinago
description:
The game board is a long coil symbolizing an ornament (KARACOLI) carried by the Arawaks.
You place your token on the square in the center of the maze. After rolling the dice and moving You draw a card from the pile indicated by the square: history, geography, flora and fauna, food, miscellaneous. If you fail, you go back to the box where you came from. If your answer is correct, you roll again and so on until a wrong answer.

The winner is the player who finishes first.

name: Gamma extra
description:
Based in the traditional human towers from Catalonia.
The players should build the estructure consisting in pieces and weights, to place the smallest piece of the structure above it all trying to avoid the crash.
Based on a counterweight system that the players must pick up corresponding to the dice number shown.

name: Wolf Hunt and the Race to Saturn
description:
Two simple spin and move games in one box.

Wolf hunt is on the box bottom. It's a two player chase game. One player is the wolf and one the hunter. If the wolf reaches the home den the wolf wins. If the hunter lands on or passes the space occupied by the wolf player, the hunter wins. In a four player game there are two wolf players and two hunters. Once a wolf makes the den or a hunter catches a wolf, the game is over.

A Race to Saturn is on the underside of the lid. Players race be the first to reach Saturn by the exact count wins.

name: Normandie
description:
The board represents the Normandia area in France with routes involving cities.
In his turn, player rolls dice and moves on the board accordingly. Depending on the color of the destination square, player draws a card and answer the questions of a different category: history, culture and traditions, economics, geography and tourism, sport and contemporary life. If he answers correctly, he may continues his turn.

The first to have 5 cards in different colors wins the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Technology Manager
description:
Technology Manager I.T Service Desk Game Win money and businesses. Learn IT Concepts.

Technology Manager is an I.T management card game set in an economy similar to the real world of businesses, with different industry markets. Battle for winning clients, manage money, make deals, and band together to survive in the I.T industry. This game teaches “Information and Technology Processes” so you will learn different strategies and concepts of Managing an IT business and the issues involved so it makes an exciting adventure.

Technology Manager is Russian roulette card game for 1-4 players, playing time is 30 minutes. Set in a unique technology world of hardware and software, you control a company that manages clients, owns datacenters, buys datacenter contracts “SLA” depending on the card you draw, and develop your strategy to make 1 million TM dollars and be successful in the IT industry.

You put the stack of cards on the table face down. Put the 8 SLA (Service Level Agreement) cards facing up. Players take turns drawing them. Like Russian Roulette, if you draw an CRASH card, you die lose your money and you’re out of the game.

Each player is a CTO and his function is to manage clients on their datacenter at 8 different Markets the game includes: Healthcare, Biotech/Gas, Retail/Clothing, Food and Beverages, Construction, Financial, Technology, Telecommunications. The CTO function is to manage the process and the cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: DartCraft
description: The game is about taking over a dartboard that is divided into hexagons. Different hexagons give each player unique advantages. Taking over hexagons is done by either throwing darts. The player who picks the best strategy to take over the board and has superior dart throwing skills wins the game. Also included in the gameplay are playing cards and moving armies and tower. The towers are huge pushpins that physically block darts.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Wargame

name: Formations Chess
description:
This is a chess game which starts with FIDE Chess, and enables people to place the pieces where they want, within restrictions of placement. It is provided as an alternative to shuffles, like seen in Fischer Random Chess (Chess960).

In the game, white places their pieces and then black places their pieces, and then play begins.

name: No Man's Land: Rules for Gaming The Great War 1914-1918
description:
"The War to end all Wars," a war in which the idealism and nationalism of the late 19th Century met the technological realities of the 20th Century head on. The combination of the offensive power of heavy artillery and the defensive power of field works and the machine gun resulted in a "war \of positions." Movement is not excluded, but is limited in its scope, with the "break-in" replacing the "break-through."

From the introduction: These rules are designed to fight portions of the major battles on the tactical level. Players take the part of battalion and company commanders, the highest level of command which could exert a significant influence on the course of the battle once it had begun. After becoming familiar with the rules, players should be able to recreate actions in some of the great battles of the war such as the Marne, Ypres, Gallipoli, Verdun, the Somme, Passchendale, the Argonnes Forest or the Kaiserschlagt. With experience, each player should be able to comfortably handle a battalion size unit of 500 to 100 men.

Game Scale:
Time: 1 turn = five minutes.
Ground Scale: 1" - 15 yards.
Figure Scale: 1 15mm casting = 3-5 men.
1 5mm stand = 3-5 men.
1 artillery or machinegun casting = 1 gun
Each vehicle/aircraft = 1 vehicle/aircraft

name: We Wow Wang
description:
We Wow Wang is played with a deck of 54 cards, each with a letter. 24 cards have a W, and 6 cards each have an A, E, G, N, or O. The words We, Wow, and Wang can be formed 6 times from this deck of cards.

Each player is dealt 5 cards with the remaining deck placed faced down on the table. Players begin drawing cards, saying "Wow" before the next player may draw. If the player likes his chances of completing enough of the words We, Wow, and Wang to beat his opponents' hands, he says "Wang" and all players show their hands. Scores are tallied according to each players' hand, with an advantage being given to those who have all three words We, Wow, and Wang. In a 2 to 4 player game, a player with 500 points wins. For 5 or 6 players, the total needed to win is 1000.

name: Proxima's Battlegrounds
description:
A small-scale skirmish game for 6" action figures. Battles are between Masters with 5 figures or less per side.

Masters draw cards and compare values (ala War) to determine movement/attack initiative order and resolve combat. Movement and shooting ranges are based on cards length. Optional rubber band shooting rule allows hit/miss determination. Basic H2H, Critical, Reversal, Cover rules are also included.

The game was primarily designed for playtime with the designer's daughter, to relive the combat scenes she watched on some kid-friendly robot shows. And probably teach her some basic math in the process.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Math, Miniatures, Number, Wargame

name: Its Harvest Time!
description:
A Game of farming and chance for 2-5 players. Players create their field, and roll for rain and harvest. Watch out for the drought! It can suck away any rain you have and keep you from a profitable harvest. Will you overcome the challenge and chance of farming to have the most profitable farm around?

To begin, players select crop tiles for their field. During gameplay, players roll four die, (with 3 chances to reroll) and play accordingly. Players receive rain, and from their stores, may choose to harvest their crops for points. However, rolling a drought depletes the rain already received, making it difficult to harvest the crops and thus receive points. Play goes around through several rounds until the final season, at which the winner is declared, who has the most harvest points.

name: Cyprian Rift: Warships
description:
Cyprian Rift: Warships is a starship miniatures game where players command a fleet warships that engage other ships in the Cyprian Rift an unstable region of space. Players take command of small fleet of ship which include cutters, corvette, frigates, destroyers, cruisers and carriers. The game uses a hex-board for game play and movement is plotted. Rules include fighter wings that launch and land from carriers, galactic events (terrain in space), customized ships with modular systems and easy to play rules.
Also available for the game are the Obsidian Confederate Warships metal miniatures.
The game is for people who like cinematic fast action engagements.

name: Neste Oil Lauamäng
description:
Promotional Game for Neste Oil Estonia.

The players travel around a beautiful country called Estonia. When the fuel tank of the car gets empty, there
will be a short stop at some of Neste’s fuelling stations to refuel the car, and then you are able to continue
Your trip.

Each player has a die as a car and if it shows "6" the tank is full, "1"-spot means the tank is empty.

In his turn player choose one of the four cards aside the game board and
1) place the card to his route and travel to this city showed on the upper part of the card. With each move the die must be turned one spot fewer.
2) discard the card and refueling his car to add as many spots to his die showed on the lower part of the card.
Chosen card is always replaced.

If player reaches a town where is opponent´s car he may exchange any card from opponent´s route for the card from his route.

Game ends if player in his turn has 8/9/10 cards (depends on the number of players) with different cities in his route or the deck is exhausted.
Players add up their points from the fuel pumps.
Winner is the player with the most points.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Hackers&Agents
description:
From the box: "The world has been infiltrated with hackers who are taking over computers and out to steal any of your personal data if they can get their hands on it. The cyber defense agents are well armed with forensic investigation technicians and sworn to catch these cyberpunks. You decide, will you be a hacker and get away without a trace or will you be the agent that catches the hacker with all the stolen data."

Rid yourself of all the cards in your hand before every other player and obtain as few points as possible. Points are obtained by cards left in your hand after one player has placed all of his/her cards on the PLAYCARD pile. Each player scores penalty points for cards left in their hand. As soon as one player has reached 300 points the game is over and the person with the lowest score is the winner.
publishers: Conmigr's Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers Dart Target Game
description:
Power Rangers! Rita is up to her old tricks again. You need to grab your Power Gun and stop the Evil Space Aliens attacking Angel Grove!
Objective of the game: Using your Dart Gun with only 6 darts, you need to shoot the 4 Evil Space Alien Targets.

Game includes:
4 Targets (King Sphinx, Goldar, Squat and Putty)
6 Safety Darts
1 Dart Holder
1 Dart Gun
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Foooz
description: Line up your goals on any flat surface and you're ready to play Foooz, the table football (Soccer) in your pocket. Simply grip the static arm and use the other to quickly twist and flick the player into the right position to score a goal! For extra fun, use the trick and competition cards to compete in various challenges!

name: Mees Kees
description:
A board game with mini games.
After you roll the dice you can walk in the school. If you finish at a door of a class room, you may enter that room and challenge another player for a mini game.

Inspired on the books and movie of Mees Kees.

name: Seven Gods of Fortune
description:
Greetings devoted ones! Seven Gods of Fortune is a set collection card game in which players earn favors from the Seven Gods of ancient Japan by praying at a temple built each round. A set of four cards of a single God gains one favor, while a set of one of each of the Seven Gods gains two favors. The first to six completed favors, wins.

A good memory and keen eye can help predict the return of the Seven Gods as the deck recycles, while the Gods of Justice and Winds are on hand to mix things up. Some cards have Powers of the Gods and at times it may be more important to play than pray, or even complete a favor.

Specific cards are added for three player, four player and team games; and patience-style solo-play is supported. Optional rules are suggested to speed up and simplify the game considerably for younger gamers.

May fortune see you upon the path to enlightenment but remember, you'll need more than just good luck...
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: DallasOpoly
description:
From the bottom of the box:
[quote]
DallasOpoly: A Custom Board Game
It’s the Community Adaptation of the Traditional Parlor Game. Players travel through Dallas buying, selling, and trading such Local Landmarks as Texas Stadium and Southfork Ranch on their way to Riches.
[/quote]
The traditional parlor game they refer to is Monopoly, with a few minor differences. The rules make no mention of auctions or trading. The rules specify that money is to be redistributed through the Southfork Ranch space, which corresponds to Free Parking. Dollar values for properties are ten times as high as in standard Monopoly ($500 to $4000), and the salary collected for each lap of the board is eleven times as high ($2200).

Player count is specified as 2 to 4, and four plastic Sorry-style pawns are included, but the game could accommodate more players, perhaps with movers borrowed from the Traditional Parlor Game.

Not to be confused with Dallas-opoly from Late for the Sky Production Company.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Beechgroveopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is a monopoly like game, sponsored by the Beech Grove United Methodist Youth Group.

name: Oh, welche Lust Soldat zu sein!
description:
objective:
be the first reaching target space (50)
simple 'Roll & Move' game
categories: Children's Game, Dice, World War II

name: Les voyages de Magellan aux Temps Modernes
description:
Players travel around the world in S210 Caravelle (Airplanes) buying airports.
Every time you land in a town you can buy the airport if you have the money for it and nobody else already bought it. You also have to draw a mission card that will most likely be to carry people or goods to another location. If you land on an airport owned by another player you have to pay him taxes that get higher the more airport of this color he owns. Landing on a red space make you draw a Luck Card, mostly extra cost to maintain your plane, pay taxes... You can take an insurance that will reduce all repairs and crash expenses by half. You also have to manage you fuel, if you run out of it, you'll loose your plane.
publishers: Jeux et Jouets de la Tour St Denis, La Tour Saint-Denis

name: Express
description:
Roll and Move game on a snake formed line of 95 spaces.
Each player has 4 pawns. If you land on a space with your own color, you move again the same amount indicated by the die. If you are captured, you can avoid starting at the beginning by paying 1 coin to the other player. If you land on a grey space, you are entitled to change your pawn to an express pawn (by paying 1coin) which is allowed to advance the double amount. By landing on the last space, you receive 1 coin. By landing with the 4th pawn on the last space, you receive all coins of the stock and the game ends. Player with the most coins wins.

name: Jim Knopf und Lukas der Lokomotivführer
description: There is only one pawn to be moved by all players: Emma, the train. Each player has 6 colored tickets in his hand and may play several on his turn, if the train can be moved in the correct direction to the next destination (= next number on the board). The color is correct according to the position of the Gurumusch mountain, which can be changed when you reach a destination. The player reaching the last destination ends the game. The player who used the most tickets wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Quiz4you: Mundo dos Dinossauros
description:
EN: Quiz4you - The World of Dinosaurs - Science4you

Discover the World of Dinosaurs with Quiz4you! Answer the questions in order to get the five parts of the Science4you Symbol! Find out what happens when it appears one of the special cards.
It's time for Fun and Learning with over 200 questions of Quiz4you! Learn all about the World of Dinosaurs and have fun with your friends and colleagues, at home or at school, with Science4you.

Rules: there are 52 cards full of questions to test your knowledge on various scientific areas. To play, shuffle the cards and put the deck on the table face down. The youngest player or who had the best score on the last test starts the game. The first player takes a card and chooses a question (out of the four on the card) for the player to his/her right. You cannot choose a question that has already been used previously!
If the answer is right, the player who answered correctly gains it; otherwise, put the card face down in the bottom of the deck. It is now the turn of whom aswered to withdraw a new card and give a question to the player to the right.
All the cards present one part (out of five) of the symbol of Sciencas4you: whoever gains all five symbols first wins the game! Professor 4U is the Joker and can replace any of the parts that you need to complete the symbol.
Attention! When you miss just one part of the symbol to win you have to scream 'SCIENCE' to warn other players that you are about to win. If you do not, you lose two cards that you have to put in the bottom of the deck!

_______________________________________________________________

PT: Quiz4you - Mundo dos Dinossauros - Science4you.

Descobre o Mundo dos Dinossauros com o Quiz4you! Responde às questões para conseguires as cinco partes do símbolo da Science4you! Descobre o que acontece quando aparece uma das cartas especiais.
São horas de Diversão e Aprendizagem com as mais de 200 perguntas do Quiz4you! Aprende tudo sobre o Mundo dos Dinossauros e diverte-te com os teus amigos e colegas, em casa ou na escola, com a Science4you.

Instruções: são 52 cartas de preguntas qua vão testar o teu conhecimento sobre as vária áreas cientificas. Para jogar, baralha as cartas e coloca no centro da mesa com a face das perguntas virada para baixo. Começa o jogador mais novo ou quem teve melhor nota no último teste. Quem começa retira uma carta e faz uma ds perguntas a quem está à sua direita. Não vale repetir uma pregunta qua já tenha sido feira!

Se acertar fica com a carta, se errar a carta é colocada no fndo do baralho. É agora a vez de quem respondeur, retirar uma carta e fazer uma pregunta ao jogador à sua direita.

As cartas têm todas uma parte do símbolo da Sciencas4you: ganha quem conseguir juntar primeiro todas as parted do simbolo! O professor 4U é o Joker e substitui qualquer uma das partes que necessites para completar o simbolo.

Atenção! Quando te faltar apenas uma parte do símbolo para ganhar tens de gritas ‘SCIENCE’ para avisar os outros jogadores de que estás quase a ganhar. Se não o fizeres, perdes duas cartas que tens de colocar no fundo do baralho!

name: La Aventura Fantastica
description:
La Aventura Fantistica (Spanish for "A Fantasy Adventure") is a Spanish game based on the Dungeons & Dragons cartoon consisting of 92 cards that are split into 4 decks of 23 cards. (The decks are Hank the Ranger's bow, Diana the Acrobat's javelin, Presto the Magician's hat and pouch, and Bobby the Barbarian's club and helmet with these images printed on the reverse of the cards.)

In each shuffled deck there are 10 Adventure cards marked with the letter A, 4 Dragon cards marked with the letter D, 4 Dungeon cards marked with the letter M ("mazmorass" is Spanish for dungeon), 2 Force cards marked with the letter F, 1 Bifurcation card marked with the letter B, 1 Exit card marked with the letter S ("salida" is Spanish for exit) and 1 Treasure card marked with the letter T. The aim of the game is to pick a card each turn and win by collecting 3 Dragon cards, 1 Exit card and 1 Treasure card.

Dragon cards can be collected by using a previously picked Force card against it, with the Force card then being discarded. If the player has no Force card then instead he can roll the dice; a star result means he has defeated the dragon and can keep the Dragon card, a result of 4 means a stalemate and he must discard the Dragon card but a result of 1 to 3 means he has been defeated and must reshuffle his entire deck (current deck, discarded cards and kept cards) and start again. Alternatively, the player can decide to not roll a dice, discard the Dragon card and in future he picks from a different deck; whether occupied by another player or not.

Picking a Dungeon card means that the player must miss a go and discard this card. Picking a Bifurcation card means that the player must pick from another deck for the next turn only and discard this card. Adventure cards do nothing and are discarded. Each deck has its own discard pile; there is not one central discard pile made up from different decks.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Rolling Battle
description:
Rolling Battle is an abstract wargame that uses two regular D6 Dice, two Poker Dice, and a simple map representing four different terrains. The dice are worth various values, with some counting as regular troops and others representing Captains and Majors.

The game is played over four turns. Each turn, the play roll all four dice and then split them into pair with one poker die and one regular die in each set. The poker die determines the unit type and the regular die determines the unit strength. The player will then secretly write down the unit and strength value in the terrain of his or her choice. At the end of the game (once each player has assigned a unit to each terrain) the units are revealed. Total strength values with any applicable modifiers are revealed and the player with the highest value wins the terrain. Each terrain area is worth a set number of victory points and the player who has amassed the most points is the winner.

name: Hektik
description:
Hektik is a Pit clone for many players. There are 20 sets of 7 cards in the game. One set is used for every player involved. Each player is dealt seven cards. All players pick up their hand simultaneously and start trading over the table. A player can offer any number of the same symbol, but can only name the number, not the symbol. S/he then tries to find another player who offers the same number of cards. The first player to receive 7 of the same cards calls "Hektik" and is the winner.

Differences to "Pit":
- 5-20 players
- Seven cards per player
- All symbols have the same value

name: Crikey! Jerries Over Blighty!
description:
"Crikey! Jerries Over Blighty!" is a print & play game set in the skies of the Second World War, and created by the designer as a Christmas present for his dad after seeing his collection of Spitfire Ale bottle caps.

The game is a dexterity game using bottle caps, where two players - one representing the RAF and the other the Luftwaffe - fight to determine the outcome of the Battle of Britain.

In order to win, the RAF player must destroy all of the Luftwaffe's bombers; the Luftwaffe player, on the other hand, wins the Battle of Britain by destroying all of the RAF airfields on the board and by also ensuring that no RAF planes remain on the board.

...

The files to print for the game are in the Web Links section at the bottom of this page - the board is the file called "Print and Play Files at Google Docs", and the rules are under "Game rules at Google Docs".

To make the game, just print out the board at A2 size and laminate it (to help with flicking the pieces). All other components are designed to be easily provided by common household items, or by components scavenged from published games.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Tanks of War: Third Reich Rising
description:
Tanks of War (TOW) is a fast playing 2-4-player WW2 deck building board game of strategy, skill and maneuver of massive tank battles on the Eastern Front designed to play in about an hour. Using new and innovative deck building and battle mechanics, TOW pits the Germans vs. the Soviet Union during the opening salvos of World War 2. Each vehicle has been painstakingly researched and then converted into game play terms to ensure maximum realism without being bogged down in game play minutia. When your fighting a T-34 with your Panzer 4, it will be based on historical technical info!

TOW is a unique combination of a board game, miniatures game (without the minis) and deck building game. The strategies are endless and the turns are tense with each shot making a difference!

TOW brings the intensity of WW2 tank battles into an easy-to-understand and play format which will delight historical buffs and casual gamers looking for deep strategy, explosive turns, and pitch battles.

GAME PLAY OVERVIEW

Players customize their own unique battle deck which includes cards that alter game play and vehicles such as mighty KV-1s, Panzers, and tank destroyers. Played over a massive game board, both sides must purchase the right action cards and vehicles to win.

COMPONENTS
