Tanks of War comes with 2 decks that both the Germans and Soviet Union/Russians can customize, game board, tokens, dice and much more.

One massive 23 inch game board representing the plains of Russia
2 Player Reference Cards
Battle Dice including d4, d6, d8, and d10 dice
Over 100 double sided full color tokens
Over 200 double sided full color game cards with authentic photos representing various models of Panzers, T-34s, KV1s and many more. Also included are Force Cards which can alter game rules and give your tank commanders the edge they need on the battlefield
20+ page full color rulebook with variants and historical scenarios that create endless re-playability
10 Terrain Cards
Note: components are being finalized and may change

DECK BUILDING

Unique to Tanks of War is the ability for players to customize their deck prior to the game. This allows gamers to field the right mix of vehicles and Force Cards to meet the challenges they’ll face on the battlefield!

PLAY TIME

Players can choose to play a quick 30 minute game or set up a mighty clash lasting upwards to 1.5 hours.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Memory, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Triad
description:
Triad is a two-phase abstract strategy game.

The game played on an 8x8 grid with the middle four spaces unavailable for play, leaving 60 playable spaces. Of the 60 spaces, 40 are labeled "3" and the remaining 20 are labeled "6", values which only apply during Phase 2. Each player or team has 30 pyramid pieces available to play. Play consists of two phases with an option of playing only one phase for children.

In Phase 1, players alternate turns and attempt to make as many triads as possible, scoring three points for each turn in which one or more Triads are made. A placement which results in multiple Triads being formed still only scores three points. Triads consist of three playing pieces in a row in any direction - diagonally or orthogonally, including a stack. Playing pieces may not be stacked more than three high. Score is kept in real time via a scoring track and moving plastic marker along the edge of the board.

In Phase 2, Triads are removed. If the removal of a Triad reveals numbers on the board, those numbers - three or six - are added to the player's score. If a Triad stack is removed, the single revealed number is doubled. If a player has a Triad available to him to remove, he must remove it, even though it's to his strategic disadvantage. If he cannot remove one, the other player or team plays until he has an available move or both players have no Triads that can be removed. Keeping track of number placement when laying Triads is strategically wise.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Lovopoly
description:
A game of Monopoly that you can have custom-made to include places that are special to you and your loved one, romance-themed cards, and photos of you and your loved one on the game board, instructions, and even player pawns.

http://www.lovopoly.com

name: Gold oder Pech
description:
Simple luck-based game for the very young. The game consists of 6 dice cards, numbered 1-6, 72 luck cards and a die. The luck cards are distributed onto the dice cards. The active player rolls the die and picks a luck card from the corresponding stack, then follows the instructions (receive or give gold or pitch). If a player gives out gold or bad luck, s/he can choose the recipient. After two stacks have been emptied, the player with the highest postive difference between gold and pitch is the winner.
No individual designer is credited. The games was designed and published by a handicapped people's workshop in Germany and is based on one of Grimm's fairy tales, Mother Hulda.

name: Les mots à la bouche
description:
Les mots à la bouche (The Words in the mouth) is a game that allows you to animate discussions throughout a meal shared with friends, family, colleagues or acquaintances. A different game is available for each stage of the evening, all with the theme of the kitchen. Your table and utensils are thus transformed into a giant game board!

The stakes? The losers do the dishes!

The box contains:


A book of 120 pages to organize the perfect evening!
All accessories for up to 12 guests:


in all, 236 cards representing nearly 500 topics or actions for the game

30 coaster-shaped cards for the apéritifs
60 canapé-shaped cards for the appetizers
12 original place cards
80 questions for the entrée
12 twistor cards that will make the tongue twist
30 coaster-shaped cards for the main course
30 cards for dessert
30 allspice action cards that will spice up your meal
12 challenge cards for the digestifs
publishers: Éditions Groupe Nestor, Les Éditions Prisma

name: Dwarven Euchre
description:
Dwarven Euchre is a fantasy-themed evolution of a popular trick-taking card game.

The game is normally played with four people -- two teams of partners sitting across the table from each other. Each round involves one set of partners bidding on a trump suit, cards are played around the table as the bidding team tries to win the required number of tricks. Between rounds, a battle map is updated with results. The goal is for one team to capture the center hex on the map. Depending on board position and hand results, partners may earn 'reinforcement' draws in future rounds to make their hands stronger.

Partners may discuss board position between rounds, but within a round they must anticipate other player actions. Some example decisions: "My partner has this trick so far - should I play trump or save it for later?" and "My opponent called trump - should I draw some of it out?"

Differences between Dwarven and traditional Euchre include fantasy-themed cards, the battle map, sorcerer wildcards, and reinforcement draws. The rules contain example play and a two-player version.

name: Travel World
description:
Travel World is a board game, in which players visit major cities and countries around the world. Players select different reasons for travelling - business, pleasure, adventure, or education, and, leaving from Tokyo, check in at 10 places that correspond to their reasons for travelling. The first player to call in at all such places, and return to Tokyo, wins. Players of all ages can enjoy this game of world travel.

This is a spin and move game in which players have to visit each city in their color and return to the start space. Players can choose to travel in many directions around the world but have to follow predetermined paths.

Travelling from North America to Europe can be done via two "lay-over" spaces in which the player must stop and spend a turn.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Katartis
description:
Katartis is a wargame that simulates a clash between two opposing sides, each representing commanders, troops and war machines of the armies of the Fighting Races who populate the world of Katartis.
One or more players take command of each force, determine the composition, equipment and strategy, and guide the tactical maneuvers on the ground, rolling the dice to simulate the fighting and resolve all of the events that may take place on a battlefield.

name: The Drowning Soldiers
description:
The Drowning Soldiers is a game for 2 players. Its mechanics evolve around a player-determined, constantly changing battlefield shape & size. The objective of the game is to trap & drown 3 of your opponent's pieces (soldiers).

The pieces (which we call 'soldiers') consist of 12 numbered checkers. Odd numbered pieces are in red and even numbered in blue. The numbers indicate their turn order in placement & movement phase, both of which follows the ascending order of the numbers on the soldiers.

1st phase: placement

Soldiers are being placed on the blocks under the said order. With the only restriction that no soldier can be placed adjacent to another one that was already on the board.

2nd phase: move & drown

A soldier on turn can either move to an adjacent block, move any empty adjacent block to a different empty tile on the board, or perform a card action.

There are 3 types of cards in game. Each player has 2 of each type to begin with and can recover a used card upon drowning an opponent soldier. The 3 cards are:

Bomb card: destroys a block adjacent to the soldier on turn.
Swap card: swaps the soldier on turn with an adjacent friendly soldier.
Barricade card: creates a barricade block on an empty tile of the board adjacent to the soldier on turn. Barricades are neither movable, destroyable, or mountable.

Drowning: A soldier is drowned when it is his own turn to move but there is no move available other than to use a card. The drowned soldier will then be removed from the board along with the block it is standing on.

name: 1 ... 2 ... 3 ... viva football
description:
This is a card game themed football for 02 players of all ages.
The game consists of 09 different types of cards:
• 06 displacement cards (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
• 01 card (SHOOT)
• 01 card (STOP)
• 01 card (TACKLE)
The playing field is composed of 06 parts, numbered 01 to 06. At the beginning of the game a player is on the box 03 or 04..
1. each player receive 05 cards.
2. it can only have maximum 05 cards in hand.
3. After playing, he draws a card from the pile.
4. he can choose not to play.
5. it has only 05 cards in hand, he may draw a card and discard one of his cards.

MOVEMENT
• The player can move the field one square forward playing the card number with displacement greater (or less for the other player) in which it is located.

• The player can move several boxes playing a series (ascending or descending) of 03, 04 or 05 cards (2/3, 2/3/4, 2/3/4/5), including one on which it is located.

SHOOT
The player may draw a card playing SHOOT.
It is far more opposing nets (box 01 or 06) the longer it will play a large number of TIR cards at a time.
Ex: ascending player
Case 06 ----> 01carte SHOOT
Case 04 ----> 03carte SHOOT

STOPPING THE SHOOT
Any SHOOT whatever the number of cards used can be countered with a single card STOP

TACKLE
After moving a player (01 or more deplacements cards) the next player can take control by playing a card TACKLE.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play, Sports

name: El Regreso del Jedi
description:
Spanish (mexican) Star Wars game with Return of the Jedi as a background Theme.

A Spanish/Star Wars themed game based on Stratego. Playing tokens have one inch plastic bases with cardboard standees of characters and ships from the Star Wars movie in place of the usual pictures. The game has some pieces that operate differently than their Stratego counterparts.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Fighting, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Meck-Pomm
description:
A die-rolling and trivia game about the German federal state of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern.

Players try to buy as many tourism companies as possible, complement them with related companies and bring them to five-star-standards.

Components include a board, two dice, 120 quiz cards, 28 company cards, playing money, 6 player tokens, several chips and pearls, cardboard boxes and a sand timer. The board shows a map of the state of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. Around the map, there are spaces showing different companies. To win the game, players need luck in rolling the dice and also knowledge about Mecklenburg-Vorpommern to succeed in the trivia rounds.

name: Tacship
description:
User Description

Tacship is a simplified fast-play miniatures rules system for simulating combat between manned space fighters.

The game can be played on a hex grid map or on a plain table area. The rules are designed to be used with 6mm Space fighter miniatures or smaller and are recommended to be mounted on one inch hex base if a hex grid is being used. The game can be played easly on any kitchen table.

The rules cover movement, weapons, damage, ordnance (missles and mines), decoys and a simple ship design system.

First Published in "Fallout", issue 4. (Republished in Ragnarok magazine, issue 3, "The Ragnarok Compendium" and on the "SFSFW" website)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Dead Man's Hand
description:
Dead Man’s Hand is a zombie themed take on Texas Hold'em, a community card poker game, with game play focused as much on the betting as on the cards being played. Some of the terms (blinds/river) have been changed here to more zombie centric ones (appetizers/blood), while others have been kept (flop/turn/showdown) for hopefully obvious reasons. Gameplay is the same as Hold’em except the criteria for determining and ranking winning hands has been changed due to the style of cards used in this version of the game.

To better understand these rankings, it is necessary to explain the makeup of cards in Dead Man’s Hand. In stead of the regular playing card deck used for Texas Hold'em, this deck is first made up of four types of zombies: Walkers, Shamblers, Runners, and Infected. There are twelve cards for each type of zombie. These twelve cards for each type are further divided into Red and Green colored text, with six of each zombie type. Each zombie card also has two numbers, a Decomposition number and a Hunger number ranging from one to six. These numbers and colors are arranged in such a way that each zombie has three other zombies (one of each type) that match it in both color and numbers. Thus, with these card differences, the criteria used for hand rankings is changed while keeping the dealing/betting/bluffing aspects of regular Hold'em.

Dead Man’s Hand is played on a single table with 2 to 10 players. The game is also played with an assortment of chips for the betting rounds. Traditional poker chips can be used or you can try our "Dead Man’s Hand: Poker Chips of the Living Dead" (available separately) for a set of zombie themed chips.

The goal is simple: win as many chips as you can, one pot at a time. You win a pot by having the best hand, or by having all other players fold before the showdown. As in Texas Hold'em, a hand of Dead Man’s Hand consists of one to four betting rounds. A hand ends when all players but one have folded, or the fourth and final betting round completes with multiple players still in the hand - whichever comes first. At that point, players enter into the showdown, where remaining players discover who has the best hand.

name: Goldilocks
description:
objective: be the first reaching home
acting by turns -
use the spinner, step forward and follow instructions printed on the board. Move through the house of the 3 bears reaching home

comments:
early 'Goldilocks' game;
see also Cadaco's 'Goldilocks and the three bears' from 1973

name: 20th Century @ War
description:
20th Century @ War

20th Century @ War has 3 different technology levels and additional technological advances within each level. It recreates 4 different governmental types for historical accuracy, and also has a fast paced 'conquest mode' where the world is neutral and the players carve out their own empires.

World War I

It’s 1914 and Europe is about to destroy itself. The Germans/Austro-Hungarians along with the failing Ottoman Empire duke it out with the British/Franco alliance on one front and the Russian Empire on the other. Will the Americans enter the war and save the French? You decide.

World War II

It’s 1941 and Hitler controls most of Europe, only England fights on. Japan, forced by crippling sanctions from the U.S. prepares a surprise attack against its rival in the Pacific. Will the Soviet Union fall to the Wehrmacht or hold Moscow from the Nazi hoard? Will the U.S. intervene in Europe and save England? You decide.

World War III

It’s 1984 and the world is on the brink of Nuclear War. The Soviet Union is beginning to crumble from within. The Politburo realize that it’s now or never in their bid to destroy the decadent capitalists of the west. Will the U.S. survive the nuclear exchange, will its vaunted ‘star wars’ defense system protect them from the Soviet missiles? Or will the Red Army roll straight through Europe to the English Channel and beyond? You decide.

Conquest

It’s 1999 and the great plagues have left the ‘New World Order’ in tatters, only the East Coast and Beijing offer a beacon of light within the horror. Around the world governments fall, armies dissolve, chaos reigns. It’s up to you regain control and forge a new era for your people. Will the East Coast reunite North America under a single flag or take control of Europe with an iron first? Will Beijing return to a great Monarchy and remake the Inner Kingdom or will the Communists take their revenge on a weak and paralyzed Japan? You decide.

A massive 3' x 7' table top game which recreates World War I, II & III. 2000 pieces, 2 to 5 players
categories: Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Damage Deck
description:
The Damage Deck is a deck of cards consisting of 4 suits, Ace-10 each and two times a set of seven cards depicting the hitzones (head, torso, groin, left arm, right arm, left leg, right leg) of a body.

The deck is a game system that is a tool for game designers to create their own games using this deck.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Game System, Print & Play

name: Stop-Over München
description:
The game consists of two sub-games.
In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all München-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.
This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game (backside of the board) journalists try to get the cover-story (word-guessing approach) before other players can beat them by running up the stairs of the publisher's office first.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stop-Over Karlsruhe
description:
The game consists of two sub-games.
In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Karlsruhe-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.
This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game (backside of the board) journalists try to get the cover-story (word-guessing approach) before other players can beat them by running up the stairs of the publisher's office first.

name: Gomony
description:
Somewhat resembling Russian Checkers variants such as Bashni or Shashki, as well as Emanuel Lasker's Laska from 1911, Gomony is essentially Checkers with the captured pieces remaining on the board, in stacks. It is played on an 8x8 checkered board (unlike Lasca's 7x7 board,) with 12 bi-colored pieces: white-and-green and brown-and-black. The darker colors remain on the bottom half until the pieces are promoted and turned over; this way, players are able to see which pieces beneath a stack have been promoted.

Players' beginning positions and movements are the same as ordinary Checkers, with the exception that upon jumping over an opponent's piece, instead of removing it from the board, it is stacked upon by the capturing player. Stacks are controlled by the piece on top, ordinary or promoted, unless the other player captures the top piece and frees one of his own below. To win, the opposing player's pieces must all be buried under stacks or incapable of moving.

name: Sir Harry and the Dinosaurs
description:
User Description

Sir Harry & the Dinosaurs is a set of miniatures rules for Dinosaur Hunting.

The game takes place in the year of 1878 and is about "Sir Harold Fortherington Smyth" exhibition to the jungles if India and his attmpts to capture some dinosaurs for the "British Zoological Society".

The object of the game is to capture as many dinosaurs as possible, either before your figures are killed or in a set ammout of time or as set out by a scenario (divised by the players). The rules can be played as solo game or multiple player game.

The suggested miniatures for these rules are 15mm through 25mm figurs could be used. Also scenary and dice (D4, D6, and a D10) will be needed to play.

The rules was first published in Ragnarok, issue 39.

name: Pig Jax
description: This game is similar to the traditional game of Jacks. Instead of 10 jacks, there are 8 pig figurines that must be picked up while bouncing a ball.

name: High Side
description:
High Side is a casino table game using both cards and dice.

From the game description:
"High Side is a table game that accommodates five or six players on a standard blackjack table, depending on layout utilization.

High Side is similar to Baccarat in that players do not compete against the dealer or other players. Instead, players win based on the comparison of two community hand values.

The game uses six standard decks of 52 playing cards per deck dealt from a shoe and two Pai Gow dice cups, each containing a single standard six sided die."

From the rules:
"The object of High|Side is to bet on the higher of two
hand values.

The first hand value is determined by the roll of two dice.
The second hand value is determined by the draw of a single
card. Card values equal the number on the card with Aces
playing as 1, Jacks as 11, Queens as 12 and Kings as 13.
The winning hand is the High|Side and pays even money."

name: Easy Over Under
description:
Easy Under Over is a casino table game involving both dice and cards.

From the game manual:
"Easy Over Under is a table game that accommodates six players on a standard blackjack table. The game uses at least one standard deck of 52 playing cards, two six sided dice and a pai gow dice cup. The cards are assigned numerical values with Ace = 1, each of the pip cards according to their face values, Jacks = 11, Queens = 12, and Kings = 13.

Players do not compete against the dealer or other players. The players win or lose based on the comparison of the value of their single player card to the value of the community dice roll."

name: Tusen språkfrågor
description: A simple but fun quiz game where all the questions concern language. It is made up bu a deck of cards. On each card are 10 questions written. They are increasingly difficult (1 easy, 10 difficult). Each player starts by answering a leve 1 question. If that is correct the player gets to answer a level 2 question and so on. If the player are unsure about the answer she can either try to answer or pass. If the answer is incorrect she has to start over at level one next time it is her turn. If she passes she start on the level she passed on. The first to answer a level 10 question wins.

name: Jiao Tong An Quan
description:
This is a game published around 80's-90's in Taiwan. This is a rolling dice game and combines with knowledge of traffic safety. Once a player goes to Taipei, the game ends and winner is the one who has the most points.

The dices and player tokens are made of rubber. Children can use them as erasers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Shadows over the Nile
description:
This is an expansion to the England Invaded game:
A skirmish wargame based around the close of the nineteenth century. The back drop is around Germany launching an invasion of France and Britain. A squad level game, where soldiers fight in desperate battles across urban landscapes in a bid to stem Germany and their powerful war machine. England Invaded comes with a supplement rule book (34 pages) and 10 Figures. (French & German)

Over the Wire used a unique system for developing fire power based on the levels of command you units are under. The better (higher Ranked) your command is the more powerful the attack. The unit sizes are based on Squads of miniatures where each base is an Infantry/Command/Support Squad.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Storytelling

name: Virtuoso
description:
Virtuoso is a music theory board game. Players compete against each other by successfully answering trivia questions about music history, composition, listening comprehension, and theory. Not for the faint of heart, Virtuoso is a competitive, yet educational game geared for high school and college musicians to expand their knowledge and show off their mad skills.
(source: calebheisey.com - with permission from the designer/site owner)

The game debuted at the 2012 Collab Game Board Competition hosted by the Philadelphia Museum of Art (http://www.philamuseum.org/collab/).

name: Blocks in the Pacific
description:
Blocks in the Pacific is a new concept game covering the whole Pacific Campaign from the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor (Dec 7th 1941) till the atomic blast in Nagasaki, August 1945.

Developed on wooden blocks and cubes system, over an astonishing 172x61cm full laminated multicolor map-board, there's not any paper component, but the Manual.
All the over 500 wooden/plastic components have been created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

HISTORICAL BACKGROUND
On Dec 7th 1941, without a declaration of war the Japanese Empire launched a devastating surprise attack against the US and the British forces in the Pacific.

BLOCKS IN THE PACIFIC recalls, in game form, the most decisive battles fought in the Pacific Theater, from the Pearl Harbor strike in December 1941 to the atomic blast over Japan in August 1945..

BLOCKS IN THE PACIFIC is a game for 1-4 players, 1-2 control the Allies and the other 1-2 control the Japanese Empire.
Although based on history, players in command of the two factions can modify the evolution of World War 2 in the Pacific.

RULES INTRODUCTION
The rules are divided into three major sections which can be learned one at a time.
The first section is the BASIC GAME RULES which introduces the basic concepts and enables players to start playing the game without too many rules to remember.
Then the ADVANCED GAME RULES provide more specific and detailed rules for an enhanced realism, such as the use of Fuel and the Advanced Production System.
Finally, for those players who want to get the best out of the game, OPTIONAL RULES can be added as desired.
The Optional Rules include Technology Research, Strategic warfare, Amphibious Invasions, Parachute Assaults…

SCALE: A hexagon is approximately 53 miles (70 Km) across.
A turn is 1 month long.
A full strength counter represents 300 planes, 300 Tanks, or 30,000 men, depending on the type unit, equipment and nationality.

FOG OF WAR: The game can be played with the Fog of War on (wooden blocks are placed on the map in such a way the opponent player can not see them) OR with Fog of War OFF (all units are visible).

Language: English and Italian
Genre: Operational, Strategic
Turns: Turn-Based
Complexity: Basic to Advanced, depending on which rules are used and on Scenario Lenght
Period: World War II

SCENARIOS
With over 300 units counters and 300 different resource points of various color, players can enjoy hours of fun by playing the full 1941 DAY OF INFAMY Campaign, or one of the 5 others 6-turns scenarios.

Every scenario has different Victory conditions and length, with a playing time from 1 to 20 turns.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Time of Decisions
description:
TIME of DECISIONS is the last game of the Blocks Series from VentoNuovo Games.

It covers the early years before WW2, including war in Ethiopia, Spain, Aunschluss, Invasion of Cechoslovakia...

TIME of DECISIONS is a game of World War II conflict simulation at the strategic level. It recalls the most decisive battles fought in Europe, Africa and Asia from the beginning of the invasion of Ethiopia, in summer 1936 until the dramatic end in Berlin in spring 1945. Although based on historical events and battles, the players in command of the two factions can modify the evolution of World War II.

The game is recommended for two or more players, up to 6: one/three control the Allies, and the other one/three control Germany and the other Axis powers.
The game is furthermore suitable for solitary play: the single player just controls both sides. In this case, a play with Fog of War is suggested.

Developed with a system of wooden blocks and cubes and played out over an astonishing 125x87 cm (49"x34") full laminated multicolor mapboard, the only paper component in the box is the rules manual. In total, more than 600 wooden/plastic components have been created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

The rules are divided into three major sections which can be learned one at a time:
• The Basic Game Rules introduce the basic concepts and enable players to start playing the game without too many rules to remember.
• The Advanced Game Rules provide more specific and detailed rules for enhanced realism, such as the use of Fuel and the Advanced Production System.
• The Optional Rules are for those who want to get the most out of the game, with rules for Technology Research, Strategic Warfare with the bombing of Germany and U-boat campaigns in the oceans, Amphibious Landings, Airborne Assaults, and more.

In TIME OF DECISIONS, a hexagon is approximately 53 miles (70 km) across, a turn is 1 month long, and a full-strength counter represents a major military formation (normally corps size) with 300 planes, 300 tanks, or 30,000 men, depending on the unit type, equipment, nationality, etc. The game can be played with "Fog of War" on (with the faces of wooden blocks hidden from the opponent) or off (all units are visible).

Players can compete starting from 1936 Campaign, in one of four six-turn scenarios or one of the shorter, easy-to-learn scenarios. Each scenario has different victory conditions and length, with a playing time from 1 to 99 turns.

name: Post Time Fast Action Horse Racing Game
description:
Objective: make most money
acting by turns

You have an eight race series in which to accumulate assets, through buying horses and betting them to win! And, of course, your stable of winning horses can net you big purse money. The board provided sets the odds, purse money and payoffs for each race. If you play your cards right you will be the richest owner at the track.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fool's Joust
description:
Old King Fafnir has no heir to his kingdom, a problem he means to solve by marrying off his daughter Princess Jezabelelle. Only there is one problem with this plan: the princess that being that the princess is such a spoiled rotten, cold hearted, ill tempered, foul mouthed, back stabbing wretch of a woman that no good, respectable knight or noble in his right mind would ever consider such a horrible fate.

Then he was struck with a flash of inspiration; he declared a that joust tournament be held for all eligible bachelors of certain royal status to participate, the prize for the victor being the Princess Jezabelle's hand in marriage.

No one signed up.

Desperate, the king hastily opened the enrollment wide open so that any man in the kingdom may participate in the tournament. The applicants began flowing in. Unfortunately for the king, those who did sign up are not so good, respectable, or in their right mind (or even human for that matter.) But it is too late for the king to do anything about it now, the joust must go on!

Fool's Joust is a card based system where players randomly draw their character and the opponents whom they will face in combat. Each turn the player use dice to engage in three rounds of combat, the character who scores the most hits or remains in their saddle wins. Players win a reward card for each successful combat; the first player to collect a predetermined number of reward cards wins the game.

name: Europa: Lernspiel für Jung und Alt
description:
A small trivia game containing 98 questions about Europe.

Each card contains a question on the front and an answer on the backside (which is not the answer to the question on the other side of that card).

The cards are shuffled and evenly distributed to all players. One player asks a question from one of his cards; now all other players try to find the right answer on the backside of their cards. If a player has the card with the right answer he gets one point and is the next player to ask a question.

The winner is the player with the most points. The game also contains rules for solitaire play.

name: Kłamca, Kłamca
description:
Liar, Liar is a simple card game for 3-10 players, who need to lie through their teeth to get rid of cards in their hand.
Each card has a number (from 1 to 21), and you play cards face-down. When you play a card into the pile on the table, you have to tell higher number than the last player. So the game forces you to lie from time to time.
If you seem suspicious, other player may challenge you. If you were lying, you get all the cards in the pile as a negative points. If you were truthful, the challenger is penalized.

Game includes 4 special variants that you can mix-up into the game. You choose, which special cards you include in the game.

name: Ultraman Game
description:
Nintendo Ultraman Game released in 1966 by Nintendo based on the original Ultraman TV series. The city is on the brink of total destruction. Cars are ablaze, flying from collapsing freeways. Even worse: the local stores are under threat as well. Luckily, Ultraman comes to the rescue!

Ultraman Game is one of Nintendo's grey band games. The game bears the UltraQ logo. UltraQ was the first of the 'Ultra' series created by Tsuburaya Productions.

Players choose one of four Earth Defense characters and advance on the board by spinning the arrow on game board. When players land on the spaces with 'guns' the other spinner is used. This determines which monster was defeated, which earn players the corresponding card.

name: The Beggars Divide Game
description:
This game is a game that tests the ability of players to evaluate proper on how much they give away pointwise in order to insure that players come to them to gain points, so by giving away points, the player has people coming to them to get points.

The core of the mechanics is that in a set order (unless playing simultaneous turns) a player will pick another player to beg to. The player being begged will divide up a set number of points between them and the begging player.

Play continues a set number of rounds with the player with the most amount of points winning the game.

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Save the Youth Center Game
description:
Power Rangers! The evil Rita Repulsa has sent her Pudgy Pig monster to Angel Grove. It has eaten all of Angel Grove’s food supply. Ernie’s Youth Center won’t be able stay open without food. You need to save Ernie’s Youth Center Power Rangers by getting food back from Rita’s Evil Space Aliens! All of Angel Grove is counting on you Power Rangers. You must restock Ernie’s Youth Center till Angel Grove can get its food supply back.

Game Objective: Players need to collect eight food items and bring them back to Ernie’s Youth Center to restock the food supply, and then travel back to the Command Center to regroup with Zordon!

The youngest player starts the game by rolling the die and moving the indicated number. If they make it to an Evil Space Alien Battle Location, they may stop their and do Battle. *Players do not have move the full amount on the die if they choose to stop on a Location area. After a player stops at a Location area, there turn ends. Play then continues with the player to left.

Winning the Game: The first player’s Power Ranger to drop off the eight collected food items to Ernie’s Youth Center and return to the Command Center is the winner!
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Conundrum
description:
Conundrum is the exciting game where everyone plays by their own rules.

Each player has the same set of eight rules. The challenge is knowing when to play each rule, because the rules can only be played once. Played in eight rounds, every player is dealt 10 cards each round. Each player selects the rule that he/she will play by for that round, based on his/her hand. So each player will be playing the round by a different set of rules. After each round, those rules will clear and a new hand is dealt.

The object of the game is to try to play as many cards as possible each round. Every card left in a player's hand after each round is a point. The winner is the player with the fewest points after eight rounds.

name: Sake & Samurai: Ninja Cards
description:
A promo/add-on for Sake & Samurai given at Play 2012. The cards were sold separately or given with every purchase of Sake & Samurai.

The add-on consists on 4 Ninja cards and a rule card.

From the rule card: "The Ninja strikes from the shadows, so you have to plan carefully his ambush.."
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Medieval, Party Game

name: Front Office Football: The Card Game
description:
In Front Office Football: The Card Game, two coaches assemble "playbooks" consisting of offensive and defensive plays, then play an abridged game of professional football while choosing plays, rolling the dice and determining the results.

This game focuses on the interaction between two coaches, unlike the computer version, which was originally created in 1998 and has evolved through several versions.

In the card game, each team has a set of player cards with specific strengths and weaknesses. Along with your play calls, this helps determine the results of plays, and, ultimately, the winner of the game. It's assumed coaches (you and your friends) have a basic understanding of the rules of football. This is a game for those who genuinely enjoy football strategy and don't mind a relaxing evening at the card table.

While most of the cards are in the basic sets, each team has twelve specific plays (nine on offense, three on defense) that emphasize its strengths and tendencies. This will give your games the flavor of coaching a specific team without upsetting competitive balance.

name: Walt Disney's Cinderella Aschenbrödel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space '100' (get married)
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her (cute) meeple according die roll
ending on a coloured space follow instructions of the rule sheet

name: Yo no fui
description:
The front page in the local newspaper shows the latest crimes committed in the city. The police, pressured by the public, looks for answers.
Because of this, the officers gather some of the most dangerous and renown criminals of the city, so they can interrogate them about the facts. ¡Any of them could have committed the crime! so they’ll need them to accuse each other so the ones responsible for the crimes go to jail. But, beware, for this kind of “justice” can also put an innocent behind bars.

“¡It Wasn’t Me!” is game of investigation and bluff, where each players assumes the role of a criminal, determined by "criminal cards" with unique abilities, and have to avoid being sent to jail. To do this, each player will be dealt a "Crime card" that is unknown to other players. Then an "Investigation card" that matches one of those "Crime cards" will be revealed, and players must try to individually find who is the culprit using action cards with various effects. But in the end, not all players will find the culprit, so they will have to rely on the accusations of other players, who may have different agendas and may be bluffing. The round ends with a secret votation round to choose who goes to jail and points will be determined according to your choice.


La primera plana del periódico local anuncia el último horroroso crimen que consterna a la ciudad. La policía, presionada por el público, busca respuestas.
Por esta razón, los oficiales reúnen a varios de los más peligrosos y reconocidos criminales de la ciudad, para así interrogarlos sobre los hechos. ¡Cualquiera de ellos pudo haber cometido el crimen!, así que necesitarán que ellos mismos se acusen para poder llevar a la cárcel al responsable de uno de los varios crímenes que aquejan a la sociedad. Pero, cuidado, pues este tipo de “justicia” puede poner detrás de las rejas a un inocente o a un culpable por igual.

“¡Yo no fui!” es un juego de investigación y bluff, en el cual cada jugador asume el rol de un criminal, a partir de la repatición de "cartas de criminal", con habilidades únicas, y debe evitar ser enviado a la cárcel. Para ello, se le reparte a cada jugador una "carta de crimen" que se mantiene secreta a lo largo del juego. Luego se revela una "carta de investigación", que es pareja de una de las cartas de crimen repartidas. Entonces, los jugadores comienzan a investigar quién fue el culpable del crimen usando cartas de efecto para ver la carta de crimen de otros jugadores. Pero para el final, sólo unos pocos jugadores conocerán el criminal, así que los demás dependerán de las acusaciones de los otros jugadores, que pueden estar mintiendo en pro de agendas personales. Al final de la ronda de juego, se realiza una votación secreta para determinar quién se va a la cárcel y se reparten puntos de acuerdo con las votaciones realizadas.
mechanics: Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Od Ball
description:
"The Unique Challenge With a Touch of Class"

From the back of the box:

"OD BALL is played very similar to the ancient Chinese game called NIM. Each player alternates turns in which any number of balls may be eliminated from any one of the three sections. Players may eliminate only one ball or the whole section or any number in between - but only from one section at a time. The winner is the player who forces his opponent to take the last ball."

Instead of the piles of sticks or stones usually used for NIM, it has marbles which are captured in a wooden board. Each marble can be snapped down to a lower position to take it. The board is double-sided, allowing play to continue after all the marbles have been taken.

name: Plum Chess
description:
Plum Flower is the Taiwanese national flower. In this game, a player has 12 Chinese Animal Zodiac and four weather elements. The goal is go to the middle of the board and take the flower on the center of the board. The the animal has to carry on the flower and goes back to home. Who does it first will be the winner.

The animals can eat the other one depending on their order in Zodiac (like Dong Wu Qi). For example, the：Rat > Ox >
Tiger > Hare > Dragon > Snake > Horse > Sheep > Monkey > Cock > Dog > Boar. The four elements are used for blocking others way and can't leave the square in the center.


This is an old Taiwanese game. It is supposed to be published in 1980's. It is not a very common game in Taiwan.

name: Chap with wings there, Five Rounds Rapid!
description:
User Description

Chap with wings there, Five Rounds Rapid! is a rules supplement for running Doctor Who Games using the Future Wars miniatures rules.

The supplement rules are based on the classic "Doctor Who" series (i.e pre 2005) including profiles on;

Daleks
Robomen
Ogrons
Cybermen
Sea Devils
Silurians
Autons
Yeti's
Sontarans
Ice Warriors


The rules was first published in the Ragnarok journal, issue 47 (August 2005).

name: War Stories: Rattenkrieg
description: Rattenkrieg is the third entry in the War Stories series. Featuring 20 scenarios chronicling in detail the legendary Battle of Stalingrad. Rattenkrieg introduces new urban warfare maps and rules for sewer movement, snipers, multi-story buildings, mouse holing, and street fighting. Additional German and Soviet units and assets are included as are the Romanians for the first time. Rattenkrieg not only expands the War Stories system to new theaters of combat but expands the assets and unit available to the Red Storm base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: Wer kennt Basel?
description:
"Who knows Basel - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Basel.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: Welt des Gartens
description:
Where does wild anise grow? And what does it mean to "winnow" a plant? Gardening is one of the most popular pastimes. No matter whether a cottage garden is growing at home, a garden plot is thriving on the outskirts of town, or a few flower boxes embellish the balcony, in Welt des Gartens, players with a green thumb deeply immerse themselves in the world of their hobby – and in doing so, even the most experienced gardener will learn something new.

Before starting the game, players agree on how many questions they'll face. Each turn, one player reads a question from the card; the question has multiple answers listed below it, and 1-3 answers will be correct – but there's no way of knowing how many are right ahead of making your guess.

After the active player reads off the answers, each player can place 1-3 guess markers on the numbers matching those answers. When the player reveals the correct answers, anyone who guessed incorrectly scores no points, no matter how many other answers they got right. Players who guessed correctly with all of their placed tokens score as many points as the number of tokens they placed.

After finishing the agreed upon number of questions, whoever has the most points wins!

name: Protect or Infect
description:
Protect or Infect is a turn-based strategy board game set in the early stages of a zombie outbreak. This game takes place several weeks into the infection at a point where the zombies seem to have the upper hand; not only in numbers but also in mutated ability. Four humans surviving together have taken refuge in a country side manor. On the run, down to just knives and pistols, and being stalked by countless zombies that are leading a monster directly to them, the survivors hold themselves up and wait for rescue within the halls of the zombie manor.

The game pits a team of 4 survivors against a team of zombies; each team consists of at least 1 player per side with up to 4 players on each team. The game takes place on a grid based board detailing the basement, first floor, 2nd floor, and grounds of an abandoned manor.

The goal of the survivor team is to hold out within the manor grounds for 20 rounds at which point a rescue vehicle spawns. They must then make it to the rescue vehicle with at least 2 survivors making it to safety in order to win. The survivor team can scavenge for items, barricade doors and windows with furniture and wood, and seek out strategic locations within the manor or its grounds to help aid them through the game (60+ weapons, health items, equipment, zombie traps, and weapon upgrades).

Alternatively, the survivor team can kill the zombie team boss character, The Harvester, thereby ending the zombie teams ability to spawn more zombies. Once all zombies are cleared the survivor team wins.

The goal of the zombie team is to kill all of the survivor characters in order to win. The zombie team gains 'spawn points' at the beginning of every round that can be saved up or spent on the 7 different classes of zombies available. Each class costs a varying number of spawn points depending on their stats: movement speed, health, attack dmg, and special ability. The zombie team also controls a zombie boss character, The Harvester. The Harvester is the strongest and most versatile zombie of the game but if it is destroyed the zombie team can no longer spawn zombies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jackpot Slots
description:
The thrill of the "one-armed bandit" has lured gamblers since the end of the 19th Century. From the original Poker-themed games to "Liberty Bell" - the first true slot machine as we know it today - to the complex electronic games of today, the slots have become the world's most popular casino game. JACKPOT SLOTS brings the excitement of the casino to the board game table.


JACKPOT SLOTS is the umbrella title for two slot-machine themed games:

WINNING LINES is the flagship game. As cards are dealt from a deck of cards bearing slot machine symbols, players seek to claim "winning lines" - combinations of slot machine symbols that pay off - before a lemon card turns up to end the round.

TRIPLE PLAY is a slot machine take on "Memory" in which players seek to uncover "winning lines" while, yet again, avoiding lemon cards.


The allure of the slots is before you! Are you lucky enough to hit the Jackpot?
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking

name: Battle Tank: Escape From Giant Robot Island
description:
Battle Tank: Escape from Giant Robot Island is a modular strategy board game for 2-4 players which pits battle tanks against giant robots. The players take on one of four roles, Mad Scientist Dr. Victor von Mechanstein, Sergeant Roger Stammel, OSI Agent Cynthia Collins or henchmech E-Gore Mk.IV.

Gameplay progresses in turns with each player moving their token(s) then resolving attacks before play passes to the next player. Each unit has a set movement rate and attacks are resolved by rolling a six-sided die (D6) and then comparing the number rolled to the range and the target's armor.

Each character has two of its own, often opposing, goals. One goal is active and ends the game on the turn it is achieved, and the other goal is passive and is only checked after 10 turns have been played. Mechanstein wants to prevent his tanks from being taken off the island, Stammel simply wants to escape with his soldiers, Collins wants intelligence on the Mad Scientist's forces and E-gore wants to please its master by recapturing the prisoners.

Each turn the tank players move toward the beach as more and more robots appear to stop them.

The action is modified by two sets of cards: Mad Scientist Events and Tanker Tactics. Events are large scale effects that change the game in some way or affect all the players tics are short and Tactics are minor effects that can give a boost to many actions as well as repair damage, improve speed or even find a new tank if one has been destroyed.

The playing area itself consists of 7 hexagonal tiles with a hex-grid printed on them. One tile is Mechanstein's volcanic lair and the other six are unique combinations of roads, cliffs, forests and open terrain. The non-volcano tiles can be rotated to any orientation and placed into one of several formations and are designed in such a way to always have the roads match up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Helix: The Card Game
description:
SUMMARY:
When a biological plague infects most of earth, distorting the newly discovered HELIX strand in our DNA, creating immediate mental defects and physical deterioration. The deformities mutate and the "age of zombies" becomes a reality. A desperate call for help from survivors gathered from around the world; through discovery of a secret United Nations project, awaken a reserve of space marines put in cryogenic suspension to return to earth with only one mission... to save the handful of survivors from becoming assimilated into zombies.

GAME-PLAY:
This is a two player game that generally lasts between 15-30 minutes. The box set comes with two 60 card decks; one for the Space Marines and one for the Zombies. The game offers Character Cards, Action Cards, Equipment Cards (for Space Marines Only), and Survivor Cards. Attacks are directly geared towards the characters and Survivors rather than the players. There is a follow-up expansion set ahead that can be a stand-alone or mixed in with this First Edition set.

GOAL:
To goal for the marines is to save 10 Civilians and help them leave earth safely with them whereas the goal of the zombies are simple.... feed. If the zombies "turn" all the civilians into zombies or kill off all the space marines, the zombies win. If the marines extract 10 civilians or kill off all the zombies, they win.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Zombies
