name: Hello, Mr. Gravedigger
description:
A game for the 2013 2-p PnP Game Design Contest.

A worker-placement game in which the two players are competing Funeral Home operators. The goal is to satisfy the funerary wishes of the deceased through the collection of coffins, cemetery plots, and headstones. The harder to please the client is, the closer you are to satisfying the deceased's wishes, and the faster you can accomplish it, the more points you're awarded at their funeral. But, should you fail to keep them happy, your customers might crawl up from their tombs to complain!

Apart from standard worker-placement fare, this game utilizes a unique time mechanic that dictates when and where players may place their workers. More difficult actions require more time to complete, and players must balance the use of their time against the monetary costs of their actions.

name: Goblin Pit Fight
description:
Goblin Pit Fight is a card game in which players choose one of four tribes of Goblins. This fast paced game generally takes 30-60 minutes to play. The object is to create the best hand; outscoring other players and possibly defeating the pit for extra points. It has an easy to learn, multi-level scoring system that allows players to be creative when building a hand. Each player keeps a camp, where they can secure cards for future hands.

Gameplay overview:

Each player is dealt 7 cards from which they have to make a four card hand. Players put one card into the center as their Pit card. They then have two cards left over for their Camp which rolls from turn to turn allowing players to always have two cards in reserve for future hands.

Scoring is based on card icons such as tribe, class, bone value, and Pit strength. All of these icons allow for different ways to score points each hand.

name: Bushido Wars: The Way of the Samurai
description:
In the turbulent feudal Japan, the warlords fighting each other to unify the country under the rule of his clan. Each player plays the Daimyo of one of these clans to become the new Shogun. One player that eliminates the Daimyo of the opposing faction will win the game, becoming the absolute sovereign of the country.

A game is played over many consecutive shifts, and will last until one of the players remove the enemy Daimyo. If at the beginning of his turn, a player has fewer cards than allowed, must draw a new card from the deck to add it to your hand. Then you have to do one of the following actions:
1. Attack (once per turn).
2. Cure (once per turn).
3. Pass.

name: Magic Bus
description: Magic Bus: depicts the 1969 summer concert season, including Woodstock and 15 other not so famous Rock Festivals. Point to point movement takes you across the nation to collect concert tickets which are combined into genre sets for scoring. Magic Bus can be played as a strict strategy game or as a combined experience of trivia and strategy. For the trivia version, on the back of each ticket is a list of hit songs that one must correctly name one of to keep the ticket.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: KunstQuiz Kinder
description:
KunstQuiz Kinder is an exciting journey into the fascinating world of art. Get to know the most famous portraits of children and their painters! And test Your knowledge of art at home, after visiting the museum or just so in between! In this jam-packed art quiz box you will find: 24 world-renowned painter, 24 selected paintings, 72 detailed image sections, 72 exciting issues, 72 annotated answers and 100 cards with detailed information about the artists, their art, life and work.

Correct answers scores a points. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: KunstQuiz Blumen
description:
KunstQuiz Blumen is an exciting journey into the fascinating world of art. Get to know the most famous flower paintings and painters! And test Your knowledge of art at home, after visiting the museum or just so in between! In this jam-packed art quiz box you will find: 24 world-renowned painter, 24 selected paintings, 72 detailed image sections, 72 exciting issues, 72 annotated answers and 100 cards with detailed information about the artists, their art, life and work.

Correct answers scores a points. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: KunstQuiz Impressionismus
description:
KunstQuiz Impressionismus is an exciting journey into the fascinating world of art. Learn the great impressionists and their most important works to know! And test Your knowledge of art at home, after visiting the museum or just so in between! In this jam-packed art quiz box you will find: 24 world-renowned painter, 24 selected paintings, 72 detailed image sections, 72 exciting issues, 72 annotated answers and 100 cards with detailed information about the artists, their arts, life and work.

Correct answers scores a points. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: KunstQuiz Renaissance
description:
KunstQuiz Renaissance is an exciting journey into the fascinating world of art. Learn the great painters of the Renaissance and their most important works to know! And test Your knowledge of art at home, after visiting the museum or just so in between! In this jam-packed art quiz box you will find: 24 world-renowned painter, 24 selected paintings, 72 detailed image sections, 72 exciting issues, 72 annotated answers and 100 cards with detailed information about the artists, their arts, life and work.

Correct answers scores a points. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: KunstQuiz Monet
description:
KunstQuiz Monet is an exciting journey into the fascinating world of art. Learn about the most famous painting by Claude Monet (1840 - 1926) know! And test Your knowledge of art at home, after visiting the museum or just so in between! In this jam-packed art quiz box you will find: 100 cards with selected and world famous paintings, detailed framing, interesting questions on one side, answers on another side and detailed information about the artist, his art, his life and his work.

Correct answers scores a points. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Cogito
description:
Fun, crazy, educational game where players get to command the most epic philosophers through out history in combat of the mind

Cogito is a fast-paced debate game designed to combine elements of popular games such as Uno, Magic the Gathering, and classic party games. In the game, each player assembles a team of charismatic philosophers from across time and space for the ultimate philosophical showdown. In order to win, a player needs skill, foresight, cunning, and a little bit of luck. Each player puts together his team and battles for honor, glory, and control of the truth! Each Cogito card is designed to have different crazy, fun, and occasionally mean abilities while representing and reflecting actual people and subjects within philosophy. The game balances a charming trio of gags, competitiveness, and intellectual ability. Players will experience game-play that quickly switches between moments of serious deliberation about the meaning of life to sudden requests to employ funny accents, all in one game.

name: Triage: The Game For Health Care Professionals
description:
"The game TRIAGE has been developed as as both an educational and entertaining game specially designed for the emergency health care provider, yet playable even by the lay person" - Publisher, Horizon Games
A player rolls a die to determine his or her movement around the board. There are seven featured medical scenes on the board; as a player lands on one, they have the opportunity to "handle a call." This involves answering questions pertinent to the medical situation, and if successful, gaining points and certificates. There are two decks of cards triggered by game events that can effect players scores.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Scrabble Junior: Pinkalicious
description:
Scrabble Junior has now gone pink. This fun word and picture version of the famous crossword game shows off its Pinkalicious style.

Young players match the Pinkalicious pictured words with letter tiles. Older players form their own words on the reverse side of the board.

Players collect scoring chips and the person with the most chips wins the game!

Includes 2-sided board game, (101) cardboard letter tiles, (44) scoring chips, and beginner/advanced instructions

name: Influence: Rise of a Roman
description:
Influence is a a game set in ancient Rome, where each player competes to become the Emperor. This is done by passing laws to gain influence points with the four people classes: Military, Priests, Upper Class, and Lower Class. The game centres around bribing, bidding, and the use of action cards to further progress.

The game is played in rounds, with several phases in each round. Players move to different areas of the city of Rome to increase their influence in a particular class, trade, bribe, and interact with other players.

A round consists of the Draw Phase, where players may draw and play action cards; the Trade Phase, where players may trade and bribe each others support in coming phases; the Move phase, where players must move to an area of the city to increase their points in a particular class; and the Forum phase, where players bribe the current Emperor to pass the law that benefits them the most.

Influence is a social, reasonably paced game with no waits between turns, and a variable game length.

name: Kamen Rider: Operation Shocker
description:
Kamen Rider : Operation Shocker is a fan-made print & play adventure game based off the Japanese superhero show "Kamen Rider" since 1971. It's a team-based & cooperative game for one to five players. One player will play the evil organization "Shocker" who will lay different plots to conquer Japan. The other players will play as Kamen Riders who must stop the plots before it's too late.

In each turn, the Shocker player will recruit shocker troops, kaijin(monsters) and build secret base to lay evil plots. The Rider players must move to uncover the plot before it's completed. The game ends after 9 turns. The Shocker player wins if he can complete plots worth 6 or more victory points.

The Rider player each starts with a deck of 10 action cards. Each rider player draws 4-6 cards in each turn. He may play these cards to move on the map or fight monsters in cities but each action card cost a number of ki points. The deck also serves as the rider's hit point. Additional & more powerful cards will be added to the deck when a rider level-ups. Riders will gain XPs for KO troops & kaijins & will level-up when XPs reach certain points.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Il gioco dell'emozione
description:
Objective of the game is to create and put on air two advertising campaigns for famous brands.
Each player represents an advertising agency that should develop the advertising campaigns. Each campaign is made by several elements, that should be collected by moving on the board with a dice roll. The elements are: the testimonial of the campaigns, the media that will publish the advertising, various agency figures needed to develop the advertising (varying according to the brief).
The board represents a skyline of a modern city. The game start in the month of September and ends in August.
The winner is the player that first presents two successful advertising campaigns.

The game has been produced and distributed by the Gruppo Essevi agency, as a gift for its customers for Christmas 1990.

name: Mini Dungeon Adventures: Beast Master
description: You can now play MDA with a fifth hero class, the Beastmaster. Beastmasters are aided by their animal companions, the swift falcon, the nimble ferrets, the deadly wolf and the mighty bear.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Dimension Six
description:
A unique strategy game for two to four players. The objective is to get two of your hexagons from your corner into each of the opponents’ corner. The hexagons are moved by playing one of 13 cards you are dealt. The trick is to choose which card to use at the right time. The one who does will win. by cards with 13 cards dealt to each player. Players decide which card to use each turn. Every player has a chance of winning the game right up until the end.

It’ll make you think!

name: A Weekend in New York
description:
The game board shows a map of New York. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Additionally, taxis, buses and the tube can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Questions come in two difficulty levels, as the game is designed for language learning. So the difficulty does not refer to the knowledge needed to answer the question, but to the English speaking ability.

name: Travalgo expansion
description: With this expansion you can play Travalgo with 5 or 6 players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval

name: Fire Fighters
description:
Each player chooses a fire station and helmet of the same color.
Alarm Cards are turned face down and placed on the table. Fireman #1 picks an alarm card and says "fire is at ------- (name shown on the card)

Fireman #2 spins the spinner and moves his helmet the number of spaces shown on the spinner.

The fireman who first reaches the fire removes the card putting out the fire.

All firemen then return to their station and play continues with each player reporting a fire. The game ends when any player puts out 3 fires.

name: WPA
description:
WPA: Work Progress Action invites players to participate in relief projects like those that were operating in America during the Great Depression.
Monopoly style game: roll and move around the game board, draw a card, try to collect the most money and win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War – Claws of Chaos
description:
Claws of Chaos is the first expansion for the Fleets at War! tactical starship combat game. It is played on the floor or a large table with cardboard counters representing capital ships, fighters, and other space craft. Simplified game mechanics let players engage in small skirmishes all the way up to large-scale battles involving dozens of ships.

Features:

--New Factions: the K'thonians and the Talions
--New ships: battlecruisers, drone carriers (and drones), torpedo boats and torpedo bombers
--New weapons: particle guns, plasma bolt cannons, mines, torpedoes and anti-matter missiles.
--Full-color ship counters + additional counters for fighters & missiles
--Stat Cards (one for each ship class)
--Seven new scenarios

Note: You will need to have the Fleets at War! rulebook to use this expansion.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Archie Comic Game
description: The object of this card game is to get Archie's pals and gals off the moving maze. Each player chooses two character cards which are put in folded cardboard bases and moved along other cards representing the high school.

name: Bushland Friends
description: Bushland Friends is a game for young children which has some similarity to Candy Land. On each turn a player spins a spinner with different Australian animals on it, then moves to the next space depicting that animal. When landing on a wombat, a player spins again and may move forward or backward depending on what is spun. Players can also bump each other off of spaces.

name: Tsunami sur le Goban
description:
[Eng] Inspired from Knightmare Chess, a french group of Go game created "Tsunami sur le Goban" which plays on a 13x13 board.

It's a card game for two players : During a classic Go game, players can use cards to change some rules, stones placement...









[French] Inspiré par Tempête sur l'échiquier, le Groupe Auvergnat de Go a imaginé "Tsunami sur le Goban" se jouant sur 13x13.

On joue sur 13x13 avec un jeu de carte qui sert de pioche pour les deux joueurs.

Durant la partie, les joueurs peuvent changer les règles du jeu, modifier le placement des pierres...

name: Shiploque
description:
User Description

Shiploque is a rules supplement for the miniatures game Flintloque Reloaded for adding ships and boats to the game.

The rules have profiles on five ships and rules on movement, crew actions. bording, artillery and collisions.

The rules work best when using one to three ships on a average size table.

Published in Ragnarok, issue 54 and on the Chimerae Hobby Group web page.

name: Wau Wau
description:
The letter-cards are mixed and dealt 5 cards for each player, the top card of the remaining stack is revealed.
The objective is to get rid of cards.
In turn player can either use his cards to form a word or place the letters on the top cards that they continue the word.
If player can't form a word he draws a new card.
Words score points - the longer words more points - and player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Giga Quiz: Mega-cities
description:
With over 250 questions and answers about big cities, additional Joker and booster cards that affect the course of the game, provide games and guessing fun with the Giga-effect.

There are questions one side and 4 variants another side of the card. Draw a card, ask a question and read the variants. Who bet the correct answer scores a point.

Winner is the one with the most points after the deck is exhausted.

name: Giga Quiz: Erfindungen
description:
With over 250 questions and answers about inventions, additional Joker and booster cards that affect the course of the game, provide games and guessing fun with the Giga-effect.

There are questions one side and 4 variants another side of the card. Draw a card, ask a question and read the variants. Who bet the correct answer scores a point.

Winner is the one with the most points after the deck is exhausted.

name: Giga Quiz: Pferde
description:
With over 250 questions and answers about horses, additional Joker and booster cards that affect the course of the game, provide games and guessing fun with the Giga-effect.

There are questions one side and 4 variants another side of the card. Draw a card, ask a question and read the variants. Who bet the correct answer scores a point.

Winner is the one with the most points after the deck is exhausted.

name: Kewpie Doll Game
description:
Simple move game for young players. (4-8)
Don't let the little mermaid die of sadness. She is stuck at low tide. Help her find her way through the castle to safety. From Alvin's Vintage Boardgames.

name: Whiskey Gulch
description:
In Whiskey Gulch, players compete with each other to accumulate resources and money in the post-Civil War American West. Each player controls a family that is attempting to increase their holdings through worker placement, politics, and violence. Players interact with each other and the harsh environment of the West in an attempt to become the most powerful family in the town of Whiskey Gulch.

Each turn begins with an Event Card that affects all players. Players then select two action cards and place their workers on their holdings. Then each player reveals an Environment Card that affects them specifically. Actions are then carried out and combat is resolved. To end the turn players gather resources from their property.

Whiskey Gulch has 3 ages that each last 8 turns. Scoring is based on a combination of money, resources, political offices held, and buildings constructed at game end. There are many paths to victory, but only one winner.

Whiskey Gulch is in post production. Release in Q2 2013
categories: American West, City Building, Civilization, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Biathlon: Eine Leidenschaft – Ein Ziel
description:
A biathlon-themed roll-and-move trivia game with a dexterity component.

Aim of the game: Be the first to complete the course on the board three times.

How it is played:
Players take turns rolling the two dice. If their pawn is on a ascending slope space at the beginning of their turn, they roll only one die. They move their pawn according to the die roll.
If it lands on a grey space, nothing happens. If it lands on a green space, an action card is drawn and the action performed (move pawn backwards/forwards a certain number of spaces, lose a turn etc.).
If it lands on a yellow space, a question card is drawn and the active player has to answer a biathlon-related question. If they succeed, their pawn advances five spaces. If they fail, they go back five spaces.
If the pawn lands on a blue space, they have to go back to start.
If a player rolls the same number on both dice, they gain a fan token, which grants them extra movement in round three.
Since the game is about biathlon, there is also a shooting exercise that takes place after rounds one and two: Players have to hit a target with a wooden marble, using a wooden catapult. Generally, each player has five shots per round to hit the five targets, but shooting cards may allow them to reload. Each missed target means extra spaces to complete in a penalty round.

name: Galactic Merchants
description:
Explore the galaxy! Avoid Space Pirates! Move through Worm Holes! Watch out for Asteroids! Oh, and while you're at it, trade for resources and deliver them to the planets that need them.

Each Player is an independent space merchant captain jetting around the galaxy trying to collect resources to fill orders. There are 6 planets that need different resources, but each planet only sells one resource. Fill orders to make money and earn victory points. Once an order is filled, the planet has a new order. Earn additional victory points by exploring the board, but beware! The Galaxy is full of asteroids, worm holes and pirates that can will stand in your way.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins!

The hex board is set up randomly for each game, so exploring the board is part of the fun! No two games will play quite the same. Who is the best space explorer and merchant captain?

name: Pixel Quest
description:
Pixel Quest its a cooperative card game for 1 to 4 players, based on classic 8-bit RPGs. In this adventure game you will play as a party of heroes, travelling around to complete different quests. You’ll get an objective card at the start of the game: once the quests in it are complete, you’ll fight the final Boss. If you defeat him you’ll have won the game.

For each quest, you need to build a deck so your group of heroes can explore it. During these adventures the heroes will fight dangerous monsters, avoid deadly traps and find priceless treasures. But there is more than adventure in a hero’s life – they’ll also get rest at inns, drink at taverns and buy objects that will help them in future quests.

The greatest 8-bit RPG of all times, and you will not be playing it on a video game console, but on a table. Do you dare?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: 30 Secondes pour répondre
description:
In his turn player has 30 seconds to answer questions in various topics. With each correct answer player advances 1 step on the track with his pawn.
Player who finishes first is the winner.

name: Labyrinthe en damiers
description:
The objective is to reach opponent side of the game board diagonally first by playing maze-tiles and moving his pawn.
In turn, player rolls the dice.
If player rolls even numbers 2,4,6: He may advances his pawn two squares and can place or rotate a tile.
If player rolls odd numbers 1,3,5: He may place a tile and turn a tile.

name: Sidéral
description:
Both player has equal number of Satellites on the game board.
In his turn player rolls the dice and moves his rocket on the game board. If he landed on opponent´s Satellite he takes it over and turns around his color face-up.
Player who owns all the satellites wins the game.

name: Polimi Timeline
description: Based on the same game concept used in London: The Board Game, Polimi Timeline is dedicated to celebrating the 150th anniversary of the Politecnico di Milano (a.k.a. "Polimi"), one of the most prestigious Italian universities. Moving on a map representing the most important locations built or renovated by the architects who graduated at the Polimi, the players collect cards than can then be played to advance on the Timeline, discovering the history of the University. The first player to complete the path on the Timeline wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Ziegenbock
description:
Objective: Be the first moving all your meeples into opposite corner (Halma variant for two on a small board)
- moving by turns -
Playing equipment consists of a checkered board, divided into 7 x 7 squares. Pieces are typically red and blue; in two opposite corners of the board there are thirteen squares - starting area.
Move your meeples according to the rules of Halma.
Remarks:
Published in the 1950's

name: Quizz'N Cook Spécial Chocolat
description:
200 additional questions for Quizz'N Cook about chocolates.

This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.

name: Quizz'N Cook Spécial Vin
description:
200 additional questions for Quizz'N Cook about wines.

This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.

name: Der will nur spielen! Das Familienspiel
description:
In Der will nur Spielen! Das Familienspiel, players compete in a wide variety of categories, each testing their animal knowledge or reflexes in varied ways. Who has a good reaction time when retrieving something? Who can remember the most signals? Who can dig out a bone hidden in a bed of roses? Who knows the favorite breeds of the other players? And who can show off her knowledge of dog breeds by answering questions?

For all of these activities and more, players are rewarded with bones when they do well, and whoever first collects twenty bones in her basket wins!

name: Popular Characters from Dickens
description:
Not to be confused with "Characters from Charles Dickens," this is a card game from circa 1889. There are 37 cards in six sets of six, plus one Dickens card. Each set consists of a book card (Pickwick Papers, Oliver Twist, Nicholas Nickleby, Old Curiosity Shop, Barnaby Rudge, and David Copperfield) and 5 character cards.
Players ask each other for needed cards to complete a set, with the Dickens card doubling the value.

Milton Bradley also produced a facsimile edition in 1970.

name: Quizfächer Mein kleiner Brockhaus Die Tiere
description:
A quiz in the form of a fan, on the subject of general knowledge - 'primary school level' -, questions and answers about animals sequenced by different biospheres: garden, forest, farm, savanna, jungle, ocean. The cards are held by a screw and can be ideally taken on travels, the answers are always on the next page. The quiz can be played alone or by several players.
- 54 pages; 53 different animals -
- acting simultaneously/by turns -
active player reads aloud a question with 3 given answers (multiple choice, solutions at the following page); all players guess correct answer(s) & collecting points. Typically there are more questions (~3) on one page.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Travel, Trivia

name: Verkehrszeichenspiel
description:
Objective: be the first surrounding the map - learn traffic signs

- moving by turns -
Roll the die & move your meeple clockwise around the map; if your move ends on a traffic sign follow instructions printed inside the lid. You may take another route across the map, but you may turn left only entering a junction.

remarks;
at least 5 different editions, very first before WWII

name: Tegulis Romanis
description:
In Tegulis Romanis, players play as the influential families who built Rome from the ground up, working to build Rome into a glorious metropolis.

During the game, the players will lay tiles onto the random boards which make up the landscape on which Rome was built. Each tile shows a building, which will belong to the player when played on the board but is not considered "built" until it has its required resources. Resources are on the back-side of the buildings (the players must decide which buildings to not play so they can place resources), but resources on the board have no "owner" so they can be used by buildings belonging to any player. Once a building has its resources it is now "built" and gains the owner points or special abilities (the player may now build in the mountains, the player draws extra tiles, etc.).

The players each have the same starting pile of tiles, with another set of "advanced tiles" available to any player, most of which actually require other buildings as "resources" themselves.

name: Schweizer Reise
description:
Object of the game:
Be the first arriving at target field

Simple 'Roll and Move' game, learning the cities & places of interest of Switzerland.
Equipped with four plastic meeples, die and playing board.
Follow instructions (lid inside) if move ends on a marked field.

name: Reise durch 5 Erdteile
description:
Objective:
be the first finishing your round trip
- moving by turns -
Each player chooses her/his own (coloured) route:
simple 'roll & move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on lid inside.

remarks:
published during 1950's - plastic (painted) meeples:
republished 1960's as 'Reise durch die Welt' - but rules and board stayed unchanged (old title); facts (like inhabitants...) are related to the 50's.

name: Bayernreise
description:
Object of the game:
Be the first arriving at target space (Munich)

Simple 'Roll and Move' game, learning the cities & places of interest of Bavaria.
Equipped with large painted plastic pawns, die and playing board.
meeples: traditional 'rambling club' dress

name: NAVALUM Naval Strategy
description:
NAVALUM is a boardgame of naval strategy. The game emulates the situation in the world during the era of sailing boats before the construction of the Suez Canal.

Depending on the number of players, each one of them has at their disposal a number of resources to place in their geographic regions and boats. Each player must decide their strategy to follow during the game in order to achieve the score fixed for the victory.

Both the conquest of empty geographic regions and the forecast of the movements of your opponents are crucial to keep ongoing your choices to win the game. Most of the resources to run the game are normally shipped in your boats, sometimes you'll need more load capacity in your army to assure a final alpha strike attack and others just quick boats to colonize or steal your opponent's assets.

All these matters have been taken into account to provide you a real laboratory of the world’s geostrategy at the 17th and 18th centuries.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Voyages Extraordinaire
description:
When it was discovered that Jules Verne was not a science fiction writer but an inventor and time traveler who was actually recording his exploits, the Gears-N-Geeks crowd jumped at the opportunity to recover his artifacts.

By collecting various power sources and putting them to use with Tesla cubes the GNG's will attempt to be the first to collect the artifacts from Verne's greatest adventures, his Voyages Extraordinaire.

Through a system of dice collecting they will amass power and by rolling they will fit their power sources to discover the hidden locations of the artifacts. It is an unstable game the GNG's are playing and dice will be stolen, traded and discarded all in an attempt to be the one who makes each discovery. The GNG's can only spread their resources so far and must balance gaining their own advantage with preventing their opponents from taking the prize.
These artifacts have great power and value, once attained that power can be put to use for future collection attempts.

In the end it comes down to being the GNG with the most value in your collection of artifacts thus proving you are the greatest Vernian since the man himself.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement
publishers: IcePack Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Willi und die Wunder dieser Welt
description:
A game themed on the German movie of the same title. Willi, a reporter, is traveling around the world and takes the players with him to tell them about the wonders of the world.

Aim of the game: All players try to reach the wonders depicted on their cards with the balloons on the game board. Whoever is first to reach five of his/her wonders and takes a picture of them wins the game.

Setup: Each of the five balloon pieces is put on the corresponding starting point of the board. Each player gets three Willi chips, three compasses and three pips to go with the compasses. The cards are shuffled and each player gets a hand of five cards. Players only see their own cards. The remaining cards form the draw deck.

Gameplay: The game is played in several rounds, and each round consists of several legs: rolling the colour die to select a balloon for the round (all players move the same balloon during a round), discarding a card and drawing a new one (optional), choosing directions by marking them with the pip on their compasses, and moving the balloons on the board according to the directions on the compasses. If the balloon lands on a space that shows a wonder that is depicted on a player's card, he/she "takes a picture" (says "Click!" and reads the information about the wonder from his/her card) and draws a new card.

Balloon movement in more detail: Balloon movement is done in three stages per round. First, the start player chooses one of his/her three compasses, then the next player etc. until all players have resolved all their three compasses. A player may choose not to move the balloon if they don't want to use a particular direction on one of their compasses, but they may not use that compass again in the same round.
Spaces occupied by another balloon or a Willi chip (put on a space that the balloon leaves) are skipped. If a balloon reaches the edge of the board in north or south direction, no further movement in that direction is possible; the eastern and western edges of the map allow crossing over to the other side.

name: Roadkill Rumble
description:
It's Vehicles vs. Varmints in this whacky(!) card game where you try to flatten that fauna! Two players pit critters against cars to see who can accumulate the most roadkills. But watch out! You also have to avoid other hazards on the road while you attempt to hurdle that turtle! Big cars are tough to crash while little animals are fast enough to avoid the dangers of a busy highway. The first player to get 100 points of roadkill wins the game!

Gameplay: After drawing a hand of 3 Hazards, each player flips a Critter/Vehicle, the faster of the two getting to play and resolve the first Hazard, followed by the second. If both are still alive then they rumble, with the larger of the two winning the trick and scoring. This continues until one player has scored 100 points worth of roadkill.

name: Round the World
description:
A Goose-type game, published in a book called More Games, Puzzles and Pastimes, published by Odhams Press in 1959.

The rules:
This game is for two players, each with a differently coloured counter or button. Each player throws the dice in turn, starting on the arrow from London, and moving forward the number of spaces thrown on the dice. If you alight on a green space you move forward as indicated, on a red space you pay the penalty shown. The first to reach HOME wins, but you must throw the exact number. The method of transport changes along the route, as seen at the side of the track.

name: 1,2,3, vorbei
description:
Objective: collect most point verifying predictions
- acting by turn -

cards are shuffeld and placed upside down at different places.
cards may be shown shortly - active player may ask a combined question (how many animals/place).
Next player may have a guess - if correct, you win points - if wrong you loose points - answers may be challenged by other players.

content:
24 cards (6x 4 images),3 places
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Memory Flip Flop Fred
description:
Put your memory to the test and join in Fred the Clown's games. Throw his two-colour parts and look for the resulting combination in the cards. Have you got it?

Fred has 2 hands, 2 shoes, 1 body (in two colours) and 1 head (sad or smiley). The 36 cards feature multiple position and colour combinations, one shaker cup for throwing the pieces and forming different combinations and instructions on different ways to play the game. Attention and memory! (Description from publisher.)

name: Roundup
description:
From the back of the box: "On a turn, a player spins the spinner and moves his or her playing piece the number of spaces indicated. If the space has a horse on it the player must answer a question chosen by the opposing player. If the player answers the question correctly he or she claims the horse shown on the space. The player's turn is over after landing on a space with a horse on it whether or not he or she answered the question correctly. If a player lands on a space with a horse on it and the opposing player has already claimed the horse shown, the player can take that horse away by answering the question correctly.

The first player to collect 7 horses wins the game."

name: Red Indian Shooting Game
description: Target game using a spring loaded 'gun'. The targets are a wooden Red Indian and his horse. Players must agree the diatance away that them may shoot from and how many successful hits will win the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Children's Game

name: Die Pinguine aus Madagascar Operation Popcorn
description:
Objective: collect as many popcorn croutons as possible
- action/moving by turns -
Throw the die, move your penguin (selectable direction) and take popcorn from that space - if availabe. Collected croutons are not 'safe' - you must place them at your home base (corral) if they should count at the end.
During your turn you may choose one of these actions:
1 'change of direction': you may change directio during your move
2 'extra power': double your move
3 'flying lesson': change position with another player
4 'appease hunger': take all croutons during your move
Be careful: After last popcorn is taken game ends immediately
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Think smarter! Kreativitätstechniken
description:
"Creative techniques"

"Lateral Thinking"

75 playful and practical exercises to discover, improve and optimize. Who solve them fastest scores points.

Winner is the player with the most points.

Contents:

75 cards,
1 hourglass,
1 notebook

name: Think smarter! Zeitmanagement
description:
"Time management"

75 playful exercises show you how to maximize your time without having to be a slave to your schedule.
Learn step by step what you need time, where time-thieves rob you precious time and how to deal responsibly with your time.

Who solve the exercises fastest scores points.

Winner is the player with the most points.

Contents:

75 cards,
1 hourglass,
1 notebook

name: Backgammon: Zombie Rush
description:
A zombie themed expansion for Backgammon that gives the game a hectic feel and lends it some unpredictability due to there being an AI element present.

For people familiar with backgammon the game is really easy to get into due to the many similarities in the base rule set. The big difference comes when a checker is captured. Instead of just returning where they came from, they turn into zombies, roaming the board controlled by a set of rules out of the players control.

Save your survivors before they get turned against you by bringing them all into your safe house. But be careful, as long as there are survivors left outside no one is safe.

When both players have all their survivors (or what's left of them), the player with the most survivors win.

name: Leben im Wald
description:
"Life in the Forest"

The nature quiz for children with 32 color printed cards held together by a hinge.

Whether the answer is correct player scores a point.
At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

description:

The nature quiz for children with 32 color printed cards held together by a hinge.

Whether the answer is correct player scores a point.

name: Der grosse Porsche Fahrer Experten-Test
description:
"The big Porsche expert test"

A total of 50 different difficult questions test the Porsche knowledge and provide detailed responses from all areas of the company, model and technology. Answers are backside of the card.

Draw a card. Other players answer the question. Who is fastest and answer correctly gets the card as a point.

Winner is the player with the most points.

name: Das grosse Ferrari World Experten-Quiz
description:
"The big Ferrari expert test"

Total of 100 different difficult questions about the company Ferrari, the legendary sports car and the extensive sporting history excite and challenge all sports car lovers. Answers are backside of the card.

Draw a card. Other players answer the question. Who is fastest and answer correctly gets the card as a point.

Winner is the player with the most points.

name: Der grosse Traktor Experten-Test
description:
"The big Tractor expert test"

Total of 100 different difficult issues all friends agricultural vehicles. Answers are backside of the card.

Draw a card. Other players answer the question. Who is fastest and answer correctly gets the card as a point.

Winner is the player with the most points.

name: Der grosse Formel 1 Experten-Test
description:
"The big Formel 1 expert test"

The new expert test validates the knowledge of all Fomel 1-fans. A total of 100 different difficult questions about the premier class irritate and challenge themselves knowledgeable racing action. Answers are backside of the card.

Draw a card. Other players answer the question. Who is fastest and answer correctly gets the card as a point.

Winner is the player with the most points.

name: Der grosse Feuerwehr Experten-Test
description:
"The big fire expert test"

The new expert test validates the knowledge of all fire-Friends: A total of 100 different provoke difficult questions about fighting, tooling and special vehicles and call themselves recognized experts on the scene. Answers are backside of the card.

Draw a card. Other players answer the question. Who is fastest and answer correctly gets the card as a point.

Winner is the player with the most points.

name: Das Weihnachts-Quiz
description:
"The Christmas quiz"

150 exciting questions and answers you get a little closer to the enlightenment, so you can shine from christmas to christmas.

Draw a card and ask a questions. Who answer correctly scores a point.

name: HitStory Platinium
description:
Play DVD and guess what singing among 300 hits of the 50's to 2000! The objective is to recognize as many songs as possible.
From the beginning of the game, insert the DVD in your drive and choose the period, the level of play, and run the quiz!
Each tube is recorded in full in different versions (Instrumental, acapella etc.)

Trivia game about knowing music and musical artists. Players have six different categories, like like music history, music hits and so on.
Game comes with a DVD, which helps with audio questions and also pictures, keeps score as well.
Player goal is to collect 3 cards from each six categories.
At the beginning of each turn, players roll the die and choose according question from the card. It is either a question or something from the DVD that card tells.

Be the first player to get 3 tiles from each category to win.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: HitStory 2000
description:
Music from year 1998-2003.

Trivia game about knowing music and musical artists. Players have six different categories, like like music history, music hits and so on.
Game comes with a DVD, which helps with audio questions and also pictures, keeps score as well.
Player goal is to collect 3 cards from each six categories.
At the beginning of each turn, players roll the die and choose according question from the card. It is either a question or something from the DVD that card tells.
Categories are:
CD: 1998 and 1999;
DVD: 2000 and 2001;
MP3: 2002 and 2003.

Be the first player to get 3 tiles from each category to win.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: HitStory Années 80
description:
Music from the 80´s

Trivia game about knowing music and musical artists. Players have six different categories, like like music history, music hits and so on.
Game comes with a DVD, which helps with audio questions and also pictures, keeps score as well.
Player goal is to collect 3 cards from each six categories.
At the beginning of each turn, players roll the die and choose according question from the card. It is either a question or something from the DVD that card tells.

Be the first player to get 3 tiles from each category to win.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Balletjes in de soep
description:
'Balletjes in de soep' is a playful introduction to preliminary count.

Each player takes a 'soup bowl'-card and tries to correct some soup balls on his soup bowl to collect. Preschoolers from 3 to 5 years are as playfully introduced with the numbers from 1 to 5 and the corresponding numerical images. Moreover, they also learn to play together and wait their turn ... an introduction to a real board game.

In the game balls in the soup are all targets / goals for numbers of knowledge in young children are discussed. The box contains various game modes, both for the youngest to the other children.

name: Het Grote Boodschappenspel
description:
Go shopping with Lassa, Rabbit, Dog or Cat and practice playfully all important development skills. Collect the messages in six different stores. You will learn which messages belong to the shops, you will learn colors and shapes combine, count and even a little arithmetic.
The Great Shopping Game is a challenge for toddlers. This is due to the self assembled board, there always different looks and different game variations.

The game is different every time! The game grows with the development of your child. The younger children may independently as lotto games to play and learn what you get at the bakery, the greeting shop, butcher, .... For children from four years there is the exciting and challenging board game with three game modes:

Variation 1: Pull out each store any message.
Variation 2: Pull out any store the message on your list is.
Variation 3: Pull out the cheapest store any message.

name: Englisch-Quiz
description:
A trivia game aimed mainly at foreign learners of English.

The 110 cards contain questions about the English language and about England, the US and Australia (arts, politics, geography,...). There are six questions per card, and all questions are written in English.

The cards are shuffled. A card is drawn and the active player rolls a six-sided die to select which of the six questions from the card he/she has to answer. The player next to the active player reads the question and the three suggested answers. If the active player answers correctly, he/she earns a number of chips corresponding to how difficult the question is. (Questions are marked with 1-3 little squares; one square signifies an easy question that earns you one chip, three is for a difficult question.)

The game ends when a player has collected 13 chips. He/she wins the game.

name: Winter-Champion
description:
A simple roll-and-move game to promote tyre manufacturer Pirelli.

The board shows a race course in a winter landscape. Some spaces are marked with a tyre. These are special event fields that make the players move their pawns forwards or backwards.

Each player gets a pawn (cardboard token showing the Pirelli mascot). Players take turns rolling a six-sided die. If you roll a six, you get to put your pawn on the start space. Afterwards, you move your pawn according to your die roll. If you roll a six, you get an additional turn. If you land on an event field, you follow the instructions for that field. If your roll would mean you'd land on a space that is already occupied, you stop on the space behind that space. The game ends when a player reaches the finish space. He/she has to roll the exact number (rolling a five when you're three spaces away from finish won't help you).

name: Winx Club: Miss Magix
description:
Theme: The Winx are having a fashion show to trade their favourite outfits. But some of them will be so popular that only a die duel can decide who gets to wear them!

Components: The game consists of 24 catwalk cards, 12 Miss Magix cards and a die (apply stickers before first game).

Summary and aim of the game: Each round, players try to win as many catwalk cards as possible by using one of their Miss Magix cards. If more than one player wants the same catwalk cards, there is a die duel. The player who owns the most catwalk cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Gameplay: The 24 catwalk cards are shuffled and put in a face-down stack. Each player gets one Miss Magix card per colour (orange, pink, turquoise).
The game is played in several rounds.
At the start of a round, four catwalk cards are placed next to each other, face up. If cards are left over from the previous round, fill up to a total of four.
Then, each player chooses one of their three Miss Magix cards and puts it down, face down. The colour of the Miss Magix card shows which catwalk card(s) you want to gain this round (i.e. if you put down an orange Miss Magix card, you are going for the orange catwalk card(s)).
Players then turn over their Miss Magix cards simultaneously. If you are the only one to have chosen a particular colour, you immediately win that card. Players who were going for the same colour compete in a die duel.
The die duel: All players taking part in a duel. Players take turns rolling the die. A star symbol means that the player stays in the duel, the Winx logo means the player is out of the duel, and a player who rolls the heart symbol isn't just out of the duel but can't use his/her currently used Miss Magix card in the next round (i.e. he/she only has two cards to choose from during that round). A duel ends when all participating players have rolled at least once per die rolling round and there is either only one player left (then he/she gets to take the catwalk cards the duel was about) or all duel participants are out (then neither of them gets to take the cards, they stay out for the next round).
The game ends when the stack with the catwalk cards has been used up. The player with the most cards wins the game.

name: Winx Club: Das magische Turnier
description:
A Winx Club themed memory game.

The game contains 12 task cards and 48 tournament cards.

The task cards show which three Winx characters the player has to find. The tournament cards also show these characters.

The task cards are shuffled and distributed evenly among all players (face down). The 48 tournament cards are shuffled and laid out, also face down.
Then each player turns over one of his/her task cards. It stays in front of them, face up. The task card shows them which characters he/she has to find.
Players take turns turning over three tournament cards. The aim is to turn over the three characters from one's own task cards in the same turn.
If a tournament card shows the evil Trix, the active player's turn ends immediately. If a tournament card shows the Enchantix logo and all three Winx, the player gets to put the card in front of him/herself. It can later be exchanged for an additional card-turning activity (i.e. a player gets to turn over more than three cards in a turn).
If a player solves one of their tasks, the three tournament cards and the task cards are removed from the game and the player turns over one of their other task cards.
At the end of a player's turn, all remaining open tournament cards are turned over again so that all cards are face-down.

The player who is first to complete all their tasks wins the game.

name: Linkervoet/Rechtervoet
description:
The centipede is looking for shoes. Find the correct left and right shoe together and go in search of the golden shoe!
Who pulls the golden shoe is the winner!

This game has three difficulty levels:
- a simple "look the same" game for the little ones
- a game of "collect pairs" for children aged 4 and 5 years
- Left and right recognize and name for children 5-7 years

The game Left Foot/Right Foot exercises:
- the observation-oriented
- recognizing same images in mirror
- the identification and naming of the concepts of left and right.

name: Winx Club: Die gestohlenen Kristalle
description:
A Winx Club themed die-rolling game for children.

The evil Trix (witches Darcy, Icy and Stormy) have stolen wonderful crystals from the fairy boarding school Alfea. Lead the Winx in a magic die battle to defeat the Trix and get the crystals back!

Setup: A course is laid out with the 24 Winx tiles. Tiles with the same value (1-6) must not be placed next to each other. The 12 Trix cards are sorted into three stacks by value (4, 5 or 6). Each of the three stacks is shuffled and placed face down. The top card is then turned face-up.

Gameplay: Players take turns. The active player rolls the die and puts a crystal on the first card with the number corresponding to the die roll. He/she can either stop then or continue.
If you stop, you count the crystals that are laid out. If there are 4-6 crystals, you get to take the top Trix card from the corresponding stack. If there are fewer than four crystals, you get to take one of the Winx tiles that you have put a crystal on.
If you continue, you roll again and put a crystal on the next Winx card with the number corresponding to the die roll (counted from the last crystal, not from the start of the game). If you cannot lay out more crystals (because the result of your die roll isn't shown on any further tiles of the course), you've taken too big a risk and have to remove all the crystals from the course. Your turn ends and you don't get to take a Trix card.
Collected Winx tiles can be used to steal another player's Trix cards if you have collected Winx tiles in all the colours that are shown on the Trix card. The Winx tiles that were used to steal another player's Trix card are put at the beginning of the course.

A player who has collected each of the three Trix wins the game.

name: HitStory Quiz
description:
Play DVD and guess what singing among 300 hits of the 50's to 2000! The objective is to recognize as many songs as possible.
From the beginning of the game, insert the DVD in your drive and choose the period, the level of play, and run the quiz!
Each tube is recorded in full in different versions (Instrumental, acapella etc.)

Trivia game about knowing music and musical artists. Players have six different categories, like like music history, music hits and so on.
Game comes with a DVD, which helps with audio questions and also pictures, keeps score as well.
Player goal is to collect 3 cards from each six categories.
At the beginning of each turn, players roll the die and choose according question from the card. It is either a question or something from the DVD that card tells.

Categories:
- 100 songs for years 1950-1969
- 100 songs for years 1070-1989
- 100 songs from 1990 to today

Be the first player to get 3 tiles from each category to win.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Schluss mit 0-8-15
description:
A collection of four individual games, playable with the same materials:

- Die Expertenkommission:
Each player has a card with 0, one with 8 and one with 15 laid out in front of him/her. One player starts and rolls a die (numbered 2-7) and announces the result. The next player rolls the die and adds to or subtracts from the result (never going below 0 or above 15, so there is not always a choice). When a player reaches 0, 8 or 15, s/he can flip over the respective card. When a player calls a number of a card s/he already flipped over before, another player can say "thank you" and pick up a chip. A chip can be used to add or substract an additional point. The first player to flip over all three cards is the winner.

- Der Budgetausschuss:
Same as above, but any player can shout out the result. First player to shout 0, 8 or 15 and covers an additional card with his/her hand gets to turn the respective card over.
A player who announces a 5 or 10 must flip a card back.

- An der Börse:
Same as Expertenkommission, but the number at the bottom of the die counts. First player to shout the correct new number and covers a special "A" chip, continues the game.

- Der große Wurf:
This is a cooperative game with a time limit (the rules suggest 15 minutes). The (numbered) cards are randomly laid out, some with the colored side up, some with the black/white side up. As above, players roll the die and add or substract numbers. When 0, 8 or 15 are reached, the active player can change the position of one corresponding card with another one. If the number is reached by using the number at the bottom of the die, the players may flip over two grey cards which are already in the correct position.
A roll of 2 that cannot be used gives the players a lobby handicap (flipping over a colored card). A second handicap leads to flipping over two cards, etc. When four lobby chips are collected, the game is lost. With an unused 7, the players can collect ecology chips with which they can counter the lobby chips.

The game was published in Austria and tries to show finding unusual solutions. It was supported by the Austrian government.

name: Winx Club: Der Kampf um Alfea
description:
A (semi-)cooperative, Winx Club themed racing game.

The evil Trix witches are planning to attack the fairy boarding school Alfea to steal magic. But the Winx are on their way, trying to reach Alfea to defend it. Will you and the Winx be able to reach Alfea first and win the most magic chips?

Aim of the game: Each turn, players try to move their pawn as far as possible on the course to Alfea. The sooner they reach Alfea, the more magic chips they win. After three rounds, if they have collected more magic chips than the Trix, they all win together and the player with the most magic chips is awarded for being the most courageous fairy.

Setup: The 23 path tiles are laid out to create the course to Alfea. The Trix pawn is placed on the "red fountain" space. 3 magic chips are put on the Alfea space. Each player chooses a Winx pawn and puts it on the starting space. The 48 flight chips are shuffled and placed at the center of the table. Each player draws three flight chips and puts them down in front of him/herself, face down.

Gameplay: The game is played in three rounds. Each round consists of several phases.
First, each player choose one of their flight chips and puts them in their hand so that the other players can't see what colour it is.
Next, players simultaneously reveal their chosen flight chip.
All players that are the only one to have chosen a particular colour move forwards to the next tile of that colour. The starting place and the "red fountain" space are the only spaces that can take more than one pawn, otherwise occupied spaces are jumped over.
Players who have chosen the same colour are banned for this round, they stay were they are.
Used flight chips are removed from the game. When all flight chips have been resolved, each player draws a new chip so that they have three chips again.
Lastly, at the end of each turn the trix pawn is moved one space towards Alfea.

A round can end in one of two ways:
First, two player pawns have reached the Alfea finish space. The first player to reach Alfea receives two magic chips, the second one chip.
Second, the Trix pawn reaches Alfea. The round ends immediately. All chips remaining on the Alfea space go to the Trix.

Then, the second round starts in the same way as the first. After three rounds, the chips won by the players and by the Trix are counted. If all players together have more chips than the Winx, they win the game together and the player with the most chips is considered the most courageous fairy. If the Trix have more magic chips, the players lose together.

name: Euro Family
description:
Aim of the game is to be the first to give a gift to each family member without debt.

Playing the game
Gift cards are separated from the pack and managed, as well as money by the players. Other cards are shuffled. Each player receives 6 and chooses a player board.
In his turn player draws a card and discards one against the money or buy a gift with the money accumulated previously.

End of the game
The game ends when first player has purchased all her gifts and paid all incidental expenses. She is the winner.

name: Rekenpoker
description:
75 cards show in the middle a target number from 1 to 100. Around each target number are always four digits.

In the game you lay one card face up in the middle of the table. Who is the first player to succeed to the target number to be calculated with the aid of the four smaller numbers, receives the card.

Who can collect the most cards wins the game.

name: Graf Zeppelin's Weltreise
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target space 50
- moving by turns -
simple 'roll & move'; ending on a red marked space: see instructions.
remarks:
should be published 1929/early 1930's (not earlier because the round trip (Weltreise) was finished Sep. 1929)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Educational, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fortress
description:
Fortress is a two player abstract strategy game where players take turns placing stones at intersections on an 11x11 grid board. Players try to both capture their opponent’s stones and also to create fortresses to score points.

The game also comes with rules to play an advanced version of Tic-Tac-Toe using the same playing pieces and board.

From the box:
“Fortress is a simple game of mysterious Oriental flavor. A player tries to organize large but defensible fortresses. His opponent must exploit its weakness and mount an earnest attack. At the end, the winner is declared, based on the number of prisoners and size of its fortresses' territory.”

name: Motorradrennen
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space
- moving by turns -
move forward according die roll; ending on a marked (blue/red) space follow instructions printed on lid inside
remarks:
should be published during 1930's
cute motorcycle meeples

name: Happy Hippo: Die Talentshow vor Weihnachten
description:
Simple Goose-type race game but with cards added to add a little more variety. The game must have been given away in a Kinder Egg box. Kinder Egg usually feature toys inside but this is a rarity perhaps. The game is housed in a plain yellow plastic egg.

Aim of the game is to help the Happy Hippo to pass the talent show before Christmas.
The 20 cards are shuffled and laid face down. Each player rolls the die once. The player with the highest score starts. The players moves are dictated by the die (which has to be assembled before play can start).

If a player lands on a square with instructions, he/she must obey them. If he/she encounters a square with musical note next to it, he/she draws a card and tries fulfil the task indicated. If the task is accomplished, the player stays on the square. If not, the player goes back to his previous square.

The first player to reach the stage (square 50), wins.

Contents:
1 paper cube with scores 1-6
4 Happy Hippo playing pieces
Game board.
20 Cards

name: 20 Jahre deutsche Demokratische Republik
description:
Objective: collect as many winning points as possible by placing cards correctly
- acting by turns -
each player draws a cards & reads aloud information printed on;
card has to be turned an placed correctly upon the board (map of GDR) matching lines/borders; right - get 1 winning point; wrong - loose 1 winning point. Game ends after all cards are drawn.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle, Travel, Trivia

name: Das Sammler-Spiel
description:
Objective: collect as many wooden chips as possible
- moving/acting by turns -
Roll the die and move into direction of your choice. Ending on a space with a wooden chip you may take it and read aloud the information about that specific plant you'd discovered.
Game ends after all chips are collected.

name: Friede und Arbeit
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (field 72)
- moving by turns -
Simple 'Roll & Move' game, similiar with 'Game of Goose'.
Ending on a red marked space follow instructions printed next to the image.
Remarks:
Game was often used for betting
should be published 1910's or early 20's (due to images)
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grosstadt-Verkehr Ein lehrreiches Würfelspiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (field '60' = home again)
- moving by turns -
Each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
should be published early 1920's
cute pewter meeples

name: Miles To Go!
description:
“Miles To Go!” is a travel game with an attitude! Sit back and enjoy those long trips with a game that is sure to provide hours of fun. Make those miles seem like no time at all!

The object of Miles To Go! is simple…find as many objects as you can to acquire as many points as possible before you reach your destination. With a few tricks thrown in there, you will need a keen eye and a bit of a “cut throat” mentality.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Chaffee Shack Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Dog Walker
description:
Dog Walker is a family board game where players are competing to earn the most money by walking the neighborhood dogs and returning them to their owners in clean condition (and empty of bladder).

The dogs that players walk around the board are represented by cards, each card features a photo of a real dog (living or passed on submitted by fans). Each dog card has a bladder value and one or more sniff symbols. Boy dogs have more pee to deliver but will also stop more often to sniff things than girl dogs.

You earn a point for every dollar earned earned and for having your dogs "mark" (pee on) the fire hydrants around the board. However, only three pee markers can be on any hydrant so if a fourth one gets added, the pee marker on the bottom of the stack goes away.

The next element of fun come from the action cards. Every time a dog stops on the board to sniff its required symbols, everyone gets to play one action card, such as "tangled leash", "dirty paws" and "squirrel!" providing additional hindrance to their opponents or cards such as "romp & play", "overactive bladder" and "holiday bonus" to benefit their own cause.

name: Die fröhliche Wanderung
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (field 97)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions;

remarks:
Early GDR product

name: Kat en Muis
description:
This is a gambling game for two players and requires two dice, two counters and chips or money. The stakes are unlimited by anything except the players’ inclination or ability to pay.
RULES OF PLAY
1 The players take it in turn to throw both dice. The player with the higher score becomes Cat; the other, Mouse. They put the agreed stakes in the pots: Cat in her Kattepot on red 66 and Mouse in his Muizepot on black 66. Cat moves to the top left-hand corner of the board and Mouse to the bottom right.
2 Cat begins the game by throwing both dice and preparing to move her counter along the Cat Walk - the red numbered squares - to square 3 if the dice show 2 and 1, square 4 if they show 3 and 1, square 5 if they show 2 and 3 or 4 and 1, and so on. If Cat throws a double 1 she moves to square 11, in which case Mouse must pay her two chips. If she throws a double 6 she pays two chips to Mouse and does not move. If she lands on 5 she loses her next turn, but if she lands on 10 she may throw again; if she lands on 4 or 9 she pays one chip to Mouse.
3 Mouse now throws and moves in the same way down the Mouse Run - the black numbered squares - paying or receiving the same number of chips.
4 Cat’s turn again, and the same rules apply. But there are more: if Cat has to jump her counter over Mouse’s, she pays him one chip; if she lands on square 15 she loses her next turn; square 20 gives her a second throw; and 16 means another chip paid to Mouse. If she is already past square 11 by this turn, a double 2 will take her to square 22 - otherwise it is only the total 4 that counts. If she lands on square 22, Mouse must pay her two chips.
5 Mouse follows Cat, and Cat then follows Mouse again, each racing for the other’s pot on square 66. The earlier rules still apply: landing on 22, 33,44 or 55 earns two chips; once past 22 a double 3 leads straight to square 33, and once past 33 two 4s lead to 44 and past that two 5s to 55. Once past 55 a double six is a passport straight to the pot. Before that a double 6 still means a lost turn and a forfeit of two chips to the other player. Landing on squares 25,35,45 or 65 means a lost turn, while achieving squares 30, 40, 50 or 60 gains a second throw; stopping on 25, 36, 49 or 64 entails paying over one chip to the other player.
6 If Cat or Mouse throws a total which will take him or her beyond square 66, he or she has to turn back to 48. But the player who reaches 66 first WINS the game and takes both stakes.

The pictures on the board are taken from the works of three leading illustrators: the English artists Alfred Elwes and Harrison Weir, and the American Palmer Cox.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Tiere in Afrika
description:
Objective: catch most animals on your trip through Africa
- moving by turns -
Each player rolls the die and moves forward; ending on a red marked space you make catch an animal - if not already caught by another one. Game ends after last animal has been caught.
remarks:
Flechsig edition was edited again by VEB Dresden
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Travel
publishers: VEB Druck und Verpackung Dresden, Walter Flechsig

name: La Pontica
description:
A classic Italian gambling game, first published in the 17th century. The board represents a castle guarded by brave mice which are numbered. Around the castle are attacking cat images, each numbered as well.

The players, in clockwise order, throws 3 dice. The total shown by the dice will correspond to one of the attacking cats or one of the brave mice images on the board, and the player either pays into the bank or receives from it a proportion of the stakes.

Tripples are the favoured throw because this has special results. triple 1 to triple 4 are the corners of the castle. Double 5 is the drawbridge and triple 6 is the keep. Triple 1 to 5 lets the player collect half the stakes. Triple 6 allows the player to collect all the stakes.

name: Bat Match
description:
Free to Print and Play.

A simple game designed with a Halloween theme for young players. Use Slithers, Slime and Splodge to make components for your bat creations. Extra points will be awarded for bats with parts that match each other in colour.

Only players who manage to lay down a unique card will win a Slither, Slime or Splodge token. Bonus Cards can be won though if 3 people put down the same card. There is therefore a large element of luck to the game but there will be advantages to be had in figuring out the best time to lay each card.

The length of the game can be varied by altering the number of Bonus Cards in the deck.

Ideal for young players as there is very little waiting for your turn.

No text except the word "or" on any of the cards in order to make it as child friendly as possible.

name: Wir wandern durch Sachsen-Anhalt und Brandenburg
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target (Berlin)
- moving by turn -
‘Roll and Move’ game
move forward according die roll along the red line; ending on a green marked space follow green line & instructions printed on the board until you join the red line again.
Equipment: board, 6 meeples (can be extended), 1 die
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Stadt Land Fluss: Europa Quiz
description:
Trivia block with 120 questions and answers about Europe where quickest correcy answers score You a points.

Player with the most points wins.

name: Die Bergkraxler
description:
Objective: be the first ending upon space '100'
- moving by turns -
translation: 'up the mountain scrambling guys'
It is a simple game of racing with lovely illustrations and very cute meeples. The main principle is moving forward by die roll, but due to the use of a second (coloured) die your move becomes 'modified' ==> step left/right/reduced/...; some spaces (see instructions) grant advantages/disadvantages.
Typically game was used by adults betting money.
remarks:
should be published ~ 1900;

name: Das Raketenflugzeug
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target (back to earth ==> field 60)
- moving by turn -
‘Roll and Move’ game

start from the earth (field 1)& move according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside
Equipment: board, 6 meeples
remarks:
should be published during 1920's
places to be travelled to do not match with current knowledge about our planets
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Racing, Space Exploration

name: Wettlauf zum Futtertrog
description:
Objective: be the first enterinf the centre of the board
- moving by turns -
Simple 'Roll & Move' game; move forward according die roll; if result doesn't match (entering the centre) move back according remaining value; ending on the marked space you must start again.
remarks:
game is packed in a cardboard sleeve
should be produce ~ 1940's

name: Vom Zollern bis zum Staufen
description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 43
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game - roll the die, move forward & follow instructions printed on lid inside if you end on a marked space.

remarks:
belongs to series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele";
game should be published 1910'/20s

meeples: pewter figures
cities on the map:
Münsingen, Hechingen, Gomadingen, Nürtingen, Horb..
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Wie Wat Waar?
description:
The game board is a house that is puzzled together. All things have to be sorted in the right room. In three games, the game expanded vocabulary and teach children to play together.

The game board consists of a colorful puzzle with a turntable in the middle. In total there are 6 rooms and each room has a different color. The game includes small slices with objects. On these disks are pictures of objects. These objects belong each to one specific room of the house. This can be checked at the back of the disk: Ex. the kitchen is shown as red and all disks that belong in the kitchen have a red back.

In the game, the vocabulary around the house is practiced in different games. One game it is cooperative: The players then play against the slob. Does the turntable in the attic? Then you can slob a place ahead. Does the arrow shows to another room? Then all the players together look at an object out of this room. When they indicate a correct disc, they can put it away.

Are all discs put away before the slob is on the last box? Then you all won the game!

name: Het Nieuwe Grote Basisschoolspel vragenset 1ste leerjaar
description:
This adds new questions to the base game, especially for children in the 1 year of Belgium's 'basisschool'.

Not playable without the base game!

name: Quartaal
description:
Do you learn the Dutch language? Spelling has no secrets for you anymore? Whether you are a player who just have to have the tactical moves? 'Quartaal' is a tactical language game.

'Quartaal' is a language game that can be played on multiple levels. On every question card are questions from different levels (level 2nd to 6th grade). Players get at the beginning of the game one or more game cards, depending on the number of game boards that they play. It can be played with 1 game board for the first time, making the game easier, but it can be extended to 4 game boards.

Players try to complete their tasks as well as possible to earn points. They answer every 'language-question' which is asked by another player and earn blocks. These blocks must be placed on a game board. It is important to play tactically, score many points and make opponents to lose points.

The system is very well organized. By using multiple game boards, the game becomes harder and more tactical. Unfortunately, there are few (60) double-sided question cards for the second through the sixth grade. Although they are printed on both sides, but it still gives only 120 orders per year.

name: Farwest
description:
Welcome to the FarWest!

In this game each player will assume the role of a Deputy and they will try to help the Sheriff to deal with all of the Farwest troubles.
The Sheriff, qill be moved by one of the players around the city, and its surroundings. Each player will colect Rumors (cards in hand) so they can make a row of Suspects (cards in game) for each complete Row of suspects (5 cards) the players will try to score as many points they can.

With a scoring similar to Poker, players will have to combine the different Rumors into actual suspects and deliver them to the Sheriff, or use them to get rid of the Big Bad Guys that will arrive in the city.

Players will have to place their Deputy (player token) in one of the places in the board (city, surroundings, and far away) and execute the action that it allows them to do. At the end of the turn (every player have done his action) players are allowed to place rumors into play (to become suspects) accordling to the place and action he chooses.

Each time 2 or more Deputys chooses the same place they will have to duel for the action.

To impress the Sheriff and the Farwest Community, the Deputy must not achieve the lowest score in any of the solved problems.
