To help the deputy in his duty, there will be special people (special cards) that can lend a hand in fighting the crime!

When the 3rd Big Bad Ugly Guy is eliminated the game is over, and the Sheriff will nominate only one sucessor!

Good luck!

name: The Waterloo Game
description:
"Why did Wellington win?"

This is an abstract challenge for one or two players. The board is a "T" shaped pattern of 33 squares in alternating colors. Each square is marked with the name of a Napoleonic battle. There are 32 playing pieces (like checkers) in two colors. The playing pieces are placed on the board, leaving the center "Waterloo" square empty. The object of the game is to "jump" every piece, leaving just one token left and positioned in the center space. In the two player version the contestants take turns making their jumps.

Includes the 16" x 16" board and 32 tokens. The rules are printed inside the box.

name: More Pop The Question
description:
More from the ultimate Pop trivia card game with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify!

Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.

May be played with [game id=93736] or separately

name: More Pop the Question Extra
description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.

name: Pop the Question: Rock Extra
description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your rock card collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.

name: Pop The Question: 50s And 60s extra
description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your 50s & 60s collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.

name: Pop the Question: Soul, Funk And Hip Hop Extra
description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your Soul, Funk and Hip Hop card collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Trivia

name: 80's TV Trivia
description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1980’s style TV, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of television, featuring classics such as The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Quantum Leap, and The A-Team.

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: 70's TV Trivia
description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1970’s style TV, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of television. Featuring classics such as M.A.S.H., The Dukes of Hazard, Happy Days, Dallas, Charlie's Angels, Battlestar Galactica, Are You Being Served, Sesame Street, Kojak, Monty Python and many more!

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Rollo
description:
Objective: Gain as many points as possible hitting slots
- acting by turns -
With use of a roller rail each player tries to lead his/her rolling cisc into a slot (scoring due to printed value);
the broader the angle the smaller the slot the higher the score...
remarks:
should be published during 1920's

name: Nubulus
description:
Nubulus is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in Sepember 2011. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares. It is a transformation of checkers with the difference that the pawns move forwards, right or left, but they capture diagonally.

The goal of the game is to reach the opponent's side of the board or to eliminate all the opponent's pawns.
Each player has 14 pawns at the beginning of the match
The capturing is obligatory

1. The pawns can only move forwards, left or right, one square at a time, changing the colour of the square.
2. A pawn making a capturing move (a jump) leaps over one of the opponent's pawns. Only one pawn may be captured in a single jump; however, when possible the player must perform multiple jumps in one move.
3. The pawns capture opposing pawns by jumping over them to the nearest square of the same colour. To do this they may only move diagonally in four directions, not to the left or to the right, forwards or backwards.
4. Captured pawns are removed from the chessboard.

name: Al Murray The Pub Landlord Ultimate Pub Quiz
description:
The Nation's Favourite Pub Landlord brings you this Ultimate Pub Quiz. Think you're the brain of the bar? Well now's your chance to prove it as you choose your teams and work your way through a random selection of 1000 questions on everything British. From History to TV to Music to Sports, and a picture round as well, it's a test for any boffin or braniac. With a selection of questions written by the Landlord himself, who presides over the quiz behind his special bar board, it's the Ultimate Pub Quiz in your own home.

Box Contains 1 x Board 250 x Cards across 3 decks 2 x pencils 1 x dice Answer pad Rulebook

name: Zaczarowana Kraina
description:
It's a game directed mainly at children where they roll a die to move on the track and draw special cards. It's a kind of trivia race, but there is no finishing line - the game ends when one particular card is drawn ("Matołek the Billy-Goat" - a character from popular Polish comic books for children). During the game you have the opportunity to test your knowledge about Świętokrzyskie Province, to become acquainted with legends and famous sites from this area and to collect "emeryks" (which is the goal of the game). But you have to be careful of a highwayman called Madej and his clubs.

From the publisher's website:
A board game about the attractions of Świętokrzyskie Province.
The game Zaczarowana Kraina provides you with lots of excitement and healthy competition among family and friends at the same time getting you to know the beauty of nature, cultural wealth and fascinating past of Świętokrzyskie Province. The game encourages you also to visit some or all of presented sites.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tee-Kesselchen
description:
A children's game where two players take a Teekesselchen card. A "Teekesselchen" is a term with two different meanings. Each card depicts two homonymous pictures. The two players choose which side they are in charge of and they begin describing the pictures. The first player describes her picture and then the second explains how his is different.

Example:
First player: My Teekesselchen is something you can eat.
Second player: Not mine.

The other players can ask yes or no questions and are trying to guess both the term and two different meanings in order to earn the card. The player who guesses is then part of the team that describes the next card. After all the cards have been guessed the player with the most wins.

name: Wer kennt Dortmund?
description:
"Who knows Dortmund - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Dortmund.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

remarks:
Designer and artist Mark Altfuldisch selects different 'local experts' from each city to create appropiate questions; consequently each city has different designers listed on the box-side.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Surface Warship 1939-1943
description: SURFACE WARSHIP 1939-1943 is rules and equipment for tactical World War II naval simulation games. Each player is the captain of a ship. In a 30-second time limit turn, he moves his ship and fires his guns. The gunnery effectiveness is determined by the captain himself, since he ranges his guns by eye and guess. A system of points is used to evaluate damage to ships - how much speed and armament they lose. Torpedoes are fired by pointing a marker in a certain direction and moving it as the torpedo moves. An umpire is necessary in the game because many arguments will arrise about hits and misses, and many additional factors can be included in the game with an umpire.

name: Wer kennt Freiburg?
description:
Who knows Freiburg - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Freiburg.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Get Thee Behind Me...
description:
This is a self published board game by Doctor Mike Reddy, based on an idea by David Prior and Matthew Simmons, which can be played on Checkers/Othello boards with regular pieces. It was submitted to the One Game A Month project.

Players move pieces from their back row in a manner similar to checkers, that is diagonally forward. However, pieces can also move directly backwards one space, allowing for advance and retreat. Taking of opponent's pieces is limited to manoeuvring behind the other player's counters from the side; hence the name.

Basic strategy involves the creation of temporary vertical or horizontal lines, as both of these patterns prevent to a legal take manoeuvre; the former prevents (in the short term) the opponent from being able get to the side, the latter the completion of a take because the rear of pieces are protected. However, such structures are not sustainable for long, especially as players lose pieces.

name: Mynd
description:
This game for 2-4 players is superficially similar to GO, with players taking turns laying stones on a 11 x 11, 16 x 16 or 19×19 grid of intersections. However, unlike Go where placed pieces are static or captured, Mynd (the Welsh word for go) shows its diversity using a push/pull mechanic that allows lines of pieces to be moved along lines (horizontally or vertically), according to a simple tug-of-war mechanic. Therefore, this is more an ongoing battle that the traditional game, with the status of claimed territory being under constant attack as walled off sections of the board are pressured by force of numbers. The game ends when there is no legal move left, the board fills up, or, more often, when both players agree to end it, at which time whoever controls the most territory wins.

As an additional game reusing the Go aesthetic, utilising the same general-purpose grid and colored stones, it is hoped this will join the variety of other abstract strategy games that can be played with a Go set, such as Connect6, Go-Moku, Pente, and others.

name: Charades In-A-Box: American
description:
Charades game with American theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Real-time

name: Charades In-A-Box: Canadian
description:
Charades game with Canadian theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Real-time

name: Charades In-A-Box: Party Animal
description:
Charades game with animal theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Real-time

name: Rechenmax
description:
Objective: be the first passing target (100) & learning maths (first rules of arithmetic)
- acting/moving by turns -
example: addition
turn the spinner, add number to current position & move forward; ending on a marked space follow instructions. Hitting another meeple player must move back 10 spaces.

name: Music Game: Level 1
description:
Players advance around the "Keyboard" style board with classic wooden pawns by rolling the dice and correctly answering question cards from six categories.
Players get to 'jump' one another, land on 'move forward/back' keys, 'buy' key moves' answer music trivia and practice drawing music.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Waldmännchen-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching the centre of the board
- acting/moving by turns -
each player rolls the die & moves into direction of her/his choice; ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on lid inside; due to the turning wheel below the board after the turns ways become blocked or unlocked.

name: O Moselstrand; o selig Land!
description:
Objective: be the first ending on target space (Coblenz 62)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game -
Starting in Trier roll the die, move forward & follow instructions printed on cover inside

remarks:
published early 1930's
meeples: pewter figures

name: Angriff auf die Burg!
description:
The knight Vincelot must save the Princess Paula from the castle of Prince Finster with the help of a catapult.
You must have a good eye and a steady hand to choose a good position for Your catapult in Your turn because good shots may give You a lot of points and even save the princess.

Player who save the princess or has a most points if players get rid of their ammo is the winner.

name: Eine Reise ins Riesengebirge
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 90 => Jannowitz, nowadays Jannowice)
learn more about Silesia, especially Riesengebirge (Sudeten Mountains)
- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -
Start at Hirschberg (nowadays Jelenina Góra);
(pewter) meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on lid inside.

remarks:
Background of the cover: shows giant 'Rübezahl', spirit of many Silesian fairytales;
due to Scholz' numbering system game should had been published ~ 1910
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Speed Boat
description: Basic racetrack game with a speed boat theme. The playing surface is lithographic paper placed on the box bottom. First player to reach the finish with the exact number wins.

name: Story Mixer
description:
This Lego story telling game consists of a spinner with 6 directions and 30 small Lego models, each on a four by four base.
The active player spins the spinner, then places one of his/her models onto the field the spinner points to. S/he then gives the model a name made out of two words, such as "red dragon", "stomping elephant", "birthday cake", etc. and begins a story with that element. The next player does the same, but must use both the first model and his/her own (in that order!) in the story, etc. A player who makes a mistake (i.e. saying fire dragon) is penalized by having to take the model back. Elements that return to the field may be re-named, adding to the chaos. The spinner also has some color fields with special properties.
The goal of the game is to get rid of one's one models first. Of course, it can be varied by adding your own models.

Set # 50004
Item # 6024947

name: Auto-Rennen
description:
Objective: Be the first ending the car race by passing target space 70
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions (glued on cover inside) ending on a marked (white) space

remarks:
cute meeples (pewter figures)

name: Der Luftschutz
description:
'Luftschutz' means 'civil air defence'
Objective: be the first reaching target space 100 - learn important facts to improve protection
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked (red) space follow instuctions printed lid inside; images on the board illustrate critical areas (education)
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, World War II

name: Legion of Primus: Roll into Action
description:
Legion of Primus: Roll into Action is a game of battling Super heroes and Super Villians.

It is a push your luck dice game played on a battle board.

Each character has a unique set of powers and these powers are activated by Cubitos energy, the more energy the stronger the powers are that they can activate.
Players roll different dice to try and gain the correct energy symbols for their Powers, but roll to many OverLoad symbols and the character cannot activate this turn. Players also have the chance to unleash defensive powers in their opponents turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Gnome Wars
description:
In Gnome Wars players don the pointy hat of the Blue or Red garden gnomes to wage battle against each other throughout the backyard of the unsuspecting homeowners.

To defeat their enemies the gnome clans must move their mushroom home-base across the board, beating their enemies to coin caches while avoiding the pitfalls of backyard kiddy pools and the dangers of the cranky house-cat and the curious dog.

The first player to collect and spend 25 coins is the victor. Coins may be used to capture and fortify areas of the backyard and play various strategic Action Cards in order to out-maneuver and outplay the enemy gnome clans.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Search It...
description:
Search It...a game designed to test your knowledge against your web searching skills and speed. Players that know the answers are rewarded with moving faster through the game. Otherwise you must use your web enabled device to try and find the answer before time runs out. Players young and older will be challenged with using technology and brain power.

The playing board is made up of multi colored spaces corresponding to question cards. There are four categories to chose from. People Places Things and General. Players can either answer the question or use their web enabled device to find the answer. Knowing the answer will advance the playing piece four spaces. If the internet is used you may move 3 spaces. If you cannot answer in the 15 second time limit any other player my try and answer. A correct answer will advance their piece 1 space. Within the board layout there are special spaces. Landing on a Back Space moves your piece back 2 spaces. Players landing on and ESC space will take a ride on the High Speed Fiber Optic line bypassing several spaces.

name: Ciao Cash
description:
The centre of the game is to purchase the best items from several categories during your "lifetime" to gain the most "happiness". A character card is giving each player an additional secret goal to achieve and add happiness points at the end of the game. Money is tight, though, and "bad" cards (accidents, and so on) can cost you a lot of money. There are also cards which cost you a fee each round (mobilephone).
On their turn, players draw the topmost card of a huge draw deck. Either he gets it (the bad cards are a forced purchase) or trades them directly to other players, getting the cost himself. He can also discard a card and take the next one - at his own risk.
At the end, happiness points are added. Money counts a half happiness point for each unit. The player with the most happiness wins the game.

name: The Ultimate Baseball Trivia (Series B)
description:
Trivia cards about baseball legends past and present with over 200 different trivia questions.
With questions on each card getting progressively more challenging – starting with “Rookie League” questions for young fans and ending with “Hall of Fame” questions for true baseball aficionados.

Read the question out loud and try to answer the question correctly. If you answer correctly, pat yourself on the
back and score a card. If you answer incorrectly, try to make up
an excuse to justify your lack of baseball knowledge
When you are done the card, move to the next card.
Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: The Ultimate Baseball Trivia (Series A)
description:
Trivia cards about baseball legends past and present with over 200 different trivia questions.
With questions on each card getting progressively more challenging – starting with “Rookie League” questions for young fans and ending with “Hall of Fame” questions for true baseball aficionados.

Read the question out loud and try to answer the question correctly. If you answer correctly, pat yourself on the
back and score a card. If you answer incorrectly, try to make up
an excuse to justify your lack of baseball knowledge
When you are done the card, move to the next card.
Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Eiskegel-Spiel
description:
Objective: score most points
- acting by turns -
skittle by/with curling
there are numerous different games (& publishers) with 9 skittles;
speciality of this game: curling tools;
fixing a disc you shoot it into direction of the skittles.

well known game:
each player slides the curl three times into nine skittles;
numbers are summed up - highest sum wins

name: Route Choice
description:
Route Choice is a game of skill based on the 'Thought Sport' for the whole family, Orienteering.

This is a game for 3 to 7 players based on the sport of orienteering in as much as a map is used as the board of play and the players move their tokens around a course by way of the features marked on the map. The course is set by a Planner at the start of the game and the first Player to move his token to the finish is the winner.
The game requires skill in making the best Route Choice between controls.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Whack & Slaughter: Express
description:
Whack & Slaughter: Express is an express variant of Whack & Slaughter.
In the components you will find a map, 2 teams of preconfigured characters as well as a rulebooklet throwing you right into the action, so you can learn the basics of the game step by step.
For the basic 2 player variant you will have to provide 40 dice (or your own creativity in finding a way to track the characters' health.)
There are empty charactersheets as well, so you can create your own teams after reading the full rules.
(You will have to provide more dice on your own, if you want to play with more teams, though!)

Whack & Slaughter: Express is a Capture The Flag game;
Two parties gather in the corners of their houses.
The parties are "Team Fire", fielding a balanced yet somewhat defensive team, and "Team Frost", fielding a highly agressive team.
Both have to get into the opposing team's corner to retrieve their flag and to get back to their home corner in order to score.

The rulebook gives you a step-by-step introduction to the game by throwing you directly into the action:
Just follow the guidelines to the missions provided and you will learn the game in no time.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Duel at Dawn
description:
In Duel at Dawn Players pit their fighters on an island into a duel with rapiers, that soon becomes a duel of wits.

The game starts with players configuring their fighters by buying points in attributes and assigning one or more skills. The configuration of a fighter reflects his strengths and weaknesses.
Combat is played with the Damage Deck, so players have to outsmart their opponents in order to defeat them and to achieve the mission's goal.

While the rules come in English, the game per se is completely language independant and relies on icons only.
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Pilze kennen Pilze sammeln
description:
Objective: learn as much as possible about edible mushrooms, toadstools - recognize them safely
- acting by turns -
different games are possible:
Quizmaster (changing) shows image to next player; if answer correct (name/classification...) card may kept
- simultaniously -
Quizmaster (changing) shows image to all players; very first (correct) answer takes the card

name: Quick Draw
description:
An unusual idea, a dice and cards game that has no dice or cards. All the required options are built into the plastic box. You 'roll' the in-built dice and that will result in you 'drawing' cards, which are displayed in the many 'windows', so you know which cards you have.

Using this strange contraption, the publisher says you can play all sorts of card games and in the box the rules for Blackjack and Poker are included.

name: Rondje Drenthe
description: A quiz game. There's a deck of cards with 1/6 of a map. On the reverse side are questions. With a die you determine which question you have to answer. Winner is the first to gather all six parts of the map.

name: Het Nieuwe Grote Basisschoolspel vragenset 2de leerjaar
description:
This adds new questions to the base game, especially for children in the 2nd year of Belgium's 'basisschool'.

Not playable without the base game!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Het Nieuwe Grote Basisschoolspel vragenset 3de leerjaar
description:
This adds new questions to the base game, especially for children in the 3rd year of Belgium's 'basisschool'.

Not playable without the base game!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Het Nieuwe Grote Basisschoolspel vragenset 4de leerjaar
description:
This adds new questions to the base game, especially for children in the 4th year of Belgium's 'basisschool'.

Not playable without the base game!

name: Het Nieuwe Grote Basisschoolspel vragenset 5de leerjaar
description:
This adds new questions to the base game, especially for children in the 1 year of Belgium's 'basisschool'.

Not playable without the base game!

name: Het Nieuwe Grote Basisschoolspel vragenset 6de leerjaar
description:
This adds new questions to the base game, especially for children in the 1 year of Belgium's 'basisschool'.

Not playable without the base game!

name: Cradle: Creator's Challenge
description:
In Cradle: Creator's Challenge, you are a Creator. In the name of competition, you and your rival will conjure a world unlike any ever before conceived. Sweeping plains, rugged mountains and deep oceans spring into existence at your command, twisting and crashing into your rival's lands in a colossal battle of will. Then—by your grace—the world will be filled with life; be it by brawn or brain, your creations will vie for dominance. Fanged monstrosities, indomitable swordsmen, educated scholars, suave traders... Anything you can imagine, you may create; the Challenge will support their method of battle with a single system of resolution.

The Challenge is between two Creators, each with uniform tools at their disposal. Play is divided into two Phases: In Phase I, Creators alternate playing Tiled Cards to create a map, and use octagonal Origin Points to set where their Creations spawn from. In Phase II, Body & Soul Cards are paired together to make 3 Creations per team. After their Creator describes them, pawns are placed on the map to represent them. As pawns are moved around the map, they will come into conflict with Rival Creations. Conflict is resolved by rolling 1 to 3 six-sided dice. A continually exchanged Event Card assigned to each Creation provides aid or presents challenges as the game unfolds, typically by modifying the number of dice rolled.

By rolling successfully, Creations will lose Heart. When Heart is reduced to zero, the Creations is removed from the map. Origin Points have no Heart and are removed from the map when rolled against successfully, but are much harder to succeed against. The game is over when one side has lost both Origin Points or all 3 Creations. That side loses.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Get Blue with Mango-Force Battle Action!
description: Get Blue is a kinetic, magnetic table-top game comprising of tiles and discs. A Starter Set has four tiles and five discs. Tiles have a magnet inside. Discs have a metal core. Players score points by spinning their discs, connecting to and knocking over a tile. If a disc connects to but does not knock over a tile, players loose points. The Red Tiles are worth one point. The Blue Tile is worth two points. The Flame Spinner is a double point disc. (Points are doubled if you capture or are reversed captured.)

name: Tide of Valor: The Normandy Campaign
description:
Hit the beaches of France in the first phase of the Allied assault on Fortress Europe. As either Bradley or Montgomery you match wits with Rommel, The Desert Fox, and the best the Werhmacht has to offer.

Winning the battle of the beaches is just the first step. Whoever gains the upper hand in this fight will set the stage for the next sector.

The British mission is straight forward, capture the city of Caen, a strategic center surrounded by flat rolling fields; perfect tank country for their burgeoning armored might. But the Germans wrote the book on armored warfare. With some of the best SS Panzer divisions moving into Normandy the Germans will have the Panthers and Tigers necessary to crush the Tommies and drive them back into the Sea.

The American objective is the farming town of St. Lo, but to reach it they must overcome a different set of nightmares. Miles of the harshest defensive terrain in Europe stands before the GI's. Bocage, hellish constructs of impenetrable earth and rock provide the perfect cover for Panzer Grenadiers lying in ambush.

The tide of battle will surge and ebb but only one side can claim victory in Normandy!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Clash of Arms Games

name: The Ultimate Hockey Trivia (Series B)
description:
Trivia cards about ice hockey legends past and present with over 200 different trivia questions.
With questions on each card getting progressively more challenging – starting with “Rookie League” questions for young fans and ending with “Hall of Fame” questions for true baseball aficionados.

Read the question out loud and try to answer the question correctly. If you answer correctly, pat yourself on the
back and score a card. If you answer incorrectly, try to make up
an excuse to justify your lack of baseball knowledge
When you are done the card, move to the next card.
Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: The Ultimate Hockey Trivia (Series A)
description:
Trivia cards about ice hockey legends past and present with over 200 different trivia questions.
With questions on each card getting progressively more challenging – starting with “Rookie League” questions for young fans and ending with “Hall of Fame” questions for true baseball aficionados.

Read the question out loud and try to answer the question correctly. If you answer correctly, pat yourself on the
back and score a card. If you answer incorrectly, try to make up
an excuse to justify your lack of baseball knowledge
When you are done the card, move to the next card.
Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Dream Team Card Game
description:
How to play
Begin the game by having every player roll a die to see who goes first. The person who rolls highest goes first, followed by the person to their left and so on and so forth. Should two or more people roll the highest number than they must roll off until someone has rolled higher.

When it is your turn you must do the following.
1. Draw a card from the draw pile.
2. Use a power card, place a character card in play, or use a character card power.
3. Discard cards from your hand until you have only five left.

Power Cards
Most power cards may only be used on your turn. When you play a power card you immediately do whatever it says, then discard it. Well… not immediately, but before you do anything else game related. So you could eat a sandwich or something.

Some power cards may be used at other times, which is indicated on the card itself. When in doubt, the card is right.

Character Cards
Character cards may be placed in front of you during your turn instead of using a power card or a character power. Place the character card in front of you and leave it there until something tells you to place it someplace else. This is now considered to be an “in play” character card. You may not use the Character Card Power the turn you place a character card in play. You may only have three character cards in play at a time. If you place a fourth you must discard one.

Character Card Powers
Instead of placing a character card or using a power card you may use the power on one of your “in play” character cards. This power works just like a power card, except you do not need to discard the character card to use it.

Note, some character cards have passive effects that do not require you to use them on your turn. These abilities are always in effect and should be easy to determine. If an argument does ensue the following characters have “passive” abilities.

Khan-El, Biel-Tel, Beorn, Penelope, Neil and Harris.

How to Win
This is the part you have all been waiting for isn’t it? To win the game all you have to do is have all of your in play character cards be the same characters as on your Dream Team card. Once you do that you win!

name: Blankity-Blank!
description:
Blankity-Blank! is a word game that will appeal to anyone who likes Scrabble, Boggle, Scattergories, and other word games. It's a family game designed for 2 to 6 players ages 12 and older.

To begin a round of Blankity-Blank!, you take a card from the box and let all the players see it. On the front of the card is an incomplete word with some letters left blank; for example, P--N-. You and every other player have three minutes to write down all the words you can think of that would complete that pattern, like phone or piano or plant or prank. When time is up you all read your lists aloud and cross out any word that more than one person wrote; you score points only for words that you alone thought of.

The front of the card indicates whether this is a 1-point, 2-point, or 3-point round, according to how many potential matches there are for this pattern. 1-point cards have dozens of possible solutions, 2-pointers not so many, and 3-point cards have the fewest of all. So you score 1, 2, or 3 points for each unique word in your list. (P--N- would be a 2-point card.)

When you've recorded the scores for this round, you may look at the back of the card. It shows a list of the most common words that would be correct solutions, so players can see some of the words no one thought of.

You continue to play with another card and another until one player has scored enough points to win. This can be 25 points, or 50, or any number the group agrees to.

The game includes over 500 cards, a pad of answer sheets, and a timer.

name: Child Beauty Pageant Tycoon
description: Child Beauty Pageant Tycoon is a game where you and your friends take the role of a mother whose greatest goal in life is to have her children win Beauty Pageants. The first player to win five Beauty Pageant crowns wins the game. There are 4 very different ways to make your Child ready to compete in a Pageant. 1) Spending a night with a Stud to give your child an edge from the very start. 2) Gaining experience by simply competing in Pageants. 3) Training your Child in a special Skill. 4) Buying a special 1-use Item to be used in any Pageant. Each Pageant will have different entry fees and winnings, and they will focus on different stats. When a pageant focuses on a stat, it counts for double towards winning the pageant. For example, let's say Mary Beth has a 'Smarts' score of 3. In the Pageant shown above, she will get to double her smarts score and it will instead give her 6 points toward winning the Pageant! Glitz or Talent stats still count toward winning, but they aren't doubled in this Pageant.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fort Thomas-opoly
description: A unique version of Monopoly based off of the Northern Kentucky town of Fort Thomas. Properties include historical content and prominent places around town. The game is played nearly the same as Monopoly, but with a few variants. There are different cards, and different rules for gaining money in relation to the cards and properties on the board.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Drummer Boy
description:
This is a game for children with an American Civil War military theme published in 1890.

Players begin the game as a drummer boy and attempt to rise through the ranks and become a general. The board is styled like a maze and players move based on the results of a spinner.
Certain spaces on the board have special rules. A drum symbol allows the player to spin again. Other spaces have instructions like "Surly. Go to Guard House" and penalize the player.

The first child to reach the "General" space is declared he winner.

Includes a colorful 13" x 13" board illustrated with Civil War scenes, metal tokens, and a drum-shaped spinner.

name: Reise durch die Schweiz
description:
Objective:
Be the first to reach target space
- moving by turns -

Typical 'roll and move' game, probbably published ~1920/30's
Roll the die, move forward; ending on a marked space read aloud the datails about that sight-seeing place and follow instructions, printed on a 2-sided rule sheet. Because it was played by adults you have to spend money first before you start.
Very nice drawings/printing and - of course - pewter pawns
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wiggs
description: This 1903 card game by L.T. Hodges is played with 65 cards. There are six suits with 10 cards in each, plus 5 "cabbage" or trump cards. Players try to match cards in their hand to those on "the board" (the table). The object of the game is get the greatest number of cards, cabbage cards and fives. The 1904 edition also contains rules for playing Wiggs Auction.

name: Complete Music Quiz Night In
description:
From the box:

All the fun of a music quiz night in your own home.

This chart-topping quiz is packed full of fascinating music trivia questions (both popular and classical) guaranteed to keep everyone entertained. Suitable for all the family and any number of players.

Your knowledge will be pushed to the limits by the following categories: One Hit Wonders; 60s & 70s; 80s & 90s; Albums and Singles; Music Charades; Music & the Movies; General Music Trivia; Pop Music; Name That Tune (on CD).

The Complete Music Quiz Night In contains everything you need for night after night of fascinating music trivia fun - all you need to supply are the players!

Contents:
50 question cards containing 1,900 questions and answers.
Audio CD for Name That Tune category.
Answer sheets.
Quick start instructions.
4 pencils.

name: 24 Karat
description: A family game based on the Swedish television show with the same name, hosted by Harald Treutiger. The goal of the game is to advance to the final act where you get to see if you got what it takes to win the elusive gold bar. You do this by drawing cards that have all kinds of weird statements on them, put money on if they are either true or false and then roll dice to tell who was right. This is mixed with some contextual statements like for example "will the phone ring during the game session?". Though usually it's mostly a game of plain luck.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Turf Wars
description:
Turf Wars is a game of conquest. Players are encouraged to form alliances and manipulate the situation so that ultimately, your faction, and preferably your faction alone, dominates the land.

There are up to ten (10) rounds of game play for Turf Wars each of which consists of five (5) phases:
• Perform Pre-Event Action(s)
• Place Reinforcement Troops
• Reveal Event
• Select Action Cards and Perform Actions
• Score & Spend Dominance Points

Object of the Game
There are four (4) ways your faction can win:
1. Dominate the appropriate number of turfs on the board that match your faction’s Home Turf.
2. Land the killing blow while wiping out your faction’s nemesis, if in play.
3. Achieve the objective outlined on any of your Secret Win Cards.
4. Attain highest number of Dominance Points (DP)at the end of 10 rounds. This results in a win only if no other win conditions are met first.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Battles of Vega Star Zone
description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering the Sirius Campaign, was the early age battles before main story.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Annihilation
description:
Annihilation is a Battleship-style game for two players using pencil and paper. Each player receives an identical printed sheet from a game pad, featuring a circular overhead map of the northern hemisphere. The map is divided into boxes by longitudinal and latitudinal lines, which are labeled by numbers and by names of constellations. Some boxes are shaded, representing the oceans. Also present are boxes to track each player’s hits; in place of ships are (in order of most to least boxes) Capital, Trade and Industry, Air Base, Navy, and Peace. Each player “hides” each of these objectives on his own side of the map, vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. The Navy must be in the ocean, Peace is a single box that may be anywhere, and the rest must be on land.

Each player then takes a turn firing volleys at the other side. A volley consists of 15 bombs, which can be any combination of airplane bombs, rockets, or atomics. Airplane bombs count for 1 bomb against the limit, rockets for 3, atomics for 5. Volleys are done all at once, with the opponent not announcing hits until the volley is over. Players track these developments by crossing off boxes on their paper. When a player sends a volley, if he has previously received any hits, those hits are subtracted from the 15 bombs he may fire on his current turn.

Airplane bombs strike only the square called by the player, rockets strike the first square and any two adjoining squares called immediately by the player, and atomics strike the initial square as well as the four adjoining squares along all four sides. Any target hit on one square by an atomic is immediately destroyed, any target hit by a rocket suffers an additional box hit after what the player targeted. Should any player strike the target of Peace, the game is immediately over, otherwise the game is won when all of a player’s other targets are destroyed.

name: Dribble
description:
"Fast-moving championship basketball game by Lowe"

The game is played with two dice; one standard d6, and one with letters:

P (Plus): ball is to be moved directly forward
M (Minus): ball is to be moved directly backwards
R (Right): ball is to be moved to the right
L (Left): ball is to be moved to the left
D (Diagonal): ball to be moved diagonally

The object of the game is to score by moving the playing piece across the court into the basket at the far end. The player who scores the most points within the playing time is the winner.

(Source: instructions)

name: The Lone Ranger and the Silver Bullets
description:
Images of Clayton Moore as The Lone Ranger/Jay Silverheels as Tonto and Silver.

Text at top reads "A Lisbeth Whiting Creation."

This game was only available for a limited before it was pulled off the market. It was because of licensing issues.

Cardboard platform in center holding 16 silver luster plastic bullets, each 1.25" long.

Players move around the track, scoring points based on the symbol in the box on which they land.

Badge = 50 points
Horseshoe = 40 points
Mask = 30 points
Gun = 20 points
Feather = 10 points
Lone Ranger = go again
Coming to or passing starting circle = 50 points
Landing on big pictures by exact count = 20 points
Outlaw = lose one bullet, go back 100 points

name: Pipword
description:
Each card has both a letter and one face of a standard die. Before each turn, 5 dice are rolled and placed on the dice board in order of their colors. Then the player tries to play a word of 3-5 letters, whose die faces match a contiguous subset of the dice on the board. If they do, they score the sum of the cards' pips, doubled for 4-letter words and tripled for 5-letter words. There are also wild cards, and slug cards that can be added at either end.

The winner is the first person to reach the specified total score, e.g. 100 for 4-5 players.

name: JaXiQuoZ
description:
From the web page:
" Cool Factors:

Easy to carry.
Quick to learn and play.
Fun for word-lovers and strategy gamers alike.

Description:
Shuffle the custom deck and deal each player ten cards. Select a card from your hand to keep and pass the rest to your neighbor. Keep cherry-picking a single card from each hand until they're depleted. Each player then tries to make a single word from his cards. Letters you use in your word score points--cards you take but don't use count against you! Be the first to score 100 points, and you've won.

It has a deck of 60 cards, which have a letter and number, in different colors. Rarer letters like J and Q have multipliers on them, and there are wild cards.

name: Oh My Word
description:
From the web site:
" Cool Factors:

Amazing 12+ Games in one!
Fast, stimulating game play!
Fun for the whole family - always fresh!

Description:
“Oh My Word” is not just one game, but is 12+ games in one, with more being developed and added frequently! You can play any of the games with the same deck of cards!

One of the most fun and exciting games ever created is “Battle of Words!” It comes in “quick start,” "basic," and "advanced" versions. The basic version can be mastered in a matter of minutes and is fun for the entire family. The play consists of forming words, lengthening existing words, combining words, and stealing words from your opponent(s). The advanced version is easy to learn but will stimulate and challenge even the most astute word gamers. In addition to the basic play, there are 20 action cards that create all kinds of excitement and dynamics between the players. In either version, each player competes for high score through word values, word length values, bonus letter values, bonus word values, other word bonuses, and the number / quality of words acquired by the end of the game.

You can also play the following;
“Cross Words” - plays similar to a crossword puzzle game, without the limits of a regular game.
“Play On Words” - plays similar to a 3-D crossword puzzle game, without standard limitations.
“Finding the Right Words” - plays similar to a cubed word game, without the grid or cube.
“The Last Word” - plays similar to a word jumble or word search, with strategy & scoring options.
“Simple Words” - plays similar to solitaire, but played with words and is more entertaining.

You can even play poker style games that involve many more strategies and scoring options, such as;
“Word For Word” - plays similar to Texas Hold 'em.
“Keep Your Word” - plays similar to 7-Card Stud.
“Choose Your Words” - plays similar to 7-Card Draw.
“Hold Your Words” - plays similar to 7-Card No Draw.
“A Few Words” - plays similar to 7-Card No Peek.

In addition, you get "Your Words, Not Mine" which creates several more variations of game play, allowing you to play many of the games backwards! Rather than competing for high score, each player competes for low score by transferring their words / scores to other players."

The deck comes with 176 cards.

name: Frazzed
description:
From the web page:
" Cool Factors:

Lay down the letters!
Baffle your opponents!
Keep yourself in the game!

Description:
Frazzed (formerly Baffle) is the word game where you try to lay out the letters of your own word while preventing everyone else from guessing your word, because if they do, you're out of the game. Meanwhile, you can eliminate your opponents by guessing their words."

There is a Letter Cards Deck with 275 cards, and a Word Cards Deck with 100 cards.

name: Bayern kaufen ...
description:
Objective:
get most money within agreed time
- acting by turns -

a classical Monopoly, taking place in Bavaria, Germany with all the well known activities like buying, trading..
typically 3-6 players, including banker 7
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Spiral Game
description:
Players each have one or two pawns. Depending on a dice roll they chose which pawn to advance along the spiral. Pawns landing on or adjacent to their own colour advance forward or backward along the spiral, or move inward or outward. If you and on another pawn the other pawn moves backwards five spaces, but may then in turn trigger off backward, forward, inward or outward movements.

A quick, fun family game reminiscent to Clue (Cluedo), which offers some interesting tactical decisions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Caractor Match
description:
Taken from the game's web page:

CARACTOR MATCH is a fun, fast-paced card game where players try to match colorful symbols to make pairs. Make your pairs the quickest and win!

Each turn, players choose to draw cards from the deck or take the discard pile, make pairs, discard and pass the turn. Each symbol appears on three different cards. Each card has two different symbols. Easy enough for children to play and elegant enough for adults to enjoy.

name: Kinderfest
description:
Objective: be the first finisheng the round-trip of an amusement park
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
each player rolls the die moving forward according number; ending on a marked (red/green/blue) space follow instructions. Target (100) must be reached with a matching number.
remarks:
game was packed/sent out in a paper bag without die and meeples

name: Das neue Basketballspiel
description:
Objective: score most points flipping a ball into a basket
- acting by turns -
players try to flip a (table-tennis) ball into a basket, positioned a a height of ~20 inches;

name: Konsorcjum
description:
Consortium is a print & play dice game for 1 to 6 persons in which the players take the roles of powerful businessmen, trying to acquire the most worthy concessions possible. The concessions concern three types of natural resources (energetic resources (E), metals (M) and water (W)).

The goal is to score the maximum possible number of points. The points of each player are summed at the end of the game and are attributed for the number of their concessions, for their political influence and for the supremacy in every three kinds of resources.

The game can be played from 2 to 6 players but it has a solitaire mode also.

Konsorcjum is language independent and comes with Polish, French, English, Spanish and Portuguese rules.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Print & Play

name: Walt Disney 'Bambi'
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (100)
- moving by turns -
typical 'Roll & Move' game - ending on a marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
cute pewter figures
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Fuji's World
description:
The objective of Fuji's World is to be the first to obtain the required number of victory points. To obtain vicory points, players try to open branches of Fuji and put a number of products on the market there.
There are four regions where you can open branches. Each region consists of several countries. The aim is to market a complete set of products in a country. A product set consists of photo paper, film rolls, offset plates and R&D.
If you market all the products in a country, your competitors no longer have a chance and you gain a victory point. But until that moment, you can lose your branch at any time!

"Invest and conquer new markets for our Fuji Tilburg products! This is what Fuji's World is all about. This game has been specially developed as a Christmas gift for all personnel and temporary staff at Fuji Tilburg. Not just for them, either: it is also important that those at home feel involved with Fuji. We hope that Fuji's World will provide the basic for many exciting family evenings and perhaps it will lead to new inspiration for achieving our objectives."

name: Mr. Toad's Journey
description:
A Goose-type game for pre-5 year olds. The game appeared in the 1978 Playhour Annual. Mr. Toad was a character who first featured in Kenneth Grahame's The Wind in the Willows, written in 1908.

Rules
To play this game with your friends, you will need a dice and counters. To start playing the game, each player has to throw a six, and then throw the dice again and move his counter along the numbered spaces. On the white spaces there are things you must do if you land on them. The player who reaches number 50 first, is the winner.

name: Baby Doll's Game
description:
Baby Doll was a comic strip character in Playhour, a favourite comic for the 5's and under. It is a typical Goose-type game and is taken from the 1978 Playhour Annual.

Rules
You need a dice and counters to play this game with your friends. Baby Doll wants to get to the doll's house. But to get there, she has to go along a path of stepping stones. You and your friends can have a race to see who gets to the house first. Throw a six to start, then throw the dice again and move your counter along the numbered stepping stones the dice shows. On the grey stepping stones there are things you must do if your counter lands on them. The one who reaches the house first, wins.

name: Fools!
description:
You play the part of a Fairy Lord, commanding one of the four armies of Fairy in an epic tournament.

For each tournament, four humans are 'invited' to join by the fairy lords. Often kidnapped or unwittingly stumbling into the Fairy land, these humans exemplify the fairy's love of fools and foolish people.

You can use your powers to change the outcome of each battle, but be wary! The nobility of Fairy are very honorable in nature and won’t stand for such trickery! And watch out for the fools! They can ruin your whole battle.

Fools! is a simple card game, with one deck of 64 cards. Each player draws a small 'army' of 3 face down cards and a hand of three cards. The army cards represent those fairies who will distinguish themselves in battle. Your hand represents fairies and fools you can use to hinder your opponents or strengthen your own army.

Cards can be played as Standard Bearers, some with special effects. Players are then required to replace a card in their opponent's army with one from their hand. They may then replace a card in their own army with one from their hand. Through this all, their army cards remain hidden from everyone.

At the end of each turn, your hand is discarded and your army cards (actually those who've distinguished themselves in this round of battle) are revealed. Points are added up and the highest score wins the turn.

2 player games play to 5 points, 3 players to 4 points and 4 players to three points.

This light card game is meant to fill the same roll as Zombie Dice - a fast, light and portable game to be played anywhere. Also great with kids.
publishers: The Game Crafter, LLC, Troll in the Corner

name: Move 'n Flip
description:
MOVE 'N FLIP is a 2 player Strategy game played on a 8x8 Chess Board.

Each player has 12 pieces which are double sided – with different directions of movement on each side. At the end of each move the piece is ‘flipped’ to the other side giving different directions for the next move.

Movement is similar to DRAUGHTS/CHECKERS i.e. either a single move or a jumping move over one or more of your own AND/OR your opponents’ pieces. Any opponents pieces jumped over are captured and removed from the board.

The sole survivor is the winner!

name: Unser Blumenspiel
description:
Objective: be the first gaining 12 red meeples, placed onto your board
- moving by turns -
place your flower board in front of you and move forward according die roll:
ending on
an arrow => roll die again
a blank space => miss one turn
a space with white dots => take as many red meeples as dots you stand on and place them on the board
a space with black dots => remove as many red meeples as dots you stand on
content: 4 flower boards, 4 blue & 48 red meeples

name: CarTag Scavenger Hunt
description:
Designed to be played by up to four people on a road trip, where players are searching for different items outside the car. Items inside the car cannot be used. The driver may have to referee, but should not try to play – be safe and keep your eyes on the road!

Each player needs a game book and a pencil.
All players are racing to spot the same items. When you spot an item - call it out and make sure you have a witness to your find. Whoever spots an item first checks it off - while
everyone else must keep looking for the next occurrence of that item.

Player who gets 3 (or 4) items first is the winner of the round and he gets the sticker to their book. Once a winner is declared, move on to the next round.

Player with the most stickers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: CarTag Lincence Plate Poker
description:
Designed to be played by up to four people on a road trip, Players search for combinations of letters and numbers on license plates to make a winning hand. The driver may have to referee, but should not try to play – be safe and keep your eyes on the road!

Each player needs a game book and a pencil.
A license plate is dealt when your vehicle either passes - or is passed - by a vehicle in the next lane.
Once everyone has finished collecting their license
plates, it’s time for each player to figure out their best hand to check their boxes on their book.

Player who has the most boxes checked get the sticker on his book.

Player with the most stickers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: CarTag Letters and Numbers
description:
Designed to be played by up to four people on a road trip, CarTag Letters & Numbers has players searching for letters, numbers, and words on passing signage and vehicles (including license plates). Items inside the car cannot be used. The driver may have to referee, but should not try to play – be safe and keep your eyes on the road!

Each player needs a game book and a pencil.
All players are racing to spot the same items. When you spot an item - call it out and make sure you have a witness to your find. Whoever spots an item first checks it off - while
everyone else must keep looking for the next occurrence of that item.

Player who gets 3 (or 4) items first is the winner of the round and he gets the sticker to their book. Once a winner is declared, move on to the next round.

Player with the most stickers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Space Dogsbody
description:
Space Dogsbody is a quirky game of space exploration, resource collection, and reputation management. The players fly around space mining asteroids, fulfilling menial missions, ferrying tourists, dodging pirates and upgrading their ships, trying to make a name for themselves and some quick cash!

40% of the board starts off face-down, and players will have to explore these tiles by flying onto them, hoping to find sources of valuable minerals or lost space stations offering powerful upgrades.

There are also tourists who will pay to be carried around space, as long as the players have a Spare Bed for the tourist to sleep on in the cargo bay. Upgrades like Business Cards will increase the reputation payout for completing missions, and the players can sell Advertising Space on the side of their ship for another source of income.

Players acquire reputation in each of four categories, all of which carry sizeable monetary rewards for certain levels. Merchant reputation comes from selling resources, Freelancer from fulfilling missions, Hacker from installing upgrades on your ship, and Vigilante from destroying pirates with lasers or explosives.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Mein Blumenspiel
description:
Objective: be the first collecting 6 flowers - learn the names of different flowers
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game, collecting flowers; ending on a space without flowers name those flowers you've collected already - this rule changed within the Spika edition to: miss one turn

name: Kinderparty
description:
Objective: gain as many winning points as possible
- moving/acting by turns -
each player moves according die roll - ending on a space draw a card with a matching symbol:
try to manage your task successfully (a bit like 'Activity');
if it was accepted by majority of players gain that cart (winning points are shown - depending on difficulty)

typical tasks are:
- mimic a profession
- name two different fishes
- repeat 2x the sentences:"Esel essen Nessel gern, Nessel essen Esel gern." witout any mistake
- count down from 40 to 20; replace multiples of 5 & 7 with a special name...
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Storytelling

name: A Game of Tales and Thrilling Stories: Adventure 1 – The Museum Case
description:
You are a group of four kids and best friends. It seemed to be a day like every other day when something happened that got you really upset. A boy from your neighborhood stole money from one of your friends. You decide to get the money back. The thief hides in an old villa and you go inside. This is where the adventure begins that will turn to The Museum Case.

A Game of Tales and Thrilling Stories is a rules system for story-driven board games that does not require one player to take the role of a game master or narrator of the story. The system is similar to paragraph driven games, but follows a pre-defined story and therefore provides a more integrated story experience. The story elements are not written in a paragraph book but communicated through cards.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: CON2! The Wraith of CON!
description: A fast bidding card game that expands upon the CON! Card Game. Similar in rules, this one represents a convention going badly for all involved. Slightly darker humor with the guests, game now includes guests that factor in traits about the players themselves.

name: Gusto Vin
description: Trivia game that combines wine-tasting with knowledge about wine. The game is played in 3 rounds, consisting of a set of questions and a round of wine tasting. At the end, the player with the most points win.

name: Elemyst
description:
Build an army, Raise a tower, cast spells, equip yourself and manage your resources. What could be a 400+ game but it is compressed in a 80 card game since every card in the game may act for 5 types, its up to the player to make the choices.

Be the first to acheive victory with 15 victory points or be the one with most points when the game ends.

The game plays with players having a certain amount a "plays" each turn. a player may either play a card from his hand as a resource,an equipement,a spell,a unit in a formation,or has a stone to build a tower on a captured land. once a player has a formation of 3 cards he may capture a land card and gain its bonus. Once a player has a land he may place stones to increase the lands bonus and gain Victory Points. A player may capture a land by having a better formation (poker style a little).

name: Trilania
description:
A fast-paced, multiplayer, strategy war game that utilizes custom dice. Assemble your army, build, develop, and conquer.

Welcome to the realm of Trilania, a world that has been ripped apart by magic in many ways...
First, where once the planet was whole, a disruption in the balance of magic caused it to be divided into three layers: the Lowlands, which is the main land; the Midlands, and, suspended by magic above the Lowlands, the Highlands.
Second, the land has been divided by war for over a century. Many of the Highland races believed their gods set them above the rest of the world, and it was their destiny to rule the lower races. Most of the Midlands strived for neutrality, seeking to open trade with the Highlands and the Lowlands. The Lowlands were divided into two main groups, those who sought only equality, and those who wanted to overthrow the Highland races. Some races, with the use of magic, altered themselves to resemble their animalistic gods, and the other races, realizing that this gave them physical and tactical advantages, followed suit. You must now choose which race or races you will command, lead them into battle, and form temporary alliances as you see fit. But choose your allies wisely and watch your back, because in the end, there can only be one victor. Always remember, the best laid strategy can sometimes go awry. Let the Dice Fly High!

Game-play is pretty simple. Choose the team of dice which is kind of like building a typical card deck, except with dice. Each dice costs a certain amount Team Points (TP). You have 140 TP to build your team.

A Teams consist of 2 types of dice Units and Buildings:

Units - units do not have a TP cost. Each unit is worth 'X'amount of Man Power (MP)'X' is equal to the units level. MP is used to build addition buildings and upgrades.
Level 1 units: Tend to be your weaker men
Level 2 units: Are stronger then level 1 units of course

Buildings
War Camps: produce level 1 and 2 units
Secondary Buildings: give you various advantages through upgrades and elite level units

Objective: build units to destroy your opponents ability to produce troops.
categories: Animals, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Wargame

name: Ninja Trap
description:
A game about ninjas trying to assassinate each other as they move throughout a house by laying traps. Uses a mechanic whereby the player must remember which traps they put where in order to activate them.

Cards represent rooms/areas of a house which players may use to move about the house or play as hidden traps to activate when another player enters the trapped area. As the game progresses, it becomes more difficult to remember where traps were placed and it can even be possible for a player to trap themselves by mistake.

If a player is trapped three times, they are eliminated.

name: Space Gremlins
description:
Space Gremlins is a 2-4 player light collaborative-push-your luck game.

You play as gremlins who have boarded a space ship and are now competing to see who can cause the most damage without bringing the ship down. You will move around, chewing wires, pushing buttons, causing power outages, door failures, activating special rooms, and drawing the attention of the crew over 10 turns of chaos. In the end you will all be vented into space and the Gremlin who did the most damage will win!

name: The Quest for Piptwynn's Scroll
description:
User Summary

The The Quest for Piptwynn's Scroll is a tabletop miniatures game that pits two players against each other to obtain Piptwynn's Scroll, an artifact of great importance, that can be found on the top of Star Snag Crag. The object of the game is to reach the top of the Crag, retrieve the Scroll, and then make it off the Crag again. The game board is defined as a series 49 four inch squares arranged in four tiers. The top tier is the peak of Star Snag Crag.

Each player controls a team, or Quad, made up of 4 different specialists, selected from the 8 possible types listed in the game. Some types focus on mobility, others on combat, and some, like the Beastmastr [sic], level the playing field with unusual abilities. These character types also rely on items (magical & non-magical) to give them an edge in certain situations.

Each turn the players perform game actions in a set order of phases: Activation, Movement, Exploration and Occurrences (weather effects or wandering monsters), Conflict Resolution, and Evening (a time of healing and recharging). Both players act simultaneously so occasionally members of one Quad will end up in conflict with each other quite by accident. Random game elements can also send creatures or primitives to attack members of a Quad. Terrain effects are randomly determined the first time the member of a Quad enters a new square. These effects can produce anything from a Refreshing Spring to a Dragon Nest.

Unlike most miniatures game, death isn't a feature of Piptwynn's Scroll. When one side wins a conflict, the other side is driven away. Since this is fundamentally a race to the peak of Star Snag Crag, getting pushed back on any given turn can make the difference between winning and losing. In this way the game is more family-friendly than the many miniatures games that focus on death and dismemberment.

The rulebook also contains several rules variants, including set up a larger board for tournament play. Also included are reproducible sheets, charts, tokens, etc., along with tips on how to paint miniatures and how to build a proper three-dimensional game board. (Players must provide their own miniatures, a playing surface--which can be simple map or more traditional war game terrain, and a set of polyhedral dice)

There were several planned follow-up games for this title, including an RPG crossover. None of them seem to have ever come to fruition.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Noddy Blow Croquet
description:
Target game with 6 targets, all characters from the Noddy books. The targets are all standing and there is an arch between their legs.

Each player gets a 'plastic straw' and there is a plastic ball. Place the targets at one end of the table. Players start at the other end.

The idea is to blow the ball through an arch and thus score points. The winner is the player with the most points after an agreed set time has elapsed.

name: Noddy's Birthday Party Game
description:
A rather complicated board for the age group that would normally enjoy a Noddy related game.

Each player chooses a character and the associated playing piece. There are 6 face-down counters and when you set off along the track you must take one. Turn it over and that tells you which present you are taking to Noddy's house (example present might be a cake).

The first track to move along is the red one. If you land on white numbered squares, they will help you. If you land on black numbered squares then that will be a hazard. However the game at this point is a little different to normal Goose-type games. When arriving on a hazard square, refer to the list in the rules. Hazards relate to the presents. So, if you were carrying the cake, then a hazard for any other present would not apply.

After reaching the end of the red track, you start moving along the letters that spell Noddy (located in the centre of the board). You must reach the end of the fifth letter Y and then set off on the return journey which will end on the letter N.

Finally you move a long the white circles to Noddy's house. However, on this path there are three circles that feature two colours. If you land on one of these and your counter is one of these two colours, then you have to wait until the player with other colour reaches this circle. That wait could be a long one which might well bore the player affected. I guess the designer wanted to make a game that allowed the back-markers to catch up, which is fair enough.

The winner is the first to arrive at Noddy's house.

name: The Potions Game
description:
NEVER PUBLISHED

Players are student alchemists, taking turns exploring the academy grounds, obtaining ingredients to make potions. Ingredients come in five types, each type found in a different region of the board, or by drawing random cards.

Play consists of rolling a die to move a pawn around the board, collecting cards from certain spaces. Groups of cards allow you make potions. You need to collect enough potions to win the game, but using the potions during the game gives you powerful advantages.

name: Leapfrog
description:
Leapfrog is an alquerque-style game played on a square board of 97 spaces in a complex pattern. Each player has a Frog King and 8 Frog Pawns and the winner is the first player to get their Frog King to the central space.

Each player on their turn moves one piece a series of "leaps" — each leap being over exactly one occupied or unoccupied space. If the final leap is over a friendly piece then the player must immediately make another move with that piece. If the final leap is over an opponent's piece then the turn passes to that opponent who must make a move with that piece.

Leapfrog was published in issue 7 of the Games and Puzzles Journal.

name: Das Bienenspiel
description:
The game board represents a honeycomb in the bee hive. The queen rests in the middle of the brood nest (brown cells) surrounded by her royal household. The colored cells above the brood nest show stored pollen (inside the pollen field there are yellow and brown pollen cells).
Yet above the pollen field the honey cells are located (yellow cells). The honeycomb is occupied by the queen and several workers and drones. The smallest bees are workers.

In Das Bienenspiel players try to get 3 cards of honey and 3 cards of pollen. This is achieved by reaching either honey or pollen cells and claiming one. After each claim the player pawn has to return to the central brood nest unless he is able to hit a spot with a drone which allows the player to immediately turn around and go for another card.

Players have to move the full roll amount and must not enter cells which are occupied by bees or other player pawns.
Player with the full set of 6 cards (3+3) need to return to the queen cell to win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rolly Boys
description:
Objective: score most points hitting 'rolly boys' with a ball (skittle)
- acting by turns -
5 moveable (rotating) rolly boys (skittles), horizontally mounted on a staff, must be hit by a ball; flip the ball against a skittle (with values from 1 - 5) causing a rotation; achieved numbers should be summed up.
remarks:
typical design of wood working, located in the Erz mountains

name: Ko-Scha
description:
Objective: gain as many treasures as possible sailing in dangerous waters - game ends after all treasures are kept by players
- moving/acting by turns -
each player moves according die roll; if your ship enters the treasure island you may take a treasure - 1 or 2(max) of totally 13 - and sail home; but there are islands and shoals (light blue squares) which block or complicate (less freight) your way home.
You can get rid of your treasures passing an island, but you may load them onto your ship again with a matching die.

name: Fürstlich Fürstenbergische Brauerei
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space
- moving by turns -
each player rolls the die moving forward; ending on a marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
simple "Roll & Move" game with educational elements (beer history)

name: "Toste"-Spiel AHA
description:
Objective: be the first forming the letters 'AHA' with 9 small coloured sticks
- acting by turns -
all players get 9 wooden sticks with the same colour each;
active player rolls the coloured die three times; if your own colour is shown add one stick forming the word 'AHA'. If you got that colour twice within a turn - remove all sticks and start again.
remarks:
should had been published before WWII; confusing cover shows two dice, but none of them - 6d6 & 6dsymbols - is used/added.

name: Max und Moritz
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (80)
- moving by turns -
each player rolls the die, moving forward; ending on a marked space follow instructions, additionally read aloud text, originated from the book novelist Wilhelm Busch
remarks:
cute pewter figures
three different editions - 107, 107/1 and 107/2

name: Das lenkbare Luftschiff
description:
Objective: be the first to reach target space
- moving by turns -
A roll-and-move race game portraying an airship journey combine with all possible incidents, even fire => quite impressive: drawing of a parachuter
Ending on (such a) marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
beautiful paintings, pewter figures, large board
should be published ~1910's
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Educational, Racing

name: Legends: Dice
description:
This game is played with two deck of cards in where one is the dungeon the other is the village.
