With a bag of dice the player must roll the dice and with the result gain certain amount of mana,cash,attack,and shields. After the rolls the player must decide to visit de village or go down in the dungeon to fight a monster (classical fantasy dingeon game yes I know). The game ends when 5 Clock cards are out of the decks and the player with more Prestige points wins.

What makes this game unique is it exploits a dice pool of 21 dice and that the level system is based on a poker style achievements. You are allowed to carry 3 cards of each color.
Blue cards are Potions
Red cards are skills and spells
Green cards are Equipment
Yellow cards are Magical Time Artifacts (their power increases has the clock cards show up)

name: Lustiges Reisespiel
description:
Object of the game:
Be the first arriving at target space (Berlin/73)

Simple 'Roll and Move' game, learning the cities & places of interest of Germany before WWI. Ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on lid inside.
Equipped with pewter figures (cars) and cute drawings game communicates a special feeling of that age/time.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: In The Club
description:
Join the party with this tongue in cheek card game. Impress the ladies with crazy dances, exotic drinks and cheesy pick-up lines.

Players draw five "move" cards, a mixture of pick-up lines, dances, name-drops and outfits and cock-block cards. Then, players choose a location in the club to "make their move".

Locations include:
The Bar - players may exchange "move" cards for drink cards and play drink cards as well as other move cards.
The Dance Floor - players get a bonus to "dance moves" but cannot play name-drops or pick-up lines.
The VIP - players exchange a move card for entry, but receive a bonus for name drop cards. All other move cards can be played.
The Balcony - players get bonuses to pick-up lines and can play all other move types except dance moves.
The Bathroom - players can draw back up to 5 move cards.

The player who makes the best move, as scored by the total point value of all move cards made that round, impresses the lady that round. The next round, a new lady is eligible to impress, and the game continues until the lady total equals the winning total as determined by the number of players.

name: Pax East Wizard Duel
description:
Wizard Duel is a card game being played at the 2013 Penny Arcade Expo East. Players join one of 3 schools and roam the convention looking for other wizards to duel, and fight with a deck containing Bolt, Burst and Shield spells.
When you meet a rival wizard, call out a gravitas-laden challenge that will shake the heavens with it's fury (but not too loud). Each wizard will then select a card from his or her deck and reveal them dramatically at the same time.

A Bolt is a quick spell that strikes first to defeat the more complex Blast.
A Blast effects a large area and will easily circumvent a Shield
A Shield spell creates a wall of force that can ward off any Bolt.

The wizard with the victorious spell is... victorious! If wizards cast the same spell, they strike each other in an explosion that would easily deplete any special effects budget. The wizards then pick a new spell and the duel continues until one is defeated.

The triumphant wizard claims all cards his or her opponent used in the duel. After Pax, the points are tallied and one school is crowned champion!

name: Wir reisen nach Berlin
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (Berlin)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; you may choose (depending on the very first die roll) one of 3 different routes (car/Train/plane) to travel to Berlin; ending on a marked space follow instructions.

remarks:
very cost saving publication (1949!) => map, instructions, slipcase. Instructions reflect typical terms of that time/age like "Interzonen-food stamp" or "delousing"; incidents like 'carrying along a Westgerman newspaper - go back to...' describe daily encounters at the inner German border.
For the purposes of Berlin's 750 year celebration game was republished in 1987.
publishers: Berliner Festspiele GmbH, Hof- und Waisenhaus-Buchdruckerei

name: Il Domino Della Giornata
description:
A language learning game, designed to study the conjugation of Italian verbs (both regular and irregular). With the 48 tiles the game tells the story of a day in the life of the Grilli family. Each tile has a picture on the left side and a text on the right side. In the text the verbs are all in the infinitive form, and have to be conjugated when the tile is played, but it can be checked in the instructions whether the correct form was used.
All the tiles are numbered. The game starts with the tile number 1 and based on the description tile number 2 needs to be found and so on.
The game can be played solo or in large groups (e.g. Italian classes).

name: Reise durch Oberbayern und Tirol
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 68
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a any image follow instructions glued on cover inside.

remarks: game belongs to the series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele" with very nice graphics/images;
as usual - cute pewter figures
seems to be the predecessor of Von München durch Oberbayern nach Tirol

name: Im Märchenwald
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space 'E'
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a numbered space follow instructions of the rule sheet

remarks:
unbalanced events
pretty the same sequence & events/board compared with Im Märchenland

name: Das Kathreinerspiel
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 75 (die roll must match)
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a red marked space follow instructions printed on the map.

remarks:
simple 'Roll & Move' game, budget-friendly promotional edition (map only)
map measures: 15.65 x 10.2 inches
drawings convey a feeling about an outing during 1930's in Bavaria

name: Gazala
description:
Gazala is a low complexity wargame on the Battle of Gazala. The game can be played either solitaire or with two players.

Each player has an objective that they must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

The rules are only three pages long. The game also includes a counter sheet and a map that can be printed at 11x17 (A3) or 8.5x11 (A4).
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Malifaux: Exorcist
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

The Exorcist is a minion for the Guild.

With a walk of 3” and no charge the Exorcist is one of the slowest Guild models. To get around this the Exorcist has a zero action Driven by Purpose which makes the model suffer one wound and pushes it 3”.

With only 7 wounds and a lack of healing in the Guild Faction, the Exorcist will not make much use of this action but it is useful for positioning him or pushing him out of melee range.

The Exorcist is armed with a Sanctified Crossbow. This weapon has range of 10” and is Magical. Like most Guild models it has Critical Strike built in, giving the weapon a nice damage profile of 3/4/5 with the abilities to get to 4/5/6. With a CB of 5 the Exorcist is likely to hit most minions.

The Exorcist enables Lady Justice to deal full damage against Spirits by granting her already impressive Greatsword Magical. Combined with that and Blind Justice to ignore Pitiful and Harmless, she can shore up her weakness against Kirai with this minion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Malifaux: Pale Rider
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

A minion for the Guild.

The Guild's own Rider, the Pale Rider is a fast-moving ranged combatant, with some clever ways to get increased offensive ability, resilience, and mobility. Depending on when you activate the Rider, the Pale Rider can be a hard-hitting ranged attacker or a fairly resilient and fast (if expensive) objective-grabber.

Like the other Riders, the Pale Rider is fairly fragile for its cost, and likely to be destroyed quickly if directly targeted. However, the Rider is full of tricks and options to keep that from happening. Also like all the Riders, the Pale Rider has a complex adjustable Ability that you can use to give the Pale Rider different abilities depending on your need.

The Pale Rider is a Guild model and offers a lot of mobility to the usually-slow Guild, but it also has significant synergy with Leveticus. You're most likely to see the Pale Rider with either C. Hoffman or Leveticus.

C. Hoffman can benefit from the Pale Rider's fast movement with his Drawn to Metal ability, and can boost the Pale Rider with healing, Reactivations, or just using its attacks with Machine Puppet. The Pale Rider is one of the three most likely models for carrying Hoffman around (alongside the Peacemaker and the Mechanical Rider.)

Leveticus doesn't have a lot of synergy with the Pale Rider as a Master, but the Pale Rider usually operates solo anyway, and Avatar Leveticus gets significant benefit from having the Pale Rider in play. Avatar Leveticus can also summon the Pale Rider after Manifesting.

Other Guild Masters may benefit from the Pale Rider's speed, since many Guild models are quite slow.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: FIVE-OH!
description:
FIVE-OH! Is a card game with a humorous approach towards society’s finest. The “boys in blue”. Collect cards to form units of different types of cops. Solve crimes as they pop up with specific units you have gathered. Watch out, there are action cards also that can change the police force you have so diligently been recruiting! You never know what will come up, just like in real life “on the beat”.

Players start with five cards in their hand. During game play, you have numerous different actions to choose from on your turn. You are attempting to collect different types of "cop" cards in order to "address" calls for service you choose to play. Solving or rather "resolving" calls for service results in points, depending on the difficulty of the call for service and the number/types of cops required. The winner is the first one to acquire 50 points worth of solved calls for service. The trick to that is you want to make sure you don't have a lot of unresolved calls in front of you because they count against your final score at the end!

The game incorporates dice as well for "shootout" cards. A simple mechanic in which the bad guys hit on a roll of "6" and the cop(s) hit on a "5" or "6". Winning shootouts get you points as well, losing shootouts costs you cops you have gathered.

There are also actions that allow you to recruit (steal) cops from other players (precincts), get extra cards for "grants", etc.

There is a lot going on in this game! You must keep an eye on your opponent's precinct, as well as try to manage your own.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting
publishers: Chaffee Shack Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: BattleAxe
description:
BattleAxe
by Nick Ryan

BattleAxe is an dark age battlefield warefare simulation tabletop game for 2 players (or 2 teams) that allows the players to use their strategic skills against each others armies. The main goal is to kill the opponent's King. Each army consists of 26 numbered men, 2 warhorses. Your army including axe-men, spearmen, swordsmen, archers, an engineer, horsemen and 1 king, all with different and balanced attributes. The fighting/attacking mechanism is an elegant 1 to 3 custom dice rolling system. Each player has the exact same army, similar to Chess, as to see which player really has superior strategic skills. Asymmetrical games can also be played with endless scenarios.

Each player has an "Army Map" sheet for his army which illustrates and keeps track of each warrior and warhorse. Each man in your army has his own health meter, skills, attributes, and even a place for the player to name them. This gives an unparalleled up-close-and-personal view from the battlefield. Engineers are a big part of the game, they can cut down trees, construct archer towers to enhance their attack range, walls, fire trenches and even make extra arrows for your archers. The concept of fire, from fire arrows and fire trenches symbolized by "wild fire" tiles are also a big part of the game. Fire can spread and take down your walls and towers which creates a real feel of the chaos of war.

It's who the better strategic commander is, not who can level up faster with fairy dust and gold coins.
It's dividing and concurring enraged enemy forces, not gathering grain for the winter.
It's swiftly destroying the opposing King and all his men to become the one true King of the battlefield.
It's BattleAxe.

name: Der lustige Sturzflieger
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (150) with a matching die roll
- moving by turns -

basically a 'snake and ladders' approach with a few specialities:
- very large board
- war game theme
- belittlement of aerial war
- according instructions 'suitable for the very young ones'
which should give this game a special place..
should had been published end 1930's/beginning 40's
cute meeples
winners (1st/2nd/3rd) get gold/silver/bronze medal
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Racing, World War II

name: Het Grote Voortplantingsspel
description:
Are you fast enough to be the first to the nucleus of the egg and getting the rest to leave you behind? Do not hesitate to challenge your friends, siblings or parents for this thrilling game about reproduction.

The first to reach the egg, win glory for himself and his posterity. However, this will not be easy because the road is littered with questions about men, women, pregnancy, love and so much more. As if this was not enough, you should really watch out for the other sperm. They will do everything for you to interfere with you at unexpected moments to attack and chase away!

The Game:
-has an exciting game concept about sex education, combined with scientific content
-lowers the threshold to talk about sexuality
-was developed by experienced authors in collaboration with Sensoa (Flemish Centre for Sexual Education)
-can be played with two to four players or teams

name: Auf dem Schulwege
description:
Objective: be the first entering space '48' (school)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
Roll the die - ending on any space follow instructions printed on the board
remarks:
published ~1900

name: Sport: Die Ertüchtigung des Volkes
description:
Objective:
be the first reaching target space
- moving by turns -
each player rolls the die moving forward; ending on a marked space/image follow instructions...

remarks: due to logo & theme game should had been published between 1936 (Olympic Games in Berlin) and 1939 (change of logo);
game/theme added to Nazi-indoctrination in those days
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Educational, Sports

name: Die Reichsautobahnen
description:
three different games are proposed:
- moving/acting by turns -
1. choose one of the six different routes, being the first reaching your target space
2. start at six different positions being the first reaching the centrally located city of 'Eisenach'
3. be the very last one after hunting/catching successfully all other players

remarks:
should had been published in between 1936/1938
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Stop-Over Braunschweig
description:
The game consists of two sub-games.
In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all braunschweig-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.
This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game (backside of the board) journalists try to get the cover-story (word-guessing approach) before other players can beat them by running up the stairs of the publisher's office first.

name: Stop-Over Mainz
description:
The game consists of two sub-games.
In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Mainz-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.
This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game (backside of the board) journalists try to get the cover-story (word-guessing approach) before other players can beat them by running up the stairs of the publisher's office first.

In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Oberhausen-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Wiesbaden-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

name: Stop-Over Hagen
description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Hagen-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

name: They're Here!
description:
A cooperative, card-driven game where players take on the role of ordinary citizens trying to drive of the little green men who are invading their town.

You will move from location to location, rescuing trapped citizens, battling aliens and facing unexpected events.

The objective is to reach the alien landing zone and defeat the alien army in a final, guns-blazing showdown.

GAMEPLAY
The basic mechanic involves building a deck from a random selection of the game's location cards. Each game will be a different experience as players will not know which locations will be available in each play.

Each player chooses a character template (a hero) which will determine the items, skills and abilities the player will have at their disposal.

One at a time, the location cards are revealed and resolved.

There will be events to manage, battles to fight and citizens to save. Heroes will find items as they go, putting these items to use in order to accomplish the task of defeating the aliens.

Combat is handled by rolling a pool of custom dice, which include hero dice, alien dice and friendly fire dice. By managing the results of each roll, the players will battle their way to victory and possibly, to defeat.

name: Iron-Core
description:
Iron-Core is primarily as a vehicle vs. vehicle combat system. Although infantry play an important role, they are not the primary focus of the game. A typical game will consist of one to five armored vehicles and, three to seven squads of infantry or support units.

The game is designed to play like a WWII simulation. Every effort was taken to use and distill actual WWII vehicle and combat data in the creation of the vehicle stats and game play. Unlike modern warfare, not every shot will hit its target and many hits will not penetrate your opponent’s armor and result in an instant kill. Two evenly matched vehicles may find themselves in an extended engagement, trading shot for shot until one finds a soft spot and makes the kill.

The decision to base the play style and game mechanics on a more antiquated technology was a conscious one, born from the desire to add more depth to the combat than a simple “Roll D6, four or better, you kill your target”. Vehicles, regardless of the manufacturer represent more of a financial investment than infantry units do. With this in mind, the number of large units required to play Iron-Core have been reduced as the vehicle and infantry survivability has been extended to a more descriptive and cinematic feel.

Our goal is to provide a game system that rewards tactics and punishes suicide runs. Applying bonuses and penalties based on unit position, unit formations, moral, and support fire and tactics; you will find that an inferior force can defeat a superior force with the application of some tactical forethought. Many of optional rules may slow play but highly recommended.

There are many game systems available, each have their own strengths, weaknesses and focus. If you are looking for a brigade level combat game, Iron-Core may not be the best choice. If you want a dynamic vehicle vs. vehicle combat system where having the biggest and the best does not equate to an “I win” button, then Iron-Core may be the game for you.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Take Over
description:
Game play is conventional round the board turns with risk and reward squares. The players hold shares in companies and gain or lose money whilst trying to get shares from other players. They can also buy and sell bull and bear positions to bet on rises and falls in company stocks.

The goal of the game is to acquire all the shares of a company, which causes the game to end, and have the most cash when the game ends.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding

name: Vom Fels zum Meer
description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 66 (German coast) - starting in Friedichshafen
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; cards are drawn to determine starting positions; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued inside the lid.

remarks:
should had been published ~1910
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Travel

name: Buffalo Bill
description:
Objective: be the first catching all enemies or capture their headquarter
- moving by turns -
2 players (or groups) - red Indians & (blue) cowboys) try to catch each other by rolling the die;
remarks:
published during late 1950's/early 60's
similar to - compared with Tom Mix in Texas

name: Abgesperrt
description:
Objective: block your opponent's balls
- acting by turns -
each player moves two coloured balls each to block other player's movement; the quicker the game proceeds the higher the possibility to stumble..
remarks:
published ~1920/30's

name: Mages in the Marketplace
description:
Mages in the Marketplace is a highly interactive deck-building game where each player takes on the role of one of four mages. Each mage may also select one of four familiars, minor elementals that grow in power as they are fed magic. These mages are vying to become the richest and most famous, each for their own individual reasons.

The twist: Players take their turns simultaneously, and when it is time to decide which card they would like to purchase from the center, all mages hide their selection, revealing them together. Any player who is alone purchases their card without worry, but any time multiple players wish to purchase the same card, a duel takes place between their familiars. The crowd cheers for the winner, who then purchases that card, whereas the losing familiar becomes hurt and its master must find a new card to purchase.

The mages include:
The Magician: a master of showmanship. He uses impressive magic to generate extra Fame.
The Seer: a mage with the ability to see into the future. She can influence what order she draws her spells in.
The Sorcerer: a chaotic mage with little control, and less desire for it. His unpredictable nature makes him difficult to defeat in battle.
The Wizard: an old academic with a deep understanding of magic itself. His mana generation is second to none.

The familiars come in four basic flavours, Air, Earth, Fire, and Water, and as one feeds their Elemental they may blend them together into more complicated beasts - by combining Fire and Water, for example, one may create a Steam Elemental. All combinations are represented, including the all-powerful Omni Elemental!

Note: "Mages in the Marketplace" is a working title.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Baseball Fever
description: The fun filled trivia board game created in the spirit of baseball. It has everything a trivia board game should, including questions covering not only baseball but a wide range of general knowledge. Just like Americas favorite sport, you win or lose Baseball Fever with runs, hits, balls and strike outs. All it takes is strategy, skill and a little bit of luck.

name: Warfare
description:
Warfare is a fast paced, constantly changing, strategic contest for immortal glory, all taking place in your living room.Meet your friends on the field of battle and see who has the mettle to lead their army to victory!

Warfare is played with 2-4 players facing off with four unique Units on a 13x13 grid. Players can use a turn to move, redeploy, attack, or attempt to capture a target.

the players battle each other by rolling their individual dice. whenever a player wins a battle they receive a Victory Bonus card which gives them buffs that can affect the attack, defend or movement number they roll,or can be special actions like "Nuclear Strike" or "Deploy 2 Units". the losing player must remove their unit from play and discard it's Unit Type card and any assigned victory bonus cards.They can always redeploy their unit and get a new Unit Type card, this way the Unit's change constantly. having more than one unit in attack range of an enemy or a target adds to a attack, defend or capture roll.

once the players have collected 2 victory bonuses on one Unit they can attempt to capture one of the corner targets. the corner targets have different defense Numbers and the players have to roll to beat them. if a player rolls less than the defense number they forfeit a Victory bonus.

once all four of the corner Targets are captured. the players race to capture the center "Primary Target" the first player to capture the Primary Target Wins!
categories: Dice, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kipling: The Seemingly Saying Something Game
description:
Kipling (the Seemingly Saying Something Game) is a card/token voting game exploring themes of complex communication – saying one thing, but meaning another – for 2 to 8 players, ages 11 and over. The game is based Kipling’s six questions, in our case ordered as Why, What, How, for the intent and (in no particular order) Where, When and Who for the content.

On each turn, one player is the Speaker, who is randomly dealt a Why, a What and a How card, which can be Good, Neutral or Bad. From these, the Speaker makes up a sentence and says it to the player on their left, the Spoken To, in the style required by the cards without showing the cards to the other players.

Each other player then votes on each of the three categories, Why/What/How and chooses Good/Neutral/Bad, in clockwise order starting with the Spoken To player. During and before this phase the Speaker and Spoken To can play Jokers to double or redouble the score for that round if they choose to. Once votes are in, the Speaker reveals the cards they were dealt, and the scores are calculated; one point for each correct guess, with the potential for an extra point for the Spoken To each turn, because they will have an extra token for voting.

If nobody or everybody finds the correct combination of three intent cards, the storyteller scores 0, and each of the other players scores 1 point for each individual part they got correct. Otherwise the storyteller shares the same score as whoever found the complete answer; usually a score 3 or 4. Jokers might double this to up to 4 or 8 depending on cards in play and who was the correct player.

The game ends when a player scores 16 or more points, but this threshold should be increased for larger numbers of players. In either case, the player with the most points wins the game. If there is a draw, the player who spoke most is the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Squirrels Fun House: Lost and Drunk
description:
Squirrel goes out for a few drinks with his friends and ends up getting smashed. When he goes to walk home, he finds himself in a hallucinated alcoholic wonderland!
The objective in this game is to be the first one to get Squirrel home. Sounds easy enough, but the twisted trail loaded with booby traps and treasures, along with the drinking challenge, creates a great board game for all drinking game fans.
First pick a starter. The game comes with some creative ideas for this. Then everybody rolls one dice and moves along the trail accordingly. The trail is filled with short cuts filled with Jail spots. When a player lands in Jail, they must finish their drink before returning to gameplay. On the main yellow trail, players are likely to land on the Golden Acorns. Landing here means the player gets bonus turns by guessing high, low, odd, or even, based on their previous roll, and they keep going untill they guess wrong. Simply follow the yellow trail and everybody will make it to the finish, but the twisted trail makes this an interesting tricky challenge. Luckily the game comes with a map that will show you the way. The game also comes with sober cab rules so everybody can play. If you are a power hour fan, you will definately like the drinking challenge built into this game. The challenge is that every time you land on a "D" Spot, you must take the number of drinks that you rolled to get there. Over all, This is a unique and simple drinking board game that anyone over 21 can easily learn, and start the challenge of being the first player to get Squirrel home alive.

name: Oblasta
description:
Oblasta is a simple, fast playing, two player abstract stategy game.
Players take turns rolling two sided playing pieces, and using them to perform actions on the board. Each side allows the player to perform differnt actions on. But, the player is limited to eight pieces, and the pieces used to roll, are also the pieces used as units on the gameboard. So players are forced to try and strike a balance between units in their hand powering units on the board, and units on the board actually fighting the conflict.
A player wins by either, eliminating all the opponents offensive units, or by postioning his own offensive units in an unbreakable defensive postion.

name: Industry Giants
description:
In this game players are entrepreneurs who produce, transport and sell goods to 6 European cities.

The game introduces the full business cycle where primary resources need to be bought, transformed into secondary resources (materials) and then into final goods ready to be sold to consumers. Factories are built, upgraded and close down, workers are hired and replaced by machines as players try to maximize their profits observing the environment and the competitors.

This whole process is embodied into a dynamic economic environment. Cities develop as population migrates, new industries are built, closed or relocated, wages are increased and resources/materials prices fluctuate. Development brings higher demand, which players try to control through advertising.
Players also need to manage the transportation circuit and either invest now for future payoffs (opponents pay more to the owner of a route and the latter earns money when population migrates through his network) or try to handle the long-term costs.
Contracts which will be available each round, will inject players with critical cash (as there are no loans) but ending unfulfilled they will incur penalties.

For 2 players (and the solo) there is also an automated player who exploits opportunities and antagonizes the players without being complicated.

The game ends after the round when either all spaces have been built or one player has built all his factories (for the one and two players additional conditions for the automated player may also end the game).
At the end, each player's efficiency will be calculated as a percentage between 0 and 100, taking into account a number of parameters such as cash, sales, production lines, etc.A hidden card, dealt randomly to each player from the beginning, will solve ties.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Sehen und Begreifen
description:
'Look and Learn' (English name) is designed to stimulate a child's ability to "discriminate between objects, to compare them, to grasp relationships between them, and to sort according to common characteristics." (From the box bottom.)

Up to seven different games are possible using the multi-picture boards and picture tiles included. Three of them are described here:

1. Picture lotto
Each player gets a player board. Boards that aren't needed and the corresponding tiles are removed from the game. The remaining tiles are shuffled and placed on the table, colour side up. The game master picks up one tile after the other, shows the picture and names the pictured object. The player whose board contains the same picture calls out, gets the tile and places it on his/her board. The first player to have covered all the images on his/her board wins the game.

2. Picture quiz
The game master shows a picture without naming it. The player who has the picture on his/her board calls out, but they only get the tile if they can name the object. The opposite way is possible too: The game master doesn't show the picture but names the object shown on the tile. The player who finds the picture on his/her board gets the tile. The first player to have covered all the images on his/her board wins the game.

3. Memory lotto
Each player gets a board. He/she gets 30 seconds to memorise the images. Then the player boards are placed on the table, face down. The game master picks up one tile after the other and shows the image or names the object. The player who thinks the image is on his/her own player board calls out. The tile is placed face up next to the player board. If two players call out simultaneously, the game master puts the tile at the bottom of his/her stack. If an image isn't claimed by any of the players, the tile is removed from the game. When the game master has used all the tiles, the players reveal their boards. For each matching tile, they get two points; for each incorrect or missing one, one point is subtracted. The player with the most points wins the game.

More game variations are possible using the different colors on the backs of the picture tiles and multi-picture boards.

The box indicates that it was "Made in Western-Germany".
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory

name: Clinical Anatomy
description:
"Clinical Anatomy is an incredible study aid that plays like a game! Memorize and learn the name, location and function of more than 600 muscles, 206 bones, nearly 60 organs, 150 named nerves and 150 named blood vessels, and dozens of joints in the human body." (From the website.)

Gameplay is nearly identical to Trivial Pursuit. Players start with their token on any spot on the board. Dice are rolled to move the tokens around the board, and the players answer questions based on the subject their token lands on, such as "GA101" (General Anatomy 101), "GA102", "Cadaver Lab", and "Potluck". Correct answers garner the player an individual letter to add to their collection. The first player to collect enough letters to spell "clinical anatomy" is the winner.

name: Bance!
description:
The challenge was to create a game that uses all the worst bits of many of the bad games that Flip the Table regularly disparage, including roll-and-play ("Surprise!") and press-your-luck games, but especially Monopoly because @tableflipsyou actually likes Monopoly!

The game essentially consists of players bidding for turn order, with payments paid to subsequent players, with the added complication of the need for money to be exchanged due to restricted access to various denominations. This is followed by choice of a variety of dice movement strategies, in order to arrive back at GO! with exactly $200 (no more, no less).

During movement, if two players arrive at the same square a variant of SNAP (The BANCE! action) allows for players to steal one another's money. NOTE: The game is deliberately complex and there is a strong possibility that it will last for a long time, depending on whether players have realised that it is intended to be torturous.
categories: Economic, Humor, Math, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Eagle Alight: The Lunar Lander Board Game
description:
In honour of the FAVOURITE Computer Game (Arcade), Lunar Lander, and the 40th anniversary of the (faked?) Apollo 11 Moon Landings, here is "Eagle Alight", a Lunar Lander inspired board game.

Use fuel, Fuel, FUEL to rotate and slow your craft for an “Eagle Has Landed” moment! This is effectively a simulation of gravity on two hex maps: One with a small playing piece for the larger wide scale view of the moon surface; the other representing the various landing sites by use of layered colour hexes, with a larger playing piece to represent the ship in close-up. In the interest of best representing the original game, the two boards need to be double sided, with one side giving the large scale where the two boards are placed side by side (landscape).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Banco Imobiliário: Cidade Olímpica
description: Brazilian version of Monopoly with Rio de Janeiro's famous neighborhoods and natural features wiyh the Olympic Games theme.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Das Königreich der Tiere
description:
Objective:
be the first getting 7 'Wissens-Bons'
- acting by turns -
Each player moves along a travel-route all over the world. Stepping on a 'star' space you must give correct answer (sometimes multiple choice) to receive one 'Bon'.

name: WarOFGa Trading Cards
description:
Intro: A set of 32 GamePatra that are based on characters of forthcoming online game - 'War of Fascinating Galaxies' (WarOFGa). These trading cards make learning and memorising Physics concepts fun and part of a game.

Aim: The game can be played in many way and the aim is to gather maximum number of cards for your collection.

Game Play: Each player brings a pack or all equally divide a pack
Both players reads out the number on the card at the top
The payer with the lesser numbered card can ask for the title of the other player’s card. If she/he can recall the contents of the card, then she/he does not have to surrender the card
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Science Fiction

name: The Gracie Allen Murder Case
description:
Based on the 1930's movie. A simple children's race game. Collect evidence, until you have the arch criminal enmeshed in the evidence chain.

With wooden impliments, 24 cards, 2 dices etc.

name: The Peninsular Campaign
description:
(from Deer Valley Game Company website:)

The Peninsular Campaign is an operational level game using the block unit system to re-create the limited intelligance of the actual campaign. Players maneuver their forces without adequate knowledge of their opponents strengths or even location.

The game board covers the actual and potentional topography of McClellan's offensive operations in the Spring of 1862; from the rugged hills covering Richmond's southern approach and the swamplands covering its northeast approach to the protective confines of the C.S.S. Virginia's base port of Norfolk. A point to point movement system is employed on a 20 x 24 playing map.

Limited command abilities and critical supply wagons are key to managing your armies and achieving victory.

name: Megadungeon!: The Catacombs of Chaos
description:
Designer's blurb:
Megadungeon! is a monster-slaying, treasure-looting dungeon delve suitable for the whole family. Each player selects one of three characters, warrior, sorcerer, or thief. Each player, on their turn, draws a random dungeon tile, places it and moves their character into it. Thus, you are able to explore a completely different dungeon every time you play.

This game has been nearly a year in the making, with nearly ten months of playtesting and revision, and the end result is, in my own biased opinion, a fantastic, family-friendly boardgame reminiscent of great old games like Tactical Studies Rules (TSR)'s Dungeon! and SPI's DeathMaze: Heroic Adventure in the Corridors of Doom.
mechanics: Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Pesah Matza U'Maror
description:
Triplets Passover game
It's a card game for the entire family. Players gain knowledge of various concepts related to the Passover story in a fun, dynamic setting

A set of three cards constitutes a triplet
The three concepts represented in the three cards may be connected to a proverbial saying from Jewish sources (the Torah or the Passover Haggadah). Alternately, three figures can make up a triplet if they share a familial connection.

name: Wer wird Quizsieger?
description:
Objective: gain most victory points giving correct answer as fast as possible
- acting simultaneously -
active player turns the spinner; spinner (mounted on a disc) ends up pointing at a letter & a theme (similar to http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/12043/stadt-land-fluss); get the name first collecting a victory point;
remarks:
several discs available
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

name: Der gute Schupo
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (space 60 before WWII/space 50 after WWII) & learn traffic rules
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on lid inside.

remarks:
pewter figures -
changing designs over the decades due to product lifecycle - from very first edition 1926 to last edition 1955 with different boards & boxes/meeples
remarks on the board (for the children) are made in rhyme form

name: Deja Moo!
description:
Box Description: 100% Pasturized fun. In this moo-tastic matching game all you have to do is pick the pairs from the herd as fast as you can!

Spread the cards on the table face up. This is the HERD. Then, all players should "One, Two, Deja Moo!" and the game begins. Now all players search the cards in the HERD, looking for matching pairs of cows. There are no turns. Once all cards are gone from the HERD, each players counts the cards they have collected, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Ozeanflug: Im Fluge um die Welt
description:
Objective: Be the first finishing a round-the-world trip by plane
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on an illustrated space follow instructions...
remarks:
published early/mid 1930's
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing

name: Grübel-Grübel
description:
Objective:
gain most victory point finding matching terms
- acting by turns -
like in a quiz active player is challenged to find - as fast as possible - seven matching terms for a give task
the noise of the clock does not really a relaxing sphere..

name: Dozey's Dozy Day
description:
A game for very young children. It appeared in the Playhour Annual in 1973. It 'stars' a character called Dozey Dormouse.

Use counters and a die. Move according to your roll. If you land on one of the seven Dozey illustrations, miss a turn "for a doze".

The first player to reach space 53, wins.

name: Divorce Wars
description: In turn, a player moves one's pawn to the next unoccupied interesection ar corner. When a player reaches The Attorney, The Kids, The Shrink, The Dating Scene, or The Court that player draws an Experience CArd to see if that player will be awarded a Milestone. The player who collects a Milestone from each area and reachs the "You're a Winner" area is the victor.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: The Train Race Game
description:
Young children's game from the Playhour Annual 1984.

You can join this race with counters and dice! Choose to be either Sam Steam train or Digby Diesel. Throw the dice and move your counter along the track the number of spaces shown on the dice. If a player's counter lands on a red space, that player misses a turn. When you reach the middle of the track you can go either way round to avoid a crash. The one to reach the other end of the track first is the winner.

name: CityProGame Bremen
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Bremen each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

The same game, placed in Berlin is called "Gesellschaftsspiel Berlin" (see separate entry).
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Educational, Travel

name: CityProGame Köln
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Cologne each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Educational, Travel

name: CityProGame Rhein-Neckar Dreieck
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of teh Rhein-Neckar region each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

name: CityProGame Stuttgart
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Stuttgart each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Educational, Travel

name: Scrapland Scramble
description:
The airship marked a turning point in society. Now the skies were open to exploration, commerce, and illegal activity. The clouds became hiding places for Speakeasies, black market dealers, and much more unsavory activities. As a result, the Sky Patrol was created to help keep the peace. In an attempt to avoid being arrested during a recent “job”, you have accidentally wrecked your airship along with a few unlucky others. Fix your airship as quickly as possible to avoid certain incarceration!

On your turn, you roll dice trying to match them to a type of component (using simple icons). Once you know what it looks like, you search for a token that has the same icons, trying to recover a piece of your airship. Once recovered, airship components grant special abilities like making your turns easier or even griefing opponents.

Not all the tokens are useful. Most of the time, the player will select a token that is of no use to them and place it back in the pile. Memorization skills are necessary to ensure a player doesn't needless pick up the same token again and to remember where opponents have placed tokens the player needs. But with the special abilities that can be earned, the tokens can be shifted multiple times per game.

The first player to collect all of their tokens to complete their airship wins the game.

name: Little shark
description: Up until now a squid and its friends - lots of little fish - have been playing happily together in the sea. However, a racy little shark has suddenly appeared and is circling this group of playmates. Luckily the squid is able to spread lots of ink ! Now we need your help ! Come and play together and help save the squid and its friends by covering the shark in so much ink, that it can't see properly. Because a shark that dissapears in a 'soup of ink' cannot be dangerous anymore ! The excitement begins: Is the shark going to eat up 9 little fishes first ? Or will the squid manage to squirt enough ink to save his friends first?
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Rogue
description:
-Seize them! ...said the King.
My chambers were robbed!!
Those bandits took my treasures and they are escaping through the castle!

In Rogue you own one of the four thieves groups: Cult of Masks, Sentinels, Fox Guild, Narrow Path Clan and your purpose is to become the Master Rogue by leading your group to have the more Victory Points at the end of the game. To do that you must collect the most Treasure tokens. Each player owns 11 cards, 4 Master Thieves, 6 Gambits and 1 Black Market card (score card which gives you points depending on the treasure you have collected).

Each player chooses 1 Master Thief and 3 Gambits to begin the game and places the chosen cards face down on the table in an accessible (by all the players) area. All these cards form a mini deck of 16 cards. You never shuffle the deck. Now you cut the deck 3 times (one time each player) and the last player takes the deck, deals the cards on the table (4 rows x 4 cards each row, from the top left to the bottom right) and plays first. In each round, the player can do one of the following actions:Reveal a hidden card or to Exchange one of the cards in his/her hand, with a hidden card on the table. In that case the player who chooses the 2nd action, must place his new card faced up but note that this action costs you -1 Victory Point at the end of the game.

The Gambit cards have 2 different colored dice from the four colors you will find in the game (red, blue, green, yellow). When a Gambit card is revealed and in the same column (vertically) there is another Gambit, a Dispute takes place between the two. The players who own these Gambits, roll the corresponding dice and the one with the most hits takes a Treasure token. The Treasure tokens are faced down aside and when a dispute is commencing, you take one such token in random and place it on the Gambit cards, revealing the Treasure (the cards have been designed specifically for this purpose). In case of a tied dispute, the Treasure is lost (the King's guardians snatch it as your thieves flea to take cover). In case the 2 Gambits belong to the same thieves group, no dispute takes place as they work together to get the treasure. The player who owns them, takes a Treasure token immediately!

Each colored die represents a basic element: blue for Aqua, red for Ignis, green for Terra, yellow for Aura. The Master Thieve cards have those elements. The Master Thieves give additional skills to the Gambits when a Dispute takes place. For example when you roll a Red and a Green die for your Gambit and there is a faced up Master Thief on the table (your or your rivals') which represents Terra (green die), you add +1 Hit to the final result! Yet nothing is over. The Black Market cards have 4 different combinations of the Treasures, different for each player which grant him Victory Points, depending on the combination. But don't be so sure you can win the game since the Master Thieves can steal the Treasures from each other with a very tricky mechanic you will discover in the game. Beware.. If your Master Thief loses his Treasures, then you must place him sideways to deactivate his ability to steal, so you must place a new Master Thief to get revenge! Prepare yourself for the faster course of your life as no one knows of his victory, until the last card on the table is revealed!

A race begins...

A Thieves' Race!

name: Master LOL
description: It's a game made for making laugh the others. Each player will answear to the message sent by the narrator, writing the most original and funny thing. The 2 fastest players will take microfones to gain points in the improvisation points-track. Each player will then read his sentence and the others will vote with 1, 2 or 3 fingers (1 = not so fun, 2 = funny, 3 = hilarious). A player need a certain number of votes to gain points! Also, there are jokers that double the votes of a certain player. Master LOL is an unusual challenge for humorists! In one word, the game is made for laugh!

name: War Plan Red: North American Conflict
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Hodge Podge, It's Not Just Trivia
description:
It's not over until the game picks the winner. This game incorporates several mini-games that are played as you make your way to the End Game. Success in the mini-games help increase the possibility of winning the End Game ans thus be selected the winner.

Trivia, memory, dice rolling luck, and use of resources are combined to create a fun and challenging game. Not being good at trivia won't be a major stumbling block in this game, unlike other trivia games. And not having a good memory won't mean you are doomed to lose the game either.

Every game plays differently and there are several aspects to this game that adds excitement and fun. No matter how badly the game is going for you, you will still feel you have a chance right up until the winner is determined.

name: Halt die Strasse gesperrt  das neuzeitliche Verkehrsspiel
description:
Objective: be the first entering space '100' - learn traffic signs
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & move' game; ending on a illustrated space follow instructions printed on lid inside

name: Pluto on the Scent Game
description:
Place the 22 picnic cards. Each player in turn spins and moves his (or her) playing piece the number of spaces spun.

When a player lands on hot dog, he draws a picnic card and places it, color side up, in front of him.

When a player lands on a skunk, he must go back two spaces unless he has a picnic card. He discards one or more picnic cards to the bottom of the card pile and move forward one space for each card discarded. He may discard as many cards as he chooses. HINT: It may be a good idea to save some picnic cards for another turn.

The winner is the first player to reach Finish. A player does not need to spin the exact number to win.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pass auf!
description:
Objective: be the first entering space '90' - learn traffic signs
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & move' game; special: two (red & blue) separated routes, you may choose one of them; use two dice;
ending on a marked (red or blue) space follow instructions printed on lid inside.
remarks:
a stoplight is included, which must be operated with a battery & touched during described situations

name: LIFER
description:
Players of LIFER asume the role of prisoners in Rawdeal Prison, equipped only with a handful of cigarettes they use as currency to acquire their stash of inventory.

To begin, up to four players are dealt 6 cigarette cards of various values. These are then traded in turn for cards with the corresponding values in the Inventory deck. Players begin to amass equipment such as, Bolt Cutters, Files, Picks and Blueprints to set them en route to escape.

There are 3 separate routes out of jail, and prisoners must collect the correct combination of inventory cards to complete their escape. The first to collect the correct combination is the winner.

But all is not simple, the Inventory deck is peppered with Trick Cards, such as the Warden and the Thug, which allow players to poach cards from their opponents. There are also detention cards such as Solitary and Infirmary which alters players progress through the game.

name: Words of Art
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the party game Words of Art, players use the letter cards in their hand to build words – the catch is, the words have to relate to the text on the Description Card, or with the picture on the Art Card.

Luckily each of your cards shows two letters on it, and you choose which letter to use on each card. Each letter has a point value, plus you'll get bonus points for every card used, so creativity is rewarded!

name: Der Kampf gegen Rußland
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 50 (Warsaw)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; each player chooses the red (northern) or blue (southern) route;
move your meeple forward according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions.

remarks:
don't confuse Klee edition with the identically named Jos. Scholz edition;
all styles/explanations are being influenced by the spirit of that age/time.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, World War I

name: Course Puzzle
description:
4 players have similar puzzle with different colors and they start to race to build a puzzle on the middle of the table.
If the puzzle is ready the player who has the most puzzle-pieces on his color placed on the middle is the winner.

name: Food for Thought
description:
Food for thought is a nutrition themed board game. The emphasis is on eating a balanced diet exemplified by 6 food attributes of Fat, Carbohydrates, Fiber, Vitamins, Minerals and Calories. It is part chance (dice) and part strategy (players decide whether or not to 'eat' the food card they land on) based. The theme in general is also to introduce younger players to the above mentioned food attributes and make them more informed about nutrition.

The players start off with all food attributes on the 'good' row of the 'nutritional grid'. Depending on the food choices they make, their counters move up or down the grid until one of the food attribute counters reaches the "lose a life" row, at which point they lose a life. Players can also un-balance other players nutrition grids via the "Payback time", "switch identity" and "Chance" events. Interspersed with the food cards are "exercise", "catch some rays", "water" and "regular doctor's visit"c cards that teach the importance of these attributes.

The goal of the game is to stay alive (by not having any counter reach the "lose a life" row on the nutritional grid) by 'eating' the 'right' (balanced) foods. Another goal also is to make your opponents die by making them eat the 'wrong' foods as a result of a "chance", "payback time" or "switch identity" event. The player who is the last to stay alive wins the game.

Please visit http://foodforthoughtgame.com for a complete description of the game as well as a picture of the actual game board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Igor
description:
Mad scientists need some corpse parts to build their creature, Igor will help them reach their goal by digging into the graveyard. There are also other villagers and a vampire living near the towers where lurk mad scientists. The weather is changing fast in this village...

Each player controls a mad scientist and his servant Igor, they begin the game in their own tower where they lead some exepriments about life and death.
Igor will have to bring, arms, legs and chests to the tower while the mad scientist will have to look for a fresh head by killing a villager. When a mad scientist has all parts in his possession and the weather is stormy, he reanimates the monster and claims victory.
categories: Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Foul Play
description:
Foul Play is a party game for groups from 6 - 12. It is a fast paced who done it full of bluffing, lying, deceit, and fun. It only takes minutes to learn and you can play all night.

A narrator guides the game as players take roles in a murder mystery to try to find out who the murder is.

name: Crosswalk
description:
In Crosswalk players try to get the highest score after three rounds by moving their pawns (pedestrians) back and forth across the crosswalk.

A four player game

The crosswalk contains ten spaces marked from 1-10 moving east to west.

You will need 40 cards in four colors (Red-Blue-Green-Yellow) and numbered from 1-10. Use four cubes, meeples, or pawns in four colors ( Red-Blue-Green-Yellow ) these are pedestrians and are placed on the number 1 slot on the crosswalk at the start of game.

The Deal

Shuffle the deck.

With 2-4 players you deal five cards one at a time to each player face down, the rest of the deck is placed face down as stock. As the game progresses players may be dealt less cards.

The Play
Players then look over their hand, any cards not belonging to their suit are discarded face down next to the stock making a discard pile.

Any players not having at least one card in their suit must discard their whole hand face down to the discard pile and re-dealt five cards.

Each player chooses a card from his hand and places it face down before him. After all cards are down, they are turned over simultaneously.

This is called a match and the winner of the match is determined by who has the higher rank.

The player with the highest ranking card moves his pawn in his suit color to the corresponding number on the crosswalk.

The other players then compare their rank values with the lead players rank, the difference between them, is where the other players move their pawns to.

Example: The lead card is Red-7 the other players cards are Green-6, Blue-4, Yellow-4. Now the difference between Green-6 and Red-7 is 1, so the green pawn is moved to the #1 spot. The difference between Blue-4 and Yellow-4 to Red-7 is 3 so the Blue and Yellow pawn are moved to the #3 spot.

Players then play all remaining cards in their hands in the same manner, any players left with cards after one of the other players have none, must discard their remaining hand to the discard pile face down.

Now you return to The Deal, when the stock is empty the discard pile is made into the new stock.

The game stops when the stock and discard pile are empty then you score the round.

The Score
The game is played in 3 rounds.

The numbers on the crosswalk are also the scoring track, so (1=10) (2=20) (3=30) (4=40) (5=50) (6=60) (7=70) (8=80) (9=90) (10=100)

The number on the crosswalk that your pawn is on after the game stops is your score for that round.

The player with the highest score after 3 rounds is declared the winner.

A two player game

All the rules are the same as in a four player game except as follows.

At the start of a two player game, players decide which two of the four color suits they are going to play and which two corresponding pawns are theirs to move and to score with. Use the higher score out of the two pawns at the end of each round.

A three player game

From the deck decide which suit of the four color suits to discard, also discard the pawn of that corresponding suit color, these cards and pawn are not to be used in the game. You should now have a deck of 30 cards in three suits and three pawns to play with. From this point on, all the rules are the same as in a four player game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Lustiges Affenspiel
description:
objective: be the first reaching space 50
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a red marked space follow instructions glued on lid inside
remarks:
pewter figures

name: Köşe Bucak (Türkiye)
description: Kose Bucak Turkiye is a word game hosting Turkey which minimum 4 people can play in 2 teams. The players proceed on the game board and they draw cards in regional steps, and explain the card to their team member(s) by talking. And they use the cards that the other member guessed; in their “targets” areas on the game board.

name: Mammasnack
description:
Objective: learn more about having children, improve communicaton
- acting simultaneously -
sctive player draws a cards and reads aloud -
in some cases one player writes down an answer, others must guess
get victory point for matching answers
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: CityProGame Hannover
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Hannover each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Educational, Travel

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Berlin
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Berlin each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Rechnen bis 20
description:
52 cards with mathematical operation or answers.
Players try to play from the hand operation-cards like "4+5" or "18-9" to get a correct answer card from the table like "9".
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most answer cards is the winner.
3 more game variants included.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Leipzig
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Leipzig each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Speed Place Value
description: A bingo-style game, Speed Place Value uses a novel randomizer element. Each of three domed shakers contains four marbles - red, yellow, green and blue. Each also has four divots labeled with place values like "ones", "millions" and "hundredths". The color-coordinated Bingo cards have numbers on them where the four relevant digits are colored in a matching set of colors. At the start of each round, someone shakes the shaker until the four balls settled into the four divots. Players then evaluate the nine numbers on their game boards for digits that match the place value/marble color pairs, placing a chip on a match. The first player to place three chips in a row wins.

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Aachen
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Aachen each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Essen
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Essen each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Hamm
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Hamm each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Dresden
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Dresden each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Press Start
description:
All out video game war with a board game.

Take control of the 3 video game theaters or earn 16 bits to win.

Press Start is a 3-6 player game with a co-op expansion to make it a 4-10 player game.

There are 6 theaters of video gaming. Each player rolls for the chance to pick where they start. Highest point total on the dice chooses first.

Each player lays their game cartridge and a piece of wire in the theater and on the tile where they want to build. Each player lays down 2 cartridges and 2 lengths of wire to start the game.

Commodities that are associated with the tiles that players touch are gathered. To gain control of a theater or area a player must build up to having 2 working consoles or cabinets. Players upgrade by trading commodities and action cards or by buying a pause cards. Players can by parts or earn them by battling others and taking their items.

A player must gain control of 3 theaters or gain 16 bits to win.

On each players turn they roll the dice, dice differ depending on what theater they are in. A player can only play in one theater per turn. They may have occupancy in as many theaters as they want, but they must choose which theater to use on their turn.

A player can make as many moves as they like on each turn until they run out of commodities, action, parts or pause cards.

name: Lese- und Rechentelefon
description:
Objective:
A improve your ability to create words out of letters -
if wanted in a competitional modus
B improve your ability using basic arithmetic operations -
if wanted in a competitional modus
use the phone checking result

Each player is confronted with the same task; the faster you find the correct answer the earlier you may use the phone reviewing your result - correct answers give a bonus points;
question sheets are available showing different levels of difficulty

comparable (Lesetelefon only) with Dial N Spell
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Word Game

name: Pünktchen und Anton
description:
Objective: be the first finding the slide 'Pünktchen und Anton' after having collected a complete set (6) of slides (persons) who are present in the identically named movie/novel from Erich Kästner
- acting/moving by turns -
all slides (25) are shuffled and placed face down on the board;
each player moves according dice roll; ending on a space with a slide player may keep it if it is a missing piece. If not, slide must be placed back, also on another free space. Throwing a double player may choose: move and roll again - or jump to any corner - or jump into Pünktchen's home (because later in the game you will find dumped slides at this place, too; handicap: get out with a double only.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: The Game of Going To The Klondike
description: Ca. 1898 early McLoughlin Bros. game involving the lust for gold in the great Northwest in the 1890s. Beautiful graphics of prospectors braving the wild untamed frontier in search of riches enhance this very scarce and desirable game for game collectors or gold rush fanatics. Interior of game shows the great Northern Lights over a series of dangerous mountain passes and rugged terrain. SIZE: 18-3/4" l. x 10-1/4" w.

name: Shi**y Shark Movie
description:
Shi**y Shark Movie, a game parody of shark movie and creature feature tropes (especially the bad ones), is a card and dice resource management game where players move their ships' pawns around a 5x5 constantly changing ocean layout of cards with varying backs representing swimmers, sharks, creatures, and open water items which could be almost anything...good or bad.
To succeed, players will outfit custom ships and crew, needing certain ones to adopt particular strategies (for example, a ship must have a lifeguard crew member in order to save swimmers).
Whoever finishes the game with the most saved swimmers and killed/captured sharks is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking

name: 77 Sunset Strip
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (113)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions...
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Europa Rundreise
description:
This 1930s German game is a spin-and-move tour around Europe. There is a spinner in each corner of the board, and the four cute cars provided are in nicely painted ceramic: a very unusual feature in an era of typically metal or wooden pieces.

Each player starts and finishes in Berlin, and may travel either clockwise or counterclockwise. Players must follow directions in the rules if they land on one of Europe's 12 major cities, some good and some bad. In surely unintentional pre-WWII irony, the trip from Berlin goes no further east than Stalingrad, where the directions say the driver "decides to stay a few days in the city of Tractor Works", and loses two turns.

name: DadOpoly
description:
A classic combination of our two favorite things - being dads and playing games!

DadOpoly is a new and unique version of the classic that follows a dad's journey through fatherhood. From a house on Single Street to a hotel on College Court, DadOpoly is all fun and games (as long as you are not on Diaper Duty). The images are original, the cards are funny and the properties really hit home, making this a family friendly game that is loads of fun for all to play.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Storming the Citadel
description:
Game comes with 2 tinplate cannons, card central keep, 2 walls, 4 towers, 10t 'flats' of 25mm scale infantry of the line and 15 pieces of ammunition. The rules are inside the lid.

This Game is played on the floor or table, one player undertaking the defence and the other, (or others), the attack.
Stand the Fort up. The towers will hinge into position. Then there are numerous instructions to complete the fort and that depended on how much you paid for the game. If you didn't have all the items mentioned in the instructions, then you had to make do. Chad Valley obviously made several editions of this game. Finally, the 15 discs are laid out as instructed. These represent trenches.

The defender places his Cannon, (provided in the betier editions), at one side of the Fort, and the attackers then send one man to the first Disc (or Trench), that is,thee the two furthest from the Fort; the defender then endeavours to shoot this man, and should he miss, the attacker may then move forward to the next Trench, or bring np another man as he considers best, when the defender again fires, and so on in turn, the object of the attacker, (or storming party), being to occupy the three Trenches nearest the Fort, each with one man, and if successful in this the attackers are then said to “charge” and the Fort is taken. If, however, the defence kill sufficient numbers of the attackers to prevent the three front Trenches being occupied, he has repulsed the assault and wins the game.

Soldiers having reached the front trench cannot be fired
at. Should the defender exhaust his supply of ammunition he must miss one shot while a fresh supply is obtained.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Fighting

name: Lauamäng-laudlina
description:
Tablecloth board game.
Roll and move from start to finish. There are different foods on the way. Healthy vegetables helps You to move faster, some not-so-healty move You backwards. Player who finishes first is the winner.

Contents:
- tablecloth
- 4 game-pieces
- dice

name: Claim Your Garden
description:
The game is played on a 8 x 8 grid. Players place hedgerows to mark enclosed areas. These are then marked for a player by a play-do figure which the players can form when they need them. Each square is worth one point.
Bonus points are awarded for claiming golden coins found on the board.

name: The Mind's Lie
description:
