The Mind’s Lie is a game about how our minds consistently look at situations in biased and misleading ways. The goal in this game is to spot these errors and convince the other players that you are correct.

The Mind’s Lie is normally a game for 3-6 players that can be played in 30 minutes or less. Players take turns reading scenarios and then attempt to identify the biases inherent in each situation. Players then vote in secret and, after the reveal, try to convince each other to change their positions. The player who is most successful at convincing other players to vote as the player votes wins the game.

Over time, it is expected that players will gain the ability to identify and mitigate the effects of common cognitive biases in everyday life, thereby improving their critical thinking and decision making skills.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Fantasy Ancients
description:
Rules for games using miniatures. The author is identified only as O'Neil. There are 32 pages of rules with a card stock insert of charts and tables.

The rules cover the gray area of gaming between fantasy role playing games and the large tactical Ancients army game. Players can use the rules to recreate gladitorial combat between man vs. man (or man vs. fantasy race) combat or they can use them to recreate massive battles such the Trojan Wars or the battles in Middle Earth.

The Game Sequence:
1. Charges and spells are declared.
2. Counter charges and counter spells.
3. Reaction tests to charges and spells.
4. Normal movement.
5. Missile fire (ranged combat).
6. Reaction tests to missile fire.
7. Melee (hand to hand) combat.
8. Reation tests to melee combat.
Steps 1-8 are repeated until one side is victorious.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Eagle One
description:
A system of rules for modern aerial combat using aircraft miniatures or using paper & pencil on large sheets of paper (alternately, grease pencils on clear plastic sheets).

There are 20+ pages of rules and 4 different 2-sided data charts (2 copies of each).

Aircraft information for modern era (pre-1980) aircraft provides performance (speeds, maneuvering) and armament data (number of guns, range, damage). Players recreate historical or hypothetical aerial battles using NATO, Warsaw Pact or other air forces.

Shorter scenarios use primarily 1-2 aircraft per player.

Larger numbers of players would allow different types of aircraft, such as bombers and escorts being attacked by defense fighters. These smallest of these actions (scenarios) can last 120+ turns and involve an area of 200" x 300" (19.7 ft x 25 ft.).

1 Turn=10 seconds
1 Unit=2 miles

For miniatures play, the editor recommends a large floor area with 1 unit=10 cm (or 4-5 inches).

name: Naval Wargame Rules for the Napoleonic Wars 1793-1815
description:
(Excerpt from the Introduction): These rules have been formulated with the period 1793-1815 (French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars) in mind, although such was the progress of Naval Warfare at the time, they could, with the preparation of suitable Ship Definitions, be used for any period during the eighteenth and first half of the nineteenth centuries.

Ground scale is 1:2400. Ship scale is 1:1200, although the rules may be modified for other scales. Measurements are in mm. Time scale is 1 move=1 minute.

There are data for a number of different types of ships ranging from frigates to the vaunted ships-of-the-line. Players use scale models to recreate historical or hypothetical naval engagements. The concise rules cover wind direction, movement, and gunnery. Dice rolls are used to generate random amounts of damage and gunfire accuracy.

These rules were published by Navwar in the United Kingdom.

name: Sandlot Football
description:
A tactical football game. Saturday afternoon football without the Sunday morning aches, bruises and sore muscles. Ther are no punts, your team has four downs to score. The team scoring five touchdaowns first wins. Clipping and downfield blocks are encouraged.

The counters represent individual players on each team. Players are rated for strength, speed, receiving and passing ability. Before the game starts, players "draft" a team from the available counters.

A ball counter is used and is possessed by the ball carrier. Offense lines up first with all players at or behind the line of scrimmage. Defens then lines up on the other side of the line of scrimmage.

The play starts when the center snaps the ball to the quarterback. To keep control of the game, only five of the offense's players will move to be followed by five of the defense's players. This allows players to set up blocks and maneuver around to gain a positional advantage. The remainder of each team moves next. Passes, laterals or handoffs are attempted in the second move action. A die roll determines if a pass is completed based on the pass distance and the passer's passing ability. Incomplete passes end the play. Receivers catching the ball use their speed to run for as much yardage as possible and defensive players attempt to minimize the yardage gained by tackling the receiver.

There are no set plays drawn up in the rules, so players draw up their own plays in the dirt by using a stick (not really, but that's how you should approach the game).

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Mönchengladbach
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Mönchengladbach
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, very similar to Monopoly , moving by turn -
Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instruction of space landed on, buys - if possible and/or preferable - votes;
major difference compared with Monopoly;
"chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Mönchengladbach - question cards give you additional chances/bonuses finding correct answers
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Het Klokkijken kaartspel
description:
With this Dutch game you practice to read the digital and the analog clock.

The game has two different sides:
- If you play with the domino side, is about matching the same times on top of each other. Thus, one quarter past 9 fits with 9.15 or with the correct drawing of the clock.

- If you play with the other side, you may submit series, add cards for other players, or even steal cards from other players!
You can play this by ranking the times by earlier - later!

name: The Stewardship Game
description:
"This game was designed to be fun, but also to teach important principles about Christian Stewardship. The game emphasizes that being a good steward is a way of life, and that it is about the daily decisions we make in the use of out time, talent and treasure." (From the teacher's packet included with the game.)

Players roll a die to move around the board, reading aloud from one of four types of cards that match the square they landed on, then acting out what the card says to do. If the player lands on a "Word on Stewardship" space, they draw a card from that stack and have thirty seconds to look up the Bible verse listed on it. (Bible and timer are NOT included in the game pieces.) If the player cannot find the verse in time, they move backwards on the board. If they do find the verse, play halts until the player reads the verse aloud.

Play continues until one player lands on the "Well done good and Faithful Steward" by exact roll. This person is the winner.

name: Steel Towers
description:
Steel Towers is a game of city building, monster attacks, and high profits! After years of relentless attacks by aliens, gorillas, and monsters, Scraper City has finally banished these nuisances to a holding facility in the next state, where they are controlled by electronic collars. Downtown is ready to grow again! As real estate moguls in this once-again booming city, players compete to make the most money by building Skyscrapers to attract rent-paying tenants.

However, the Skyscrapers that make the most money are in the best Neighborhoods. Players hold cards which give them the right to build Skyscrapers along specific streets, while attracting valuable Businesses, knocking down unsightly Abandoned Buildings, and cleaning up Junkyards. However, the moguls try to foil each other by taking control of Mutant Monsters, Giant Gorillas, or Alien Attacks, making construction in Scraper City perilous at best.

The novel game mechanic for determining revenue from Skyscrapers at the end of each turn means that the most thoughtful strategy will prevail! The winning mogul is the one with the most money after ten years (turns) of building and collecting rent. Steel Towers is a unique game with easy-to-learn rules, but deep strategy.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Original World Rummy
description:
From the Passport Instructions to the "Original" World Rummy by Adell:

"Original" World Rummy is a game designed to combine the timeless appeal of playing cards with the impact of Backgammon and the strategy of chess.

Instructions are printed in 26 languages for the enjoyment of your family and friends around the world. Besides the languages listed in this entry, the rules are also printed in Farsi (Persian) and Swahili.

There are 106 tiles (each measuring 27 mm x 33 mm) used in the game. There are 2 jokers and 104 numbered tiles. The numbered tiles are in four colors: Black, Red, Blue and Yellow. Think of these as card suits. Each color consists of 13 "ranks" (numbered 1 to 13) and there are 2 sets of 1-13 in each color.

The tiles are mixed up and placed face down in the middle of the table. Each player draws one and the player drawing the lowest number goes first. 14 tiles are drawn by each player into their rack.

Objective: The first player to play out all their tiles in their rack wins the hand. The winner scores the tile points that are left in their opponent's racks. First player to get 500 points is the winner.

A player's turn begins with drawing a tile. Players lay down melds of 3 or more tiles ("sets" of the same rank or "runs" (consecutive ranks in the same color)). Once each player has laid down 1 meld, they can play on the melds of other players. If the player can't play on their own or another person's meld, they must pass. There's a sand timer, so player's lose their turn if they spend too much time analyzing their options.

Splitting runs and sets:
As an example, if you have a Black 7 tile, you can split a Black run 9-8-7-6-5 into 2 runs - Black 5-6-7 and Black 7-8-9. If you have a Red 8-9, you can split 4-10's (Red, Black, Blue, Blue) into run Red 8-9-10 and set of 3-10's (Black, Blue, Blue).

The Jokers have some restrictions on their use, but they can be powerful options for a player's strategies. If you have the right tile, you can play it to replace a Joker, but then you must play the Joker right away; you cannot place it back in your rack.

Besides the tiles, the game comes with 4 tile racks (some assembly required) and 2 sand timers.

name: Space Relics
description:
In Space Relics, each player is a space pirate racing against the others to get the most items and most valuable artifacts out of an intergalactic museum.

The game board has a grid for the platform tiles that players will need to move around in order to reach the fixed gallery tiles where the items and artifacts can be found. The platform and galleries (except for the center gallery tile) are set up randomly each game.

Players start the game with 12 action points to use for movement and relocating tiles. However, the action points are reduced by 1 each round to simulate the space suits running out of air and power.

Items and artifacts are randomly drawn from two decks of cards. However, the primary artifact, The Heart of Sol, is always in the center of the board.

Art by Steve Thomas (www.stevethomasart.com)
categories: Adventure, Print & Play, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Immer mit der Ruhe
description:
Objective: be the first leading all (3) of your meeples home
- moving by turns -
a 'Pachisi'-variant

Each player has a set of 3 meeples that start in his/her corner of the board. The goal is to move the meeples around the board back to the "home" section (=start). Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may throw out others meeples. Thrown ones are returned to their player's corner and must start again. The winner is the first player to move all meeples "home".
The major difference is located as red square (8 spaces) in the middle of the board, which must passed 4 times. It becomes a bottleneck, because only one meeple may move into (next step out of) it. During this period it can be thrown out easily.

name: of Shot & Blade
description:
of Shot & Blade is a boardgame of action, magic and high adventure set in the unique fantasy world of Edath where non-combat skills are as influential as combat in surviving a wild and broken world. The game allows for a variety of simple adventures to be played – skirmishes, quests, hunts, investigations, etc – and in a variety of settings.

Players split into two teams. The Adventurers Team attempt to achieve a final objective and take their squads and champions across three Locations against beasts, ravines, natives and the like, while the Nemesis Team aims to thwart them.

With each encounter, the players draw from their chosen Skills and any support they may get, and opposed players engage in a conflict where their dice rolls are influenced in a back and forth fashion until one player can do no more and so loses that particular contest, suffering the consequences.

By the time the final goal is reached the Adventurers will have succeeded or failed to acquire boons and other bonuses that can aid them in an all or nothing last ditch attempt to succeed in their mission. Adventures can be played stand alone or as part of a series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: CineManiac: Horror Edition
description:
A card/party game for 2-5+ people, played while watching any horror movie.

Players use Plot cards that coincide with actions on the screen to earn points, and Curse cards to force their opponents to reenact scenes or otherwise interact with the movie.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Mother's Day
description:
Act as a stay at home mom trying to clean the house. Each player moves through their own house (a play mat) trying to clean. The first player with a clean house wins. The trouble is that there is a child in each house controlled by the game. The child moves through the house playing with toys and making a mess.

A child with no toys will help clean up but it is risky to try to keep they toys from the child because the mom only has two hands to work with. The child cannot go into mom's room or the garage so toys can be stored there but it takes time to move.

This game is part strategy and part luck.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation
publishers: Melancholy Media, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Steam City Defense
description:
Build defenses and collect parts so you can turn your city into a giant flying machine before a rampaging mechanical hoard destroys the land.

Roll dice each round to determine if you get defenses, flying machine components, or agents capable of sabotage. Work with or against neighboring cities. Each round the mechanical hoard will attack random parts of the city. The first city in the air wins.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Trading, Worker Placement
publishers: Melancholy Media, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Steam City Warfare
description:
Each player controls an air fleet and engage in a battle. Each side has a city, up to 2 airships, and up to 4 fighters. Once a player's city is destroyed, they are out of the game. At the end of each round, the wind pushes the fleet, complicating the strategy of troop deployment.
As fighters and airships are destroyed, new ones can be launched by sacrificing the ability to attack. Ships can crash into each other and mountains causing damage.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Melancholy Media, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Steam City Warfare Expanded Fleet
description: This is an expansion for the game, Steam City Warfare. It adds mountain strongholds, drone missiles, and bombers to the game. Not intended as a stand alone expansion but can be played separately with a 1" sq type play mat (sold separately). Requires the rules from Steam City Warfare: Core Game and the Expanded Fleet rules.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Melancholy Media, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Guilds of Florence
description:
Guilds of Florence is a worker programming game where every player represents a clan of humble origin that is putting all their savings into improving the status of the clan. In order to do this, they will send their brightest sons as apprentices to some of the guilds of the city in seek of fame and fortune. To facilitate this, they will also marry some of their prettiest daughters to influential members of society in order to gain access to their exclusive guilds.

Game flow:
1. Coming of age: each clan adds a son ready to work and a daughter ready to marry to their resource pool.

2. Getting a job: each clan sends as many sons from the resource pool to find a job as apprentices as they want and can afford. To get a job as an apprentice, you must have influence in that guild, there must be an available apprentice slot (only one per guild every turn) and you must have enough money to pay the admission fee.

Other ways of getting influence in otherwise inaccessible guilds, is by marrying your daughters to one of the meeples already in that guild. By doing so you gain access to that guild as long as that daughter lives or if you have already sons working in that guild.
Some guilds can only be accessed by bribing the master a fixed amount of money.

3. Wedding day: each clan marries as many daughters from the resource pool as they want and can afford. To marry your daughters you need to pay the dowry to the lucky husband-to-be.
When choosing which husband in a guild you would like to marry, your clan needs to have someone (son or daughter) in a guild of the same class as the target one. For example, someone in a minor guild, can only marry someone in a minor guild, whereas someone in a major guild can marry anyone.

4. Pay day: in this phase salaries get paid, products get made and products get exchanged for money.

5. Time goes by: apprentices may become journeymen. Journeymen may become masters or keep improving their skills and maybe get a higher wage. Masters may improve their mastery and gain increased reputation and produce more products. Masters that reached the highest in their career, when time goes by, will sadly pass away. Same applies to their wives, who will also suffer the same fate.

6. Going to the market: each player buys as many products as they want and can afford. They can also exchange certain products for different products as a barter according to the market table. They CANNOT sell products for money; only masters can sell their own products for money.

7. Adjusting turn order: in turn order, and one at a time, players may exchange sets of products for licences (VP). Move the VP tracker for those players accordingly. Once all players have passed in sequence, the new starting player will be the one with the most VP at this point in time.

End of the game and scoring
The game ends when all players run out of meeples as they have all passed away.
The game also ends immediately if after one full turn, none of the guilds have any meeple on them but there are meeples in the clan or resource pools.
The winner is the player with most Victory Points.

name: Rat Chase
description: Let's chase a rat! The objective of the game is to be the first player to stop the rat running. The rat will run in random directions around the room for 20 seconds. Chase the rat around the room and hit the button on its back with your broom. The rat will respond with each correct hit by making a "yip yip" sound. Once you've successfully hit it 4 times, the rat will stop and make a crying sound. But if you don't, the rat will stop and laugh at you!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game

name: The Christmas Goose
description:
Presumably, a simple roll and move game, given the times and the type of games that existed in the 1890's.

This 1890 game from McLoughlin Bros. is listed with a picture at Bored Games.

name: Cimarron Strip
description: The game is based on a TV show in the 1960's. Players are racing to claim territory in the strip of land between Kansas and the Indian Territory in the old west. There are 23 territories (areas) in the Cimarron Strip which are now open for claiming. Movement is by a spinner. Players start with a stand-up playing piece showing a cowboy and 7(?) claim tokens. The board consists of a map of the 23 areas, the starting area outside the Cimarron Strip, and paths connecting everything. Each area has one red space that the players must land on to claim the area. If 2 players land on the same spot there is a gunfight using a deck of "hit" or "miss" cards.
categories: American West, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wireheads
description:
"When two wireheads test their skills against eachother several factors decides the outcome; the ability to learn and adapt fast to changes, flexibility in strategy and tactics when necessary, master of both attack and defense, courage to try the unknown and wits to outsmart the other combatant."
- Enigma, also known as TripWire (Legendary Y-Gen wirehead)

Wireheads is a two-player deck building game set in a cyberspace environment. Players takes the role of a wirehead. Each character in the game has different strengths and abilities. Wireheads connect to the virtual world through an interface which may be upgraded or loaded with powerful software to be better prepared for the unknown. In the virtual world they fight for power and glory.

Choose a set of cards that fits your strategy. A typical round of Wireheads consists of a Draw phase followed by the action phase where players use enhancements, upload softwares and sabotage for the opponent in order to gain advantage. New cards are learned from the source and added to your deck. Cards on hand are both effect, software and power to learn new. All cards are freely played from hand without cost. However, stored software and hardware upgrades pay upkeep.

Strike at your opponents interface, exhaust their deck or archive, negate cards on hand. Everything is allowed in order to defeat your opponent.

Every game will differ from the other due to the fact that different cards are available and of those you choose only the cards that fit to the situation and strategy.

Strap up and connect, Wirehead.

"No strategy is good but the strategy to observe, adapt and act faster than your enemy."

The game components:
216 Cards (36 different cards with 6 cards each)
16 Power cards
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Free Your Glee
description: Two teams take turns guessing the identity of the character on the WHO card by asking a yes/no question. Each team only gets five guesses per turn. If guessed, the team now tries to get the WHAT part of the card. Special mystery character cards are included to increase the difficulty. The first team to identify both WHO and WHAT get the character card, and if they get eight they win the game.

name: Jahrmarkts-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (50)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a coloured (red/yellow) space follow instructions glued on lid inside. A '6' allows you another roll/move.

name: Autobahn
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: The Merry Game of Bicycling
description: Typical spin and move children's board game with wooden pieces (red, blue, yellow and green). Game goal is to travel with bicycle from and come back to home first of all. During the travel players should pass Dear Park, Boat House, Pleasant Park, Apple Lane, Hillside Farm etc.

name: Operation "Ka-Go": Battle for Mars
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese anime series Space Battleship Yamato 2199. The game covering space battles for Mars .

Players control star fleet of either the Earth(Terran) or Empire of Gamilas.
The main engine of the game is use chit-pull system. Each turn, players choose to use how many chit for that turn. Each player has four different activation chits(movement, fire, torpedo and repair), but many starships can activate only one to three times in a turn.

The game include five scenarios, two is based on animation story and three is fictional. Winner determined by scenario specific condition.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Lowlander
description:
Lowlander is a card-driven solitaire game of fantasy exploration so compact, you can almost take it with you anywhere. Starting from your hut in the wild, your branch out to new frontiers as winter comes along and you need to gather resources in order to survive. But beware, in the vast forests of the realm dark and vicious creatures hide in the shadows.

Select from various scenarios ranging from simple hunts in the wilderlands to defending your home from the forces of the necromancer Yrmgor. No session will be like the other, as the modular gaming board is randomised before each game.

In Lowlander you can take a job in the village, go mining in the mountains, engage in skirmishes with the local fauna or simply collect wood for the winter. As rounds progress, you will move the game's clock, altering it from day to night time, which will impact your encounters in the wild, for it is safer to travel by day.

Lowlander is intended as a budget-game with a rich gaming experience for the true board game enthusiast who needs a solitaire fix and will be released by Q3 2013.
categories: Adventure, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Farming, Fighting
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Vite taxi!
description:
The goal is to be the best taxi driver at Paris, pocketing the first 500 Francs, while avoiding the many pitfalls of the circulation of capital!

The game board is the map of Paris, with its main arteries, main sites and monuments.
Initially, everyone draws a movement-card for finding the starting point and then draws another card for the destination point and the price.

In turn, players is roll dice and move the number of spaces, a card is also drawn each turn.

A player may refuse to move but passes his turn. Once a player reaches his destination, he earns money and take a new card for the next round.
Player may put his money in the bank in certain boxes to avoid an unpleasant surprises during a game.

The first 500 Francs pocket wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WWII TANKS
description:
WWII TANKS is a fun, fast-paced card game where players try to match WWII AFVs presented to look like wargame counters to make pairs. Make your pairs the quickest and win!

Each turn, players choose to draw cards from the deck or take the discard pile, make pairs, discard and pass the turn. Each vehicle appears on three different cards. Each card has two different AFVs. Easy enough for children to play and elegant enough for adults to enjoy.

Able to stand on its own as a simple game, WWII TANKS is also a perfect vehicle [pun intended] presented in a simple format to introduce and expose others to the wonderful world of wargaming.

The artwork is gorgeous. Makes a great introductory game for your non-gamer friends as well!

All the rules fit on one card. A game takes about 15-30 minutes to play.

name: Detektiv Horch
description:
Main idea:
An educational game aimed at teaching/practising the relation between sounds and their written representation in the form of letters. Many primary school children have a hard time differentiating similar sounds, such as German ö - eu - ei. The game is meant to help them by making them listen closely.

Game play:
Basic game: Each player gets 6 picture cards and puts them in front of him/herself, face up. The remaining picture cards form a face-down stack at the center of the table. The stack with the 24 face-down letter cards is given to the game master, oldest player, or is passed from one player to the next each turn.
The game master (or one of the players) looks at the top letter card and reads the sound. Each player can now discard one of their picture cards if it matches the sound from the letter card. For example, if the letter card is "SCH", the picture cards showing a key, ("Schlüssel"), pig ("Schwein") or frog ("Frosch") can be discarded. A player who doesn't have a matching card has to draw one from the draw deck. If the drawn card matches, he/she may discard it immediately.
The first player to get rid of all his/her cards wins the game.

The "expert" variant: Each player gets 8 cards and may discard as many matching cards as they can when it is their turn (rather than just one picture card per sound card).

name: Aidler-14
description:
Wealthy individuals on the Earth funded a project and have assembled the tools and mining teams capable of a 1 year expedition to a Near-Earth asteroid and have placed you in charge of its operation. The mission is not without risk however. In an effort to achieve the greatest resource achievement and make more room for hauling resources back to the Earth, the teams have been supplied with limited water and must learn to “live off the land” by locating sources of water to sustain themselves all the while avoiding the numerous other dangers of mining an asteroid such as outgassing and related geological effects. You and your team will be pitted against other mining teams with the same capabilities and it will be up to you to outperform the other teams to achieve the largest, most diverse haul and achieve victory. Good Luck!

AIDLER-14 pits players in a unique mining mission where the ultimate goal is to acquire the greatest amount of resources, making the most efficient use of available mining tools and techniques that are available through the use of the mining assistance cards. Abilities range from advanced movements on the asteroid surface to being able to double and even triple your teams mining production for the turn. Your mining team has 3 workers which you deploy to either explore and uncover new resources to be mined, mine resources that have already been discovered, or process raw mined materials into processed goods that will save weight and space on the Earth return vehicle for the trip home. The game consists of 12 rounds with each round being broken up into 6 distinct stages.

Worker placement, dice rolling, and timing are the key mechanics to this game as choice of available cards and locations on the board are chosen in succession beginning with the starting player for the round. Placing more than one worker for mining will increase the odds that more resources are produced, but at the same time increases the risk of losing those workers to the damage sustained mechanic of the game that simulates the many dangers associated with this type of mission. Management of water resources cannot be overstated as the teams will have to seek out sources on the surface to replenish water utilized to keep your team alive as well as operate the equipment on the surface.

Combining the most unique and exciting elements of outstanding games such as The Settlers of Catan, Agricola, and Stone Age with a science based approach to the prospect of mining for resources in space makes AIDLER-14 stand out compared to the many other space mining-type games that are on the market and makes for endless replayability and a lot of fun.

name: Rechengalaxie
description:
A space-themed mathematics trivia game for ages 11 and up.

Aim of the game:
Collecting 16 galaxy tiles (4 each in yellow, red, green and blue) to put them on the corresponding player board. (The resulting picture shows a supernova.)

Game play:
Each player rolls the die once. The player with the highest roll starts and moves his/her pawn according to the die roll. When passing the orange start space, players get a galaxy tile of their choice and put it on their player board. Players then take turns, trying to collect galaxy tiles by answering the mathematical questions from the blue and black question cards. Which colour tile you get depends on which space your pawn lands. Galaxy tiles can also be collected by answering questions about space on the "black card" and "joker card" spaces.
The player who first manages to collect a complete set of galaxy tiles wins the game.

name: Vietnam
description:
English:

Vietnam is a collector NAC based wargame, set in this bloody conflict. It recreates the battles and challenges that came under american detachments. The huge amount of tokens shows the different units and weaponry used: Viet Cong, Green Beret, heliborne troops, infantry, mortars, anti-aircraft, missile launchers, Chinook, Cobra, Huey and Cayuse helicopters.

Two, three or four players take command of American and South Vietnamese troops, and the army of North Vietnam.
Once initial troops placed on the board, each player takes turns moving the mobility factor of each unit, applying modifiers depending on the passing zone (rivers, streams, jungle paths, roads and rice fields).
Infantry units can engage in combat with adjacent opponents, existing differences between combat values ​​depending on their experience and equipment (guerrillas, viet cong, infantry and Green Berets are an example).
Artillery units can launch ranged attacks against other tabs or objectives.
The weather factor also plays a big role.
The firepower and mobility offered by different types of helicopters are the great strength of the American contingent, as opposed to the number of North Vietnamese infantry and difficult terrain mobility, may be grouped, giving the oportunity to cheating with empty groups that must be discovered approaching them.
Several Fire Support Base, which at siege are recreated in an extended area on the board, providing another level, much more exciting, including mines and barbed wire to open a gap.
At the end of the round 14, players earn points for every target that their units still maintain (bases, hills and villages). The winner is the most points of victory has joined.

Similar: Vietnam


Spanish:

Vietnam es un wargame de coleccionista, basado en el juego de la desaparecida NAC, y ambientado en el conflicto que le da nombre. En él se recrean los combates y dificultades a las que se vieron sometidos los destacamentos estadounidenses. La enorme cantidad de fichas reflejan las diferente unidades y maquinaria usada: viet cong, boinas verdes, tropa helitransportada, infantería, morteros, antiaéreos, lanzamisiles, helicopteros Chinook, Cobra, Cayuse y Huey.

Dos, tres o cuatro jugadores toman el mando de las tropas americanas y survietnamitas, o el ejercito de Vietnam del norte.
Una vez colocadas las tropas iniciales sobre el tablero, cada jugador se turna moviendo el factor de movimiento de cada ficha, aplicando modificadores dependiendo del tipo de zona por el que pase (ríos, riachuelos, jungla, caminos, rutas y arrozales).
Las unidades de infantería pueden entablar combate con los adversarios adyacentes, existiendo diferencias entre los valores de combate dependiendo de su experiencia y equipo (guerrilleros, viet cong, infantería y boinas verdes son un ejemplo).
Las unidades de artillería pueden lanzar ataques a distancia contra otras fichas u objetivos.
El factor climatológico también juega un gran papel.
La capacidad de fuego y movilidad que ofrecen los distintos tipos de helicópteros son la gran baza del contingente americano, en oposición a la cantidad de infantería norvietnamita y su movilidad por terreno dificultoso,pudiendo agruparse, engañando al contrario con grupos vacíos que avanzan y deben ser descubiertos acercándose a ellos.
Existen varias Base de Apoyo al Fuego, que al asaltarse se recrean en una zona ampliada en el tablero, ofreciendo otra escala, mucho más emocionante, incluyendo minas y alambradas por las que debe abrirse una brecha.
Al finalizar el turno 14, los jugadores suman puntos por cada objetivo en el que aún mantengan sus unidades (bases, colinas y poblados). El ganador es el que mayor cantidad de puntos de victoria haya sumado.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The Stanley Africa Game
description: 1890-1910 spin and move board game depicting the famous expedition in deepest darkest Africa that starts at the mouth of the Congo and terminates in Zanzibar. Box lid depicts H.M. Stanley on his mule attended by three armed native scouts. Interior of game is beautifully lithographed with various colleagues of Stanley in vignettes around the perimeter along with scenes from various African localities.

name: Sovereign: A Deck-Building Game
description:
Sovereign is a relatively simple deck-building war game with a great deal of player interaction. Each player takes on the role of a leader, hidden behind his castle walls. The goal is to amass an army and batter down your opponent's walls.

All cards have two possible uses, most of which can either be a Simple Action, which is played then discarded, or a Unit, which remains in play until it is defeated in battle. Players generate gold to purchase more Contract cards and Influence to place their Units on the table.

There are two main paths to victory: one may defeat his opponent on the field of battle, or create a great Monument. Monuments are built in three tiers, each giving a permanent bonus (depending on the Monument). The third tier ends the game in a victory.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Supper Time
description:
This game is intended to teach children table manners in a fun and interactive setting.

By rolling the dice, players will advance their pawns around the board. By landing on each space, a new scenario is proposed and the parent can use the opportunity to instruct their child on table manners.

By answering correctly, the child would receive a card representing the space that was landed upon. The game ends when the child has all the cards in their hand.

name: Augen Auf! Das neue Verkehrsspiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 100 (P); learn traffic signs
- moving by turns -
Simple Roll & Move game; ending on a marked space follow instructions on the lid inside. The players can choose between beeing a car driver, motorcyclist or pedestrian. They have to follow the traffic rules and use the travel routes accordingly. The pedestrian has only 50 spaces to travel, so his rolls count only half (round up)! The traffic cop stands on space 58. Any player who rolls a 6 may rotate the traffic cop to restrict the movement of the opposing players.

remarks: published before and during WWII

name: Das schöne Märchenspiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (12)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a red marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
published ~ 1920's
added: a cardboard-die

name: Chuggington Top Trumps Activity Pack
description:
A selection of games and puzzles aimed at the very young, using characters from the Chuggington TV series. Altogether there are three different games and 4 puzzles to keep a young mind busy.

Naturally, there is a pre-school Top Trumps game with 12 cards. Each train is rated for Speed, Friendship, Adventure and Wisdom and each is illustrated in colour. This will be a short game which is right for the age group - they won't have time to get bored.

Secondly, you can play Pairs with the cards because there are 12 cards giving a description of each of the twelve trains. So the player won't find an exact match but will be able to find, say, two Chatsworth train cards.

Thirdly, there is a simple which is played a little like Rummy but much easier. You have a hand of five cards and you draw a card (from the stack or the top of the discard pile). If you get a matching pair, you may lay it down and discard one of your other cards on to the discard pile. The first person to get rid of all their cards, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Speedy Bee
description:
Speedy Bee is an observation and speed ​​game.

The bees are looking for pollen. The first player who have six pollens wins the game.

The game includes three designed dices with four small balls representing the primary colors (blue, yellow, red) and black.

The board has six pollen balls, three with the color of the dices and three representing the mix between the primary colors (green, purple and orange). And the black color is used for the queen of the bees at the center of the board.

Each turn, one player rolls the dices and then all players have to catch the correct pollen balls depending on the color dices and according to the color mixing rules.

If you get the correct ball, you win a pollen token. If you are wrong, you have to give one back.

name: Kalory
description:
"Kalory: A game for all fun loving, weight conscious people!"

Kalory is a roll-and-move, weight-loss-themed Monopoly derivative which instructs players on methods of losing weight.

After rolling dice, players move their playing pieces around the board, gaining or losing Kalory chips (which represent weight). They also perform actions on cards that they draw, depending on which space they land on. The first player to lose all of their Kalory chips is the winner.

Players may select different game lengths: a lightweight game, a middleweight game, or a heavyweight game. The game length corresponds to an increasing number of starting Kalory chips.

name: Mad Libs Criss Cross
description: Before the game begins each player customizes several of the cards with names of family members, friends, pets etc. in Mad Libs Criss Cross Game. Then each player picks nine cards from the card tray and puts them onto their card holder (3 Nouns, 3 Verbs and 3 Misc.). The first player lays down a sentence made of cards and counts up the total score which is printed on the individual cards. The next player lays down a sentence crossing over or adding to the previous sentence and adds up the score. When all of the cards are used or no one else can make a sentence the game is over. Object of the Game: The player with the most points wins.

name: Thüringer Land wie bist du schön
description:
Objective: be the first ending a round trip in Erfurt (Thuringia)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions...
remarks:
published ~1950's in the GDR
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Ein Bummel um die Welt
description:
Objective: be the first ending a round trip in Berlin
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game: choose one of the coloured routes around the world; ending on a marked space follow instructions...
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Aastaring Aias
description:
Educational board game for kindergartens about vegetables.

There is track on topside of the board and various vegetables growing on the game board under the track.
Player rolls the dice in his turn and moves accordingly on the track. If child lands on square where the name of vegetable is written he/she must recognize this vegetable from the board. Then he/she rolls again and the dice show one of the six categories player must answer the question about this vegetable.
If the answer is incorrect the player moves backward 3 squares.

Player who finishes first is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sydney Harbour Bridge
description:
The game commences from the Sydney side of the Bridge marked Home and continues over the proposed scenic railway to the North Shore, and back along, the main roadway of the Bridge following the numbers from No. 1 to 100.
Each player throws the dice in turn it being necessary to throw a 6 to commence the journey.
The first player to return to Home wins the game.

name: Prima Klima
description:
Objective: get most event/action cards; learn more about communication/environment;
- acting by turns/simultaneously -
shuffle 2 green, 4 red, 6 orange, 8 blue event/chance cards forming a pile;
create your world by assembling carton pads with a disc/placing 6 'weather' tiles upon the disc; at last fix all together with a rubber band building a tension
active player draws top card, depending on colour you have to solve a question (multiple choice), increase/decrease tension (rubber band), solve calamities (dropped weather tiles); if you are succeeding get corresponding event card...

name: Die Thüringen-Reise
description:
Objective: be the first ending a round trip in Gotha, Thuringia; learn more about Thuringia.
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions
remarks:
published before or during WWII
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Pille ja Palle Veeohutusmäng
description:
Simple board game for children about water safety.

Players roll the dice and move on the board. There are many special squares on the track to move forward or backward, miss the turn or answer the simple questions how to act safely near the water. Who finishes first is the winner.

name: Elite: Station Run
description:
From the Website:

"Station Run is a board game version of the computer game Elite, released by Ian Bell and David Braben in the mid 80s.

You and some other players need to get from one end of the game board to the other without your ship being destroyed. Other players might do it, or some of the random people who ply the spacelanes might get to you first.

Station Run is a free-to-download game. No need to whip out the credit card for this one, and no need to try and remember your paypal password."

From the free PDF rules:

"Station Run is a game for one to four players. Each player is the pilot of a ship which has just hyperspaced into the system. They must get to the nearby planet’s space station in order to sell cargo, refuel or whatever else they might want to do. The player can take on a number of roles. Traders are ferrying cargo between systems to make profit, which they can use to improve their ship or buy another one. Bounty Hunters are seeking out wrongdoers and bringing them to justice. Pirates are only interested in plundering the traders and stealing their cargo. Miners are looking for asteroids to mine for valuable minerals.

The aim of the game is to get from one end of the game board to the other in one piece. Random encounters may occur, as other spacefarers and asteroids make their way around the planet’s
orbitspace. The game is designed to be open-ended and as freeform as possible (just like the computer game)."
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Wett-Turnen
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 50
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; endimg on a red space follow instructions glued on lid inside;
remarks:
probably published befor WWII

name: The Jolly Animal Picnic Game
description: The first player to reach the finish (Picnic Grounds) by any count wins the game. Two to four persons may play. Players take turns spinning and moving. If a player lands on a red colored space, the player must take a card and follow the printed instructions. There are 25 reward/penalty cards in a complete game. If the cards are exhausted during play they are reshuffled.

name: Vudila Lauamäng
description:
Board game for local Estonian children game room.
Roll and move on the game board. Some special squares. Who finishes first is the winner.

name: Killer: Vanilla
description:
Killer: Vanilla is a fast-paced card game with its tongue firmly in cheek. Players deal out death and destruction in many forms while trying to avoid the onslaught coming back at them. (This game is not recommended for children or those of a sensitive nature: bless 'em.) Kill off the weakest players to improve your hand as you balance defense and gear against a varied offense. Silent scoring heightens the tension... can you take another hit? Are Doctor De'Ath or the Booby Trap in someone's hand? Be the last man standing or take ‘em all with you!

Each turn a player may: make an Attack (Hand to Hand, Ranged, Area, Special) against any other player; play an Equipment card (aid survival); or change any or all cards in hand. Defense cards (Parry, Evade, Flee, Safe House, other) protect against Attacks, while Follow Ups boost damage. Global cards generally apply to all players. If a player gets a killing blow, his hand limit increases and he takes his target's cards. After the first kill, the scoring goes silent, leaving players with only an impression of how close to elimination they are.

Killer:Vanilla is a take-that card game which suits a 'beer & pretzels' mentality more than serious gaming. Play time is about 5 minutes per player, when you are used to the cards. The built-in expansion, The I In Team, adds some more complex solo cards as well as specific cards and rules for Team games.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Modern Warfare

name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: Command Expansion #1
description:
Command Expansion #1 comes with nine cards, numbered 1 to 9.

During setup, each player randomly takes one Command card. Command cards give player a unique ability for the entire game or once per round.

Examples:

(1) Scavenger. When refilling your hand from the draw pile, you may claim one of them from the top of a discard pile instead. The card may not be a wild card from the Trash pile.

(2) Rapid Advance. You can create 1-3 sets per turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: Command Expansion #2
description:
Command Expansion #2 comes with nine cards, numbered 10 to 18.

During setup, each player randomly takes one Command card. Command cards give player a unique ability for the entire game or once per round.

Examples:

(10) Summon East Winds. Once per round, you may create a set from any one card in the discard pile. This must be performed on your own turn.

(11) Hard of Heart. After you draw 1 card at the beginning of the turn, you may discard 2 Beauty cards and draw three new cards or discard 3 Beauty cards and draw five new cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: Allegiance Expansion
description:
The Allegiance Expansion comes with nine cards in three allegiance colors.

During setup, each player takes an Allegiance card of his/her team. When the round ends, Allegiance cards count as a card in the color set it matches.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Hit fast! Hit hard!
description:
As the eastern bloc crumbles in 1989 Gorbatjov is ousted in a reactionary coup led by the Soviet military. In desperate attempt to turn back time and unite the eastern bloc the long prepared offensive into western Europe is launched. A critical element for success is to be able to interdict the American reinforcements over the Atlantic to its NATO allies. That job belongs to the submarines of the arctic fleet in Murmansk. But they need air support and support from surface vessels as well and Murmansk is too far away from the North Atlantic seas to provide that support. In order to seize air fields and naval bases on the Norwegian west coast as fast as possible an invasion of Finland and Sweden is launched at the same time as the Norwegian border is crossed on the Nordkapp to outflank the Norwegian easily defensible terrain along the northern coast. Neutrality will not protect Sweden this time. But maybe an army of 600 000 trained men and 600 tanks will?
This game deals with the southern part of the Soviet operation against Sweden, the invasion of Skåne. The well trained paratroopers of the VDV and the equally well trained Baltic marines land to face the bulk of the Swedish armoured brigades supported by infantry and artillery in terrain ideally suited for armoured units. Will the Swedish built turret less tank Strv 103 meet the expectations, though twenty years in service now, or will it be up to the British built Centurions, with more than thirty years in service, to destroy the invaders?
With X pages of rules, XXX counters X maps and 13 scenarios the game is designed to help understanding of the challenges of the Swedes as well as those of the Warpac. While gameplay is designed to be fast and easy with command and control issues being in the centre of the design the optional rules allow for deeper study into logistics and recovery. Units are platoons and each game turn equals one hour . Hexes are 500 meters across.

Hit fast! Hit hard! centres on the 7th armoured brigade, PB7 Malmöbrigaden, and its hypothetical but well planned and trained actions around Ystad on the Scanian south coast. Equipped with Strv 103C, the upgraded version of the famous “S” tank was the cutting edge of the XI. Division responsible for repelling or at least fixing an invasion aimed at Ystad or Trelleborg. While PB7 might be superior in fire power to the air assault and naval infantry units it initially will encounter these are the elite units of the Soviet union. If the soviets seize a working harbour mechanised units with T-72M1 tanks are sure to pour in fast. You will also see parts of two different Swedish types of infantry brigades as well as territorial defence units and the 12th independent mechanised battalion with Strv 102R, partly upgraded Centurions, and motorised rifle companies in trucks rather than Pbv 302 infantry fighting vehicles.

name: Un Contre Tous
description:
"One against All" in English is a word game in which a player, in turn, plays against all others.

One player has 6 minutes to choose three secret words (maximum 10 letters per word), and gives a definition for these three words. The player draws half of the letter-cards for his opponents and gives information how many number of times this letter is present in the words etc. Player keeos other half of the cards.

When all the cards are drawn, the opponents have 6 minutes to find the words. For this, they can ask questions related to words, the player can only answer yes or no. Opponents can also ask if the letters kept by him during the draw are part of words.
The player receives tokens for each question or request letters, and receives a bonus for word not found.
The game is played over several rounds. The final winner is the one who has the most points.

name: Shattered Empires
description:
Join the galactic conflict by taking control of one of five factions in this customizable card game. Pick your strategy. You can choose to the Empire, those forces still united in uneasy alliance, or side with the rogue element, Warlord Darkon, and his stolen Imperial Technology. Become a member of the Bogathan Empire, hell-bent on making up for those centuries of denial and finally eradicating all the inferior life forms. Maybe you’ll join with the Merchant Coterie, banding up with other freighter captains, merchants, and mercenaries, while trying to fulfill your Black Market deals. Become a part of the Void, sentient battle computers that want nothing more than to continue to repair and expand, even at the expense of everything else in the galaxy.

Shattered Empires is an expandable card game where each player has their own customized deck of cards built around a chosen faction. Each deck contains a Base, which represents the player, then all the components necessary to build a fleet of ships and wage war in an effort to destroy all opposing bases.

Players take turns allocating their resources, building ships, acquiring more resources, then using those ships and resources to attack their opponents.

name: OPFOR Insurgency II
description:
OPFOR Insurgency II is the new, solitaire version of the old OPFOR Insurgency series from Warcoach Games. The new version is not only solitaire but incorporates all the best features of the previous Insurgency versions.

In this version, you lay down a grid of cards representing various terrain in your command area. Underneath are secretly placed a variety of cards that could be decoys or real insurgency units of various sizes. One card is a HVT (High Value Target). You draw a random hand and have 3 turns to find and destroy the HVT using those resources. Your resources could include intel units to help you locate the HVT, combat units to destroy it or any insurgents, support units to add strength to your combat units, or local national units to help in both intel and combat.

name: Schurken Schnappen
description:
Objective: hit as many hoodlums as possible
- acting by turns -
Kim and her friends are trying to hit rogues using a catapult - use box inside as target (zones are marked);
do not hit Ron - you will get a minus point;
hitting the same target zone - no additional point;
first player achieving 20 points wins the game
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mr. Money
description:
Probably made to cash in on decimalisation of the currency in Britasin.

Each player gets a board, with spaces for coins that will complete your image of Mr. Money. There is no choice or skill. You roll the Deci-Dice (sic) and your roll result tells you which coin you may place on your card. Play continues until one player has a completed card and that player wins.

name: Catch the Leader
description:
The game features of Toby Twirl and his chums. Toby Twirl was a Pig with human hands and feet and he appeared in books by Sheila Hodgetts between 1946 and 1958. His image was illustrated by Edward Jeffrey. This game is from one of hthe Toby Twirl Adventures books.

Rules
An exciting game for a number of players. Choose one player as Leader, the rest being Runners. Use a dice for scoring and counters or buttons for players. The Leader has first throw; a six entitles anyone to an extra throw. Don’t wait for a six to commence. If a Runner catches up to, or passes, the Leader, he or she wins and takes the place of the Leader next round. If the Leader reaches home without being caught he or she is the winner and the next player in turn is the Leader for the following round.

name: Doubloons
description:
Doubloons is a high seas pirate themed game that takes place around the Doubloon Islands. You and up to three other people will take on the roll of one of six captains, whose goal is to claim the treasures of the surrounding islands as your own and become the wealthiest pirate in the seas.

Doubloons will be playable with 2-4 people and is intended for players of all ages. The game board will be made up of 25 modular tiles, randomly placed at the start of each game to ensure that no two games are played exactly alike. Players will take their ship and travel from island to island with the goal of obtaining more loot than the other players. There will be multiple decks of cards to give you the ability to attack other players for their loot or defend against the attacks of others as well as provide for some additional effects. Each player will also have a unique special ability that they may use during the game to give it an additional tactical challenge.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Triba Vivo
description:
From the publisher: "The wise ones of a small tribal village have gathered everyone around the campfire. 'We are searching for the most able tribes person in the village. They will be chosen as our tribal champion!' The tribes people work hard to impress them. They recount stories they were told as youngsters, hunt bison, gather berries and defend the village against rival tribes. Soon they will find out which one of them will achieve the most glory and earn the respect of the wise ones."

Triba Vivo is a simple card game with an Esperanto theme, as componets are written in this language. Players try to get the majority of the cards of one of four types in order to get victory points. The point values for each type range from 0 up to 3, and this is defined randomly at the begining of each round. The game lasts as much rounds as needed until one player gets 12 victory points, who then wins the game.

Each round has two phases. First, each player gets 5 cards. Then 1 card is drew from the deck and put face up at the end of each point of a five-point Esperanto-Star depicted on the gameboard. Next players alternately select 1 card from their hands and put it in one of the 5 points of the Star (up to a maximum equal to the number of players plus one), not covering completely the card below. The player also has to put one of his/her playing pieces in anyone of the numbered rondels along each arm of the Esperanto-Star. At the end of this phase all cards and pieces will have been set upon the game board.

Now comes the second phase. Beginning with the star arm marked with a small white star, each star arm is resolved clockwise in the following manner. The player who has a piece of his/her color in the highest rank, as defined by the numbers on the rondels (lowest numbers are highest) is the first to take one of any of the cards on that star arm. Then the second highest player selects one of the remaining cards, and so on, until each player took one card. There will be one card left behind on the star point. Remaining star arms are resolved in the same way. Victory points are then scored according to the rules described above. If none achieves 12 points, a new round begins.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Weate State
description:
We are the citizens of the Weate State. We deserve to be happy, we deserve to move up in this world, and this company. If someone else is being successful, that only makes your success less. You must defeat the other citizens of the Weate State that are trying to be better than you. You will have to liquidate their assets, buy them out, and engage in a little bit of friendly “combat-atition”.

Weate State is a living card game currently in development by Right After Then.

Players take the role of a character in the Weate State. Everyone starts with a random deck of cards and a character card. Throughout the game players have to make choices as to what items they want to use, and what they want to deposit into the bank to use as money. Many ways exist to take down opponents, but in the end only one will stand with their deck, bank, and and health in intact.

name: Top-A-Top Kids
description:
Top-A-Top Kids is a new version of Kuźnia Gier's Top-A-Top party game that's designed especially for children.

Game play remains much the same as in the original game as the players take turns placing their cards in the middle of the table and reacting appropriately to the funny pictures on the cards played, e.g., by making special gestures or saying something. Having good reflexes and the ability to make associations is crucial as your reaction has to be quick and appropriate, or else you lose a turn and take all the cards on the table into your pile. The first player to get rid of all of her cards wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game

name: Command Line
description:
Command Line is a table top game where players take command of vast robot armies and battle across a system of planets. The board is made up of many different planets currently inhabited by biological lifeforms. Each players starts with their own planet, some units, and some generators. As generators produce more units and currency, you will expand to different plants and destroy the inhabitants. Currency can be used to buy upgrades, more generators, and tech cards. Tech cards allow you to modify the moves you take, some will even give you the power to destroy entire planets.

This is a game of pure strategy; there are no dice rolls, random card draws, or any form of luck. Combat is resolved with a calculation of attack and defensive power, and these powers can be improved throughout the game. By the end of this war, armies will spread across the system, devastate their opponents forces, and even destroy planets.

name: Cross Factors Cross Multiply
description:
Two games in one!

The object of Cross Factors is to be the first to cover two sets of numbers (from 1 to 12) by moving around on the board. For example, if a player landed on the number 24 then he could cover a 6 and a 4, or a 2 and a 12.

In Cross Multiply you try to gain the most points by creating rows of three or more on a multiplication table. This is done by first creating two numbers by rolling two dice (twice) and adding them together. These numbers are then used as the X and Y indices (or vice versa) on the table to claim a square in the table. On each subsequent turn the player can choose to replace one of the two numbers and thereby capture a new position on the table.

name: Dr. Seuss: 3 Terrific Card Games!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dr. Seuss: 3 Terrific Card Games! includes Crazy 8s, Go Fish, and a one-of-a-kind ABC Memory game with The Cat in the Hat, Horton, Yertle the Turtle, and many more favorite Dr. Seuss characters!

name: Nick's Finger Baseball
description:
Take me out to the ball game!

Nick's Finger Baseball is a free, two player game of strategy and outwitting. Playing the role of the captains of two baseball teams, both endeavor to lead their team to victory.

Over the course of 9 innings, there are a large number of turns. In each turn, each player simultaneously reveals their strategy for that part of the game. The player whose team is on offence reveals a number between 0 and 4, trying to reveal a high number... or are they? For they are also trying to avoid revealing one of the 2 numbers the defense revealed at that time, as revealing those spells disaster, which just gets worse the higher the number is! Do you shoot for high numbers and hope the defense isn't there, or try to sneak a lower number past them? As the defense, do you block the high numbers to stop power plays, or aim lower and stop sneaky plays?

Those are the types of choices you have to make in Nick's Finger Baseball, a battle of wits for 2 players!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Giant's Footprints Game
description:
Game that appeared in the 1988 Rupert Fun book.

Rules:
This game is played on the footprints in the two ovals. First copy the two green footprints on thin card so that they can be cut out separately and used for counters. Next make a cardboard top, as shown on the right, and push a used matchstick through the centre to make it spin.

One player chooses the track marked L, and the other the track marked R, Each places his counter on the correct green footprint at the start. Take turns to spin the top. The number which rests on the table tells you how far you may move. Sooner or later one of you will land on the green footprint of your track. If the other player’s next turn takes his counter on to the other green footprint, he has made a “pair” and so wins the game.

name: Stack 'em up Stan
description:
A family game for 2 or more players. It must be played on a hard and level surface.

The purpose of the game is to stack the objects as high as possible using only the mechanical figure “Stan”. The lifting operation is performed by deploying a trigger on Stan’s back. Players take it in turn to add one object to the stack. After rolling the dice, the player must use Stan to lift the current stack, maneuver it and balance it on top of the item depicted. If the stack should fall, the current player is eliminated from the round.

The last player remaining is the winner.

name: Zodi
description:
Zodi is a simple strategic card game that revolves around deduction.

Play Action Cards to increase counters on Icon Cards. Once an Icon Card has 10 counters on it, the game ends. Players then reveal which Alignment Cards they have and score points based on Icon Card ranking.

Game Requires tokens or counters to keep track of game state.

name: Fish Pond
description:
Fish Pond is a game in the Vintage Game Series of Channel Craft. The games in the series come in a small tin and recreate games from the Victorian era.

This 2-player game requires players to roll a single six-sided die (the die has the one pip replaced by a picture of a fish) to move their peg on a track of holes, which represent a stream leading to a pond. Players then roll the die again to see what lure they choose and if they roll the right lure, they roll again to see if any fish are caught. Once a player reaches the end of the track, both players tally their catch. The player with the most fish and at least one of each species of fish wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Okto
description:
OKTO is an abstract board game for two players. Each turn players roll two D8 and places tokens based on the number rolled. The first player to build a path across the board is the winner. But the adversary can use the numbers rolled to capture pieces, making the game more strategic.


OKTO é um board game abstrato para dois jogadores. A cada todada, os jogadores rolam dois D8 e colocam marcadores no tabuleiro de acordo com o número rolado. O primeiro jogador a construir um caminho que atravesse o tabuleiro é o vencedor. Mas o adversário pode usar os números rolados para capturar peças, tornando a partida mais estratégica.

name: Kionpa
description:
In the center of the universe there is a planet called Kionpa. It is here that the incarnated forces of Light and Darkness do eternal battle for the fate of the universe.

The forces of the Light are represented by an army of Good folk, such as elves, dwarves, and the heroes of humanity, while the Dark brings an army of Evil beings such as goblins, wraiths, and demons. (If possible, in future expansions for the game there will be different armies for the Light and the Dark.)

The game of Kionpa is a strategic two player game that looks a bit like Chess at first glance, with each player having their army lined up on opposite sides of a gridded board. Each player will pick and move one of their pieces per turn, and each piece can only move within certain ranges and directions.

Each piece also has unique abilities that are played through the use of cards and powered by energy they collect from certain squares in the middle of the board. These abilities range from unique ways to kill other pieces to abilities that can alter the landscape of the board, and some of them can be played defensively.

name: Questing
description:
In this cooperative "RPG-lite" game designed by a middle schooler, players take on the role of heroes who must quest around the kingdom to find the gemstones they need to enter the castle, where the evil Chimera is gathering his strength. If they can't defeat it before it becomes powerful enough, the kingdom is lost.

Each turn, a player rolls a die to see how far he can move, moves up to that distance, and then takes an action wherever he lands (which usually involves drawing a card to see what encounter he has). During play, players will collect "Quest" cards, which challenge them to travel to specific mysterious locations on the board and confront special monsters there. Doing so earns them gemstones, and they need three to enter the castle to challenge the Chimera. If a player rolls a "1" on the movement die, a strength token is added to the Chimera, and if the Chimera gets 11 tokens, it wins.

The game includes a simple advancement system for the characters; the players earn money for defeating enemies, and they can spend that money in the training hall to buy new skills for their characters.

Combat is handled with a simple die roll. Each monster has a target roll the player must hit; rolling the target number or higher harms the monster, rolling below harms the player's character. Once characters have advanced their skills, they can start to roll two or more dice instead of just one to see if they can roll a die that meets or beats the target number.

If the players manage to get into the castle and defeat the Chimera before it gets 11 tokens, they win.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Pip Up Cubes
description:
This dexterity game based on Jacks (Jackstones) won The Boardroomers Contest. Criteria was to use up to 20 playing cards and 10 game cubes and nothing else.

To play, all you need are the A-9 in 2 suits from a deck of cards and 10 game cubes. Each player gets a suit and organizes the cards according to rankings.

On your turn, place the number of cubes equal to the card number in play onto the table/floor. Organize the cubes to mimic the pattern of the pips on the playing card with ample space between cubes.

Grab an extra cube, toss it into the air, flip over your hand and quickly pick up all the cubes representing your card, and then catch the tossed cube in the same hand.

Complete a card and move on to the next one on your turn. Miss and play passes to your opponent. First player to complete all 9 cards is the winner.

HERE ARE THE COMPLETE RULES:

PIP UP CUBES - A dexterity game for 2 players, ages 9+
Designed by Bonnie Neubauer
Winner of the Boardroomers February 2013 Design Contest
(c) 2013 Bonnie Neubauer

Goal: Be the first player to work your way through all 9 of your cards, picking up cubes from the table (or floor) that are placed in the same pattern as the pips/symbols on the cards. You do this by tossing 1 cube in the air and, with the same hand, scoop up cubes from the table, then catch the tossed cube in that same hand... without dropping any cubes.

Components: 10 cubes & 18 poker cards: A-9 of hearts or diamonds and A-9 of spades or clubs.

Set-up: Place the 10 cubes between both players.
The 9 red cards go to one player, the 9 black to the other.
Each divides her pack into 3 parts: Ace, 2-5, 6-9.
Each places their Ace face-down on the table/floor. Then they shuffle their 2,3,4,5 cards and place them, face down on top of the Ace, each forming her own unique stack. Players both shuffle the 6,7,8,9 cards and each place them face-down on their stacks.
Both players flip over their stacks so the Aces are face-up. Neither looks at the cards below.
Player who is closest to 9 years of age goes first.

Play: First player places 1 cube on the table/floor. She tosses another cube in the air and, with that same hand, scoops up the table cube, and then catches the tossed cube in the same hand with the cube she picked up... without dropping any cubes. Do this and you accomplish the card!

If the first player fails to accomplish this (she dropped a cube or didn't catch the tossed cube), her turn is over and play moves to her opponent who attempts her own Ace card (picking up 1 cube).
Once a player successfully completes the Ace card, she places it on the bottom of her stack. This reveals her next card. It will be a 2,3,4, or 5. Her turn continues.

For cards 2-9, players place that number of cubes on the table, following the pattern of the pips/symbols on the card. All cubes should have at least a 1/8 inch space between them if you are playing with 1/2 inch cubes. Handicap players to even out skill, by adding more space or using less space between cubes. Here's what cubes will look like on the table for cards 3, 5, 6, 8:

A player's turn lasts until she fails to accomplish a card (drops cubes or fails to catch the tossed cube). This card stays face-up on top of her stack and she will re-start with this card on her next turn. Likewise, her opponent starts with the card that was left face-up on her own deck at the end of her last turn. Once you are using cards greater than 4, you will have to re-arrange the cubes on the table each time your turn starts.

Turns continue back and forth. Players will be going for different cards most of the time. As each card is accomplished, it's placed on the bottom of the deck and the next card is immediately attempted on the same turn.

Winner: First player to successfully make it through all 9 of her cards wins. If she went first, the other player gets one last turn to catch her. If there is a tie, re-play the 9 card and first wins!

name: Katas
description: Katas is designed for the true card game aficionado. Fun and strategic, it embroils four players, in two teams of two, in an intense struggle for victory. To start each round, the players bid to decide the attacking team, the trump and the target number of points. Next, the hand plays out in 12 turns, during which the defending team will do its utmost to prevent the attackers from accomplishing their goals. Though the structure is classic, the rules are unique and exceptionally well-balanced.

name: Stars of Hope
description:
Shattered Throne is the second expansion to the Planet Masters dicegame. This optional set of rules explains how to use the new dice.

Background story:

With order restored, diplomacy now reigns. Politicians are on their apex of power. Discussion and consensus now decide almost each and every action that happens in the galaxy. The claws of diplomacy hold entire empires in their grasp.

name: Tajemnice Krainy Ducha Gór
description:
Tajemnice Krainy Ducha Gór is an educational game about places of touristic interest around Jelenia Góra. Players are tourist guides competing to take their groups to most interesting places, while their actions are limited by cards in hand and time tokens they are given.

The game deck consists of two types of cards: sightseeing places and interesting facts. Places make up the trip each player's group takes and are a basis for scoring, while facts can add to the score or even (when played at a correct place) can multiply it. Playing places costs time tokens and playing facts costs cards in hand, so finally all players are left with nothing to do and the game ends. The winner is the player with most points.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: Kuźnia Gier, Stowarzyszenie LGD Partnerstwo Ducha Gór

name: Rockin' Math
description:
Think rock stars don’t need math? Think again! How many concert tickets do you have to sell to cover your agent’s fees? How much leather will you need to make custom pants for your entire band?
