In his turn player chooses a card and reads it aloud.
He must answer three questions correctly to advance on the game board. Player who reaches the International Music Awards first is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Music, Trivia

name: Fantasy Warriors: Dawn of New Heroes
description:
Fantasy Warriors is a wargame about fantasy armies clashing on a battlefield.

It is not a skirmish game but a game that revolves around units that move in ranks.

The main focus of the game is the strategic deployment of units and the kind of orders the units have. Every units will have a generic behaviour depending by the orders thay have and will change that only if a new order is delivered. Greater armies will have a more complex chain of command so orders must be delivered by voice or by other means (banner bearers and herlads can be too far) so couriers are employed.

The careful management of orders given or changed during a game is the key to vistory because you must be able to react to the situations that can arise! And be sure to have competent leaders on the field (another aspect of the game this one)!

The first scouting part of the game help the players to shape and organize the battlefield and the scenary elements on it, then it's time for omens and leaders' speeches to rise morale and motivations of troops.

From that moment on the most common things seen on the battlefield will be, in this order, the ranged attack phase, the combat phase and the reorganization/change orders phase.

Magic will obviously alter mechanics, supllying for an exemple to the lack of good communications on distances, but do not confide too much in the bizzarries of magic!

D10-sided dices are rolled to check the outcome of actions, attacks and potentially morale-shakening events (like the death of your Leader or seeing your comrades wiped out in few minutes).

Special items to be defended or positions to be conquered represnt the objectives but, obviously, it is possible to concede to the adversary when things are clearly FUBAR.

Constant management of leadership, C&C chain of command and orders given make Fantasy Warriors a game that can be very different from other fantasy wargames out there.

Tens of races and units add excellent variability to the game that has been published firts time in 1990.

This new edition in particular is an ambitious idea that strives in bringing to life the Fantasy Warriors world, creating pratically from scratch the theatre where the exciting battles and stories of valour, sacrifice and war are going to unfold.
The old "Warrior" magazine, published by Grenadier (many wargame players will for sure remember good memories here!), described in very brief and fast strokes some of the places that composed the savage and grim fantasy world of the game, but it never brought it forward a complete gazzetteer of a region, a map or some of the peculiarities that races, tribes and people of this world share (or fight for!).

Contributors to this campaign will have the opportunity to see again a great classic of the fantasy wargame world having a new life, helping us in bringing the game to new heights where the old Grenadier never had time to reach.

This campaign will drive forward the game to develop the well-proven mechanics of Fantasy Warriors into new terrains, new rules for naval and seaside battles, sieges, fortifications, city fight and more ideas we are testing yet to see what we can add to this wonderful ruleset.

A real background world will be fully developed, with maps, cultures and tens of races, something the old Grenadier never did in details.

If this campaign will meet success. future is going to see new armies, beasts, wondrous vehicles and buildings.

name: Turtle Thumb Tussle
description:
Rather than go to war, the indigenous tribes of Chelonia have invented a novel way of settling disputes. As my learned reader will no doubt be aware, Chelonia is the last remaining habitat of Proganochelys quenstedti, the roof turtle; now hunted to extinction elsewhere because of its colourful shell. The natives play a game on the backs of the turtles, which is described below. Naturally, the game must be played quickly before the affronted turtle reaches the water and swims off.

In Turtle Thumb Tussle, two players use their hands to occupy territory on a board resembling a turtle's shell. Players roll dice to determine which finger moves next, and to what colour. Think Twister meets Sumo with hands instead of bodies, and you won't be far off the mark!

name: Rockin' Reading
description:
Think rockers aren't readers? Think again! From reading the reviews of your latest album to the blog posts about your sold-out concert, you’ve gotta read to rock and roll!

In his turn player chooses a card and reads it aloud.
He must answer three questions correctly to advance on the game board. Player who reaches the International Music Awards first is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Music, Trivia

name: Il gioco dello Zig Zag
description: An educational game for beginning students of the Italian language. On their turn, players (or teams if more than two are playing) draw a card which gives them a topic, and must then say as many Italian words as possible related to that topic. Each word they think of within the time limit permits them to advance one space along the zig-zag track.

name: Triopolit
description:
Abstract dice game.
On a board consisting of card board tiles of triangular shape players move their pawn by dice roll. You are allowed to move onto an adjacent tile if the symbol of one of the 3 special 4sided dice corresponds. If you roll "eye" and the symbol of the tile you stay, you are entitled to jump to any other tile with that symbol.
Player who first has visited all 4 tiles of his color wins.

Rules in German or English. Revised rules (2nd run) are better.

part of the symbol trilogy like
Triopolis (largest box)
Triopolix (smallest box)
All 3 games are close in shape but very different in game play.

More details: Pöppel Revue 3/94
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Up Down
description: Japanese Old Game. Players take turns rolling two dice an putting coins onto the hollow spaces of a balancing see-saw. The game is over when all coins have been placed, and the winner is the person who has the balance tipped to his or her side.

name: Erst denken dann lenken
description:
Players start with their 4 pawns at the 4 corners of the board. They roll the dice and decide to advance with one of their pawns. At the beginning, each player is provided with 10 traffic signs. At the end of any move, a player is entitled to place one of his traffic signs near a space. According to the traffic sign, a pawn can be blocked, forced to move slower or take another route. A player who disobeys a sign must answer a question from the rule book about traffic rules. When all 4 pawns of a player arrive in the central parking lot, that player wins.

Content:
board, 120 traffic signs, 2 dice, 16 pawns, catalogue of questions

produced (but not published) by ASS

name: 召喚師戰爭: 洞穴哥布林派系套牌
description:
[English]
This is the Summoner Wars: Cave Goblins Faction Deck, in Chinese version. The content is the same as the Cave Goblins starter faction in the English Starter Set. It expands the Summon Wars with more a new choice of faction. Remark: Faction decks in the Chinese version are published as separate products.

[Chinese]
召喚師戰爭中你扮演一個召喚師的角色。你被召喚之石賦
予呼喚強大勇士和施展強力法術的能力，以在你與一個敵對
的召喚師的戰鬥中幫助你。遊戲的目的是摧毀你對手的召喚師
卡。當你是遊戲中唯一擁有召喚師卡在場中的玩家時，你就勝
出了。

洞穴哥布林派系套牌
1 斯尼克斯- 召喚師
1 吞食者- 捍衛者
1 莫克- 捍衛者
1 波拉夫- 捍衛者
8 戰士- 普通兵
6 彈石手- 普通兵
4 狂暴戰士- 普通兵
3 哥布林部落攻擊- 事件
3 哥布林憤怒- 事件
2 哥布林突進- 事件
1 哥布林無堅不摧- 事件
3 牆壁卡
1 召喚師參考卡
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: 召喚師戰爭: 神通族派系套牌
description:
{English]
This is the Summoner Wars: The Benders Faction Deck, in Chinese version. The content is the same as the starter deck included for the Benders in the English Master Set. It expands the game with a new choice of faction. Remark: All Faction Decks in the Chinese version are published as separate products.

[Chinese]
召喚師戰爭中你扮演一個召喚師的角色。你被召喚之石賦
予呼喚強大勇士和施展強力法術的能力，以在你與一個敵對
的召喚師的戰鬥中幫助你。遊戲的目的是摧毀你對手的召喚師
卡。當你是遊戲中唯一擁有召喚師卡在場中的玩家時，你就勝
出了。

神通族派系套牌
1 塔骷髏- 召喚師
1 卡拉爾- 捍衛者
1 古爾頓- 捍衛者
1 索格文- 捍衛者
7 欺騙者- 普通兵
6 操縱者- 普通兵
5 破壞者- 普通兵
3 模仿- 事件
3 精神控制- 事件
2 魔力汲取- 事件
1 英雄誕生- 事件
3 牆壁卡
1 召喚師參考卡
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Game of Data Processing
description:
The Game of Data Processing (An Application Approach) consists of advancing discs around a logic flow diagram (the board) and gather points with the goal of becoming a Data Processing Manager before your opponents.

Along the way, player can move into different subroutines, pick up "Stimuli" cards, and branch out at decision points within the program.

Players gain points in Intelligence, Motivation, and External Influence to spend toward promotions and eventually the game winning management goal.

name: Mythic Mages: Defenders of Elderwood
description:
In the humble forest village of Elderwood, trouble is stirring. The Great Tree that has been a beacon of light and hope for the villagers, may now be the cause of the village’s demise. Evil forces are at work, and their goal seems to be the destruction of the tree. A horde of dangerous beasts and magical creatures have continuously been assailing the village. Who or what is controlling them has yet to be discovered. The villagers’ resilience has so far kept the monsters at bay, but the attacks grow more difficult with each wave. Yet while all may seem lost, fate has stepped in to give the villagers one last hope. A mysterious stranger by the name of Balthazar has appeared from outside and has agreed to help the village. He has identified four local youths who have started showing signs of talent to control the elements. If they can learn to develop and harness this power in time, Elderwood can be saved!

In Mythic Mages: Defenders of Elderwood, players take on the role of apprentice mages who must learn the ways of magic and use these new skills to save the village from certain destruction. Mythic Mages is a deck-building game with a truly cooperative slant. Players are not only building their own decks carefully, but must also be aware of what the other players are building in theirs. To best complement each other, players will occasionally have the ability to pass or swap cards to optimize their team performance.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Man, Primitive: A Prehistoric Fantasy Adventure
description:
Man, Primitive's setting is millions of years ago in the Paleolithic period. Humans are just beginning to form settlements and small villages. Times are tough for them, hunting & gathering food in the cold weather.

Man, Primitive's game-play has several different movement factors. A large game board that represents the northern region of Palagon is where the players begin their journey. One space at a time they move. During encounters, they will take place on the Battle Board. The Battle Board is a smaller board laid out for tactical movement around creatures. Players will move according to their character card's Speed setting. The mechanic of the encounters revolve around rolling a custom "Fate Die" along with a d10 to determine the outcome. Damage will be rolled according to the weapon's damage die. The characters village will be upgraded throughout the game along with weapons being crafted from materials found along the way. 4 players will be the characters and 1 player will be the Great Spirit(GM). Solo adventures are being created for those in between larger games to acquire better items.

Man, Primitive's goal is just what the real primitive's goal was to do; survive. There are 11 hunting quests each lasting an average of 1 hour. The players will need to make it through all of quests, build up their village and craft their weapons. The players will be upgrading everything for fear of the Ice Lord returning with it's minions. A final boss fight will ensue. Already planned expansions will finish the story and conjure some creatures the players have never seen.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: Clacto Dice
description:
Game based on the use of magnetic marbles (clickets). The object is to place all the clickets on the game board (in the shape of a ruther), without moving them as a result of magnetic attraction.To determine to vacant place on the board where the clicket is to be put the players throw dice. Obviously the number of eyes on the dice determine the place to put the clicket.
The player who succeeds in placing his last clicket without disturbing the other marbles on the board wins the game.

name: Fun Bowl Football
description:
This game features a picture of Hall Of Fame Coach Paul "Bear" Bryant. The game is a dice game where dice are used to determine the outcome of each play. Cards represent various plays for the defense to guess what the offense will choose. If the defense gets the correct play, any yardage gained is cut in half.

The box cover states "100 made in USA"

name: Loversopoly
description:
Lover'sopoly was created for the sole intended purpose of creating a game intended for married couples that most adult board games on the market today do not offer. Most adult board games today are very shallow and have no depth to them. married couples have often purchased "sex games" that come and go and offer no substance. Lover'sopoly touches on every level of marriage relationship from intimacy, to sex, to romance and even humor.

The players are by rolling the dice and advancing to the next space. Spaces consist of "action spaces" as well as "Pandora's Box" and "Naughty or Nice". When landing on an action space the individual has the right to purchase the space and build on the space "time chips". By purchasing more time chips they receive more time with the action when their spouse lands on it. "Padora's Box" and "Naughty or Nice" are not properties open to ownership but rather actions or questions that are fueled throughout the game and keep the game interesting and moving along. The goal is to own as many of the desired action properties but watch out because your partner may earn the right to purchase an action property right from under your nose.

The action properties are the most creative portion of the game. Ladies, how would you like to receive a nice 3 minute kneck massage every time your partner lands on your space?
Or perhaps you wouldn’t mind your partner drawing a seductive pose of you in your birthday suite? Men, how would you like your spouse enjoying a nice dessert off of your mid-section? Or perhaps having your wife describe your most attractive features?

This game has everything for both male and female and is the perfect way to spark up a relationship. Loversopoly makes the best Valentine’s Day gift as well.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ransack
description:
Ransack is a cut-throat board game for two players. Ransack is about two thieves, The Wolf and The Scorpion, who have challenged each other to a thieves' duel.

Both players must race to be the first to loot 11 coins from the dungeon. This is easier said than done, though, since your fate rests on the fickle nature of coin tosses.

Players take turns navigating through a dungeon that is built using tiles drawn from a central pile. Combat, events and deciding whose turn it is are all handled using coin flips.

Optional rule variants include a gambling / drinking versions. Due to the inclusion of these rules in the rule book the minimum age is set at 18.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Make Space For Puma  The PRS Board Game
description:
Game Intention:
More space, more sales, more margin. This logic is part of our Phase 4 growth strategy. Now we want to make it happen. To be The Better Retail Partner we need to grow deeper into the world of retail. PRS provides ways and solutions to make, maintain and increase PUMA branded retail space on retailer's floors.

As growth is serious business, we decided to wrap it up in a. Game for you to play with your PRS buddies.

Each player starts with $70,000 capital and you explore the game board that shows brand environments in various retail situations. Embedded in these environments are PRS opportunities. Make money by collecting your realized solutions' operating profit each round.

To win the game, you must a) pass the collect operating profit field with b) all space opportunities of your color realized, and c) the highest operating profit (cash minus IOU and interest) of all players. Once a player calls "game over" all other players collect one round of operating profit. Continue game, if operating profit of another player is higher than that of caller...

name: Let's Go to Campmeeting
description:
"Meetings, hikes, choir practice, fire duty, and a baptism. All the fun, excitement, and spiritual renewal of a true to life campmeeting."

Players draw destination cards and roll the dice to proceed to that location. Upon arriving at their destination, players read and follow the instructions and when finished draw a new destination card. Players earn souls for completing tasks and arriving at destinations.

Play continues until "The Last Day of Campmeeting" card is drawn.

The player who has collected the most souls, wins that game.

name: Invasions Tuatha Dé Danann
description:
In Invasions Tuatha Dé Danann, players will storm the ancient island of Ireland as the Tuatha Dé Danann, seeking to conquer and claim the land from the Fir Bolg inhabitants. The Tuatha Dé Danann are not the only invading faction, the inbound Milesians and Fomorians will also take part in what will be a legendary war!

Players shall gather resources, fortify hill-forts, reinforce Tuathian armies, and construct megalithic stones which are essential for a Tuatha Dé Danann victory.

The invading factions seek the land for themselves, so the Tuatha Dé Danann must seek each others help, if they wish to have any chance at fending off these invasions.

Survive the invaders and the mightiest of the Tuatha Dé Danann will become King. Fail, and the Tuatha Dé Danann are history!

On each turn, players will take part in each of the Gather, Build, Training, Movement, and Exploration Phases. These phases will allow the players to use their worker units to gather the resources they need to strengthen their control of the island. These resources will be necessary during other phases, where players will be able to construct hill-forts, prepare armies for battle, and build megalithic stones to solidify the strength of the Tuatha Dé Danann across the land.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Worker Placement

name: Stick-to-It!
description:
Players toss the self-stick ball on the special wall-board to land on a “letter fish” or a “picture fish,” and then must answer the question about that letter or picture depending on the game.
If the answer is correct player scores a point.

f.e.:
Toss and say the letter. “This is the letter
Toss and say a word that begins that word
Toss and say the picture word and identify its beginning sound.
etc.

Player with the most correct answers is the winner.

name: Taijitu
description:
A taijitu is a symbol representing the balance between opposing forces. (For example, the Yin-Yang symbol is a taijitu.)

It is also the name of this two player game set on an octagonal board made of hexagons. There are three types of pieces- player one's black pieces, player two's white pieces, and a type of piece both players can use that is grey. All of these pieces start in the center of the board, connected together. Along the eight sides of the board are scoring markers called Trigrams. The first player to land one of their pieces (never the grey ones) onto four of these Trigrams wins the game.

A player's turn is to take two actions, and an action is simply moving a piece they are allowed to move to any unoccupied adjacent space. A player is allowed to move either pieces of their color or grey pieces, but with these two cardinal rules: First, they are not allowed to move any grey pieces the other player moved on their previous turn, and, second, no piece may ever be separate from the rest of the pieces at the end of any action.

When a player scores a Trigram, they flip the piece that landed on it to its other side, which now makes it a normal grey piece. This means as one player is winning, they will also have a more difficult time scoring.

name: Taffy's Party Game
description:
Taken from the instruction sheet:

"Taffy's four party scenes are shown on the board - but where are the guests? Each player is Taffy, trying to be the "hostess with the mostest" by making the right scene with the right guests.
Players start with random guest cards for all the parties. You make the party rounds according to your calls on the telephone. The spaces on the board match the shapes of the guest cards. Whenever you land in a space for which you have a guest card for a matching shape, you must place that guest in the space. Funny scenes will develop, such as pajamas appearing at the formal party, guests in bathing suits frolicking in the snow, etc.
Whenever you are able to take the correct guest to the correct party, you receive a picture card. The WINNER is the player who can show she is the best hostess by placing the most guests correctly and collecting the most pictures."

name: Bombinoes
description: Bombinoes is a game of creative connections. During the game you have tiles and attempt to form them into a line. However, all the tiles have images on them and placing a tile requires you to come up with what the tile has in common with the tile next to it. A cloud and an umbrella might be connected by "rain," for instance, while a criminal and coffee might be connected by "words starting with C." You're only able to use any kind of connection once in your line, and your opponent might break up your line with a bomb tile and force you to rethink connections on the fly, so making the 10 connections you need to win the game will take an agile mind and a creative spirit!

name: Castle Garden: Coat of Arms
description:
First expansion for the base game introducing 13 guards per player

Translated from the box:
Your guards take on the opposing army of equally powerful guards in this Castle Garden expansion. Can you outsmart the enemy? Are you faster? Then you have chance to capture the opposing guards.
in this game of attaque and seduction it's a matter of timing and insight.: be too greedy and you might loose your head, too careful and your enemy captures you instead.

Nerves of steel might help you master this expansion of Castle Garden

name: The Game of Boy Scouts
description:
An old track game that depicts the players rise through the Boy Scouts. Players start at "start here" location on the outer circle track. After spinning, player move the indicated amount. The first player, reaches the center space on the board win the game.
Beautifully color illustrated 18½" x 18½" game board, with four colored wooden pieces and two cardboard spinners with metal arrows. The original instructions were printed on the underside of the cover.

The game board contains 100, 1-3/8" colored circles, most showing boys working their way up from Tenderfoot through the stages of Scouting. The term "Eagle Scout" badge was in existence for only one year before this game was issued which is probably why it's not listed. 57 Merit Badges were available to choose from. These are listed in the text-circles. Each corner provides a detailed illustration of some facet of scouting. The exterior of the board is pressed with scrollwork in all eight corners.
The 20" x 10" box itself is wooden and lined with a textured leather-like material.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Silben-Memo
description:
There are cards with different animals and syllables with set of three f.e. gi-raf-fe.
Who first finds all three syllables and sets the animal names together gets the cards.
Player with the most sets is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Business Guru
description:
Business Guru is effectively an Indian variant of Monopoly.

Players buy and sell property, build houses and hotels, and collect rent from their fellow players. Properties, however, are entire nations, rather than pieces of real estate. Airlines and shipping lines also replace railways in Business Guru.

There are other small differences, but the roll-and-move system is very reminiscent of Monopoly-style games.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Million Dollar Idea
description:
Million Dollar Idea is a roll-and-move game where players try to become the most successful (and thereby wealthiest) businessmen through entrepreneurship. The game board has three concentric circles around which the players must move their pawns (by rolling dice) to progress through the game.

The outer circle represents "starting up your business". By landing on the various spaces of this circle, players must complete certain tasks through negotiation and by drawing cards before moving on to the second circle.

The second circle (referred to as the "inner circle") represents "operating your business". Players move their pawns through this circle in a similar manner to the outer circle.

When a player has accumulated sufficient wealth and experience from game spaces, cards, and negotiations, he may move to the "inner path and winner's circle". If a player has completed the requirements for wealth and experience ahead of his opponents, he moves to the winner's circle and wins the game.

From the game box:

"Million Dollar Idea is an exciting new board game in which players escape the corporate rut and exercise their entrepreneurial spirit. In Million Dollar Idea you market your own 'great idea' by forming a company, obtaining financing and making money through the sales of your invention. Unfortunately while you strive for success, dilemmas such as competitors who steal your ideas, union problems, lawsuits, and the ever-present threat of a hostile take-over test your business acumen while doubling your blood pressure."

name: Plus und Minus bis 100: Memo Spiel
description:
Like in usual Memory players look for pair of tiles but instead of similar tiles there is a mathematical operation on one tile and answer on another tile to look for in this game.

Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Mengen und Größen: Memo-Spiel
description:
"Quantities and sizes"
Like in usual Memory players look for pair of tiles but instead of similar tiles there is a similar types but different quantities or sizes on tiles to look for in this game.
f.e. player must match pair with 10 minutes and 600 seconds.

Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Selbstlaute: Mau-Mau-Spiel
description:
a, e, i, o, u - who hears what words have the same vowels?

Players may play the card on the middle stack if the word on that card he/she plays has the same vowel if the word on the topmost card.

Player who first gets rid of his cards is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Wörter mit ss und ß: Rechtschreib-Spiel
description:
Lasso, Fluss, Tasse, Karussell - Maßband, Großeltern, Straße, Blumenstrauß
German language "S"-sensitive spelling card game.

Cards are placed face up on the table. In turn, each player may take the card that he can safely assign either "ss" or "ß". The children then check themselves by just looking at the word on the back of the card.
Who sets four words with "ss" or "ß" first wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: The Three Little Pigs
description:
This is a game produced under the name "a Little Golden Game" by the Golden Books publisher.
A game for 2 to 4 Players ages 5 to 8.

In the game Three Little Pigs, one player is the wolf and the other players are pigs. The players will take turns spinning and moving their pieces on the board to the next matching color of the spinner. If a pig lands on a path leading to a house, they hide in that house. If the wolf lands on a path leading to a house (straw or stick) he blows it down.
The wolf player wins if he successfully blows down the straw and stick houses. The pig player(s) wins if he successfully hides all three of his pigs.

name: Old MacDonald Had a Farm
description:
This is a game produced by Golden Books under the name "a Little Golden Game".
A game for 2 to 4 players ages 5 to 8.

This is a children's game that touches on a type of memory game.
Players start with a Scoring Board in front of them. In turn, players will announce "Heads" or "Tails" and flip over one of the Animal Cards in the center of the table. If they called the correct animal part (heads or tails) they get to keep that Animal Card and take another turn.
When they get the matching head and tail of an animal, they place the completed animal on their Scoring Card.

name: Pixeled Kings
description:
The game is played with a deck of 8-Bit Playing cards, the traditional deck. All 56 cards including the gaff cards and jokers are used.

The game begins with each player receiving a king card, they are shuffled and dealt out randomly. Once the king cards are dealt each player then receives 5 cards. The kings are held with the hand so the other players don't know which king the other players have. The player at the dealers left begins.

The player lays a card down to start a trick , all of the players play a card from that trick if they have it. If they don't they must draw a card then play any card. They player with the highest card with the same suite that was started wins the trick, unless a gaff or joker is played. The player that plays a gaff or Joker gets to take the trick. If multiple gaffs or jokers are played the players must enter into a best of 3 roll-off with 8-bit dice. If there are more than 2 jokers or gaff cards played on one hand. The players roll one die each, the player with the highest roll gets a bye in the first round as the other players roll against each other. The highest total best of 3 wins the roll off. If any player in a roll off rolls double ?s or double aces (the engraved picture on the 1 spot) they win the roll off immediately.

The player who won the last trick begins the next trick, the game ends when someone runs out of cards.

Scoring:

3 points for every trick won that matches the same suite as your king.
2 points for every trick won that includes a gaff or joker.
1 point for every trick won that does not match the suite of your king.
-1 point for every card left in your hand.


The game is played in sets, and points are recorded after each set. The first person to earn 25 Points is The Pixeled King.

name: Quick Slap!
description:
Ready to slap something quickly? Well, Quick Slap! is the game for you as it features both "quick" and "slap" in the name. The games features a deck of symbol cards, with the cards featuring 1-3 symbols in various colors and shapes, and a deck of "slap" cards.

At the start of the game, three slap cards are revealed, each saying something like "Three red", "Four triangles" or "Three different cards showing the same color". The symbol cards are dealt out among the players, then they takes turns laying out one card at a time, with each new card covering the card that the player previously played. As soon as the cards in play match the conditions on one of the slap cards, players race to slap the slap card; the first player to do so claims the card, then a new one is revealed. (If you slap at the wrong time, you must return a previously claimed slap card.)

Whoever collects the most slap cards wins!

Quick Slap! Deluxe includes more symbol cards, more slap cards, and a bell.

name: 4 Letter Words
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In 4 Letter Words, each round players receive thirteen cards and must make as many four-letter words as they can. In this Rummy-style card game, players go head-to-head with opponents to see whose words score the most in each position. Will you be successful, or will you be shouting four-letter words?

name: Trickery
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Trickery plays like conventional trick-taking games like Bridge and Hearts, but changes the rules with each round of play, allowing for thousands of different combinations. Last hand, 9s were worth double, diamonds were trump, 5s were worth extra points, and the Queen of spades was on everyone's least wanted list. Now Aces reverse value, the fifth trick you take gives bonus points, 7s negate the entire trick, and the choice of trump goes to the highest bidder. Next hand – who knows?

name: Hexadraughts
description:
Draughts for 3 players, as recorded in the files of the British Museum in London.

Each player has 10 pieces. Each player starts from one of the flat sides of the triangular board.

Each player can capture pieces from both of his two opponents and this is carried out as in normal Draughts (the rules do not say that jumping can only be in one direction, i.e. you cannot jump a piece by doing a move rather like a knight in Chess). Each piece can be moved in three directions, straight ahead, or to the right of 'straight ahead' or to the left of 'straight ahead'. Crowned pieces can be moved in any direction.

Pieces can be 'crowned' by reaching the back starting row of his opponents. This is precarious because at either end of your side of the board, your opponents' back row is only five hexes away from each other.

The game is over if there is only one player left or if two players are so hemmed in that they cannot move any more.

name: Decomposed Queens
description:
The game is played with a deck of Zombie Rider Playing cards. All 56 cards including special gaffs and jokers are used.

1. The game starts as each player receives one of the random queen cards.

2. After the queens are dealt each player is dealt 5 cards. The queens are held in the hand so the other players don't know which queen the other players have.

3. The player at the dealers left begins. They lay a card down to start a trick, each player must play a card from that trick if they have it. If they don't they must draw a card then play any card. They player with the highest card with the same suite that was started wins the trick, unless a gaff or joker is played. The player that plays a gaff or Joker gets to take the trick.

4. Roll off: If multiple gaffs or jokers are played the players must enter into a best of 3 roll-off with Zombie Rider dice. If there are more than 2 jokers or gaff cards played on one hand. The players roll one die each, the player with the highest roll gets a bye in the first round as the other players roll against each other. The highest total best of 3 wins the roll off. If any player in a roll off rolls double ZR (the engraved picture on the 1 spot) they win the roll off immediately.

5. The player who won the last trick begins the next trick, the game ends when someone runs out of cards.

Scoring:
3 points for every trick won that matches the same suite as your queen.
2 points for every trick won that includes a gaff or joker.
1 point for every trick won that does not match the suite of your queen.
1 point for every roll off victory.
-1 point for every card left in your hand.
The game is played in sets, and points are recorded after each set. The first person to earn 25 Points is most decrepit queen.

name: Slender: The 8 Pages
description:
In this game, the player must survive long enough to collect 8 pages about the Slender, a horror that stalks, either killing you, or driving you insane to the point where you commit suicide.
To play, you move, and then roll to see if Slender appears. If you make it to the next location, you can check to see if a page is there.

The more pages you collect, the more likely the Slender will appear, it will become harder to get away from it.
You will have to be quick, as your flash light will slowly run out. Once it is dead, it is nearly impossible to win.
Even if you collect all 8 pages, you are still killed, but you can have a sense of accomplishment.

Based on the Slender: The 8 pages computer game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: The Oregon Game
description:
"Play The Oregon Game and, if you know more Oregon facts, history and simple trivia than your opponent, you win. The Oregon Game will test the skill of the staunchest native Webfoot and yet the multiple-choice questions offer an entertaining way for children and newcomers to learn more about Oregon." (Taken from the rules)

The active player reads aloud the question and four possible answers. He then silently guesses the answer, checks the back of the card and if correct, moves his peg forward. If incorrect, the other player then gets a chance to guess and move (if correct). Players take turns as the active player until one has reached the end of the scoring track for the win.

name: Dicetropolis
description:
A press your luck dice rolling area control game themed around city building.

Players take turns rolling "Permit Dice" in attempt to get matching permit colors in order to place a one of their buildings on to the city board. Players press their luck by rolling more Permit Dice in efforts to get bigger buildings and to score more points but watch out for the Stop Work Orders or you might not be able to build anything on your turn.

Players earn points as their buildings get placed each turn and bonus points at the end of the game for Block Monopolies, Zone Mastery, and most buildings adjacent to each other. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck

name: Patilez
description: From the game box cover: "A little like checkers and backgammon but easier to play... A two player strategy game with infinite possibilities." Patilez is a race game where the winner is the first player to move all his numbered playing pieces from their initial positions to their designated spaces along the center line of the board while avoiding being hit by your opponents unique white piece and sent back to its start.

name: Gerontopoly
description:
Gerontopoly game is aimed at helping health professionals and students gain greater awareness and sensitivity toward aging-related changes. The object of the game is to gain as much life satisfaction as possible without losing money, while avoiding developing chronic diseases. Players roll the dices and move their pieces around a board much as they do in similar recreational games of chance, but their "purchases" are mundane personal aids such as dentures, hearing aids and walkers. Players of Gerontopoly can find themselves detained in the nursing home, adult day care center or hospital. On the upswing, each time they pass GO, they receive $300 from Social Security. During the game, players try to avoid getting "Chronic Disease" cards and attempt to collect as many "Life Satisfaction" cards and as much money as possible. They try to accomplish this by answering various questions about aging including: *With normal aging, which declines the least--hearing, smell, taste or vision? Answering 'taste' earns the player $50. The acceptance of Gerontopoly by non-health care professionals helps to widen the scope of people learning about aging lifestyles.

In a 2-phase study, the acceptability and efficacy of the game was evaluated. Using a 22-item, postgame questionnaire, the 190 dental students, 23 dental hygiene students, 25 college sociology students. Results also suggest the game can change attitudes and enhance awareness about the concerns of the elderly.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Championship Fight Game
description: Fight Game from 1950 using a spinner to find results of each round. A decision to a knock out are possible. Game was designed by Frankie Goodman of the US National & Intercollegiate Boxing Club

name: First Words: Memo Spiel
description:
Players look for pair of tiles but instead of similar tiles there must be picture on one tile and word on another tile.

Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Malnehmen bis 100: Memo Spiel
description:
Like in usual Memory players look for pair of tiles but instead of similar tiles there is a mathematical operation on one tile and answer on another tile to look for in this game.

Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Plus und Minus bis 20. Memo-Spiel
description:
Like in usual Memory players look for pair of tiles but instead of similar tiles there is a mathematical operation on one tile and answer on another tile to look for in this game.

Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Awkwords
description:
Players select tokens and start them from the middle Square. High roll of the dice decides the starter.
Each player in turn rolls the dice and moves his token the number of squares indicated.
Tokens can move in any direction, therefore players always have a choice of letter squares to land on.
As a player lands on letters, he writes them down in consecutive order. Players try and collect letters which give the best chance of building words of consecutive letters. The words may be of any length, and may have overlapping letters.
Example — PEGAGAYLYZX contains the words — PEG ; GAG ; GAY ; GAYLY.
If a token lands on an "ANY LETTER" square, the player chooses any letter he wants.
Tokens cannot pass each other, and cannot land on the same squares. Players can therefore try to block their opponents. If a token is blocked so that it cannot move in any direction, it loses that turn.
The words that are built, count one point per letter. The example above is worth 14 points.
The first player to collect 20 points is the winner, or, the game can be shortened or lengthened, by deciding at the start of the game what the winning score should be.

A variation on this game is "SCRAPWORD”
Each player chooses any word and all the players write it down. All the players will have the same list of words. The game plays the same way as "AWKWORDS" but when a token lands on a letter that the player has on his list, he crosses it out.
The first person to cross off every letter in every word, is the winner.

name: Sight Word Picnic Bingo
description: 3-by-3 bingo game for children learning to read. Players match words or pictures from drawn tokens to corresponding words on their boards.

name: BattleWin!: Battle To Win The Ultimate Battle Of Win
description:
On the distant planet of BattleWin the BattleGods have summoned all the greatest Battlers of the universe together to compete in the Ultimate Battle of Win.
Using a combination of Strategy, Bluffing, and Luck.
Battlers will Battle to Win by reducing their opponents health points using numbered "Battle Army" cards combined with "Battle Strategy" Cards
The Loser is the person with the least amount of Health points at the end of the game.
Do you have what it takes?

Setup:
Players face each other with a deck of 18 Battle Army cards (2xcards numbered 1-9) and 4 Battle Strategy cards (recruit,heal,battle and block)
Take your 4 action cards and keep them in your hand.
Place your health point card where other battlers can see it. Using a marker (a coin or some other object) to indicate your health status.
Decide on the maximum amount of Health you can have for the battle. This cannot be exceeded.
Battlers shuffle their Army cards and place the deck in front of themselves.
Each player draws one card from their Army and places it face up on the Battlefield.

Playing the game:
The game is turn-based with each player taking simultaneous turns.

During each turn, the Battlers secretly choose between one of 4 Battle Strategy cards to play.
They then place the card face down on the table.
Battlers then simultaneously flip their chosen action card to reveal their Battle Strategy

More than 2 players varient: Players must say the name of the person they wish to battle after placing their Battle Strategy card.
(Or alternativly place a card with the players number on it down with their Battle Strategy Card)

Strategies are as follows:
Recruit = You draw 1 card from your deck and place it on the battle field (from left to right) You can only have up to 5 cards in total on the battlefield
Heal = You draw a card from your deck and regain health points to the value shown on the card. The card is discarded afterwards
Battle = You attack your opponet with the total value from adding up current Army cards you have on the battle field (Army cards are discarded afterward)
if your opponent plays either their Recruit or Heal card your battle card cancels them out and your damage is dealt.
Block = The first 3 cards of your opponent's Battle Army are blocked if they played their Battle card.

Game ends:
The game ends when one Battler has lost all of their Health points.Or when one Battler has depleted all of their Battle Army card deck.
(if more than 2 people are playing the remaining battlers take one more turn after one of the above end conditions have occured)
The Winner is the Battler with the most Health Points at the end of the game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Non c'è 2... senza 3!
description: In "Non c'è 2... senza 3!" the tiles are randomly spread out on the table, face down. The player on turn flips one of them and then looks for another one with the same image. And what is the difference with a common memory game?!? The fact that each image is repeated 3 times and the tile you look for doesn't have to be on the table, it could be in your opponents loot! you have to remember this in order to steal it!

name: Legendice
description:
A very long time ago, when science sucked and magic was really trendy, when there was a really huge offer of heroes and, luckily, they did not want to be paid, when behind each door you could find ugly but precious treasures or cute but lethal monsters and a dice roll could often decide the destiny of the humankind...
... in other words, when the world was a funny place, some incautious accepted each dangerous mission that was assigned by the most powerful characters of the time. The fate was on their side and their gestures became legendary.

Could you beat their fame? Be incautious yourself and try to build an even more legendary legend!

At the beginning of each round all the dice are rolled and grouped by their value.

In turn, each player chooses one group of dice and place it beside a deck of his choice in order to recruit Heroes, accepting new Missions or discover new lands (and the monster that lives there!) recovering special items.

When all the dice will be placed, each player in turn will use one or more heroes from his hand in order to defeat the monsters. The colour of the dice used to discover the land determines the skills the hero must have in order to participate to the battle.

The recruited Heroes will be added to the player’s hand, while Missions, defeated Monsters and Items will be placed in front of him side by side forming the timeline of his legend.

At the end of the game, the player will gain points for each item, monster and accomplished mission.

To be accomplished, some of the missions requires the player to discover certain items or to kill a specific monster (so only the cards placed after the Mission in the timeline will be considered), while some other requires the player to have already discovered certain items or killed a monster (so, in this case only the cards placed before the Mission in the timeline will be considered).

The player with the most points will be the winner.

name: Isle of Domination
description:
Isle of Domination is a turn-based strategy-economy Print & Play board Eurogame.

Players can build cities, armies on game map. Gameplay goes around resources. There are two types of resources: Countable resources like food, wood, stone, ore, test-tube and gold. Special resources like horse, iron, fish, wheat, marble, diamond and mana are used to develop (science) or build (building) something. There is no storage for resources, a player needs to have access (by having a city near the resource) to certain number and type of resources to build something. Food is the most important resource, each city, extra population and army eats one food. You need food-surplus to build a city/army/extra population, but no problem if your food production goes under your food production (no starving to death).

Each player has an economical page (like character page in RPGs), that shows the state of his empire. Players use small markers (for example: coins) for recording various things.

Player's turn have 4 phases:

random event phase: A random event happens, that has effect to all players, usually a positive thing to each player.
money phase: Player adds the number of his/her gold production to treasury. (Gold is the only resource in Isle of Domination, that is storaged.)
army moving phase: Players can move their armies by grid lines of hexes. Combat system is very simple: if attacker's army is stronger than defender army, defender army has to be withdrawn. No dice rolling this time. Army power is based on sciences, and have modifiers by terrain, city or buildings.
building phase: Player can build a city (on a hex edge occupied by an army), increase population, build an army, develop a science and/or build a building in this phase.


The goal of this game is to reach one of the six Victory Conditions. It is possible that all other Players have stronger economies, stronger armies and bigger empires, but still you win because you reach one of the Victory Conditions.
There are 6 different types of Victory:

Territory Victory: You dominate by having a large number of cities.
Military Victory: You dominate by having a very strong and large army.
Population Victory: You dominate by outnumbering others in population.
Science Victory: You dominate by knowledge. (You develop Future Science 2.)
Cultural Victory: You dominate by your people's cultural influence. (You build Cathedral.)
Magical Victory: You dominate by magical superiority. (You have a city near every Mana resource.)


Informational page contains exact numbers regarding the conditions above.

Game map has a random factor - dice-rolls determine one extra resource for each hex. This way, certain resources may have shortage or abundance, so diferent strategies can succeed in each game.
Randomized map preparation may make some of the Victory types easier than others. But when several players pursuit the same victory, it will be much more difficult to achieve it.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tavern Dice
description:
Tavern Dice is a push your luck dice game!

A party of heroes heads to the tavern, to drink and play before heading to a quest.

Press your luck rolling those dice, try to score points for each wizard, Rogue, Knight, Archer or Barbarian...Don´t roll the skeleton or you will lose a die.

The more of the same hero you roll on consecutive rolls the more point it will score... if you don´t roll the one you need you will lose all your acumulated points.

No more dice? You are kicked out of the tavern, into the nice mud puddle!

name: The Seal Beach Trivia Game
description:
Trivial-Pursuit-like game that has players moving tokens around the game-board to answer questions in various topic categories.

Object Of the Game

The object of the game is to be the first player to work your token up to the center of the board and answer a question correctly at LEVEL 5.

name: A Fair Battleground
description:
For centuries, the two kingdoms of F and B have fought each other in a peculiar way. Whenever war is declared, The Flag of The Old Empire is placed in the middle of The Ground, the contested borderland between the two kingdoms, and the two armies engage in battle to take control of The Flag and carry it into the opponent's lands: the first army to do so is declared victorious.

A Fair Battleground is a non-historical wargame set in a pseudo-Napoleonic era. To win, you must push the opposing army back or outmaneuver it, so that your own army can advance and eventually carry The Flag into the other player’s territory. Meanwhile, the opponent can engage you in battles to stop your advancement and try to take control of The Flag.

In A Fair Battleground, skillful deployment and maneuvering is more important than raw impact, but typical winning tactical moves of the era like attacking the opposing armies from behind are forbidden. Asymmetry between players is given not by a different mix of forces or objectives, but rather by the interplay of two pairs of opposing roles (Advancing vs Contending and Attacker vs Defender) that the two players take and exchange during the game. These roles determine both what the players can do and when they can do it, as well as which of the different armies are more useful to each of them.

Battle resolution is basically luck-less, but a simple optional rule that adds a random factor is provided for players who prefer luck-based systems.

---

A Fair Battleground is a print-and-play game that uses a board and 20 counters; the players must supply 9 euro-cubes or similar objects to be used as markers, and, optionally, two six-sided dice.

A Fair Battleground was an entry in the 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Monster Zoo
description:
Monster Zoo is a 2-4 player casual deck-building game / zoo management game.

In Monster Zoo, you are a Zoo Keeper catching monsters in the wild for your Zoo - while trying to prevent other players from doing the same.

Each turn you will be collecting new monsters, using monsters to help you catch even more monsters, and managing the monsters in your Zoo.

Players start off with the same deck of cards. Over the course of the game, as you catch monsters, you will build a stronger and more resourceful deck. You will need to balance building a stronger deck along with building up your Zoo. Placing monster cards from your hand into your Zoo earns points, but monsters in your Zoo will no longer play an active role in your deck.

With over 30 unique monsters cards in the base game, there is a wide variety to the actions and combinations you'll see during a typical game.

The first player to build a full Zoo wins!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Skelebone's Model Game Entry
description:
This is where the description of the game should go. This should contain information about the theme, game-play, and goal of the game.

Links to expansions and re-implementations formerly went in this box, but they now have relevant places in the header information, so they should no longer go here.

Bolded additional fields that are still used on this page are Integrates with:, and much more infrequently Similar to: , though items that have substantial similarities might be collected into a family

name: The Great Aleph Beis Race Game
description:
The Great Aleph Beis Race Game is designed to teach children the Hebrew alphabet.

Players are given a card showing a Hebrew word and they must find the hidden letters on the board which make up this word. The game board displays a town through which players must race their cars (player tokens) in order to collect the Hebrew letters. Using a spinner, players travel along coloured paths which direct them to the hidden letters.

The first player to complete the word on their card and return to the starting point wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Religious, Word Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dew Drop Inn
description: Place balls in the center of the Upper Plate and spin the top. Balls are thrown helter-skelter causing some of the balls to be thrown off of the plate and then drop into holes on the lower plate. The balls come to rest in the little scoring areas where each player scores points dependent on where the balls land. Play continues until 1 player scores 100 points.

name: Quandrum
description: Quandrum is a game that shifts under your feet like a hundred angry snakes. Players play cards from their hands to move their tokens around a board. Cards can also be played to change what each space on the board does, the location of the goal, the fundamental rules of the game, and a multitude of other effects. With over a hundred unique cards in the deck each game is going to be special. To win a player simply has to land their token on the same space as the goal. Assuming the goal stays where it is.

name: Inventeur / Inventor
description:
Embody an inventor who has to end his invention before rival and progress through the diverse stages of manufacturings by avoiding the traps of your enemy. Be the first one to end your invention and become a Inventor Master.

It is up to you to find your winning strategy, but be careful! Any strategies have their double sharp edges. Will you opt for the attack or the defense? Will you keep your cards in hand or you will be afraid of being stolen to them?

Take part from now on in this intense full of emotion adventure or everything can change any time!

Specifically: You deploy three sources that are based on your progression through the four cards that represent the devellopement of your invention. Feel free to block the sources of your opponent so they can not play objectives or will you choose to keep on hand of cards that will protect your source material. Players must play cards that are used either to advance or regress to another.


Incarnez un inventeur qui doit terminer son invention avant son éternel rival et progressez à travers les diverses étapes de fabrications en évitant les pièges de votre ennemie. Soyez le premier à terminer votre invention et devenez Maître Inventeur.

Libre à vous de trouver votre stratégie gagnante, mais soyez prudent! Toutes stratégies ont leurs double tranchants. Opterez-vous pour l’attaque ou la défense? Garderez-vous vos cartes en main ou aurez-vous peur de vous les faire voler?

Prenez part dès maintenant à cette intense aventure chargée d’émotions ou tout peut changer d’un instant à l’autre!

Concrètement : Vous déployez 3 sources qui sont la base de votre progression à travers les 4 cartes objectifs qui représentent le dévellopement de votre invention. Libre à vous de bloquer les sources de votre adversaire pour qu'il ne puisse pas jouer d'objectifs ou bien ferez-vous le choix de garder en main des cartes qui protègerons vos sources matérielles. Les joueurs doivent jouer des cartes qui servent soit à avancer ou a faire regresser l'autre.

name: InvestmentOpoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

"A game that Plans for your future" Some kind of Monopoly clone that is supposed to teach you how to manage money.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Ciutat 10
description:
"Ciutat 10" is a card game where each participant has the option to build their ideal city, a city 10 which ensures the promotion and respect of human rights. The goal is to do it before the other players. To do this, each participant will have to provide your city with actions and resources to ensure the five basic principles of a city 10

The game consists of three types of boards and two decks of cards. The central Resource and Actions board, where you place three cards shown to all players and the deck to replace them, the central Cost Cards board where you place these cards in the same way as the other from the players drawn this cards to his hands, and a City Board, where players build their city and punctuate the Resource and Actions cards at the end of game

The Resource and Action cards are divided into five concepts or colors: A City for All (blue cards), Welfare City (green cards), Democratic City (yellow cards), ​​Committed City (violet cards) and Civic and Participatory City (red cards). Each cards has a cost to play

Cost Letters, with values ​​2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 with which to pay the Resource and Action cards of the same color to play in the player's City Boards.

There is a special acknowledgment cards to complete all cards of the same concept, they gave 10 extra victory points. At the end of the game the player who has the greatest total in Resource and Actions cards in his City Board wins.

Ciutat 10 is an educational game developed by Marinva, for the Red Cross in Catalonia to promote awareness of human rights of citizens


Ciutat 10 és un joc de cartes on cada participant tindrà l'opció de construir la seva ciutat ideal, una ciutat 10 que garanteixi el foment i el respecte dels drets humas. L'objectiu és aconseguir-ho abans que la resta. Per fer-ho, cada participant haurá de dotar la seva ciutat d'accions i recursos que garanteixin els cinc principis bàsics d'una ciutat 10

El joc es compon de tres tipus de tauler i dues baralles de cartes. El tauler central de cartes de Recursos i Acció, on es col·loquen tres cartes mostrades als jugadors i la baralla per reposar-les, el tauler central de Cartes de Cost on es col·loquen aquestes cartes de la mateixa manera que les altres i un Tauler de Ciutat per a cada jugador, on construeixen la seva ciutat i puntuen les cartes al final de joc

Les cartes de Recurs i Acció es divideixen en cinc conceptes o colors: Una Ciutat per a Tothom (cartes blaves), el Ciutat del Benestar (cartes verdes), Ciutat Democràtica (cartes grogues), Ciutat Compromesa (cartes violetes) i Ciutat Cívica i Participativa (cartes vermelles). Cada carta té un cost per ser jugades

Cartes de Cost; amb valors 2, 4, 6, 8, i 10 amb les quals pagar les cartes de Recursos i Acció del mateix color

Hi han unes cartes de reconeixement especial per completar totes les cartes d'un mateix concepte, que donen 10 punts de victòria addicionals. Al final del joc, el jugador que tingui el major puntuació de cartes de Recursos i Accions al seu Tauler de Ciutat guanya la partida.

Ciutat 10 és un joc educatiu desenvolupat per Marinva, per a la Creu Roja a Catalunya per promoure el coneixement dels drets humans dels ciutadans

name: One Thousand
description:
One Thousand is a fast-paced battle card game for 2-4 players. Go head-to-head or play as teams and be the first to inflict 1,000 casualties and emerge victorious! Game play is similar to Mille Bornes

Use your battle cards to launch artillery strikes and unleash deadly gas attacks. Use aerial recon to scout your enemy and counterintelligence to thwart their offensive. Muster your troops and mount your attacks in a race to inflict the most damage!

Aligned as teams or playing head-to-head, players arrange their cards on the battlefield as they attempt to launch an offensive and score attack points. Opponents can use Sabotage cards to stall an offensive and disable any future attacks until the Sabotage cards have been remedied. Perk cards can be played to permanently prevent a particular Sabotage card from being used. Hand management is an important part of the game as, to win, a team or player must reach an attack score of exactly 1,000 to win the battle. Multiple battles are played and scored as part of a campaign in which teams or players attempt to be the first to reach a total of 5,000 victory points.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, World War I
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simulation, Take That

name: Alpha Colony
description:
Build a settlement among the stars!

Mankind has finally found a planet suitable for habitation far away in a distant solar system. The race to claim its lands is on and competition is fierce! Resources are scarce and the colonists threaten to rebel if their taxes are too high! Will you be able to create the first successful colony on this alien world or will crime, natural disasters and space pirates spell doom for your fledgling settlement?

From 2-4 intrepid explorers will attempt to settle, build and administrate over a small colony on a far away planet. Players may work together or against each other in the struggle to find suitable land, sufficient resources and a happy equilibrium among the populace. Taxes, buildings and the military all play an important role in achieving a functioning and thriving settlement, while random planetary events keep you on your toes. Whoever scores the most economic, military and socio-political points is the winner!

First explore 1 of 4 types of territory, then gain income by taxing your populace. Next build factories and buildings to gain resources before training your military. Lastly, deal with rebellions and random events. When all the land is taken, add up your economic, political and military points to see who wins.

name: Game of the Transatlantic Flight
description:
Highlighted by fantastic 1920's artwork, this is an air race between 2 to 4 players. Some players start on North America, some in Europe. Travelling in planes, players try to avoid perils along the way to the other side of the Atlantic Ocean in the least amount of time.

The board contains various travel points along the route, showing your planned journey. On your turn you spin and move your plane the number shown on the spinner. If this would take you past a landing station you must remain where you are until you spin an exact number. You are considered on schedule as long as you don't land on any delay spots, and you may even deduct time if you land on a "time spot". If you land on an "off course" spot, then you must take an alternate (longer) route to your journey. You may land on a forced landing spot or run out of gasoline depending on which spot you land on.

At the end of the game you must total up the hours lost or gained to determine the fastest player and they are declared the winner.

An example of this game, given many years ago, was selected as an example of the evolution of America and is housed in the Americana collection of the Boston Childrens Museum.

name: Tresquis
description:
"Tresquis: Joc de descoberta dels valors naturals de la comarca del Pla de l'Estany".

Educational game, a roll and move where you move across the board visiting 67 places around the territory (Comarca del Pla de l'Estany, inside Catalonia, Spain). Along the way, you also have to solution environmental problems.

The location cards are evenly distributed among the players. Every time a player visits a location, he/she gets the location card, draws a special card and applies the results.

The winner is the player that first gets free of every location card in his/her possession (or, if playing with a determined time limit, the one that has the less cards remaining) or also the one that solutions more environmental problems; or even the one that has visited more places.

name: Perspectivo
description: Each player has 7 blue cubes and 3 green triangular pieces. Two cards are revealed which show an object one can build with these pieces, but from different angles. The players now try to be the first to build the building depicted on the two cards. The first player who manages correctly gains the two cards. The first player to win 14 cards wins the game.

name: Der kugelrunde König
description:
The game consists of many pie piece shaped tiles which contain sentence parts; there are also round picture tiles on which the "round belly king" does something with someone somewhere, using some item.

The rule set contains many different game ideas, all aimed at training kids to read fast and accurately and to form correct complex sentences. Some examples:
- A player picks a picture tile, then lays out a sentence which shows the events of the picture.
- As above, but now the player must put one wrong tile into the sentence. The first of the other players to find the mistake scores a point.
- Players compete forming as many correct sentences from the available tiles as possible.
- Each player draws an image, looks at it and turns it over. Now everyone must find the corresponding sentence parts and say their sentence; the first one to manage that is the winner.

name: Scrapyard Battle
description:
Unashamedly based on the TV show of a very similar name, each player controls a team of 4 characters (each with their own nick-names and brief backgrounds) who have to build a fantastic competing machine out of the bits and pieces found by them in the scrapyard.

On day 1 they need to find the best components that they can in the scrapyard heaps, drag them back to base and weld them together within the time set.

On day 2 the two (hopefully completed) machines square up in competition).

There are 5 battles in the base game - a Sofa-slinger, a cabbage cannon, a powered raft, a can stacker and a hill climber that can be played individually or one after the other as a championship challenge.

An entry for the 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest

Dropbox Folder for pdfs ready for sharing - https://www.dropbox.com/sh/zgydx2pl2k3zg3n/0f-tfeNCNv?m
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Game of Three Blind Mice
description: Typical spin and move board game from 1930's. The player first succeeding in moving his Mice into the Mouses' Home again in the order stated, by exact spins of the arrow, win the game.

name: Game of BoPeep
description: A simple race-style game, the board is printed with instructions all along the route, in the form of lines from "Little BoPeep" and other well-known nursery rhymes. The players move wooden pieces around a spiraling track. The first player to reach the center space named "Home" by exact count wins the game.

name: Animal Fun
description:
Animal Fun is a game that aims to help children identify animals and learn their names.

The players are each given an equal of cards, on which pictures of animals are printed, along with their names. The heads of the animals, all of which are circular cut-outs, are removed and mixed face-down in a pile. Each player takes his or her turn to flip one of the cut-outs and fits it to their cards if it matches one of their animals' bodies. If it matches none, the cut-out is flipped back and mixed back into the pile.

The first player to fit back all their animals' heads wins the game. There is also the option to mix in and match the irregular shaped name cut-outs.

name: The Game of Visiting Birds' Nests Without Robbing Them
description:
Game published in the Odhams Press book, The Children's Book of Games, Puzzles and Pastimes.

You will require a pack of ordinary playing cards for this game. Divide them into two separate packs, placing the Aces, Kings, Queens, Jacks, tens and nines into one pile and all the twos, threes, fours, fives, sixes, sevens and eights into another. Put them side by side face downwards on the table

Each player draws a card from each pack, turns them over and compares them with the pictures on this double page, where are depicted ten different birds with the number of their eggs and the value of the card. For example, if you draw an ace (Kestrel) you must return all the eggs you have collected except those of the Owl, Moorhen and Kestrel. If you draw a two (Rat), it steals any one egg and you must keep this card until you draw a Queen (Owl), in the meantime drawing one card only from the pack containing the picture cards. If you draw ^ King (Moorhen) you retain her egg but miss a round.
Each player keeps an account of tiie number of eggs he has collected during the game, and at the end of the round subtracts his losses from the total. The cards are then returned to the bottom of their respective packs and shuffled for the next round. Play six rounds and then again add up your total.

The first player to collect ten different eggs wins the game.

You will find there are less cards in the picture pack and the round finishes after these have all been drawn

name: Gamboolee
description: GamBOOLee is a game for 2, 3, or 4 players. Each player tries to capture the royal families of the other players and to win all the ransom money. To determine the winner, the players have tournaments between their knights (similar to the "jousting" bouts of the knights of old) and the loser must pay ransom for the pieces he has at stake in the tournament or lose his pieces to the winner. The game continues in this manner until one player has won all the ransom money and all the pieces, or until the remaining players concede defeat with the player to the highest total -- the total of the ransom prices of all the pieces he holds and all of his ransom money. The magnets in the knight bases decide the winner of each tournament in a completely random and unpredictable manner.

name: Regati
description:
Regati is a sailing race game...a board game of skill, luck and strategy. Up to 10 players can all race a ship against each other around the board. Line up ready for the start, cross the starting line, sail around the buoys and Windy Point, to be the first to cross the finishing line.

But, you can only sail a maximum speed according to the wind direction, and the wind direction changes...

Each move, you either move your ship OR you decide to change the wind direction. A wind direction change affects all players equally...and it may even result in a play direction switch. Sailing moves have realistic speeds, with six points of sail to the wind. So, for example, reaching across the wind is your fastest course, as is tacking to take you upwind. Your ship may block other ships...and watch out for the wind shadows from other ships or from the land! A person at the back of the race can influence all other ships by changing the wind direction. It is seldom the case that the first person around the first buoy stays in front...tactical sailing is required.

You can also sail as teams, whereby your tactics are determined with other sailors in mind. You can also organise a regatta (multiple sail races), so the best sailor of a few races is the winner. The point scoring method for these are described in the instructions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: The Marketplace Race
description: The Marketplace Race is a promotional game designed to sell the virtues of Digital Equipment Corporation's new (at the time) J-11 microprocessor, introduced in 1983. While the purpose of the game is marketing, it is theoretically a playable game. It's a basic spin-and-move game, with the spinner built into the board, but with interrupts along the path which all speed the player with the J-11 along while slowing down the player with the "Brand X" chip. The first player to the Market Place wins!

name: Shafted!
description:
You are a prospector in the Old West just trying to get by doing the only thing you know and that’s digging for Gold. Your goal of riches is only hindered by what you may find in the mountain itself. Each prospector will take turns digging deeper into the mountain looking for gold nuggets. When the mountain is emptied of all its available treasures, the prospector with the most Gold nuggets WINS!

This game uses a unique 2 tile set system. The "Mountain" is built by randomly setting up 64 of the 72 possible tiles in an 8 by 8 grid. The other set of 72 "Shaft" tiles are shuffled and set up in stacks for draw piles. As the players dig, the "Mountain" tiles are collected and replaced with the "Shaft" tiles. This allows for more players to be added without extending the game time substantially. And makes each game vary with the number of possible Rocks, Gold and Dirt tiles placed.

name: Time Strike
description:
Time Strike is a 2 player PnP card combat style game where you have to keep wondering not where you're being hit, but when! You fight an opponent in 40 second rounds. The player that scores the most hits, wins the round, and whomever wins the most rounds, wins the fight!

Fights take place using on the timeline, where players must add time cards before being able to play attack cards. Time Strike is highly strategic because you can have a full-on combo planned that could be thwarted by an attack a few moments before your combo. Keep your opponent guessing, but keep your guard up in this intense time based battle.

Awards:
Tied for 2nd place in the 2012 Mashup Game Design & Artwork Contest

name: Obstsalat
description:
A fruit-themed dice game for children that combines elements from Yahtzee and Old Maid

Theme
Players try to collect the biggest and ripest fruit for a fruit salad. But careful, don't get any moldy ones!

Goal
Collect as many points as possible by rolling die combinations to win fruit tiles and avoiding the mold tile.

Game play
There are 12 fruit tiles (4 different types of fruit in three sizes). They are sorted according to size and type and placed in the middle of the table.
Players take turns rolling the four dice up to three times per turn. They may set aside as many dice as they want. The dice show the different types of fruit on four sides, a joker on one, and "Moldi the mold" on the last. After a maximum of three rolls, the result is counted. Each roll of a fruit counts as two of that type, the joker can be used as one of any type of fruit. Four fruits of a type win the active player the small tile of that type, 5 the medium one, and 6 the large one. If a player rolls 7 or 8 of one fruit, he/she gets all the tiles of that type, even if another player has already won them.
If one of the dice shows the mold side at the end of a player's turn, that player doesn't win any fruit tile and has to take the mold tile instead. The player who has the mold tile when the game ends gets two minus points.

The game ends when there are no tiles left in the pool. Players count their points and the player with the most points wins the game.

name: Hijack the Revolt
description:
'Hijack the Revolt is a quick game of calculated risk, cooperation and backstabbing for three players.

Throughout history rulers have treated their subjects badly enough for the populous to rise up against them. Though joined momentarily in their common effort to overthrow the tyrant, the rebellious forces are comprised of factions having different visions of what their new country should be. Only one of those ideals will win out, and only then if they can remain united long enough to make their rebellion a success and avoid execution.

Hijack the Revolt is a cooperative game, up to a point. In this game of urban warfare there are four objectives which the three rebels must take before the Dictator sends reinforcement.
