The game components consist of tiny wooden (cherry-wood stain) blocks with embossed gold foil lettering, which fit perfectly in a maroon, plastic case that is the depth of only one block and opens so that only one face of each of the blocks can be seen at a time. There are 42 blocks in the set; each block has five letters on each block face with the sixth side blank. (According to the description on the instructions, the distributions of letters are proportional based on common usage.) The object of the game is to arrange the blocks within the case to spell interlocking words (horizontally and vertically). The perfect game would show 13 words (seven words across, six words down) without using blanks. The number of blanks that are showing when the player is finished determines the score; each blank is worth one point. Players attempt to score the lowest number possible.

There are two different sets of rules; one set is on a small slip of paper that can be removed from the case, while the other set of rules is glued to the inside, top lid. Each set of rules has a different method of scoring, and a different set of game parameters, including different allowable word types and different descriptions of how the game is to be scored. In one version, no prefixes, suffixes, or abbreviations can be used.

Though this is similar to a solvable word puzzle, the distribution of letters (and specifically the rules included with the game) suggests that there are multiple ways to get a perfect score and, therefore, multiple ways to win.

name: RoShamBo Rush
description:
RoShamBo Rush is a competitive racing game. No story here. Just tighten your shoes, race, and be prepared for a nail biting finish. RoShamBo Rush was designed to be quick paced and to keep all players in the game with its system of catch-up logic. There is a very small learning curve, making it a great game to introduce newcomers to table top gaming.

As the name implies, Rock-Paper-Scissors is a large part of the game. Players duel each other using a set of cards that remain in each players possession throughout the game. Banter is encouraged. It is a good way to solicit a tell from your opponents. If you have people reading skills, they do come in handy.

The game features racers (pawns) that stand over 2" tall. The racers are adorned with helmets and body armor when a player lands on a "Armor Up" space. Armor serves as insurance for losing a battle and keeps that racer from taking hit points in exchange for a piece of armor.

Though linear like a race course, you have decisions to make on your turn. Who will you battle? When is the best time to play your Twist Cards? Nobody coasts to an easy victory here. Only the scrappiest competitors will earn a place on the winners podium which only has limited space reserved for the top three racers.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Wolf und die 7 Geißlein
description:
Translation: The Wolf and the Seven Young Kids
players(kids) win if two of them reach target space; wolf wins after 6 kids are caught; with less players than 8 all seven kids are divided;

A 'Roll & Move' game; being a little goat throw the die and move forward, wolf only is throwing 2 dice; follow instructions glued into the lid ending on a marked space.

Game should had been published late 1920's/early 30's
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Novel-based, Racing

name: Send in the Clowns
description:
'Send in the Clowns' is a quick-playing card management game in which you take on the role of a circus impresario. Your troupe of clowns have entered the Best Dressed Clown competition and are trying to assemble costumes (made up of four garments - hats, shirts, trousers, and shoes) that match in colour (red, yellow, green, blue, purple, or pink) and pattern (stripes, checks, spirals, or stars).

But just as fast as your three clowns gather their matching clothes, so your rival troupes swap clothes in your wardrobe with clothes from their wardrobe!

Each clown can wear accessories (red noses and blue buckets) to enhance its score, which is based on the longest run in each category (colour, pattern, and accessories): 1, 4, 9, 16 VPs. Each game, one colour and one pattern scores one step higher than the others.

You can also add balloons, unicycles, tightropes, and juggling balls to extend your scoring!

Each player turn involves 3 main actions: 1) draw a card; 2) draw another card -or- swap a card -or- play a card; 3) play a card. You can only play cards if one of their characteristics matches the adjacent card. And you can only swap a card it it matches the one you are swapping it for. An optional extra action at the end of your turn allows you to discard a card to claim an accessory (nose or bucket).
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Wondrous Wizard Game
description:
From the box...
Enchantingly different! The Magic of "Make-Believe" delights Children as they tour the Domain of the WONDROUS WIZARD on a King-size Game-board.

In a Race to reach the Castle, short cuts through the Enchanted Forest lead to a Dragon, Spectre Trees, Witches and the Giant! Moves are indicated by a Spinner. Plastic Pawns mark Progress.

Tops in Imaginative Fun for 2-3-4 Players, surprise Messages from the THE WONDROUS WIZARD help decide who wins the Game.

name: Trojan Cross
description:
Trojan Cross is played on a 13 x 13 grid of red and black squares that features a “Trojan’s Cross” in the center (and adjoining four squares) of the board. All the corner squares of the board are red. The game’s pieces consist of 20 red and 20 black checkers, each with a pawn on one side, a crown on the other. The game is played on the black squares of the board, with players’ pieces beginning on the black squares of the three closest rows. Players may begin with any combination or formation of pawns and crowns, so long as they are identical to each other, though the instructions do provide three recommended ways to start: three rows of pawns, or one row of crowns and two of pawns, or two rows crowns and one of pawns. Black moves first.

With the exception of the cross in the middle of the board, player movement is the same as an ordinary game of Checkers. Pawns may move forward (left or right) one square only unless jumping and capturing an opponent’s piece, when they may jump however many times there are openings. Crowns may move and jump forward and backward. Captured pieces are removed from the board. Crowning of pawns takes place upon reaching the opponent’s home row, or after moving over any four squares in the Trojan’s Cross.

The game’s instructions feature a number of diagrams describing what movements a pawn may make within the cross, how it may exit, what conditions it must meet to be crowned, how the opponent must be notified, and how the opponent may interrupt. The game is won by capturing all of an opponent’s pieces, or by blocking all of an opponent’s pieces from moving, or by making seven uninterrupted moves within the cross. Methods are provided for scoring, should players desire it for multiple matches, but the simplest method provided is one point for one victory.

name: O'Grady's Goat: A Merry Game
description:
Card Game

Description
"O'Grady's Goat: A Merry Game" card game with 89 strips of uncut playing cards and an instruction sheet in a paper covered cardboard box; box lithographed with the head of a smiling goat breaking through a globe with a banner around its center with images of goats pulling carts which you must try and pair up into appropriate related catagories, box inscribed, "O'GRADY'S/ GOAT/ A Merry Game/ MILTON BRADLEY CO. SPRINGFIELD MASS".
Marks on the game box
stamped: on box cover: "O'GRADY'S/ GOAT/ A Merry Game/ MILTON BRADLEY CO. SPRINGFIELD MASS".

name: EyeSpy! The Mind-Reading Game!
description:
The aim of the game is to think of things that other players cannot guess. Players draw cards that provide a category, and having thought of (and written down) something either related or not related to the card the player to their left and each subsequent player has 60 seconds to guess what it is. Questions may be asked, but can only be answered with a Yes, No, or Maybe. If no one is able to guess the answer the player moves forward on the game board. The first player to reach the Finish wins the game.

Contents:
6 Tokens, 60 Second Timer, 384 EyeSpy Cards, Playing Board, Magic Pad & Plastic Pencil, Instructions and Free EyeSpy tee-Shirt & Tournament Application Form.

name: Island Conquest
description:
Island Conquest is a network building game for 2 to 6 players. Players start with an equal number of islands under their control and using resource management and well planned strategy, battle their way toward building the largest collection of islands.

The larger and more connected an island, the more powerful and influential it may become, providing additional resources per turn and a stronger base from which to launch attacks.

The gameboard is designed to be played in two different formats, allowing for faster gameplay and even starting points with both the full board being utilized for 5 or 6 players, and a smaller portion of the board sectioned off for less players. So ready your troops, gather your resources and start building bridges.

Fight to the end and fight the urge to retreat. This is your quest.

name: 5 Pillars: Conquer the pillars of Islam
description:
Increase your knowledge of the pillars of Islam while having loads of fun with your family and friends. Strategise and rotate your Pillar Tokens in order to build the pillars of Iman, Salah, Zakah, Sawm and Hajj. Conquer all pillars at five difficulty levels before the other team to win! Along the way, cite references from the Quran and Hadith for extra Merit Points so you learn more about Islam with every flip of the card.

Play for a couple minutes or all night long, but for the best learning experience don’t stop until you have conquered all the pillars of Islam. This is the Ultimate Islamic Board Game Experience and can be played separately or together with the 5Pillars Fun Box!

Components included: 1 game box, 1 game board, 2 punch cards with 25 pillar tiles each, 1 punch card with 5 pillar tokens, 1 vacuum tray, 750 cards, 1 instruction manual

name: Al Djemma
description:
Al Djemma has a two-step objective to win the game. The first objective is to move around the outer court until the player has an opportunity to move his token in safety through the treasure maze of any of his opponents with the object of landing on any one of the opponent's 5 treasure circles, thus capturing an opponent's treasure.
The final objective of the game is TO MAKE AL DJEMMA. This occurs when a player, having secured treasure pieces for his tokens, and having entered the inner court, succeeds in landing by an even throw of the dice on one of the three circles of his own color within the inner court .

name: Gunship: Tactical Bomber / Fortress
description:
The Tactical Bomber is a new set of boards, cards and tokens to further expand the Gunship galaxy. Intended for 4-Player battles, the Bomber will offer massive firepower options at the expanse of being slower and less repairable than a Gunship.

Tactical Bomber Boards are landscape in nature and feature 10 Hit Locations, including Wings and a customizable Rear Turret. With 3 Bomb Bays, a multitude of payloads will be available, including high-explosive Nova Bombs and Plasma Bombs, which include a new Fire Mechanic.

This set will also provide a new Attacker/Defender system to the game. One team will be defending a Planet with their Carrier, Gunship and Fighters. The Planet will be the site of a powerful Fortress, which must be assaulted by the Attackers.

The Attackers will have a Carrier, Gunship, Tactical Bomber and their own Fighter Squadrons. The mission objective is the destruction of the Fortress below and team tactics and strategy will be paramount.

Bombing Objectives will be a major part of the upcoming Storyline Mode. An abandoned Fortress can be seen in the Gunship: Afterburners expansion.

New Crewmates relative to the Bomber and Fortress will be announced during the July Kickstarter and available for purchase.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Plonka: The Game
description:
Everything your Granny shouldn't know about grapes or hops or sherry parties or bananas and other totally obscure alcoholic trivia that nobody really gives an Aussie XXXX about unless they're more than schlightly sqwiffy.

This is a game of totally obscure and useless trivia. Nobody knows the answers and nobody probably cares. The idea is to bluff and counter-bluff to avoid collecting the green bottles. Collect nine green bottles and you're out!

name: $1000 Minute
description: Players attempt to correctly answer all ten trivia questions from one card before their time runs out (There is a DVD timer included in the game). The first nine correct answers are worth $10 each. If all questions are answered correctly, the player pockets a total of $1,000 from the Bank. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins!

name: International Airlines Game
description: A roll and move game where the first player to get all four of their jetliners to their destinations wins the game. Along the way players may be impeded in their journey by various hazard cards that represent the real and perceived perils of the times in which this game was designed such as hijackings, bomb threats, UFO encounters, and the devil's triangle.

name: ClaudeSoucie
description:
ClaudeSoucie is a variant on Lines of Action, where the object is to be the first player to get all their pieces into one group. ClaudeSoucie differs from Lines of Action several different ways:
1. The game is played is playable on a 10x10 board, or larger or smaller size.
2. One player sets up all the pieces around the outside of the board, and the other player then picks what color they will play.
3. Pieces that would normally be removed from play are put at the bottom of the piece that is capturing the piece in the stack. By doing this, a capture creates a stack of pieces containing 2 or more pieces. A single piece can move on top of a stack of pieces to control the entire stack.
4. The player who is the first player to have all their pieces in one group at the start of their turn wins, as opposed to immediately, as is the case with Lines of Action.

ClaudeSoucie was invented by Donald Silberger.

name: Material Intelligence: The Game
description: This is an educational card game for teaching materials science to people. This game can be played by 2 or more players. Shuffle the cards and deal them face down. Each player turn the top card face up but in a way that others don't see the card. Each card present a material with 6 attributes. The player to the left of the dealer picks one attribute from the top card and reads its number, eg. density 2320. Other players read out their respective attribute. The highest value on the attribute collects all other top cards and place them in their pile. Then it's the winner's turn to turn the top card and to pick an attribute. In the case of a tie in the attribute value, these cards are placed in the centre of the table and the main player gets to pick another card and to choose an attribute. The winner gets to take the cards from both rounds.

name: Logical Spies
description:
You are a cunning and dastardly spy. Deny it, you scoundrel! Use your skills of wit and observation to discover the other spies’ identities and expose them before they expose you. The winner is the last remaining spy.

Logical Spies unfolds like a social logic puzzle, in which the players play the role of a spy. Your identity is represented by 6 cards: Nationality, Codename, Cover, Vulnerability, Secret Weapon, and special Agent ability.

Each round begins with the Spying phase and ends with the Accusations phase. Spying is fast and simultaneous. Recover your cards as quickly as you can while observing what other players do. Accusations is calculating and methodical. Consult your Logic Sheet. Accuse other players until you make a false accusation. As you make correct accusations, players must reveal that card.
When your entire identity is revealed, you are out of the game.

The 12 Agent cards add a special ability. The Enigma may lie about his Codename. The Assassin may wink at players to make them reveal a card. The Die Hard gets 1 final round of accusations upon elimination...
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fantasy Islands
description:
A Fantasy Island-Building Game for 2 - 4 Tribal Leaders by Andreas Propst & Tobias Strunz.

“In the middle of a medieval fantasy archipelago, rival tribes are building their settlements on neighbouring islands. You are the clan-chief of one of these tribes and responsible for your village. Build and expand your settlement, care for your followers and nurture your clan. Finally you will be able to build a massive army or achieve cultural superiority. Whatever path to victory you choose - the fantasy islands await you!”

The goal of the game is to be the first player to collect 20 Victory Points. Each player starts with a tiny Starting Island made out of 7 hex tiles. Players will expand their islands in order to mine stone, ore and gather wood needed to build the more advanced buildings. Players will grow food and wine to keep their soldiers and wizards loyal and collect mana to cast powerful Spells.

In Fantasy Islands, many roads lead to victory: Pure Military force, Naval supremacy, securing the Trade monopoly, keeping your population happy, Cultural dominance or Spellcasting power. Excelling at one or more of these aspects will net you the VP needed to win and furthermore, players will be able to engage in Conflicts (Military, Trade, Sorcery, Cultural and Naval) which, in case they emerge victorious, will get them certain benefits.

This game is a cooperative effort by Andreas Propst (Austria) and Tobias Strunz (Germany).
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Civilization, Fantasy, Farming, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Phase Order

name: Hatfield vs McCoy "Gold Rush"
description:
Hatfield vs. McCoy - "Gold Rush" is a dice / strategy table top game of hillbilly prospecting. Each family is seeking new gold mine claims. Roll your dice to pick up new claims, or become a claim jumper and try to take one from the other family. Roll your 5 rock, paper, scissors dice and bid them against a family member that holds that mine. The family with the most claims that hit gold at the end of the game wins!

This Box Contains:
5 Custom RPS Blue Dice
5 Custom RPS Red Dice
2 Custom Black Dice
8 Red Marker Pawns
8 Blue Marker Pawns
12 Prospecting Cards
3 Hatfield Family Cards
3 McCoy Family Cards
2 Game Guide Cards
And 1 Rule Book

name: Johnny Get Your Gun
description: A spin-and-move game where you are trying to shoot the most valuable big game animals using a spinner shaped like a gun.

name: The Hawkeye Football Game
description:
Using American Football fundamentals, players simulate an Iowa Hawkeye football game with charts, dice, and an exact replica Kinnick Field game board.

Game-Play: The defensive player secretly selects one of three defensive formations (running, blitzing, and passing) and marks it with his d6. Then, the offensive player verbally selects one of tweleve running or passing plays. The defensive player exposes his formation, and the offensive player rolls 2d10 to reveal the outcome of the play from the play chart. Play results include, but are not limited to: incomplete pass, interception, sack, penalty, touchdown, no gain, or a yardage gain of another dice roll. Game time and score are tracked on a separate charts. Special team results are also covered on a field goal, kick-off, and punt chart.

Contents: 2 play charts, 1 exact replica of Kinnick Field game board, 1 field goal and penalty chart, 1 official time chart, scorepad, 1 line-of-scrimmage marker, 1 ten-yard marker, 3 colored markers, 2 offensive dice (d10), 1 defensive die (d6), 1 rules folder, and 1 Hawkeye button (1st issue Collectors Edition only).

The game rules do not cover the sport of American Football; therefore, basic knowledge of the sport should be known or referenced with a NCAA college football handbook.

name: Seasons of War:  Days of the Conqueror
description:
Days of the Conqueror is a mass-battle miniatures game for the period of William the Conqueror (11th century). Units are composed of a number of stands of miniatures. Units are rated by a die (D4, D6, D8, or D10) in each attribute: Discipline, Morale, Attack, and Armor.

Each unit must make a Discipline Test (with results of either Rash, Simple, or Strategic) each turn to determine what action it can or must perform. Rash actions require units to make disadvantageous actions, while Strategic actions allow more complex actions such as reforming, force marching, and forming shieldwall.

The combat system is very "Risk-like" where the Armor dice of the defender are compared to the Attack (or missile) dice of the attacker, with each Attacking die that exceeds an Armor die causing a hit. Units use their Morale attribute whenever they take damage to determine their reaction.

Army lists for Normans, Anglo-Saxons, Vikings, Franks, Bretons are included. Six typical scenarios are included as well as a campaign system that links the scenarios.

name: CIRQUE
description:
Objective: The winning player is the first to connect 5 of their stones in a row.

1. Player 1 places one stone on the first turn.
2. After turn one, each player places 2 stones per turn.
3. Two stones can not be placed adjacent to each other (including touching diagonally) on the same turn unless they are placed to squares of the same color.
4. Two stones can not be played to squares of the same color during a single turn unless they are adjacent to each other.
5. Whenever a player fills in a single shape with their stones, they gain another stone to place during that turn. This stone placement must follow normal placement rules.

name: Exploring Azores
description:
Conquer the largest number of islands of the archipelago of the Azores.
The player who answers correctly two questions about the Azores, can choose which island is conquered.

Bilingual: English/Portuguese

Roll the dice and move player pawns through the archipelago the required number of spaces in any direction and answer the appropriate question based on where you land. If correct take over an island and roll again.

Object: take over as much of the Azores as you can.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Snacks and Bladders
description:
Snacks and Bladders teaches anatomy, biology, diet & nutrition by exploring the human digestive system through roll & move and trivia question mechanics.

Correctly identify body parts and make wise food choices to stay ahead of your opponents.

name: Eureko!
description:
A jig-saw puzzle game which can be played in four different ways.

Basic play: Each player gets a one of four different color/picture puzzle frames and a box of 36 numbered puzzle pieces of the same color. Then there is a die/dice/chit pull and the players take/loose pieces depending on version played. This continues till a player completes a puzzle and yells Eureko!

The four ways to play are:

1. Color Eureko! - roll color die (d6 yellow, brown, green, blue, yellow/blue, green/brown) and number die (d6 1, 2, 3, 4, -1, -2), get/loose that many pieces of the color(s) rolled.

2. Number Eureko! - Put your color puzzle pieces number side up (pieces are numbered from 1-72, not all numbers are in each puzzle), a number disc is drawn and any one with that number gets that piece, if the number was red players with that number also get a credit chit, chit may be turned in for more pieces.

3. Picture Eureko! - each player rolls the number die and gets/looses that many pieces.

4. Solitaire Eureko! - play however you want or just put the puzzles together.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Erie Canal
description:
Erie Canal is a 2-4 player Print-and-Play game that focuses on transportation in the canal. The canal board pieces are modular so you can change the canal each time you play the game, offering many possible scenarios. As a part of the 2012 Historical Themed Board Game Contest, Erie Canal comes with 4 pre-defined scenarios to play.

In Erie canal each player on their turn will be given an allotment of action points, which they will use to perform various actions. Some of these actions will allow the player to control the locks, which is a new element introduced for this game. Each player will have to transport goods and people up and down the canal while trying to make effective use of these locks. The player gains the most victory points by transporting the most people and goods will be declared the winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: BigforkOpoly
description: BigforkOpoly is a promotional board game released by Pride Distributors, Inc. as a fundraiser for local community organizations in the town of Bigfork, Montana. It is a derivative of Monopoly and is virtually identical to it in most respects.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Klondyke Nugget Game
description:
From directions:

The box represents the mining fields of the Klondike.
Put the nuggets into the lower part of the box through any of the mine openings and place the mine covers on at random.
The players decide which shall commence the game and also the number of ounces of gold to be found to constitute the game as 50 ounces, 100 ounces, 200 ounces, etc.
Shake the nuggets in the box.
The first player takes a "pick axe" and lifts up any mine cover he chooses. If a nugget appears underneath lying wholly or partly within the circle covered by the mine cover, the player has to his credit the number of ounces stamped on the underside of the mine cover and he
also has another chance to lift a cover and so continue until he finds a mine with no nugget, at which time he looses his play.
The second player to the left follows and so on throughout the game.
If more than one nugget is found at one time under a mine cover the player places to his credit as many ounces of gold as there are nuggets times the mark on the cover.
Leave all the nuggets in the box and shake them up between every play. Any player can shake when another player is not actually lifting up a mine cover.
The player which first gets the number of ounces of gold agreed upon at the beginning of the game, wins.
Implements:
6 mine covers, 6 nuggets, 1 pick axe.

name: Sockrifice
description:
Race to collect and successfully sacrifice the most princesses to the wise Dryer Dragon in order to prevent the asocalypse and be named king or queen of Lint. Your sock puppet adventurer has been chosen to overthrow the evil princess cult in their effort to raise the destroyer of Lint existence, TOES. The only way to prevent the end of days is to successfully sacrifice the required amount of the evil princesses so the Dryer Dragon can craft the great TOE SOCK OF BINDING to defeat TOES, but if too many princesses are rejected then TOES will arise and the evil princesses will win.

Players win by being the first to fill their "throne meter" - accomplished by sacrificing princesses. (description from Kickstarter)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Myths and Consequences
description:
The purpose of this game is to dispel commonly held myths related to teen pregnancy and sexuality and to show the consequences for one's quality of life. In the process of playing, teenagers will be challenged to face the real consequences of sex.

While moving around the board, players will draw cards dealing with the subjects of Sex Facts, Health and Disease, Contraceptives, Sex and Values, and Sex and Success. Correctly answering the questions on these cards gives the player points.

Certain spaces on the board will force the player to spin the Sex Wheel of Fortune. Of the several results on the spinner, one is pregnancy. Some spaces also will cause a pregnancy. Failure to maintain your score above a certain point will also result in pregnancy.

Pregnancy forces players into a Dilemma. Female players will have to decide on which path to take: Adoption, Motherhood, or Abortion. Male players will have to decide on which path to take: Support or Marriage. Each choice may have different consequences affecting a player's score.

After a predetermined period of gameplay, players will tally their scores. The player(s) with the higher scores have increased their chances of success and happiness while those with lower scores have diminished their chances.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Thundercats Game
description:
Battle through space to match up the THUNDERCATS characters!
Match and collect complete characters to win the game.

Spin the wheel in center of the board and place a characters body part (either their head, body or legs) in corresponding section of the board.
Player with most correctly matched complete characters is the winner!

A game for 6 players. 4 years and over.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Races of the Expanse
description:
Races of the Expanse is a game of creating an alien race, or human variant race by shuffling multiple decks of cards together, and then using your race to explore and colonize the Expanse of space between the Orion Spur and the Sagitarius arm. We plan to bring the game to Kickstarter this Fall. In Races of the Expanse each player takes turns picking a deck for their base creature, such as Crystaline, Humanoid, Crustacians, or Octopoids, Then in reverse order players choose a special ability Deck from clairvoyant, aquatic, subterranean, or creative. Your random homeworld will then add a regional events deck. These three decks will be Shuffled together, to form your races play deck. Extra races and abilities are planned as stretch goals. finally a communal planets deck is built based on the number of players. Play proceeds clockwise from a random start player.
All players start with a hand of five cards. Player 1 plays up to two cards, and then draws two cards, unless affected by cards or special abilities. Players may have no more than 10 cards in their hand. If, after drawing, you have more than ten cards, discard until you have only ten. If a player runs out of cards in their deck they shuffle their discarded cards and start the deck fresh. Play moves clockwise until the last planet is drawn. (Planets can only be drawn when Explorers are played.) When the last planet is drawn, each player gets one last turn, and then the game is ended and a winner is decided.
The player with the most resource at the end of the game is the winner. You get resource by having the most population on a planet. If two or more players have an equal amount of population on a planet, nobody gets the resource for that planet. The max population of a planet is in the upper lefthand corner of the planet card, the resource of that planet is in the lower righthand corner of the planet card.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Nexus
description:
Nexus (working title) is an abstract strategy game for two players in which you want to be the first to occupy the opponent's home blocks. The playfield is comprised of a series of three-dimensional blocks that can be re-configured to create paths.

To start, the three red and three blue home blocks are placed on opposite sides of the game board with the corresponding pawns on top. Each player rolls a die to determine how many action points (APs) he can spend on his turn; the points can be divided between moving pawns and modifying the board. The possible actions are:


Move (1 AP) — Move a pawn to any orthogonal, unoccupied adjacent face if the path is unbroken. If a player lands on an opposing pawn, that pawn returns to one of its home cubes.



Add Block (1 AP) — Add a purple block to the board adjacent to one of your pawns. This block defines a path that all players must follow. Blocks can be stacked vertically.



Rotate Block (2 AP) — Rotate any unoccupied adjacent block; blocks below other blocks cannot be rotated.



Remove Block (3 AP) — Remove any unoccupied adjacent block from the board; blocks below other blocks may not be removed.


Red and blue home blocks cannot be rotated, removed or stacked upon. The first player to move all three of his pawns to his opponent's home blocks wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Meander
description:
Meander is a mechanized board game with a game board that rotates on its own while players try to reach their home base on the opposite side of the board.

To start, each player has five colored spheres in a starting area of the corresponding color. Players take turns moving their spheres one space per turn — but a turn can occur only when the board has paused and isn't currently moving. If a player has a sphere in hand when the board starts to rotate, he must return the sphere to the start position. A player cannot move into a colored space other than his own. If a player moves a sphere to the center of the game board, he can warp that sphere to the home position. Two spheres cannot occupy the same space. The first player to move all of his spheres to his home spaces wins.

For a different gameplay experience, during set-up, each player takes turns placing neutral white spheres on the game board, one sphere per player. The neutral spheres can be moved by any player and serve as blockers.

name: The Ranger Animal Fair
description: A sort of bingo game where using a spinner players try to fill in the animals on their card by spinning the animal on the large spinner

name: Bottlecap Baseball
description: A simulation of Baseball. Bottle caps represent players, one color for each team. The ball is a white bottle cap. By way of flicking a player into the ball with one finger, the ball is; pitched, hit, fielded, thrown to the bases. The playing field is a mat of slick plastic coated paper and has areas marked that indicate different actions of baseball. For instance, if the ball comes to rest in the rectangular area in front of the home plate then a strike is counted against the batter.

name: TagOn
description:
ABOUT THE GAME

TagOn® is a Bible-based, family-friendly crossword board game that provides instant fun for everyone! You've played crossword games before, but never like this! It enhances your Scriptural knowledge and promotes learning of the Bible. It provides an excellent way for families and friends to have meaningful fun while strengthening their knowledge of God's Word.

TagOn® is a game in which two to four players score points by playing and tagging Bible principal words from individual letter tiles. Words are played across or down in crossword fashion and must appear in a Bible dictionary, Bible Concordance or Bible Research Guide adopted by the players as the game dictionary. The game dictionary may be a hard copy print edition, online edition or mobile phone app. It may also be a searchable online Bible or its corresponding mobile phone app. With your game dictionary, you have set up the stage for fun!

What makes TagOn® unique and interesting? Through suspenseful action and thoughtful play, Bible books, characters, utterances, lands and genealogies of Bible characters as well as events and scenes of Bible times are dramatically revealed. What a game!

OBJECT OF THE GAME

To have fun, learn and to become the person with the most point for playing and tagging Bible words.

THE PLAY

The play of the game involves finding, playing, connecting and tagging related Bible words. Played words may have a direct connection with existing words on the game board. This game is about remembering what Bible words were said, who said them, who were related to those characters, where the words were spoken, and in which Bible book can the words be found.

Players will have opportunities to obtain extra points by playing Bible words that have a direct scriptural relationship with other words [tagging words] or/and by playing words on specific colored squares marked with Bible books, characters, utterances, lands and genealogies on the game board. The revelation of Bible characters, places, events, utterances and genealogies, combined with the tag word challenge makes playing TagOn® a fun and interesting game for the entire family.

What about playing new words by replacing existing letters on the game board? You have to see the game rules and actually play the game. Different Bible stories or events appear in every play of the game. This game is so much fun you’ll want to play until God’s Kingdom comes!

name: Fantail Faustball
description:
Fantail Faustball is another board game of the Fantail sportys games line. It is an educational, entertaining board game, where two teams play Faustballby using smart charts each.
Faustball is played on a large field. The net is located at a certain height from the floor. Players must hit the ball with the fist; it is allowed to let the ball bounce on the floor one time before hiting it. Up to three passes are allowed before the ball is returned to the opposite field.

On the game board there is only a piece (the ball) which is moved by each team in turn, which makes the gameplay very agile.

name: Zoo Fu: Path of the Samurai Zookeeper
description:
Players will control their furry, scaly, and feathered combatants in an uproarious spin on competitive matching games.

Assemble your attack combos from the cards in your hand, then choose an opponent. Fling down your attack with enthusiasm and determination, calling out your moves with energy and style! "I attack you with the Spinning Money Punch!" Your opponent looks unimpressed until you throw down your finishing move card, "Of Doooooooom!!!" His face goes white and sweat beads on his brow as he reaches into his cards and…

Will your attack be successful and earn you powerful chi? Will your opponent block your attack, taking your chi and causing you to lose standing in the eyes of the Samurai Zookeeper? Perhaps you need more training in the Zookeeper's dojo! Never fear, though, play continues until the deck is exhausted, so there's plenty of time to hone your skills and change your destiny in this game of skill, luck, and bravado for 3-6 players.

name: Kvaredroj
description:
A 2 players abstract game that uses a bunch of d4.
The goal is to capture the opponent's 4 target dice.
The dice can move as many times as shown on their current position but one can chose to use one turn to change the value on one die instead of moving.
Any captured non-target die is rerolled and replaced on the board, so placement and adjusting values is often a better option than attacking the opponent's dice.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Ĝaberŭoko
description:
Ĝaberŭoko (Jabberwock) is a trick taking card game with an Alice in Wonderlands theme where players must fulfill different contracts (20 available), sometimes trying to take some specific cards, sometimes avoiding them.
The game contains standard Ace->10 cards and three different Jabberwocks in each color. The Jabberwock is a trump card that comes back in the hand of a player and immediately evoluate to a less powerful version of himself. Only another Jabberwock can beat him.
Because it's not good to have Jabberwocks in your hand at the end of the game, you'll have to find the right balance between taking cards with the trump and trying to weaken it to give it to someone else.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Eight-Year Resistance War
description:
Eight Year Resistance War is a solitaire strategy game covering the Second Sino-Japanese War (July 7, 1937 – September 2, 1945), which was a military conflict fought primarily between the Republic of China and the Empire of Japan from 1937 to 1941. After the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941, the war merged into the greater conflict of World War II as a major front of what is broadly known as the Pacific War. The Second Sino-Japanese War was the largest Asian war in the 20th century. It also made up more than 50% of the casualties in the Pacific War if the 1937–1941 period is taken into account. Although the two countries had fought intermittently since 1931, total war started in earnest in 1937 and ended only with the surrender of Japan in 1945.

In this game, you, the player, lead China’s Army (KMT Central Army) to fight against Japanese invasion. Major battles and historical events are represented by event cards which may be executed chronologically as the history (see the Historical Game option in 17.0), or randomly so as to make youself unprepared for what will happen in the next turn. You have to use your limited resources (limited number of actions, and event cards beneficial to you) to avoid Japanese capture of your Capital, Chungking. To do so, you need to gain support from Western Allies and the help from your unreliable temporary ally – Chinese Communist Party’s Red Army, which will get the final victory (China) from you if you allow them to expand and gain sufficient political support among generals, soldiers and civilians.

Errata: Page 9, [15.1] "i)..." -> "the KMTPS level <=20."
Map file Page 3，step 2: Only the first "2".

(You are always welcome for any comments or suggestions.)
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Fiefdom
description:
Creative Commons License
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.5 License. Fiefdom - Possible new version with every player on the same map

Object of the game of Fiefdom
The goal of Fiefdom is to accumulate the highest VP buildings

Keep: the central hexagon in the fief Coast: The outermost 24 hexagons of the fief Fief: The abstracted land shown on the building map. Hex: One of the 61 hexagons of a fief Region: One of the six marked areas of a fief

Each player receives 1 of each resource except gold. Each player has their own fief. Resource producing buildings are unlimited in number, but the other buildings are limited by the number of players. For these buildings, place one in the center of the table for each player (e.g. in a 4 player game there are 4 harbors

name: Warrior is About to Die!
description:
Warrior is About to Die! is a simple convention style dungeon crawl game that supports 4 players plus a game master at a time. Though players can drop in and out of the game constantly. It is designed to replicate the arcade classic Gauntlet in a way that is fast and easy.
This game functions as a sort of toolkit allowing the game master to set the game up in a way they choose, the rulebook and character sheets are a free download here and you can use whatever miniatures and terrain you choose to play the game.

name: A Game of Toll Gate
description:
"A Game of Toll Gate" is a variation (such as India - An Oriental Game) of the Parcheesi game.
The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".
Components: 4 purple, 4 green, 4 yellow, and 4 red playing pieces; 4 die and 2 shakers made of wood.

name: Career Explorers
description:
The game board is divided by age into 4 quadrants. They are elementary, middle school, high school, and young adult. The pathway that extends through these ages are filled with scenarios that give experiences related to People, Data (information), and Things (tools). Players navigate the board by rolling dice and moving.

At the conclusion of the game, players are directed to an occupation that relates to the experiences, interests, and education that they encountered on the route. Players learn that experiences throughout their lives and the choices that they make directly relate to their adult life and ultimately, their career choice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Retro Pak III
description:
(from Critical Hit website:)

RP III is 8 scenarios + color cover, long out of print (15 years) from ASL News (formerly Euro Pack I).

All designed by European designers, with all errata input, new art and the latest presentation.

The set includes 2 × Eastern Front + 2 × Poland 1939 + 1 × Indochina 1940 + 2 × Belgium 1940 + 1 × Holland 1940.

There are lots of new uses for those CH counter from recent releases! All eight scenarios use standard geo boards 2-41 (thus the 'retro' approach.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: 召喚師戰爭: 深處矮人 派系套牌
description:
[English]
This is the Summoner Wars: Deep Dwarves Faction Deck, in Chinese version. The content is the same as the Deep Dwarves starter faction in the English Master Set. It expands the Summon Wars with more a new choice of faction. Remark: Faction decks in the Chinese version are published as separate products.
Deep Dwarves

1 Tundle - Summoner
1 Kynder - Champion
1 Lun - Champion
1 Sprog - Champion
7 Miners - Common
6 Gem Mages - Common
5 Scholars - Common
2 Wake the Father Gem Events
2 Magic Stasis Events
2 Illusionary Warriors
2 Summoning Surge
1 Magic Torrent
3 Wall Cards
1 Summoner Reference Card

[Chinese]
召喚師戰爭中你扮演一個召喚師的角色。你被召喚之石賦
予呼喚強大勇士和施展強力法術的能力，以在你與一個敵對
的召喚師的戰鬥中幫助你。遊戲的目的是摧毀你對手的召喚師
卡。當你是遊戲中唯一擁有召喚師卡在場中的玩家時，你就勝
出了。

深處矮人派系套牌

1 吞道爾(召喚師)
1 凱英達(捍衛者)
1 魯倫(捍衛者)
1 斯波洛格(捍衛者)
7 礦工(普通兵)
6 寶石魔法師(普通兵)
5 學者(普通兵)
2 喚醒原石(事件)
2 魔法停滯(事件)
2 幻影武士(事件)
2 召喚力飆升(事件)
1 魔法洪流(事件)
3 牆壁卡
1 召喚師參考卡
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Super RPS: Rock • Paper • Scissors
description:
In this card game, players will have to duck, dodge, and morph to avoid combat and to attack their enemies. The classic hand game Rock Paper Scissors is taken to new heights of intensity and competitiveness. Clever timing divides the winner from the loser.

It all starts with having 3 "Soldiers" to use during the game. Each Soldier represents a blunt Rock, a piece of Paper, or sharp pair Scissors. The standard rules of combat engagement are enforced that only allow Rock to attack Scissors, Scissors to attack Paper, and Paper to attack Rock. But player can change their form to attack otherwise unreachable opponents or avoid combat altogether. And all the rules can be bent or broken.

The game is played in turns with no set number of turns in a game. After a player loses all their Soldiers, they are out of the game. The last player with at least 1 Soldier left wins!

name: Bots to Bits
description:
Players take turns shooting or blocking missiles that target face down robot cards and factories. Each destroyed robot and factory card is collected and is worth points. Game ends when all six robot factories are destroyed and collected. High score wins.

More description to come!

name: La pesadilla de mi abuelo
description:
Explore a mansion full of traps and save the world from the invasion of monsters. You can arm yourself with anything, anything goes, a denture, a nunchuck of sausage... anything before falling to the threat.
Explore each of the rooms of the mansion, no game is equal.
One of the players will play the role of king of the monsters, others will have to join forces to defeat him.
If you choose be the king of the monsters, use the suspect Cuco, the flying Hippocampus and other monsters against your opponents; everything is full of uncertainty.

Anything goes in...
The bane of my grandfather.


Recorre una mansión llena de trampas y salva al mundo de la invasión de los monstruos. Puedes armarte con lo primero que pilles, todo vale, una dentadura, un nunchaku de chorizo... cualquier cosa antes que sucumbir a la amenaza.
Explora cada una de las habitaciones de la mansión, ninguna partida es igual.
Uno de los jugadores desempeñará el papel del Rey de los monstruos, los demás tendrán que aunar sus fuerzas para derrotarle.
Si eliges ser el Rey de los los monstruos, utiliza contra tus adversarios al Cuco sospechoso, al Hipocampo volador y al resto de monstruos, todo está lleno de incertidumbre.
Cualquier cosa vale en...
La pesadilla de mi abuelo.

name: The Worldship
description:
The universe is dying. You and the other surviving remnants of various alien species have managed to remain alive these past months by pooling all of your resources into a communal Worldship, on which you all live. The Worldship has arrived in a new system - and each species has sent out a team to scout for information & resources. If you can work together and repair & refuel the Worldship before it leaves then everyone can continue to survive. If some tasks prove too difficult, then one or more species will have to be left behind.

The goal of the game is to not be left behind - but whether that means cooperation or competition is up to each individual player.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bayern Reise
description:
Bayern Reise is a version of Deutschlandreise (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/6787/deutschlandreise) and is similar to Hessen Reise (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/34470/hessen-reise).

In Bayern Reise you travel around Bavaria/Germany.
You get 9 destination cards (11 in the 2 and 3 player version). Now you start traveling around the board (which shows a map of Bavaria) to reach the citys showing on your cards. Therefor you have to roll a die.
When rolling a 6, you get an action card. The action cards give you some tasks, e.g. going back to your starting position or move to a specific city.
The first player who has visited all his destinations and traveled to the state capital Munich wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hi-score Bowling
description:
Game comes with 2 balls, 10 pins, a pin setter, a shooter and a magic slate scorecard. The game claims that "IT's A SNAP TO STRIKE OR SPARE".


Perhaps someone can by looking at the design or the logo determine who created the game in the first place. Also game looks like a game from the 70's or 80's.

name: Breaking The Devil's Backbone
description:
The Name: "Devil's Backbone" is a colloquial term for the Natchez Trace. "Breaking" means successfully completing a trip up or down the Trace.

The Game: By 1769, frontiersmen loaded their flatboats with furs, tobacco, whiskey, coal, copper, livestock, etc. and floated down the Mississippi River to sell their goods in Natchez. Along the way they have to endure many hazards on the Mississippi River. After selling their goods in Natchez, they could not go back up the river (no steam boats yet), so they walked back to Nashville, on ancient Indian Trails. Travel the Natchez Trace as those frontiersmen did; endure the same hardships and privations they faced: the fevers, the thieves, the Indians, etc. Meet the famous men of the past: Andrew Jackson, Lincoln, Audubon and many, many others who also traveled the historic Indian trail between Natchez and Nashville.

The Purpose: To endure the hazards of the Trace and get to Nashville, if you do, you will have Broken the Devil's Backbone.

(taken from the game insert)

Designed by Joe and Jean McConnell (Times Daily, Florence AL, dated 19 Jul 1990)

name: Shipping Forecast
description:
Shipping Forecast is a roll and move, push-your-luck, dice-rolling action game with strategy, based on the shipping forecast.

The variable weather and sea conditions given on the Shipping Forecast Cards will help and hinder you as you move your trawler to and try to land hauls of fish.

Should you stick with that much needed fuel can, or roll the dice just once more to bring in another haul of fish? Battle the conditions at sea and try to reach calmer waters, or take your chances where you are, preserve your fuel and weather the storm?

Shipping Forecast is an easy to learn dice rolling game with strategy that will force you to make tough decisions every move!
publishers: octopus08 Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Extraterrestrial Grail
description:
The universe is teetering out of control and the aliens that inhabit it are getting restless. Rumors about total annihilation have spread through every corner of each galaxy. The rumor is that if one particular object can be obtained, then that alien's race and home planet will be saved. Otherwise, their race will be exterminated and their home planet will be destroyed. One alien whispers to another, "What are we looking for?" The other alien snaps back, "The Grail, of course."

Extraterrestrial Grail is a turn-based strategy board game for 2-4 players. Extraterrestrial Grail takes place in outer space in which you are an alien searching for the Grail. Only one player gets the Grail at the beginning of the game, so the other aliens must find out where it is by fighting each other and exploring planets for it.

Each player receives attribute cards at the beginning of the game. A player can only hold a maximum of 6 attribute cards in their hand at a time. All of the attribute cards that the player has chosen to not place in their hand must go into their planet boxes. Some attribute cards are weapons which remove life points from an enemy alien (bomb, missile, laser rifle, and etc.). Other attribute cards are designed to steal cards from other aliens (mug gloves, rope, and etc.). There are also attribute cards that let you safely search and give you the ability to search foreign planets (respiration headgear, flashlight, thermal garment, and etc.). There are many more kinds of attribute cards as well!

Turn Options:

Roll die and move your alien (only once per turn)
Search a planet for attribute cards (if your alien token is on a planet)
Start a battle with an enemy alien located on the same space as your alien
Use attribute card(s) in your hand


Battle Turn Options (choose one per battle turn):

Use natural attack
Flee from battle
Use an attribute card in your hand


The object of the game is to have the Grail in your hand when the alarm goes off or have the Grail in your hand when all the other aliens have been eliminated. If no one has the Grail in their hand when the timer alarm goes off, then everyone loses. For example: If there is time still left on the timer and only one alien is still alive, then that alien must find the Grail before time is up to win the game (the game will end when the last player standing finds the Grail).
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: FREY
description:
Introduction
Frey is an abstract game similar to Go played on the line segments of a base 4 hex board.

Object
The object is to surround the largest total area with your color wooden segments.

Player with the highest score wins.

Play
Two players Red and Blue take turns placing wooden segments in their color onto the empty line segments of a base 4 Hex board.

Red plays first then play alternates.

On your turn you have one of two choices,

1) Place a wooden segment in your color onto an empty line segment of the board or
2) Move a wooden segment in your color currently on the board to another empty line segment by pivoting off of one of said segments endpoints.

Pivots and Breaks
Pivoting off an endpoint is only allowed if

1) The endpoints that your pivoting off of are free, not connected to your opponents pieces or
2) The endpoints that your pivoting off of are connected to your own pieces.

When pivoting, a segment may not cross over either a friendly nor enemy piece.

A Break is when you pivot one of your like color connected segments breaking them into two segments.

Capturing
Capturing your opponents segments is done by surrounding them with your color segments from endpoint to endpoint.
You may not play into any area that has been closed off by your opponents segments.

The game ends when the board is full or no valid moves can be made.

Scoring
Count all of your captured enemy pieces and all of the spaces surrounded by your colored pieces. Each captured piece is worth .5 points apiece and the spaces are worth 1 point apiece.

Highest score wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure

name: Legends of Rock
description:
Legends of Rock is a game about acquiring as much Fame as possible before meeting your untimely and tragic demise. Rockers begin the game by creating an album in one of the 8 genres represented on the genre wheel. Throughout the game rockers will create new albums, go on tour, and create hit songs.

Legends of Rock is primarily a set collection game with two resources: Music Tokens and Tour Chits. Turn order for selecting these resources can be manipulated throughout the game during the Free Time phase, where rockers can choose to become more Talented, practice their on-stage Diva skills, impress a better Producer, or hire a competent Managers.

Album sales rely on the genre track, only what is popular sells. Hit songs rely on the quality of the song and can score the most points but don't offer lasting success. Touring can score a lot of Fame if you have the Fan base that wants to attend.

name: Planetoid
description:
Planetoid is a deceptively simple game played on a spherical board. Players must capture all of his her opponent's pieces. Strategic challenges emerge as players navigate a borderless play surface.

Players: 2

Setup: Each player places their 6 pawns on the designated home spaces (Red or Blue). Players roll 2 dice to determine who plays first. The highest number plays first.

Gameplay: On each turn players rolls 2 dice to determine how many spaces they can move. Moves may be split between two pawns.

Only one pawn may occupy a space at a time. If a player lands on his or her opponent's pawn, that pawn is removed from the game board.

Goal: The first Player to capture all of his or her opponent's pawns, wins the game.

Playing time: 20-25 minutes
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Darkling Plain: an Augmented Reality Miniature Board Game
description:
Darkling Plain is a miniatures board game that is powered by augmented reality (AR). Darkling Plain combines all the best aspects of a traditional board game such as Settlers of Catan or Ticket to Ride and a video game such as Final Fantasy or World of Warcraft. Board games offer a social experience and depth of play, while video games offer immersion, glorious eye-candy, and computational wizardry.

There are no actual miniatures in Darkling Plain. You place cards that represent your units and other features, like a ring of standing stones or a village, upon a full-color game board. When the cards or board are viewed through the camera of a smart device or computer, the game comes to life like a video game. Spectacular special effects abound as a fantasy battle bursting with the magical and the medieval consumes your tabletop.

name: Dai Sai Sou!
description:
Dai Sai Sou! includes 36 unique robo part cards with different characteristics, providing diversity to create up to 6 robos at once. Part cards have a maintenance gauge, defense, melee and range attacks, and a special ability. Players will use these parts to attack their opponent's robo. In addition, players will be able to use action cards to modify attacks and defend against oncoming bombardment. A dice roll plus your modifiers from the robo part you use to attack and action card will have to beat your opponent's armor for the robo part you attack. A successful hit lowers the opponents maintenance gauge, usually by one level.
Parts will take damage when hit. If a part takes too much damage, they can become inoperable and are at risk of blowing up, leaving you more vulnerable. If a player disables too many parts or destroys the chest part of a robo, then that robo is destroyed. Some may be fortunate enough to collect the necessary cards to perform an ultimate attack that will turn their opponents’ robo parts into scrap metal. Make sure you're the last one standing in this robo-royale.

name: Destination Bristol
description:
Promotional game for the makers of Fry's Chocolate.

A simple roll and move game where you must get your ship from London to the publisher's factory in Somerdale, Bristol. Obey instructions on the pink squares. First to reach the factory, wins.

name: K-21 Spionaggio Internazionale
description:
Game of the 70s spy, where players have to play some missions before you get to the airport and escape to win the game. The game board is a city with various places that players must attain, they can also take advantage of the rail, ferries and helicopters to move faster and take advantage of the other spies.
A turn based game, with dices for movement, Top Secret goal card and event card.

name: Everwind: Jeksey
description:
Everwind - Jeksey

Galwyndor's Oldest Strategy Game
Match wits with your opponent as you strategically maneuver your Messenger to the other side of the board.

A forgotten game from a forgotten time, Jeksey was invented as a cover for a secret cipher. The ancients would use the gameboard and a key to transmit encrypted messages to one another, which is why the object is to get your Messenger deep into enemy territory.

It plays like chess, but there are only four types of pieces, so the rules are simple. Using five Wards, four Cavals, three Litus pieces, and one Messenger, you must outwit and outmaneuver your opponent.

Based on the game appearing in the Everwind Series of books by Janden Hale. Game designer: Janden Daniel Hale.

https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/everwind-jeksey
publishers: Darkana Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: GeoCards USA
description:
A geography card game which allows a United States map to be built in hundreds of different way.
Each player adds a card from his hand to the map on the board. If a player cannot add to the map he draws a card. Game ends when one player runs out of cards.

name: Armored: The Art of War
description:
Armored: The Art of War is a card game based on accurate US Army doctrine. All aspects of military decision making processes will be encompassed; combat troops to medics, logistics and even finance will add intricate layers to the game for advanced players and quick combat bonuses described in detail for beginners. With smooth game play and tactical decision making, you will enter the world of the military commander.

Even with its military structure, Armored will appeal to all those who have no military experience and just enjoy card games. Whether you enjoy creating multiple decks, each with their own playing style or just having your primary deck that dominates your opponents - Armored will engage you. From the beginning steps of creating your deck and identifying your playing style to the actual battle, all your favorite card game experiences are still there.

On each card, one asset is shown along with the accurate information for that vehicle, weapon system, troop or other asset such as stats and associated military symbology. Much like other card games, Armored is played with 'Attack' and 'Defense' stats. Specific to military requirements of movement and weapons, 'Range' and 'Weight' have been added.

Armored can be played with 2 or more players on a tabletop or map. Each player has a minimum of three rows that are active within the game. It is within these rows that assets are introduced and maneuvered onto the playing field. Columns have been included to create a grid structure required as assets advance, retreat and evade their opponent. The majority of the individuals who will play Armored will use standard approaches based on deck preference and card stats.
